title: Agent(e) soutien Administratif
description:
Client ID: 5322

Agent(e) soutien Administratif

Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) Agent(e) soutien Administratif pour une entreprise dans le domaine bancaire. Notre client est situé à Montréal.


Description des tâches et responsabilités – Agent(e) soutien Administratif

Les responsabilités du poste incluent :

- Préparer et envoyer les factures pour approbation;
- Envoyer les factures approuvées aux comptes fournisseurs;
- Réaliser les opérations relatives à la comptabilisation des revenus;
- Classer les factures dans SharePoint;
- Mettre à jour la feuille de calcul de l'état de la facture
- Mettre à jour les listes de participants aux différents cours;
- Ouvrir et créer des opportunités dans le système CRM;
- Préparer et envoyer les certificats et photos des cohortes;
- Donner accès au système de gestion de l'apprentissage à de nouvelles cohortes;
- Soutenir les chefs de projet pour tous les outils MVP pertinents à développer, intégrer et maintenir pour toutes les solutions;
- Gérer, exécuter et compléter les demandes d'amélioration généralement du responsable de la solution - uniquement des modifications mineures du contenu, la gestion de la traduction et le téléchargement dans les systèmes;
- Maintenir et collaborer à la mise à jour des exigences du système autour de la prise en charge du portefeuille de solutions;
- Agir comme point de contact, notamment pour les propositions et les outils de support : support et maintien des propositions et des outils dans différents systèmes, validation et mise à jour du contenu opérationnel (taux horaires, outil de référence régional, tableaux de facturation, jalons de tous les outils de coût, clauses légales, etc. );
- Coordonner et assurer l'achèvement des demandes Service Now pour les améliorations de la solution;
- Être responsable de l'administration et de la gestion de Sharepoint : utilisateurs, superutilisateurs, nouvelle solution et retrait de la solution.


Exigences du poste – Agent(e) soutien Administratif

- 5-7 année minimum dans des rôles de soutien administratif, gestion d’événement et projets ou de l’administration;
- Expérience en cabinet de service professionnel un atout;
- Études de niveau collégial ou études supérieures dans une discipline appropriée;
- Soutien administratif/gestion d’opération;
- Systèmes: Word, Powerpoint, Excel;
- À l’aise avec la technologie et facilité d’apprentissage de nouveaux outils;
- Orientation client : Bonne capacité à interagir avec des clients externes et des collaborateurs internes;
- Expérience dans la gestion d’événements un plus;
- Excellente maîtrise de l’anglais et du français (parlés et écrits);
- Capacité de résolution de problèmes;
- Grand souci du détail, minutie;
- Bonne capacité de rétention d'information, de prise de notes et documentation;
- Grande capacité d'organisation du travail afin de respecter des échéanciers serrés tout en gérant et en équilibrant les priorités (multi-tâches);
- Autonomie, débrouillardise;
- Entregent et facilité d’adaptation;
- Bilingue (anglais/français).


Type de poste
Contractuel 6 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellement.

Date de début
Immédiatement

Numéro de référence
BH338507

title: Administrative Coordinator – Pacifica Seniors Lodge
description:
Position Title: Administrative Coordinator – Pacifica Seniors Lodge Department: Supportive Services

Reports to: Manager of Pacifica Seniors Lodge Salary Range: $24.48-$26.52

Location: Nanaimo, BC - Pacifica Seniors Lodge

Schedule: 8:30am-4:30pm, Monday – Friday (70 hours bi-weekly)

Organizational Focus:

Pacifica Housing has been providing safe and affordable homes for almost 35 years. We are a rapidly growing organization dedicated to meeting the housing and support needs of our community. As such, we are committed to building our fast-growing team with a culture that supports our people and reinforces our core values of authenticity, leadership, respect, and social justice.

Pacifica is proud to be a Certified Living Wage Employer by The Living Wage for Families Campaign.

What we Offer:

  • A mission driven, meaningful working environment.
  • Minimum three (3) Weeks Vacation Entitlement.
  • Best-in-class Benefits Package for full-time employees (includes extended health & dental, life insurance, among others).
  • Employer RRSP Contributions (employee matching not required).
  • Significant wellness time.
  • Career development and internal advancement opportunities.
  • Organization and individual training opportunities.
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

Position’s Primary Objectives:

Under the guidance of the Manager of PSL, the Administrative Coordinator provides administrative support to the Manager of PSL and the operations of Pacifica Seniors Lodge by handling a variety of tasks in order to ensure that all interactions between the organization and others are positive and productive.

1. Provides support to the Manager of PSL and the operations of Pacifica Seniors Lodge, including:

  • coordinating meetings and conference calls;
  • maintaining filing and filing audits for the Manager of PSL;
  • coordinating inspections of the site;
  • scheduling for Pacifica Seniors Lodge;
  • advocating on the behalf of the residents or the organization to external agencies for support; and
  • resident support which includes but not limited to serving food, assisting in the kitchen, coordinating of resident programing, minor cleaning, creating notices to be posted and day to day letters for residents, and move in and move outs.

Position’s Key Responsibilities:

1. Provides administrative support to the Manager of PSL, including:

  • assisting the Manager of PSL with the development of protocols, policies, procedures and/or proposals;
  • coordinating in fundraising, public relations campaigns, workshops and special events;
  • maintaining reports such as statistics, logbooks, resident daily activity records; and
  • scheduling and coordinating the Manager of PSL’s calendar.

2. Provides administrative support to the operations of the Pacifica Seniors Lodge and residents, including:

  • assisting residents in navigation of external services;
  • coordinating referrals to essential services and programs for residents;
  • providing support for a wide variety of off-site activities;
  • providing support to kitchen staff as needed, such as assisting with cleaning, prepare the dining room for meals, and serving residents meals;
  • deliver mail to residents;
  • providing wellness checks to residents as needed;
  • assisting with minor repairs and maintenance (such as light bulb changes), as required; and
  • providing resident documentation as directed by the Manager of PSL, such as move-in and move-out paperwork, preparing notices for residents, and printing/updating forms for residents (resident lists, dietary lists, etc.).

3. Providing general administrative support to various departments, property services, supportive services, and health and safety functions, including:

  • collecting rent and entering receivables in Yardi and deposits;
  • scheduling call outs and updating on-line schedule;
  • recording, transcribing and maintaining agendas/minutes for Occupational Health & Safety and other committee and working groups as required;
  • monitors maintenance requests on Yardi; and
  • coordinating in the safety inspections at our Supportive Housing sites.

4. Other related duties, including:

  • providing back-up for team members and other staff as required;
  • coordinator social events at PSL, office decoration; and
  • other special projects when needed.


Qualifications (minimum Education and Experience requirements):

Qualifications:

  • WHIMS Certification is required.
  • First Aid Certification is required.
  • Food Safe Certification is required.

Education:

  • Post-secondary education in Office Administrator Program plus related experience in a professional office environment.

Experience:

  • Highly proficient in MS Office programs including Word, Outlook and Excel.
  • Proficient in Acrobat Adobe, Windows Explorer.
  • A minimum of 2 years equivalent experience is an asset.
  • Recent and related experience preferably in the non-profit housing sector or in a related social service field.

Note: An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong research, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and balance role responsibilities and interpersonal dynamics in a fast paced, high pressure environment.
  • Knowledge of Yardi Property Management software an asset.

Additional Criteria for Role:

  • Completion of a Criminal Record Check is required before employment commences.

Pacifica Housing advises all employees, contractors and volunteers of the risk of violence, injury and harm that is present in the execution of their duties. Pacifica Housing is committed to providing a safe and risk-free work place, however, we acknowledge the inherent risk in social housing and direct support work while in homes and in other support relationships.

Pacifica celebrates diversity and what makes you uniquely you. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your culture, ethnicity, race, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran’s status, color, religion, and diversability.

title: Administrative Assistant / Install / Customer Service
description:
â€œPBS is the fastest growing â€œAll Inclusive Business Platformâ€ vendor in North America and weâ€™ve only just begun! â€œ 

 

The Opportunity:

We are changing the way people buy and service cars one dealership at a time. In business for over 30 years, PBS is the third largest DMS (Dealership Management System) provider to the North American retail automotive industry. Each month we welcome hundreds of new users to our software platform, and we need your help.

We are unique in the industry because we view our customers as business partners, technology innovators, and friends. Our software can run all aspects of an automotive dealership with sales, service, inventory management, and accounting modules.

And that's where you come into the picture. While specific roles are posted, PBS is always open to pivoting with quality people and adding to the team based on your skills and the needs of our customers. After you join the team, we will continue the process of moving you into new roles based on your talents, growth, and interests.

 

The Role:

As an Install Services Administrator you will be working in conjunction with the Dealer Training Optimization team and Project Management team to facilitate a dealership from their current DMS provider to PBS

 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide excellent support to our customers in our software
  • Support and troubleshoot issues that are both called in or emailed
  • Escalate issues to the corresponding teams when needed
  • Set up letterheads for new installs and communicate with customers to get their approval
  • Setup, maintain and communicate on global training, Dealer Academy, master schedules, and Turbo Meeting requests
  • When needed, help the DTO Admin team with the manufacturer inspections, loaner agreements, and income dashboards
  • Responds to both internal and external support requests in a timely manner
  • Be able to talk about and navigate parts of our DMS Software to be able to better assist our customers
  • Willingness to commit to an ongoing system of education and cross-training
  • Maintain documentation and update as processes change within the department

 

Qualifications:

  • 1-2 years previous experience in a related industry or field
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with proficiency in Excel
  • High School Diploma
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Strong problem solving and trouble shooting skills
  • Strong documentation abilities
  • Effective time management
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong multi-tasking & prioritization
  • Available for occasional work on Saturday and/or Sunday to support software installations
  • Available for occasional work on USA/Canadian holidays based on installation needs
  • Possible travel (1-2 weeks/year) within Canada and the USA may be required. In consequence, proof of COVID-19 vaccination and a valid passport and/or US visa (if applicable) will be a requirement

 

What we offer:

  • Internal promotion and growth opportunities
  • An education department dedicated to helping you with professional and personal development
  • Corporate membership to Goodlife Fitness
  • Free parking
  • Staff events
  • Competitive base salary
  • Great referral bonus
  • Staff discounts with GM, Dell, Goodlife and more

 

 

PBS Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Disability Assistance (Requests on your application status will not receive replies.)

PBS Systems is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including any job seeker with a disability. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to recruitment@pbssystems.com. In your email please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting and the Job Title of the position for which you are applying.

JOIN A WINNING TEAM AT PBS Systems

At PBS Systems we thrive on inspiring pride among our team members and envy among our competitors.

Our culture rests on providing opportunity and challenge for our team members while encouraging healthy work-life balance.

To keep growing and building on our success we look for like-minded individuals to join our team.

Bring your passion, energy and experience.

We will give you the training, support and encouragement to succeed.

title: Adjoint(e) administrative
description:
Nous sommes fiers d'obtenir des résultats exceptionnels dans l'exploitation d'hôtels grâce à notre capacité à combiner la science supérieure de la gestion hôtelière avec l'art et le professionalisme de l'hospitalité. êtes-vous à la recherche d'une entreprise prospère pour grandir avec? Avez-vous ce qu'il faut pour grandir avec nous?

L'Adjoint(e) Administrative : assiste les processus et les contrôles connexes dans le domaine des finances, certaines tâches des ressources humaines et de la même manière, soutient les autres départements de l'hôtel lorsque cela est nécessaire.

Les responsabilités incluent (mais ne sont pas limitées à) :

Paie, gestion du crédit hôtelier (rapprochement et communication en temps opportun des comptes clients, traitement des comptes clients, recouvrement des acomptes, facturation de groupe, analyse des comptes principaux et autres charges à recevoir) ; répondre aux demandes de renseignements d'une manière qui dépasse les attentes des clients internes et externes ; fournir les rapports mensuels nécessaires; aide à la vérification des revenus; aide aux tâches de la caissière générale; des tâches comptables et administratives supplémentaires au besoin.

Conditions:

Il s'agit d'une excellente opportunité pour une personne très organisée et soucieuse des détails, dotée d'une grande aptitude numérique et de compétences en matière d'enquête / réconciliation. Le candidat doit :

  • Posséder un diplôme en hôtellerie (ou équivalent) et au moins 1 an d'expérience équivalente dans un environnement de crédit/recouvrement (de préférence comptes clients hôteliers), ou une expérience antérieure en restauration hôtelière, réservation, accueil ou gestion.
  • Avoir de solides compétences en communication, en relations interpersonnelles et en service à la clientèle, avec un traitement téléphonique amical et professionnel
  • Avoir la capacité de prioriser et de gérer plusieurs tâches pour respecter les délais requis
  • Être efficace pour anticiper et répondre aux besoins des invités ou des collègues, ainsi que pour résoudre tout autre problème pouvant survenir avec confidentialité, diplomatie et résolution efficace.
  • Connaissance pratique de MS Word, Excel
  • Expérience dans le système d'accueil (Opéra, Fidelio, Maestro ou similaire)

REMARQUES:

Les candidats qualifiés sont invités à postuler avec un CV. Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais ne communiquerons qu'avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.

Vous devez avoir le droit légal de travailler au Canada pour présenter une demande. puisque l'employeur n'a pas d'evaluation d'impact du marché du travail (EIMT) qui soutient un travailleur étranger.

** Les demandes d'emploi ne seront pas acceptées par courriel, en personne ou par télephone.

title: Administrative Assistant 2022 - Remote
description:
Administrative Assistant - Remote

This is a full time position.

You must apply using our easy-apply portal: https://ontariomusicians.easyapply.co/

Please note that aspects of this position are modified to ensure Health and Safety during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Note: Emails regarding this position come from a "Get Hired" account, and may be delivered to your spam folder. If you haven't received a confirmation of your application within 72 hours, please email

jobs@canadianmusicians.coop

for support.

As an Administrative Assistant, you will work with and support the Corporate Services and Human Resources Departments to support a variety of departments at Canadian Musicians Cooperative (The Co-op). Administrative Assistants may be assigned to a particular department or program. Your skills will be critical in facilitating active communication and ensuring all department responsibilities are up to date and being maintained.

Due to federal funding requirements for this program, successful applicants must be:

  • 15–30 years of age on their first day of work

  • A Canadian citizen, have a permanent resident card, or be protected under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (there is no requirement to be a student) 

  • Residing in Canada during the length of the employment.

This program pays minimum wage for your province. The summer employment length is 7-16 weeks between the end of April and beginning of September. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Prepare, key in, edit and proofread correspondence, invoices, presentations, brochures, publications, reports and related material

  • Open and distribute incoming mail, messages, and other material and coordinate the flow of information internally and with other departments and organizations

  • Schedule and confirm appointments and meetings

  • Answer telephone and electronic enquiries and relay telephone calls and messages

  • Set up and maintain manual and computerized information filing systems

  • Determine and establish office procedures

  • Attend meetings to take attendance, record, and prepare minutes 

  • Compile data, statistics and other information to support research and grant writing activities

  • Research, write, update/edit and distribute office materials and forms, including:

    • updating the employee handbook;

    • updating, printing, and collating workshop materials;

    • editing media releases, key speakers notes, PowerPoint presentations

  • Receive, process and file all other forms and processes as assigned

  • Distribute materials as assigned and authorized by senior staff

  • Organize Google Drive and related assets

  • Update the Monday.com boards with details as needed

  • Facilitate communication between departments, and follow up regularly with clients, coworkers, and supervisors

  • Liaise with and support program leaders and departments as assigned

  • May be required to supervise and train office staff in procedures and in use of current software

  • Perform other appropriate duties as assigned by management


Education/experience requirements:

  • The ideal candidate possesses or is a current student of a post-secondary program in one of the fields of Business, Music Business, Human Resources, Communication, or related field; or possess equivalent work experience and knowledge.

  • Experience working as an administrative or executive assistant is an asset.

  • Experience working remotely is an asset.

Key Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and other characteristics: 

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Personable demeanor

  • Outstanding organization skills

  • Ability to collaborate with several teams at once, managing your work within multiple initiatives simultaneously

  • Prioritization

  • Meeting deadlines

  • Critical thinking skills

  • Active problem-solving skills

  • Accuracy in data entry

  • Intermediate computer literacy using the following systems and software:

    • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

    • Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Calendar, etc.)

    • Online communications platforms (Slack, Discord, Zoom, etc.)

     

    The Co-op seeks individuals who enjoy collaboration, creativity, learning new skills, and engaging with artists and the community. This position may involve working some evenings and weekends as needed for special events (typically mass interviews and onboardings) and items needed on an urgent basis.  

    If you have any additional documentation (i.e., your own past projects or school assignments) that you would like to submit as part of a portfolio of your relevant skills and areas of expertise, please do so in the pre-screening box labelled “Additional Documentation.” Please utilize a Google Drive, Dropbox, or equivalent software to link these files, and ensure that application screeners will be able to open the files without needing to log into the platform. 


    To have your application considered by the Hiring Team, all pre-interview questions must be filled out completely. Please note that there are no part-time positions this year.

     

    If you are successful in our initial screening, you will be invited to a formal panel job interview.

    ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

    Membership is not required to participate in the competition for this position, and no preference is given to existing members in our ranking process, however, upon acceptance of an employment contract, all employees are required to join the co-operative.


    Those not selected as an Administrative Assistant are still welcome to join The Co-op as members. Professional Creator members have access to the same live or digital resources, support and community as those in our musician programs.

     

    Canadian Musicians Cooperative welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please email

    jobs@canadianmusicians.coop

    if you have any questions or require accommodations.

    We thank you for your interest in Canadian Musicians Cooperative and for participating in our competition. Only those candidates selected for consideration will be contacted.

title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.


Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?

As a Proposal Coordinator, you will be a key member of the Sales Operations team, working collaboratively with Operations, Sales, Business Development, and other stakeholders to create quality, compelling proposals to help drive organizational success. 

Your work will include:

  • Preparing proposals and facilitating request for information, clarifications and addendums.
  • Managing quality control of final bid products.
  • Organizing and conducting internal department meetings, including minute preparation and progress tracking. 
  • Identifying and communicating task priorities and deliverables for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Coordinating project charters, project plans, project schedules, assumption and clarification logs, risk management plans and estimate summaries.
  • Assisting with the management of the development process including working through, checklists, reporting and liaising with the design and construction teams.
  • Providing support, including editing and developing templates in accordance with brand standards.
  • Organizing and maintaining documentation

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Security - in a time when other companies are downsizing, we are growing
  • Very competitive compensation package
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader

Follow Dexterra Group on LinkedIn.


Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Post secondary education; college diploma and/or university degree
  • 1 to 3 years of relevant working experience
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) 
  • Familiarity with Visio, Salesforce and/or RFPIO is preferred
  • Competency in Adobe and InDesign would be considered an asset
  • Foundational experience with CRM and sales automation tools is an asset
  • Excellent written and communication skills
  • Experience in coordination work within a cross functional group in a fast-paced environment

Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.


Videos To Watch

  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Ii7vyl1MXM&feature=emb_logo

title: Looking for someone immediately to oversee virtual school for 8 and 4 year old.
description:
Our family is looking for someone to start immediately and help oversee virtual school for our 8 year old son (grade 3) and 4 year son (JK) - from roughly 8:45am - 5:00pm. This position would essentially be help keeping them on their schedule, oversee outdoor/recess time etc. - no tutoring/teaching expected. Virtual school ends at 1:30 for the 4 year old and 3:00 for the 9 year so there would be some time later in the day where they would require care/activities. This position would likely be in this format for at least 1 month -from that point should something change with in-person school we are flexible in terms of our needs/support. We live near Beech Ave and Queen - a family friendly neighbourhood, close to parks and the waterfront. We are looking for someone COVID conscious - and as a family have been isolated since school ended before the holidays and both parents are working from home.

title: Administrative Assistant - Site Support (Screener)
description:
Job Description:

 

Being a part of Covenant Care/Covenant Living means being a part of an organization that takes its mission to heart in everything we do. We draw on being rooted in a Catholic tradition that has been serving Albertans for over 155 years. We believe that this is what makes our organization stand out in our approach.

Our mission is to â€œcontinue the healing ministry of Jesus by serving with compassion, upholding the sacredness of life in all stages, and caring for the whole person â€“ body, mind and soul.â€

All Employees are called to our mission through their desire to serve, support transformation and growth, and contribute to the betterment of all those we serve, as well as each other.

Our Employees are an extension of our residentâ€™s families and key to how they feel about their home. As a valued member of the Covenant family, you have the ability and desire to be a part of influencing the lives of all those that reside in our home sites and contribute to a caring and compassionate environment.

If this description of our organization resonates with you, and you are called to serve, please see the below outlined career opportunity, and how you can contribute to our organization.

 

Position Summary

 

The Administrative Assistant - Site Support provides general office support services and customer service duties, ranging from assisting the hiring process by screening applicants, screening visitors to the site,  reception, non- medical assistance to residents and guests, responding to inquiries and administrative duties.   The overall focus of the position is customer service and resident satisfaction with a high level of confidentiality, discretion and sensitivity. This position is privy to and collects personal and medical information from staff, residents, families, and visitors.

 

Qualifications

  • Courteous in receiving and assisting residents, families, volunteer and visitors
  • Ability to maintain good working relations with staff, public and outside agencies
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality
  • Flexibility with changes in the organization and maintain a positive outlook
  • Successful completion of Grade 12
  • Intermediate Level of Microsoft Office required (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc)
  • Excellent command of English language (written and verbal), as well as interpersonal and organization skills and the ability to multi-task
  • Able to work collectively in a team environment
  • Ability to work with limited supervision and shows initiative
  • Under Alberta MOH guidelines, adhere to all "single site mandates" in place
  • Compassion to those living in a supportive living environment
  • Experience in a supportive living or other health care facility is considered an asset
  • Required proof of completion of vaccination
When Applying:

Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
All employees new to Covenant Care + Covenant Living must provide a criminal records check, including vulnerable sector search.
Covenant Care + Covenant Living is committed to an inclusive work environment and encourages all qualified  individuals to apply.

We thank you in advance for applying with Covenant Care + Covenant Living.

title: Administrative Assistant (Remote)
description:
Our Mission is Simple: Be the easiest place to buy and sell your car in Canada.


What does that mean? We look at every single aspect of a vehicle purchase and remove all of the friction points.


Here's a few examples:
You can buy a car entirely online, without any salespeople involved
You can have your new car delivered to your driveway, usually the same day
You can spend a week with your vehicle to decide if you love it, and if you don't we'll pick it up

*This is a remote position only available to candidates residing within British Columbia.  Please note this positions requires weekend availability*


Job responsibilities:


  • Process and complete all incoming vehicle applications
  • Prepare contracts for customer to sign upon purchase (Online or In-person)
  • Communicate with department managers if need be to gather accurate/missing information
  • Review insurance quotes and documents
  • Process warranties and lien payouts/releases
  • Handle all paperwork related to the vehicle
  • Collaborate with the other teams to complete the application successfully
  • Perform basic math calculations 


Desired skills and abilities:


  • Entrepreneurial attitude with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Previous experience in an administrative role 
  • Strong Microsoft Excel skills
  • Strong multi-tasking capabilities
  • Result-oriented, creative and charismatic with the desire to share a laugh or two with your teammates
  • Open availability preferred


This is a truly exciting time to join Canada Drives and we are looking forward to doing great things together! In addition to a competitive salary, we provide

  • Extended dental and medical benefits
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • Excellent on the job training
  • Inclusive, fun, and vibrant work environment


Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Office Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

Fountain Tire is looking for  a Office Administrative Assistant with strong organizational and attention to details skills to join our team in our South Edmonton Head Office.    

 

What do we offer?

  • Competitive compensation
  • Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits for you and your family including RRSP matching
  • Recognition and incentives for your contribution to the organization
  • Educational Allowances that support individual growth and development
  • Policies and programs that support a balanced lifestyle, including flex days and an easy commute to our office located close to the Calgary Trail and Southside  Anthony Henday
  • Discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and services at all Fountain Tire locations

Why work for Fountain Tire?

  • We are a Platinum Member of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies
  • We are one of the 10 largest independent tire dealers in North America, and recipient of many Customer Service and Best Business Awards
  • We continually strive to expand our operations in existing markets, as well as new markets and currently, we have over 160 stores from BC through Ontario
  • We have a fantastic organizational culture that values associates and the work they do to make Fountain Tire a great place to work!

The office Administrative Assistant will manage the reception duties for Fountain Tire Place, assist with Fountain Tire Place building maintenance/repair inquiries, assist with general administrative duties, provide support and back-up to other Legal team members and miscellaneous other duties. Duties will include:  

Mailroom (35%)

  • Receive, sort and distribute, and send out daily mail/deliveries.
  • Act as the lead contact for Fountain Tireâ€™s courier vendors including sending/receiving deliveries and related invoicing.
  • Manage supplies (miscellaneous office and coffee supplies for Fountain Tire Place, postage machine and courier related supplies, name tags/name plates/business cards), including related rebilling.
  • Maintain mail-room, including all required mail sorting slots.
  • Rebill courier and postage charges to Stores and Fountain Tire Place Teams.

Reception (35%):

  • Greet visitors with exceptional customer service, and maintain visitor logs and visitor badges.
  • Manage incoming calls and redirect as needed.
  • Maintain reception area in a safe and clean manner.

Other administrative support (30%)

  • Assist Accounting Team with vendor set-up in DAX.
  • Receive and organize catering requests as needed, including related rebilling.
  • Support where needed for Fountain Tire Place meetings including arranging coffee/refreshments, room setup and takedown/cleaning.
  • Maintain Fountain Tire Place Online contact lists.
  • Responsible for Fountain Tire Gift Certificates including filling requests and maintaining control log.
  • Coordinate regular cleaning of kitchens (fridges/microwaves, etc.).
  • Maintain the distribution and updating of Fountain Tire Place building access fobs.
  • Provide administrative assistance as required to the Executive Team.
  • Provide administrative assistance as required to the Legal Team and other Fountain Tire Teams.
  • Participate in all safety initiatives, as required or assigned, to guarantee safety at Fountain Tire.
  • Participate in special projects and perform other related duties as assigned.

The necessary experience, knowledge, skills and abilities required in the role:

  • 2-3 yearsâ€™ experience working in a receptionist and/or administrative support role.
  • Physically able to lift up to 35 lbs.
  • Exceptional organizational skills with high attention to detail.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products.
  • Demonstrated ability to work well independently and as part of a team.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Problem solving skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.

Interested and qualified candidates are encouraged to apply on-line. In office resumes will be accepted by reception only.

title: Administrative assistant
description:
- Position: Administrative Assistant
- Workplace: Hybrid
- Salary: Between $20 and $24 per hour
- Start date: As soon as possible

Spring is synonymous with change and renewal! Is it also for you? In any case, you absolutely must take a look at this job offer in the insurance field which will certainly make you want to renew your professional life!

Do you want to work in a collaborative and friendly team?
Do you have a strong interest in customer service?

This job is for you!

Advantages
What the position of administrative assistant in the field of insurance in downtown Montreal offers you:

• Dynamic environment in downtown Montreal

• A daytime schedule of 37.5 hours per week

• Salary between $20 and $24 per hour depending on experience

• Hybrid model

• Experience in the field of insurance

• Benefits (group insurance, RRSP and more)

Responsibilities
What your day will look like as an administrative assistant in the field of insurance in downtown Montreal.

Entry of data relating to insurance policies

· Email management

· Prepare and organize certain files

· Drafting of letters, memos, reports and correspondence

Other related administrative tasks

Qualifications
Do you have what it takes for this administrative assistant position in the insurance field in downtown Montreal?

• Professionalism, excellent customer service and good management of time and priorities

• College diploma or experience in insurance (an asset)

• Good knowledge of written and spoken English

• In-depth knowledge of the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, Power Point)

Summary
Does this post interest you ?


Email us anytime at catherine.lague@randstad.ca, at sebastien.raymond@randstad.ca or at fanny.labrecque@randstad.ca.

Call us at 514 350-0033.

If you know of people interested in administrative support positions, please feel free to provide them with our contact information. It will be our pleasure to help them!

For more information on this position and all other positions currently available, visit www.randstad.ca.

We look forward to your CV.

All CVs received will be reviewed equally.

Only selected candidates will be contacted


Randstad Canada, 525, avenue Viger Ouest, bureau 501, Montreal, Quebec H2Z 0B3

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Administrative Assistant 1
description:
Job Description:
Job Title: Administrative Assistant 1
Work Site: VGH 12th & Oak

Status:

Start Date:

Hours:

 

Regular Full Time  

As soon as possible

0800-1600

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays

Salary: $21.67 - $28.44 per hour
Reference#: 163856-ayc

 

Come work as an  Administrative Assistant 1 with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) is looking for an Administrative Assistant 1 to join the dynamic team at Vancouver Acute Administration. Apply today to join our team!


Reporting to the Director, the Administrative Assistant 1 provides confidential administrative assistance and secretarial support to the designated Director and programs/services throughout the applicable Community of Care (CoC) or Corporate Department of Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH).

 

As an Administrative Assistant 1 with Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

  • Interact primarily with director/ managers and their administrative support staff throughout the Community of Care (CoC) and across VCH to professionally represent the Director's interests, share information, clarify details and answer questions.
  • Triage information of a sensitive and confidential nature, coordinates the flow of information, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of administrative services, and keeps the Director apprised of issues and activities.
  • Collaborate with other Administrative Assistants to ensure off ice eff iciency while promoting teamwork and maintaining a friendly and professional atmosphere.
  • Work independently and communicate with internal and external stakeholders/customers in a manner that promotes positive and respectful relationships.

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

Education & Experience

  • Graduation from a recognized administrative assistant/secretarial post-secondary program Three (3) years of senior administrative support experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Must have advanced word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, desktop publishing, and database soft ware skills and the ability to type a minimum of 60 w.p.m.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Exercises considerable judgment, tact and discretion in preparing, disclosing and handling information of a confidential and/or sensitive nature.
  • Liaises in a professional and courteous manner with managers/directors, staff and the public to gather and disseminate information.
  • Communicates in a compelling, clear and understandable manner (both verbally and in writing) in order to represent the Directorâ€™s interests.
  • Applies excellent time management skills to prioritize and complete assignments in a manner that optimizes departmental eff ectiveness and contributes to organizational success.
  • Practices care and thoroughness when maintaining, monitoring, calculating and summarizing data, records and budget information.
  • Collaborates with peers to ensure administrative systems and processes are consistently followed and monitored for eff ectiveness and that gaps are addressed and resolved when identified.
  • Employs expertise in the use of desktop computer applications to create a variety of documents and presentations.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

 

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

 

Please note that a resume is required to apply to this posting.

Hours of Work may vary due to project requirements.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Corporate Administrative Assistant
description:
General Information:

The Cowichan Valley Regional District is now accepting applications from prospective candidates to join our organization as a casual Corporate Administrative Assistant working primarily in the head office in Duncan. Reporting to the Executive Coordinator and supervised by the assigned department-designated supervisor, the Corporate Administrative Assistant provides exceptional and professional customer service and administrative services in support of CVRD operations. This position works in several areas of the main CVRD office including:   Land Use Services, Operations, Emergency Management, Legislative Services, and Finance.

Qualifications:
  • Secondary school graduation plus completion of aminimum 6 month certificate in office administration or business administration from a recognized post-secondary educational institution
  • Four (4) years of related experience in an administrative support role.
  • Experience in local government is considered an asset
  • An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.
  • Class 5 BC Driverâ€™s License

Please click here to view the full job description and qualifications for this position.

Hours of Work:

Business hours are Monday-Friday 8  a.m. to 4:30  p.m. and hours of work may be up to 35  hours per week. As these are casual opportunities there are no guaranteed hours of work. Due to the nature of the work the work schedule will be coordinated to meet the operational needs of the head office and may include shifts in blocks of time for planned absences or shifts on short-notice for unplanned absences. Successful candidates must be available to work a flexible variety of shifts, primarily days, but may include evenings (for meetings) and weekends (during emergencies). Overtime shall be compensated as per the CVRD and CUPE Local 358 collective agreement after 7  hours  per  day/35  hours  per  week.

Salary:

These positions are unionized (CUPE Local 358) and compensated at the Secretary II level, in three steps, $28.99  â€‘  29.88  â€‘  30.77 per hour (2021 wage rate).

Application Instructions:

Please submit a resume and cover letter as part of your application. This competition will remain open until filled and applications will be processed as they are recieved.  

Note:

Testing may be required during the interview process. Testing is based on the knowledge, skills, abilities and qualifications outlined in the job description. In addition, the succuessful candidate will be required to submit a satisfactory criminal record check.

title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
Overview:

 

Location:   Edmonton, Alberta

Position:   Regular / Full Time  

Positions Available: 1

 

Waiward is a respected construction and maintenance service provider that operates one of Canadaâ€™s largest fabrication shops based out of Edmonton, Alberta. Our mission is To Be Your Trusted Partner which ensures we act with integrity in all that we do. Through planned growth and development, we have kept our commitment to provide our customers with an unsurpassed level of service. Waiwardâ€™s historical and future success is grounded in our collective commitment to our core values.

 

At Waiward, we believe a diverse and inclusive workplace is the key to unlocking the full potential of our people. It is essential to build a team that represents the communities and clients we are serving. We attract, hire, and develop people of all backgrounds and ensure fairness and inclusion within our hiring processes. We believe in investing in people based on their expertise, capabilities, aspirations, and performance despite their race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, and beliefs.

As a leader in our industry, we believe diversity and inclusion strengthen our team and are committed to making sustainable progress in our company and the communities and clients we serve. With the support of our leadership team and peers, our people are encouraged to share their perspectives.

 

Job Purpose

The Proposal Coordinator is responsible for the completion of EOI and prequalification requests, processing proposal requests, assembly of proposal documents, management of client portals, downloading/filing of client documents, and reporting of Estimating KPIs.

Responsibilities:
  • Displays a commitment to Waiwardâ€™s incident-free vision, values, and culture.
  • Supports the bid proposal process through the activities of coordination, SME collaboration, writing, finalization, assembly, internal reviews, and submission.
  • Acts as chairperson of the bid/no-bid meeting; responsible for presenting opportunities, tracking meeting notes, and updating our meeting log.
  • Checks the drawing registers that come with the packages to ensure the package is complete.
  • Analyzes bid requirements and ensures that proposals meet requirements.
  • Acts as client liaison during the bid process.
  • Maintains tender and proposal document management as appropriate.
  • Conducts maintenance of our proposal and prequalification content databases, including generation of reports.
  • Reviews and formats various documents for proposals.
  • Coordinates / administers bid debriefs, and post-submission lessons learned.
  • Engages in the proposal, final formatting, assembly, and delivery.
  • Develops and executes consistent company identity through document templates.
Qualifications:
  • Degree or diploma in marketing, communications or another related field, or equivalent industry experience.
  • Proven analytical, communication, organizational, project management, and technical writing skill.
  • Proficient in MS Office software capacity to work effectively with deadlines and short-time frames in high-pressure environments.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, specifically InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator would be an asset.
  • Ability to lead multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Possess detailed knowledge of proposal and marketing procedures, work processes, and tools, along with evidence of past successful management of proposals teams.
  • Comfortable leading large group meetings.

 

Working Conditions

The job may require the incumbent to walk stairs; be outside in inclement weather (slippery surfaces and cold); carrying objects, driving and being exposed to normal office routines.

 

Physical Requirements

The incumbent is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: viewing a computer terminal for extended periods of time; and extensive reading. The incumbent is also required to stand and sit for extended periods of time.

 

 *Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted. Waiward is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Reception Administrative Assistant
description:
Roska DBO Inc. is currently seeking a Reception Administrative Assistant for our busy client located in Whitecourt, AB. The shift for this rolewill be 6 hours a day, from 9am - 3pm, for 5 days per week with the possibility of becoming full time in the future. Must reside in the Whitecourt area.

If you are energetic and excited to work as part of a team, focused on providing exceptional customer service, completing each job to the highest standards and want to contribute your skills and experience within a growing and dynamic industry, then we want to hear from you!

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Inventory management
  • Asset Integrity data support
  • Regulatory administrative tasks
  • Courteously receive and screen in-bound calls, emails and visitors, while always maintaining a professional image and demeanor
  • Book meeting rooms and arrange for catering
  • Photocopying, scanning and binding of various documents
  • Ensure that all incoming mail is sorted and distributed
  • Prepares all outgoing mail
  • Make travel arrangements for staff
  • Provide administrative support to the West operations team
  • Order kitchen and office supplies and ensures all work areas are stocked appropriately
  • Perform light housekeeping (dishwashers, counters, etc.)
  • Typing of various correspondence as required (Word/Excel/PowerPoint)
  • Take accurate minutes at company meetings and distribute accordingly
  • Establish and maintain an effective filing system
  • Production validation for various fields
  • Maintain excellent rapport with field staff and vendors
  • Open invoice coding and processing
  • Assist with planning and organization of company social functions and events
Successful candidates will have the following:
  • Highschool Diploma / Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree
  • 2-3 years of previous office administration work experience
  • Basic knowledge of the oil and gas industry
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Motivated and enthusiastic team player
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral
  • Effective time management and organizational skills with ability to prioritize and multi-task
We thank all applicants in advance for your interest in Roska DBO Inc., only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Roska DBO Inc. is a customer-focused operations company with a 25 year track record offering expertise in production and equipment solutions on well sites and facilities. Based in Grande Prairie, Alberta, with a network of locations, Roska serves all of western and northern Canada, plus selected U.S. and international markets, with a primary focus on the Alberta/ B.C. region.

In addition to fulfilling the contract operating needs of oil and gas producing, midstream and pipeline companies, Roska Designs, Builds and Operates well-site facilities, rents equipment and provides Production Testing and flowback services using a company-owned well testing fleet. When you join the Roska Team, the sky is the limit!

title: Office Administrator
description:
Summary

The Office Administrator will be responsible for a variety of administrative duties to support multiple departments. In this role the Administrator will be responsible for completing all administrative support and office services for the company as directed by the Operations Excellence Manager. This multifaceted position will require an open-minded, team-focused individual who is ready to take on a variety of responsibilities and gain a breadth of experience.

Job Duties

  • Enter and update information into relevant databases (B2W, Viewpoint)
  • Complete filing and paperwork to support multiple departments
  • Administer and manage inbound/outbound mail, including priority post, packages, courier services, and other correspondence
  • Coordinate departmental programs, such as meetings, seminars, workshops, special projects, and events
  • Answer and manage inbound telephone inquiries
  • Assist with inventory and ordering for office supplies
  • Assist in the creation of internal communications such as newsletters and e-mail blasts
  • Provide support to multiple departments with ad-hoc projects and reports


Requirements

  • Minimum 1-2 years' working experience in a customer service role
  • Previous experience in an office environment an asset
  • Post-Secondary Education
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook)
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise tact with sensitive material and information
  • Capable working both independently and in team environments, able to foster positive working relationships across all levels of the organization and working styles
  • Highly organized, able to juggle competing priorities and adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing work environment
  • Self-starter with a can-do attitude and willingness to learn

Additional Information

  • The Office Administrator will be based in the office, and certain tasks will require your physical presence in the office to complete

title: Project Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

 

Wood is currently recruiting for a Project Administrator within the Conventional Energy Canada business unit. We are looking for a motivated, energetic individual with comprehensive knowledge of administrative processes and procedures, able to function with a fair degree of independence.

 

The Project Administrator will provide support to the Project Management Team.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Compile and generate correspondence and presentations
  • Arrange travel and prepare expense reports
  • Schedule meetings and take minutes of meetings as required
  • Compile, review, and analyze data
  • Format and edit documents
  • Onboard and offboard personnel
  • Process overtime requests
  • Manage office seating requirements for both internal moves and new starts to the project team
Skills / Qualifications:
  • At least 5 years of administrative experience  
  • Knowledge of EPC Administration
  • Oil/gas and/or EPC experience
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills  
  • Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)  
  • Experience with SharePoint and Oracle
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to set priorities, follow-up and meet deadlines
  • Speed and efficiency
  • Ability to multi task
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Reception / Administrative Assistant
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Receptionist / Administrative Assistant to provide all administrative and office support functions to including office maintenance, and inventory management. The successful person will support all facets of branch operations including sales, management, and operation. Are you a get-it-done, can-do person? Are you so organized that you wish other people would let you organize their lives for them? If so, read on!

This Receptionist / Administrative Assistant position comes with a competitive salary and a typical schedule of Monday-Friday. We also offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the office position for you, apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN RECEPTIONIST/ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT

As a Receptionist/Administrative Assistant, you are an organizational expert! Your friendly personality shines by presenting a polished, professional impression of the company. You manage the reception desk: receive, screen and forward incoming calls; and greet visitors with a winning smile. You love keeping people informed by distributing incoming correspondence. Your passion for organizing shines when you maintain the reception area.

You love drafting documents, managing correspondence, and filing documents. You make photocopies, sends faxes, produce reports like a superstar. You are responsible for data entry, tracking, and updates. Your exceptional customer service skills provide information to internal and external customers.

On a daily basis, you process expense reports and mileage reports. Your attention to detail is impeccable when you update and maintain contact lists and distribution lists. You enjoy your job as you are never bored and get to work in an exciting fast-paced office!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 1-2 years' office administration experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Intermediate computer skills including ClaimTrak, Word, Excel, Outlook, Xactimate, and XactAnalysis
  • Ability to type at least 50 WPM
  • Strong administration and record keeping skills
  • Basic administrative/accounting math skills

Are you able to effectively prioritize and manage your time in a fast-paced environment? Do you have strong verbal and written communication skills? Are you attentive to detail with great administration and record keeping abilities? If so, you may be perfect for this office position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR OFFICE TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Administrative Assistant/Coordinator
description:
The Opportunity
McElhanney Ltd. is seeking a dedicated Administrative Assistant/Coordinator to join our Design Build/P3 Engineering team in Surrey, BC. In this role, you will be responsible for assisting our engineering project managers with project controls, invoicing, and administrative support. The successful candidate will have strong communication and organizational skills, with ability to work in a fast-paced professional environment.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Attend internal and external client meetings with Division and Project Managers to support duties including project staffing, conducting workload meetings, notetaking and preparing weekly reports for ongoing project utilization.
  • Assist with preparation of proposals, technical reports and documents.
  • Prepare and issue project invoicing and track subsequent accounts receivable.
  • Assist with composing letters, memoranda, and e-mail correspondence as necessary
  • Support branch reception services such as, answering phone, greeting clients, handling incoming and outgoing mail and couriers, managing inventory of office supplies and coordinating supply orders
  • Organize filing systems including archiving and disposal as appropriate, ensuring confidentiality of files/documents.
  • Support team members by facilitating project logistics such as travel, meetings, conference rooms, and conference calls.
  • Perform clerical tasks such as filing, photocopying, scanning, archiving, and disposal of documents.
  • Optimize and customize existing process and procedures for the various practices.
  • Lead or assist with other project and administrative tasks as necessary.

What You’ll Bring
  • 2-5+ years of related administration experience
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (particularly Excel)
  • Results oriented individual with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and timelines
  • People oriented with an ability to establish a high degree of credibility with staff and clients
  • A motivating and engaging energy with demonstrated strength in leading highly complex groups
  • An excellent written and verbal communicator with interpersonal and relationship management skills.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee owned and operated firm with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
 
Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
#LI-AM3 
#junior


If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Part-Time Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

Welcome to EagleCraft Boats! 

At our plant in beautiful Campbell River, British Columbia, our talented team of 25 full-time staff specializes in designing and building custom aluminum boats. Well represented across the globe, our company is proud to have built over 800 aluminum quality vessels ranging from pleasure crafts to commercial work boats.

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Answer multi-line telephone, screening and directing calls appropriately;
  • Accounts payable entry including checking and verifying of PO’s/Packing slips against Invoices;
  • Mastercard reconciliation for Managing director and Controller;
  • Record A/R in accounting system and customer files;
  • Backup for inventory receiving;
  • Manage inventory/ordering of office supplies, promotional materials, company apparel, etc;
  • Work independently to complete clerical duties such as mailing, typing, scanning, photocopying, faxing, filing, etc;
  • Receive, sort, and distribute daily mail/deliveries;
  • Maintain office cleanliness and organization;
  • Handle confidential and/or time-sensitive material appropriately;
  • Compile customer boat packages;
  • Assist with Sales & Marketing as needed.  Social media support, Lead generation follow-up;
  • Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

What do you need to succeed?

  • High school diploma or equivalent;
  • 1 year relevant office experience preferred;
  • Microsoft Office proficiency (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.);
  • Must have attention to detail;
  • Clear verbal and written communication;
  • Experience relevant to marketing, design, or social media will be considered an asset.


Additional Information

What's in it for you?

  • Working alongside a great team of talented individuals;
  • Flexible hours, guaranteed 20 hours per week;
  • Opportunity for advancement/full-time employment;
  • Family owned company;
  • Annual wage reviews;
  • Extended benefits coverage;
  • Education opportunities.

title: Assistant administratif / Développement des affaires
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Assistant administratif / Développement des affaires

 

Linen Chest est actuellement à la recherche d'un candidat qualifié pour aider au développement des affaires, à la saisie des données et à d'autres fonctions liées au commerce de détail et aux partenariats stratégiques, en travaillant directement avec le directeur du développement des affaires. Nous pensons qu'il s'agit d'une formidable opportunité de construire votre carrière au sein d'une équipe dynamique qui peut suivre les tendances commerciales et les appliquer en conséquence.

 

En plus de fournir un soutien administratif, ce poste peut impliquer de travailler sur divers projets, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter (i) le marché en ligne de Linen Chest, y compris l'évaluation, l'intégration et la négociation avec de nouveaux fournisseurs ; (ii) le soutien aux partenariats stratégiques et aux initiatives de vente aux entreprises (industrie immobilière, designers, gestionnaires immobiliers, etc.) ; (iii) la recherche, l'analyse et les communications liées à de nouvelles opportunités commerciales potentielles, y compris les plateformes de marché tierces ; (iv) l'aide au lancement de campagnes marketing, la rédaction, le copywriting et le rôle de point de contact pour les comptes clés ; et (v) la collaboration avec d'autres départements de Linen Chest, tels que le marketing numérique, pour ajouter de la valeur et améliorer la marque Linen Chest.

 

En fonction des performances et de la confiance établie au cours de la période initiale, il y aura des opportunités significatives de participer à des discussions stratégiques de haut niveau et à des projets spéciaux qui intéressent le plus le candidat du point de vue des compétences et du développement professionnel. La rémunération, les opportunités et les promotions futures seront proportionnelles aux performances.

Description du poste

Le candidat retenu devra posséder les compétences suivantes :

  • Bonnes compétences administratives, saisie de données et souci du détail ;
  • Digne de confiance et passionné par la vente au détail ou la stratégie commerciale ;
  • Proactif, attitude positive, curiosité et volonté d'apprendre ;
  • Bonnes aptitudes relationnelles ;
  • Capacité de représenter la marque Linen Chest, gérer des comptes et établir des relations de confiances.
Qualifications

  • Excellentes compétences communicationnelles (anglais et français) ;
  • Détenir une expérience en création et lancement de campagnes marketing stratégique par courriel
  • Bonne capacité de rédaction de textes (un atout) ;
  • Bonnes compétences en matière de recherche ;
  • Volonté de travailler dans un environnement rapide et flexibilité en fonction de la tâche ou du projet en cours.


Informations supplémentaires

Venez faire carrière au sein de la grande famille Linen Chest !

Nous pensons qu'il s'agit d'une formidable opportunité de construire votre carrière au sein d'une équipe dynamique qui peut suivre les tendances commerciales et les appliquer en conséquence."]

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve. Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates.

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Founded in 2016, Clutch is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Saskatchewan, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital, and Azure Capital Partners.

The Role:
As Clutch's Halifax operations continue to grow in size, staff and complexity, we're looking for an Administrative Assistant to keep our office organized and running efficiently. You will be part of the operations team supporting the processing of registrations, document generation, paperwork for customer deals and any other tasks as required.
Reporting to the Senior Operations Manager, the successful candidate for this role is highly motivated, a self-starter to take ownership of a variety of key administrative tasks and has worked in an organized environment.

Please note: this role will require you to be in our office at 20 Duke St, Bedford, NS B4A 2Z5. 

Responsibilities:
  • Collecting vehicle registrations and interfacing with local DMV to transfers registration.
  • Printing and managing customer documentation as per requirements.
  • Organizing and archiving vehicle registrations, warranty and other relevant paperwork.
  • Logging and archiving receipts associated with vehicle reconditioning.
  • Performing ad-hoc data and document audits as required.
You have/are:
  • Previous administrative experience is strongly preferred.
  • High attention to detail. You do not make any clerical mistakes either on a ownership transfer form or while managing documents.
  • Self-motivated and able to work in a fast paced environment.
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize competing demands.
  • Desire to learn new skills.
  • Technology savvy (Email, Google Drive, Slack etc.).
Must haves:
  • Attention to detail and strong ownership to their work: This person will handle vehicle registrations and transfers, which require flawless execution and no room for errors
  • Be open to work in a fast paced environment
  • Can multitask between tasks from managing vehicle registrations to generating customer's paperwork
Why You'll Love it here!
  • Be part of a growing Canadian Brand and change an industry
  • Competitive Salary and Equity Incentives!
  • Learning Budget -- for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Health & Dental Benefits

Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email 

talent@clutch.ca

.
