title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
Do you want your day-to-day work to have a real meaningful impact on your entire team?

When people around you are overwhelmed and disorganized, you bring order to the chaos and lead by example with your detailed eye, reliable presence, and trustworthy self.

And if we're being honest? We need someone exactly like you. (Like yesterday.)

Who do we think we are?

Excellent question. WeyMedia is a proudly Maritime company with a simple mission:

Make money easy and fun for everyone.

To do that, we strive to make both moneyGenius.ca and creditcardGenius.ca the best in our space. Although we're a young company, these two websites have already become two of the top resources for Canadian consumers.

We serve over 250,000+ engaged users by means of our free tools and technology, actionable articles, and objective personal finance product reviews.

We also actively reward our readers through GeniusCash ‒ our very own cash back rewards program on participating credit cards.

(And if that wasn’t enough, check out our $10K Tesla giveaway at creditcardgenius.ca/offers.)

So if you want to help us make it easy for Canadians to make smart financial decisions, read on…

Who we need

We need a detail-oriented, reliable, and trustworthy Administrative Coordinator to be part of our growing team.

  • You'll help grow our team by supporting all of our hiring initiatives.
  • You'll create and maintain business files, records, and processes using our accounting program, CRM system, and cloud office suite as needed.
  • You'll store and manage supplies for our new employee toolkit so that all new hires have the laptops and equipment they need to do their jobs well.
  • You'll facilitate customer relations with excellence and service top of mind.
  • You'll work directly with our clients and partners to accelerate our growth.
  • You'll ensure accurate and effective communication that represents the team and our brand.
  • You'll investigate and respond to all inquiries promptly and accurately.
  • You'll schedule and coordinate appointments and meetings as requested.
  • You'll support projects by attending meetings, ensuring all actionable items are recorded and delegated.
  • You'll manage multiple email accounts and respond to and redirect emails and inquiries.
  • You'll support stretch projects and assist the team as needed.
  • You'll wear many different hats in a lean, agile, and fast-paced culture.

Who you are

You care about your work, you know your stuff, and you go the extra mile.

  • You're a citizen or permanent resident of Canada.
  • "Organized" is your middle name ‒ you get things sorted, completed, and delivered on-time (or earlier).
  • You have at least 5 years experience working in a fast-paced professional services or start-up environment.
  • You can think on your feet ‒ no problem is too big, no question is too difficult ‒ you know how to find the right answers online and offline.
  • You're a self-starter, reliable, trustworthy ‒ you care about your team and doing your work well.
  • You have proven skills using G Suite, Office, and accounting software like Quickbooks online.
  • You're comfortable with technology, live in the cloud, and can learn and adapt quickly.
  • You're an amazing scheduler with a fine-tuned attention to detail and high standards.
  • You're good with numbers, spreadsheets, and math doesn't scare you.
  • You're a lifelong learner, a student for life.

What you'll get

We take care of our team. Here's a quick list of benefits you'll get working with us:

  • Challenging and rewarding work that has a real impact on the financial health of Canadians.
  • Work from home anywhere in Canada with permanent remote full time status.
  • Opportunities for continuous growth and career advancement.
  • Competitive salary based on your skills and experience.
  • An equal share in a portion of the company's profits.
  • 100% paid premiums for health, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 26 vacation and wellbeing days per year which includes:
    • 3 weeks of vacation
    • 8 public holidays
    • 2 flex days
    • Your birthday off
  • New Employee Toolkit that contains everything you need to do your job well.
    • Includes a company laptop, second monitor, and a dozen other useful items.
  • Regular team building fun including team games, lunches, happy hours, competitions with prizes, and more.
  • Mental health support through inConfidence and the Calm app.
  • Mobile phone allowance to help cover part of your monthly bill.

Let's talk

If you think this is you, please apply with your cover letter addressed to Chelsea so we know that you thoughtfully reviewed our job description.

title: Central Administration Coordinator
description:
Company Description

We have a lot of reasons to be proud to work here.

  • We have a generous benefits package, defined contribution pension plan and performance based success sharing to wellness days and allowances and leadership and learning development investments
  • Local is everything. We're all about working with local businesses and partnering with our communities to make them strong and vibrant
  • As a credit union, living the co-operative principles are part of our long and rich history
  • We develop meaningful relationships with our co-workers and members - that means learning about their passions, families, ambitions and doing what we can to improve their lives
  • We have a unique culture where we take our business seriously, but we like to have a little fun along the way
  • Education is a priority and we offer an abundance of leadership and professional development programs and training to help you be the best you can be
  • Corporate Social Responsibility is alive and well. From our partner Socks for Change to delivering financial literacy to new Canadians, to reducing our impact on the environment to being the official sponsor of the Niagara 2022 Canada Summer Games - we donate our time, money and expertise
  • We are all PenFi ambassadors and we live our truly local brand from the inside out

Who we are

  • PenFinancial Credit Union has been helping Niagara grow for over 60 years. With nearly 20,000 Members, and a rich history, our roots are firmly planted and our future is strong. As a values-driven co-operative we believe the prosperity of our Members and our community go hand in hand, and we’re on a mission to improve lives and strengthen communities.

Job Description

  • Complete processing and balancing of the paper and electronic daily transactions by the clearing system to ensure all transactions are accurately completed daily ,including stop payments, NSF, returned items, unpostables, manual items, member transfers, unqualified items ,US items and certified Items and any other items related to the clearing process.  Posting all outside payrolls and balancing of the same.  Post all related clearing items to the related General Ledger and balancing of same. Collect all related charges for any of the entries related to the clearing process and communicate with branches.
  • Completion of the Payment Stream Processing including approval of all Incoming and Outgoing Wires. Administration of the Branch CAFT System but not limited to the execution of the daily processing and maintenance and facilitating of branch requests.  The administration, set up and maintenance of the Corporate CAFT system liaising with BUSCOM to fulfil the requests of their members, and training of same.
  • Complete processing and balancing of Relay, Clearing Offset and balancing of related General ledger accounts. ATM balancing for offsite ATMs and assist branches with ATM balancing.  Processing of ATM adjustments and discrepancies
  • Daily balancing and posting of File and Exchanges relating to M2M, Remote Deposit Capture, Bill payments, Bill rejects, Bill tracing,  IOP, advices, and all related tracing items . Balancing of all related General ledger accounts
  • Complete AML processing, reviewing and creating of Large Cash and Wire Reports summarized and submitted. Liaise with Central 1 to prepare reports for submission to Fintrac.  To act as a main point of reference for branch staff relating to Fraud and reporting of same to Central 1 Fraud Alert System and report to compliance.
  • Tier 1 support for IT including but not limited to password resets, assisting with banking system questions/issues, etc 
  • Perform other assigned responsibilities.
Qualifications

  • College of university degree relating to financial banking industry or equivalent work experience an asset
  • 3 years financial knowledge related to the administrative duties of the job function.
  • Effectively manage competent priorities and timelines with the ability to work under pressure and defined deadlines and independently without direct supervision
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office and Excel


Additional Information

To learn more visit https://penfi.ca/careers/

While we welcome all applications, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Accessibility accommodations will be made for job candidates upon request.

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

Job Description

Here's How We Work:

Will work closely with the Administrative team and Administrative Office Manager. This role will be in office and both act as primary Reception and support administrative tasks largely computer based. The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role, and possess proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel and Outlook, and strong typing skills. In addition, possess strong organizational and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail. 

Most of The Things You’ll Work on:

  • Greeting (and registering) all incoming visitors.
  •  Maintaining contact lists and logs
  •  Manage logistics for meetings (coordination of lunches, sanitization etc) 
  •  Answering telephone calls (VOIP system) and responding to general inquiries. 
  •  Supporting IBI Group staff through an administrative function - both in-office and remote based employees
  • Providing administrative support to office, business development and project functions.
    • Includes working within our CRM, reference documents, and project documentation.
  •  Creating documents and spreadsheets in Word and Excel 
  •  Coordinate outgoing and incoming mail/courier packages 
  • General office maintenance (ordering supplies, communicating with building facilities, maintain upkeep, boardroom support, etc)
  •  Handling various tasks assigned by Office Manager including rearranging office space as required, maintaining and updating the code books in the library, renewing licenses and subscriptions, etc
  •  As part of the administrative team, participate in general tasks such as:
    • vacation and sick coverage for other team members, document distribution, supply orders, kitchen/coffee/dishwasher support, document management in support of architectural jobs
  •  Liaising with the departmental teams and office groups as necessary
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have: 

  • Experience working in a large office or work environment
  •  Highly capable with Microsoft Office programs, particularly Outlook,  Word and Excel
  • Professional and pleasant approach to all interactions. 
  • Professional and pleasant phone manner. Switchboard experience an asset
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a group.
  •  Information managements skills (filing, IT processes, etc);
  •  Confident with the ability to build strong working relationships
  •  Energetic, diplomatic, flexible, problem-solving mindset
  •  Strong organizational and prioritizing skills with the ability to take initiative
  •  Architectural / Engineering / Real Estate Development experience beneficial


Additional Information

Why you should work for IBI Group:

Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.

  • Competitive Base Salary based on industry standards
  • Robust Extended Medical Benefits
  • Participation in Incentives Program
  • Remote Work Options or Hybrid WFH-Office Schedule
  • Coverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional Associations
  • Professional Development & Self Directed Learning Resources

We request applicants submit RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We Are The Employer Brand of Choice.It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for an Administrative Assistant in London,Ontario.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the VP of Health Division, the Administrative Assistant provides administrative support to the Health Leadership team. Under minimal supervision performs a wide range of administrative activities and tasks. Handles assignments using independent judgment facilitating effective and efficient flow and processing of information and work associated with the day-to-day operations as assigned. The Administrative Assistant is available to complete special projects and support Health Operations.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Performs general administrative and clerical duties to include but not limited to: maintaining and managing calendars, booking travel and scheduling staff meetings; arranging meeting space or virtual meeting tools; ensuring that any follow-up actions resulting from the meeting are documented and completed
  • Opens and distribute incoming regular and other material and co-ordinates the flow of information internally and with other departments
  • Preforms data entry
  • May compile data, statistics and other information
  • Writing down minutes and meeting summaries
  • Coordinates meetings
  • Picks up supplies and office equipment

Knowledge & Skill Requirements

  • Post-secondary education
  • 1-2 years of experience in the field or related area
  • Proficiency in MS Office, Microsoft Work, PowerPoint, and Excel
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communications
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment

Why work for us?

  • This position may be qualified for our hybrid work option
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Competitive Benefit Offering
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Award Winning
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)

Sounds interesting? Please send your resume and salary expectations directly to Anna Micka, Director of Recruitment and Employee Experience at

anna.micka@voyago.ca

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

Job Description

Here's How We Work:

Assist with project support duties on current Architectural projects and other regular administration duties. The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role, and possess proficiency in Microsoft Office: Sharepoint, Office 365 Word, Excel and Outlook and strong typing skills. In addition, possess strong organizational and problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail.   

Most of the things you’ll work on:

  •  Maintaining project lists and contact lists, including data inputs into company CRM program
  •  Project filing and other document handling as required
  •  Assisting with progress draws and change orders, in support of architectural jobs
  •  Assisting with document management regarding  submissions for permits and occupancy
  •  Coordinating meetings, assisting with submissions and other architectural tasks as required
  •  Handling switchboard and reception as lunch / break fill-in and vacation coverage
  •  Assisting with courier and fax distribution
  •  Assisting with supply orders, equipment maintenance, kitchen/coffee/dishwasher support
  •  Coordinating reference librarian and product reps visits
  •  Working with Urban Design, Engineering, Marketing, Graphics as well as Architectural team
  • Other duties as required
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  •  Minimum 3-5 years' experience working in a large office or work environment
  • Highly capable with Microsoft Office Suite  
  • Familiarity with Sharepoint and O365
  • Abilities with Mac and PC preferred
  • Information managements skills (filing systems, IT processes, etc)
  • Confident, socially comfortable with people
  • Energetic, diplomatic, flexible problem-solving mindset
  • Self-directed, ability to determine task priority, necessity, etc.
  • Keen interest in learning and mastering new skills
  • Quality Management driven
  • Architectural / Engineering / Real Estate Development experience helpful


Additional Information

Why you should work for IBI Group:

Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.

  • Competitive Base Salary based on industry standards
  • Robust Extended Medical Benefits
  • Participation in Incentives Program
  • Remote Work Options or Hybrid WFH-Office Schedule
  • Coverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional Associations
  • Professional Development & Self Directed Learning Resources

We request applicants submit RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Administrative Assistant (TIVE) - Bilingual
description:
Join the big family Tetra Tech ! Our reputation in the engineering industry is based on our technical expertise and the commitment of more than 20,000 professionals around the world, including more than 3,500 in Canada and 1,500 in Quebec. We take care of the human being and we are aware that our people are our strength. Come and use your full potential with us!

The culture at Tetra Tech is:

  • talented and user-friendly teams;
  • flexible modes of work, adapted to your reality, because life is part of our plans;
  • The daily collaboration in a most enjoyable environment;
  • A support focused on your professional development;
  • A human, responsible and integrity environment, impressed with inclusion and diversity.

this What we are missing to continue to shine the administrative team of the Municipal-Water Group, it is a bilingual administrative (IVE) assistant that stands out for its rigor and skills.

Territory : Province of Quebec - Flexible working mode. Ability to be 100% teleworking

The challenges that will allow you to exceed:

  • Provide administrative support to the teams in the Engineering Projects Framework;
  • Perform the correction, review and layout of various engineering documents in French and English (letters, tables, reports, studies, agenda, Minutes , quoted, addendum, progressive counts, requests for government authorization, etc.);
  • Proceed to opening files;
  • Participate in the writing of service offers;
  • Organize, keep and maintain various documents (corporate cv, project cards);
  • track and ranking (files, emails) and ensure compliance according to the standards of Quality;
  • Assist project teams in preparing and monitoring meetings, projects, submissions, etc.;
  • assume the tasks inherent in the functioning of the group.

what Made of you the ideal person for this position:

at Tetra Tech, we have a place for you! With the wide variety of projects we have, your role will be adapted according to your level of expertise.

  • Secretariat degree, in office, administration or related field;
  • more than 3 years of office experience;

  • bilingualism compulsory (French-English);

Tetra Tech subscribes to an Employment Equality Access Program and invites women, Aboriginal people, people with disabilities and visible or ethnic minorities to to apply. Please note that only selected applications will be contacted.

title: Agent(e) de soutien administratif, classe I
description:
Poste à temps complet

NATURE DU TRAVAIL

Le rôle principal et habituel du titulaire de cette classe d'emploi consiste à accomplir un ensemble de travaux administratifs de nature relativement complexe selon des méthodes et procédures établies et des travaux de secrétariat liés au déroulement des activités des activités de la formation continue.
 

QUELQUES ATTRIBUTIONS CARACTÉRISTIQUES
- Elle peut avoir à réaliser une partie ou l'ensemble des travaux d'un ou de plusieurs secteurs d’activités, notamment celui des programmes créditables (AEC).

La personne de cette classe d’emploi :

- Effectue des opérations comptables de nature relativement complexe et voit au respect des normes et des procédures. Elle peut également effectuer certains achats de valeur peu élevée. Elle accomplit des travaux de vérification et voit au contrôle des paiements. Elle prépare et effectue les dépôts et les encaissements.

- Transcrit des textes et reproduit différents tableaux et graphiques. Elle tient à jour des banques de données, l’inventaire des documents requis par les personnes utilisatrices, certains dossiers des personnes qu'elle assiste ainsi que leur agenda. Elle organise les réunions, convoque les personnes participantes et prépare les dossiers nécessaires.

- Est appelée à faire de la mise en page de textes variés et d’en faire la correction linguistique.

- Accueille les personnes, donne les informations relevant de sa compétence et les oriente à l’intérieur du collège.

- Cherche et recueille des renseignements à inclure dans la correspondance ou dans des rapports.

- Assortit, classe et repère des documents selon les méthodes établies.

- Initie au travail les nouvelles personnes.

- Utilise les outils technologiques de l’information et des communications mis à sa disposition en lien avec les travaux à réaliser.

- Au besoin, elle accomplit toute autre tâche connexe.
 

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

- Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires ou un diplôme d’études professionnelles avec option appropriée ou détenir un diplôme ou une attestation d’études dont l’équivalence est reconnue par l’autorité compétente.

- Avoir au moins une (1) année d’expérience pertinente.

- L’ensemble des connaissances et attitudes requises sera évalué par divers tests :

  • test de français;
  • test des logiciels de la suite Microsoft Office, Word intermédiaire et Excel débutant.

title: Administrateur/Administratrice du bureau / Office Administrator
description:
Brandt est actuellement à la recherche d'unAdministrateur/Administratrice du bureau pour sa succursale de Val d'Or.

Ce poste est responsable de diverses tâches administratives et de fournir un soutien à la succursale/bureau.

Fonctions et responsabilités

  • Assumer les tâches de réception
  • Surveiller les réclamations de garantie
  • Soutenir la facturation, les comptes recevables/payables, la paie et le traitement des biens/fournitures
  • Responsable des dépôts en succursale et de la coordination de la sécurité
  • Tâches administratives générales assignées
  • D’autres tâches peuvent être assignées

Compétences requises

  • Excellentes compétences en communication et en organisation
  • Capacité à respecter les échéances
  • Maîtrise de Microsoft Office

Experience requise

  • Expérience préalable dans l’administration des services et la coordination de la sécurité, considéré comme un atout
  • Diplôme ou certificat d’études en secrétariat est considéré comme un atout

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Brandt is currently seeking anOffice Administrator for our Val d'Or location.

This position is responsible for various administrative duties, and providing support to the branch/office as required.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provide reception duties
  • Monitor warranty claims
  • Support invoicing, accounts payable/receivable, payroll, and wholegoods processing
  • Responsible for branch deposits, safety coordination
  • General administrative duties as assigned
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Skills

  • Must possess excellent communication/organizational skills
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office

Required Experience

  • Previous experience in service administration and safety coordination is considered an asset
  • Office Education diploma/certificate is considered an asset

title: secrétaire (Saint-Jérôme, QC, CA)
description:
Concours: 139408
Titre: secrétaire
Statut: Permanent
Durée: Permanent
Lieu: Saint-Jérôme
Fin d'affichage: 12/05/2022

VOS DÉFIS

.

NATURE DE L'EMPLOI

Effectuer diverses tâches administratives et de secrétariat afin de fournir le soutien requis au personnel des unités administratives desservies.

 

TÂCHES TYPES

  1. Recevoir ou préparer divers documents ou formulaires d'entreprise incluant ceux relatifs à la gestion du personnel, les vérifier, les corriger et obtenir les approbations requises et informer les personnes concernées. Effectuer les recherches et le suivi relatifs au traitement de ces documents ou formulaires ainsi que la saisie de données dans les systèmes et au besoin, procéder à l'extraction de rapports des systèmes d'entreprise.
  2. Transcrire, formuler, dactylographier et. corriger des lettres, courriels, textes, rapports courants ou autres documents.
  3. Recevoir les demandes d'information et la correspondance, obtenir les renseignements nécessaires ou la documentation pertinente, y donner suite et en assurer le suivi. Traiter les questions qui relèvent de ses attributions.
  4. Préparer, vérifier et tenir à jour divers dossiers, rapports, listes et registres et compiler des données servant à la préparation des budgets ainsi que pour diverses statistiques.
  5. S'occuper de l'organisation matérielle des réunions, préparer l'ordre du jour et la documentation pertinente. Au besoin, assister aux réunions, rédiger le compte rendu et en faire la distribution.
  6. Mettre en place ou tenir à jour un système de classement de divers documents ou dossiers, classer les documents ou dossiers, voir à leur conservation ou à leur destruction selon les encadrements en vigueur
  7. Vérifier les quantités de fournitures de bureau, de matériel ou d'équipement. Préparer les demandes visant leur renouvellement et obtenir les approbations requises. Coordonner les actions relatives à l'aménagement des unités administratives desservies.
  8. Communiquer avec les personnes concernées pour l'entretien des appareils ou équipements de bureau.

 

Les tâches mentionnées reflètent les éléments caractéristiques de l'emploi identifié et ne doivent pas être considérées comme une énumération exhaustive de toutes les exigences occupationnelles Inhérentes. 

VOTRE PROFIL

  • Secondaire V ou équivalent
  • Détenir un diplôme d'études collégiales (DEC) en techniques de secrétariat, un atout.
  • Posséder une expérience approfondie dans le domaine du secrétariat.
  • Avoir une grande capacité à coordonner les demandes, à organiser des rencontres, à gérer l'agenda et à assurer le suivi des dossiers et des projets.
  • Avoir une bonne maîtrise des systèmes informatiques de l’entreprise, un atout.
  • Avoir une très bonne maitrise des logiciels Word, Excel, PowerPoint et Outlook.
  • Avoir de l'expérience en facturation, un atout. 
  • Avoir démontré sa capacité à traiter des dossiers de nature confidentielle et faire preuve d'une grande discrétion.
  • Démontrer la maîtrise des compétences comportementales suivantes :
    • Agile et orienté résultats
    • Centré sur le client 
    • Éthique professionnelle, rigueur, souci de la qualité et de la sécurité et du développement durable.
    • Travail d'équipe
  • Avoir de la langue française une connaissance appropriée à cette fonction.

.

PARTICULARITÉS

  • Horaire de travail 5 jours/semaine du lundi au vendredi. 
  • Doit détenir un permis de conduire de classe 5.
  • Le candidat retenu fera l'objet d'une vérification administrative de sécurité, incluant une enquête de bonnes moeurs. 

Le candidat retenu fera l'objet d'une vérification administrative de sécurité.

Diplôme obtenu à l'extérieur du Canada : Nous exigeons l'évaluation comparative des études émise par le Ministère de l'Immigration, de la Francisation et de l’Intégration. Vous devez présenter le document officiel sur demande.

Pour que votre candidature à ce poste soit prise en considération, vous devez déposer votre candidature sur notre site emplois.

Hydro-Québec applique un programme d'accès à l’égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Nous vous invitons à lire la déclaration de l'entreprise à cet égard. Nous communiquons uniquement avec les personnes retenues à la suite de l'analyse des dossiers.

title: Administrative Assistant
company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description:
Administrative Assistant, People
People and Experience

Position Description
Reporting to the Director, People, the Administrative Assistant will provide administrative support primarily to the Director, but also provide support to the leadership team in People and to CAMH employees in supporting HR reception to ensure the smooth and effective operation of the People Department and its functions. This position will also be responsible for providing core administrative support as required to the managers and teams that report to the Director, as well as responding to employee requests and liaising with other internal CAMH departments to ensure consistency with administrative processes and requirements to ensure the effective operations of the People Department.

The successful candidate will work closely with and assist the Director, People and their management team, be responsible for maintaining the Director’s schedule by booking appointments and scheduling meetings with both internal and external partners; providing assistance, preparing documentation and gathering information on a wide range of confidential organizational, employee, and program related projects and issues. You will be required to provide employment verification letters to employees; reviewing payroll, general ledger and operating budgets and tracking specific work assignments, etc.; general office administration duties as required (ordering supplies, maintenance requirements, invoices for services, subscriptions, staff development, acquiring voicemail, computer access, keys etc. for new employees to the department). You will work closely with the Director, People and will deal with and have access to confidential information and provide assistance to colleagues, staff, clients and the public regarding any of the above. There will also be opportunities for you to participate and lead special projects within the People Department. The successful candidate will support a workplace that embraces diversity and encourages teamwork.

Qualifications
The successful candidate will have a Post Secondary Certificate or Diploma in Office Administration, Human Resources, or a related discipline, combined with 2 to 4 years of relevant administrative experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Executive-level experience would be considered an asset. Superior interpersonal, planning, time management, organizational, critical thinking, problem-solving, and customer service skills are required. The candidate must be able to multi-task under pressure, deal with conflicting priorities, and coordinate projects to tight deadlines, with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail are required. In this role, you must be willing to take initiative, have the ability to prioritize work effectively and efficiently with minimal supervision. As a team player, you possess excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to communicate effectively. Advanced computer skills, particularly with Microsoft office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) are essential. Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills are critical. The ability to work with clients and stakeholders of diverse cultural and social backgrounds is necessary. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language are assets. Bilingualism (English/French) would also be considered an asset.

Please Note:This full-time position is NOT part of any bargaining unit.

Salary Range:Competitive Compensation and Benefits

Please click the apply button below.

Posting Date: May 4, 2022
Closing Date: May 14, 2022 by 5pm
Job Number:898241


CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

title: Operations Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview

 

 

Operations Administrative Assistant

 

 

 

Looking to build your career in an exciting industry and a growing world class organization?  Come see why so many of our team members recommend us to their friends!

 

Who are we?

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation is proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies in North America.  We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands across industries as diverse as manufacturing, distribution, retail, food service, and hospitality.  We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to enhance the value and impact of our services.

Responsibilities

 

What do our Operations Administrative Assistants do?

 

Operations Administration Assistants help with the coordination and management of internal branch functions as well as interface with customers over the phone. This role supports sales professionals, office management and service technicians.  In addition, Operations Administrative Assistants perform general clerical duties as assigned for the benefit of the region.

  • Prepare sales proposals, Log Books, and other customer-generated information
  • Submit all required paperwork within designated timeframe
  • Assist with Customer and Colleague Opinion Surveys
  • Support orientation and training of new hires
  • Maintain adequate inventories of all required supplies
  • Process accounts payable vouchers on invoices
  • Participate with accounts receivable and collections, as needed
  • Work with customers, managers and sales reps to resolve billing problems
  • Assist with payroll
  • May open, sort and distribute daily mail
  • May count monthly inventory
  • May assist with forecasting and monthly financial close
  • May serve as HR liaison between corporate and branch

What do you need?

  • High school diploma or GED
  • 3-5 years of administrative/office/customer service experience
  • Strong attention to detail and willingness to learn
  • Excellent organization and time management skills
  • Ability to maintain confidential information in mature manner
  • Available to work Monday-Friday and Saturdays as needed
  • Must pass pre-employment background screen and drug test

Why Choose Rentokil Canada Corporation?

 

A career with Rentokil Canada Corporation is exactly that - a professional trajectory filled with opportunity.  We pride ourselves on being a world class team that rewards high performance.  We offer competitive pay on a bi-weekly pay schedule and many of our roles offer incentives based on performance and providing exceptional customer experience.

 

Below you'll find information about some of what Rentokil Canada Corporation has to offer.  All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits when they meet certain criteria.

 

  • Professional and Personal Growth:
    • Robust Paid Training & Professional Development Path
    • Opportunity to grow - We love to promote from within!
    • Fantastic Tuition Reimbursement benefits & Scholarship Programs (for FT Colleagues)
  • Wellness:
    • Excellent Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
    • Outstanding Company-Paid Short Term Disability
    • Access to Long-Term Disability Insurance
    • Employee Assistance Program that offers services such as free counselling services and other benefits
    • Company-paid sick time
  •  Savings & Retirement:
    • Retirement Savings plan with highly-competitive company-matching contributions
    • Holiday Savings Club option with company-matching funds
    • Employee Discounts (includes many offerings, including cellular/mobile service, (and more)
  •  Work-Life Balance:
    • Vacation Days
    • Company-Paid Holidays

 

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work.  Is that you? 

Additional Information

Want to hear Colleague feedback on what it's like to be on our team? Check us out on Glassdoor! Glassdoor - Rentokil North America

 

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation  is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply for positions. Rentokil Canada Corporation is committed to provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Please ensure to inform us if you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant


Job ID


63954


Posted


04-May-2022


Service line


REI Segment


Role type


Full-time


Areas of Interest


Administrative


Location(s)


Toronto - Ontario - Canada


_CBRE Investment Management is a leading global real assets investment management firm operating in more than 20 countries around the world. The firm seeks to deliver sustainable investment solutions across real assets categories, geographies, risk profiles and execution formats so that its clients, people and communities thrive. CBRE Investment Management is an independently operated affiliate of CBRE Group, Inc., the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm._


_This position will be working with the Private Infrastructure line of business for CBRE Investment Management in our Toronto office. The Private Infrastructure team creates long-term value for its clients by accessing, acquiring and managing high-quality investments and building comprehensive infrastructure portfolios. Today the team manages over US$6.1 billion on behalf of institutional investors globally._


The Role


CBRE Investment Management, Private Infrastructure is looking for an Administrative Assistant to join our Private Infrastructure team and provide support to a group of professional staff on the Investment team. The Administrative Assistant will work closely as part of an Administrative team to provide back-up and ensure the continuous uninterrupted support of the investment team and other staff as required.


Responsibilities


– Provide administrative support including document and presentation preparation, as well as photocopying, binding, filing, updating databases, etc.


– Support Investment team professionals with booking all travel and accommodations (flights, hotels, car services, etc.), coordinate cancellations, schedule out-of-town meetings, prepare and maintain travel itineraries, develop agendas, and ensure all relevant materials are available before departure


– Create and initiate correspondence and memoranda; compile and prepare data for administrative reports and presentations


– Serve as an administrative liaison to others within/outside the department/company regarding administration issues in areas such as accounting (expense reports), marketing (client events), etc.


– Answer phone calls with regards to inquiries, researching and resolving problems requiring knowledge of administrative policies and procedures


– Complete monthly expense reports, including gathering receipts and preparing reports for corporate credit cards


– Manage calendars and schedule meetings; complete registrations for conferences and AGMs and organize conference dinners; arrange panel calls and presentations; prepares agendas for team meetings


– Works as part of the Administration team to support and provide coverage for other Administrative Assistants and other office support duties as needed


– Carry out special projects and assignments as requested, including coordination/planning and execution of special events for client, department and/or office events as needed


– Assist with other ad hoc administrative support as required


#CBREIM


Qualifications


– A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience providing administrative support to both junior and senior staff in financial services, consulting, law or other professional office environment; experience in private markets (private equity or infrastructure investing) an asset


– Exceptional computer skills including demonstrated expertise in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook


– Strong oral and written communication skills; well-honed interpersonal skills; ability to build and maintain relationships cross-functionally throughout the organization and externally with clients, vendors and other third parties


– Proven time management and organizational skills; ability to work well under pressure with tight timelines; experience dealing with multiple conflicting priorities and the know-how to prioritize effectively


– Experience with booking travel (flights, hotels, cars, meals, remote meetings, etc.), meeting scheduling, expense reporting and agenda preparation


– Ambitious self-starter, solid team player with a positive attitude and a high degree of professionalism and ethical standards


– “Roll up your sleeves” willingness to work in an entrepreneurial environment to get work done as necessary; resourceful and persistent


If you are interested in applying and have the qualifications for this role, please submit your resumeand cover letter.
CBRE, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer (Women/Minorities/Persons with Disabilities/US Veterans)

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant

Watrous, SK

 

Join a team that shares your passion and enthusiasm for Canadian agriculture! Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited (P&H) has an opportunity for a motivated, forward-thinking and dedicated individual to bring their organization and customer service skills to a role as an Administrative Assistant based in Watrous, SK.

Work and grow with a family-owned company.

P&Hâ€™s roots go back over 110 years, and we have always been a Canadian, family-owned and managed agri-business. Our corporate culture values are family values; honesty and integrity with a focus on listening and continuous learning. Like family, we support our staff to always do better.

With over 70 locations spanning from coast to coast, and trade links around the globe, P&H is growth-oriented, diversified and vertically integrated with operations spanning across grain trading, handling and merchandising, as well as crop inputs, flour milling and feed mills.

Skills and experience for the next step in your career.

As Administrative Assistant, you will be responsible for facilitating the overall operation of the facilityâ€™s office through daily administrative tasks. Reporting to the General Manager, the Administrative Assistant will also be the first point of contact for producer/customer calls and will redirect inquiries to the appropriate resource or Manager when needed. 

Your day-to-day activities will include:

  • Grain Delivery Payments to customers
  • Crop Input transactions including participation with inventory controls
  • Assist with the creation of grain contracts
  • Maintain filing for all documentation per auditing standards
  • Assist with Safety/HACCP documentation
  • Perform exceptional customer service & reception
  • General Office duties including maintaining supplies
  • Other duties as assigned

The successful candidate should enter the position with the following qualifications:

  • Minimum 1 year of experience in an office/clerical/administrative role
  • Post-secondary education in administration or agriculture or equivalent experience
  • Knowledge of or previous experience in the agricultural industry (an asset)
  • Exceptional Customer service and interpersonal skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to work as part of a team and independently
  • Decision making and problem solving skills
  • Ability to multitask
  • Proficient computer skills.

 

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Learn more about us at www.parrishandheimbecker.com


P&H is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that is reflective of Canadian society.  As a result, Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited is an equal opportunity employer and is in compliance with the Employment Equity Act. We welcome applications from women, aboriginal people, people with disabilities and members of visible minorities.  Accommodations in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Administrative Assistant-Commercial Support
description:
Reporting to the Plant Administration Supervisor, the Commercial Support Specialist will provide key support activities.  This support role performs duties such as back up for commodity purchasing and front reception.

 

Core Functions:

  • Act as a liaison to the Plant Administrative Supervisor
  • Provide vacation backup to Senior Commercial Support specialist.  Ensure that all plant commodity purchases and receipts are properly controlled, applied, and settled as per the producer’s instructions
  • Provide reception support and vacation backup to Administrative Assistant and all related duties including answering phones, filing, catering needs, office supply ordering, mailing, etc.
  • Support and coordinate the gathering of documentation requested by various internal/external audits, specifically in regards to SOX narratives
  • Assisting various other departments with administrative duties, including but not limited to data entry and support for Health & Safety recognition programs and clothing orders
  • Vacation coverage for Oils Support position
  • Annual record retention archiving and offsite storage coordination
  • Provide support to maintenance with tracking of Contractor hours reconciliation, misc. administrative duties needed by maintenance department.
  • Provide support to purchasing with creating monthly standard purchase order report, auto order supplies spreadsheet entry, etc.
  • Reconciliation of company purchasing credit cards.
  • Administration of clothing program and reconciliation of employee clothing with invoices.
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Post-secondary education preferred; high school diploma or equivalency is required
  • Prior work experience in customer service, both to internal and external stakeholders
  • Demonstrated problem solving experience and ability to react quickly and make decisions in a rapidly changing environment
  • Must have ability to work in a fast paced team environment
  • Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks
  • Proficient skills with Microsoft Office, Excel and SAP
  • Effective mathematical, written and verbal communication skills are essential

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Together, we are stronger and achieve more.

Viterra is looking for a full time Administrative Assistant to join our team in Thunder Bay. This role is responsible for performing a variety of administrative and support services within our Maintenance department.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Acts as a “first point of contact” for incoming calls and visitors responding to routine inquiries.
  • Inputs information into appointment calendars of various managers as required.
  • As directed, prepares and circulates agendas and related information for meetings and arranging meetings.
  • Prepares, edits and formats various documents, reports, spreadsheets and/or presentations.
  • Maintains Maintenance Records.
  • Validates Payroll in Kronos for unionized employees in the maintenance department.
  • Maintains filing systems and adheres to records retention schedule.
  • Prepare and submit Purchase orders to support maintenance. 
  • Maintains office and equipment. Orders office supplies. 
  • Receives, sort and distributes incoming and outgoing correspondence. 
  • Completes accounts payable vouchers, submits invoices for payment and may reconcile purchase card statements.
  • Supports and assists other office functions as required, and other related duties as required.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Computer proficient with demonstrated ability in the use of spreadsheet, databases, communication, and word processing software applications.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Proven ability to work effectively within a team environment.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize activities to meet deadlines.

Education and Qualifications:

  • Minimum of three (3) years related experience.
  • Grade 12 or equivalent and an administrative / business office certificate or Certificate of Administration.

Equivalent combinations of education and experience that result in the required level of knowledge skill and competence will be considered.

Employment Type: 

Regular

Posting Close Date:

5/6/2022

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Description:

Weâ€™re a naan traditional companyâ€¦


The  Administrative  Assistant  is a self-starter, proactive, results-oriented individual with excellent  organizational and  communication skills who willprovideoutstanding support tothe T&DGroup Leader,reporting to the T&D Program Manager.

 

What FGF Offers:

  • FGF believes in Home Grown Talent, accelerated career growth with leadership training.   Unleashing Your Potential  
  • Competitive Compensation, Health Benefits, & a generous flexible medical / Health spending account
  • RRSP matching program
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Discount program that covers almost everything under the sun - Restaurants, gyms, shopping etc

Primary Responsibilities  
 

  • Produce a variety of materials such as reports, spreadsheets,  powerpoint  presentations  etc.    
  • Assists  with/helps  prepare information for presentations  
  • Verifying  the accuracy of  correspondence, documents, letters and memos    
  • Organize  and schedule  internal and external meetings and  ensures  all details are managed    
  • Create action plans to track progress and follow up  to ensure  timelines are met  
  • Update  databases/files  (electronic & hard copies)  maintaining  current documentation  (i.e.  agreements,  NDAâ€™s, audits)  
  • Reconciliation and preparation of receipts for expense reports  
  • Other miscellaneous duties as required  

Required Experience  

 

  • Minimum 2 years of experience  in an  administrative  support role  
  • Advanced  knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  
  • Exceptional organizational  skills:  ability to speak to/work with all levels within an organization  
  • Adapt and work extremely well with a diverse set of stakeholders  
  • Thoroughness and careful attention to detail  
  • Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding    
  • High  level of maturity,  good judgement,  and the ability  to deal with confidential information  
  • Familiarity in an environment requiring  discretion, sensitivity to confidential matters  
  • A talent  for multi-tasking and the ability to work  in a  fast-paced  environment  
  • Knowledge of Concur,  ICIMS and Visio  considered an asset  
  • Finance, Accounting experience, considered an asset  

What is the recipe for a great career at FGF?

Working at FGF Brands, there is never a dull moment! As a successful company that is continually growing there is always challenging yet rewarding work to be a part of.  We have an entrepreneurial spirit which encourages all our team members to use their own creativity and out of the box thinking to come up with solutions and new ideas.

 

 

Disclaimer: The above describes the general responsibilities, required knowledge and skills.   Please keep in mind that other duties may be added, or this description may be amended at any time.

title: 202 - Administrative Assistant / Receptionist
description:
Our client, one of Canada’s most progressive Midstream companies in Canada, has an immediate need for an Administrative Assistant. This is a contract position for two (2) weeks with a very good chance of extension. This role is located in the Calgary, Alberta

 Description       

The Administrative Assistant in this role will establish a positive first impression with all visitors and new hires. Support the day-to-day activities associated with the smooth and safe running of the office, including being a focal point for occupants on office services and reception matters, developing and maintaining office protocols, coordinating building services, overseeing the property management, and managing third-party vendors.

 Accountabilities

  • Welcome visitors to the office and assist them as needed.
  • Answer, screen, and forward incoming calls and emails, answering enquiries as necessary.
  • Manage, distribute, and prepare incoming and outgoing mail, packages, and office supplies.
  • Support onboarding and offboarding activities.
  • Follow reception and office procedures with maximum efficiency and continuous improvements.
  • Coordinate event planning and internal and external meeting activities as directed.
  • Ensure office space and operations are safe, and efficient, and add maximum value
  • Coordinate property management services and building maintenance activities.
  • Coordinate and manage office services contracts and relationships with vendors, and service providers.
  • Acquire and distribute internal and external marketing materials.
  • Prepare and manage the office services budget.
  • Provide support for HR initiatives and internal communications.
  • Other duties as deemed appropriate for this position by leadership.

 Required

  • Organized with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office and office management applications.
  • Strong communication, customer service and relationship building skills.
  • Exceptional attention to detail and time management skills.
  • Problem-solving and project management skills.
  • Flexible, independent self-starter with the ability to use initiative.
  • Discretion in dealing with confidential matters and information.
  • Preferred
  • Working knowledge of SharePoint, ServiceNow, Robin, SuccessFactors, Concur and SAP, as well as the use of office machinery, such as postage meters, and multi-function printers.
  • Education, Training & Certifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related field preferred.
  • Experience
  • Proven experience in an Office Services role or similar.
  • Previous success working in a fast-paced office environment.
  • Working Conditions
  • Working in an open-plan office environment.
  • Prolonged computer usage throughout the working day.
  • Ability to lift 50lbs.

Additional Information

  • Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin” for this opportunity.

If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at

http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

#WES

#MON

title: Commis
description:
REPRÉSENTANT COMMERCIAL

Vous souhaitez combiner votre passion pour l’automobile avec votre désir d’offrir le meilleur service à la clientèle? Nous avons ce qu’il vous faut. Chez CARQUEST, notre objectif est d’être le meilleur fournisseur de pièces du marché secondaire de l’automobile. Notre société mère, Advance Auto Parts, est le plus important fournisseur de pièces automobiles du marché secondaire nord-américain.
Nous sommes à la recherche d’amateurs de voitures positifs et motivés pour se joindre à notre équipe. Les titulaires de ce poste devront entretenir d’excellentes relations avec nos clients.

CE QUI EST OFFERT PAR L’ENTREPRISE:

L’occasion de travailler pour le plus important fournisseur de pièces automobiles du marché secondaire nord-américain.
Des possibilités d’avancement de carrière dans toute l’organisation Advance Auto Parts.
L’accès à un excellent système de formation en ligne dédié au développement personnel ou à la formation des gestionnaires.
Une culture organisationnelle enrichissante grâce au programme de reconnaissance des coéquipiers et aux repas en équipe.
Un rabais employé sur les pièces automobiles, les outils et l’équipement.
Un régime d’avantages sociaux collectifs après 90 jours à l’emploi, y compris l’assurance maladie complémentaire, l’assurance dentaire, les soins de la vue, l’assurance vie et l’assurance en cas de décès ou de mutilation accidentels.
Des avantages financiers tels qu’un REER collectif avec contribution de contrepartie de l’employeur et un régime d’achat d’actions à rabais pour tous les coéquipiers permanents.

CE QUE VOUS APPORTEREZ À L’ÉQUIPE :

Être passionné par le service à la clientèle. Avoir une disposition naturelle à offrir un service exceptionnel en tout temps et à tisser des liens durables avec les clients, les autres employés, la direction, etc.
Être orienté sur la vente : Posséder des aptitudes avérées pour la vente et toujours s’efforcer d’atteindre les objectifs de vente personnels et en magasin, de même que les objectifs de service.
Faire preuve d’esprit d’équipe. S’engager à travailler en équipe. Démontrer une attitude positive et amicale.
Avoir de l’expérience dans l’industrie automobile. Posséder des connaissances avancées des pièces et systèmes automobiles. Avoir de l’expérience avec le système pour point de vente. Conseiller les clients pour leurs projets ou pour la résolution de problèmes complexes, par exemple l’identification de pièces.
Être débrouillard : Localiser des pièces auprès de différentes sources, y compris les commandes spéciales, secondes sources, etc.
Apprendre rapidement. Avoir une connaissance approfondie des opérations en magasin et une parfaite connaissance des procédures d’entretien et d’inventaire en magasin.
Faire preuve d’autonomie et de fiabilité dans l’exécution des tâches. Effectuer l’ouverture et la fermeture du magasin de manière responsable. Favoriser un environnement de travail sécuritaire.
Scolarité : Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires ou diplôme d’équivalence d’études secondaires.
Être flexible : Être disponible le jour, le soir, la fin de semaine et lors des jours fériés, au besoin.

Exigences physiques : Les détails de la présente décrivent les exigences physiques nécessaires pour que l’employé puisse effectuer avec succès les tâches essentielles de son poste, avec ou sans accommodement raisonnable. Dans l’exercice de ses fonctions, le coéquipier sera principalement appelé à marcher et à se tenir debout. Le coéquipier doit être en mesure de parler, d’entendre, d’utiliser ses mains et ses doigts pour manipuler ou toucher des objets, de tendre les bras pour atteindre des objets, de grimper, de se tenir en équilibre, de se pencher, de s’agenouiller, de s’accroupir et de ramper. Le coéquipier devra fréquemment soulever et/ou déplacer des objets allant jusqu’à 23 kg (50 lb). Ce poste exige d’avoir une bonne vue de près et de loin, de distinguer les couleurs et d’avoir une bonne perception de la profondeur.
Environnement de travail : Les détails de la présente décrivent l’environnement où le titulaire devra accomplir les tâches essentielles du poste, avec ou sans accommodement raisonnable. Dans l’exercice de ses fonctions, le coéquipier travaillera habituellement à l’intérieur dans un environnement de vente au détail. Le coéquipier sera occasionnellement exposé à des produits chimiques caustiques. Le niveau de bruit dans l’environnement de travail est habituellement modéré.
En tant qu’employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi, nous ne faisons preuve d’aucune discrimination envers tout postulant ou employé en raison de son origine raciale, de la couleur de sa peau, de son sexe, de son âge, de son origine nationale, de sa religion, de son orientation sexuelle, de son identité de genre, d’une incapacité ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par les lois fédérales, provinciales ou municipales.

title: Administrative Assistant, Trades & Industrial (Summer Student)
description:
Established in 1976 the Saskatchewan Indian Institute of Technologies (SIIT) is a First Nation governed post-secondary institution. Recognized under provincial legislation, the Institute has been conferred authority to grant certificates and diplomas. SIIT welcomes over 2400 students into our urban and community programs annually as well as serving over 6000 clients through our nine Career Centres across the province. The Saskatchewan Indian Institute of Technologies is playing a significant role in Saskatchewan's economic future. You can contribute to that success while building your career.


Nature and Scope

The Administrative Assistant - Summer Student provides administrative functions while maintaining a high degree of accuracy and careful handling of highly confidential and sensitive information. As an employee of SIIT, this position positively promotes and create an environment that demonstrates SIIT's vision, mission and mandate.


General Accountability

The Administrative Assistant - Summer Student will have the opportunity to gain excellent experience while developing the skills necessary to be successful in their future. The summer student will have an opportunity to improve their teamwork and communication skills, as well as, their administrative skills and leadership capabilities. This position includes the following broad range of accountabilities:

Specific Accountabilities

  • Extensive knowledge of the functions, purposes and programs of SIIT to answer and direct routine inquires and promptly respond as required
  • Answer the phone in accordance with SIIT standards; transfer calls where appropriate and take messages as required
  • Greet and interact with clients and visitors in a timely, professional and pleasant manner; coupled with determining the nature of visitors' business and providing appropriate information
  • Management of the front office which includes being responsible for opening and closing the office by following applicable procedures; as well as maintain a clean atmosphere on the main floor, lunch room, and front reception area at all times
  • Provide professional administrative assistance to your direct supervisor and to employees in your department in order to support the accomplishment of business activities
  • Maintain the filing systems of the department
  • Carry out quality control of data entry
  • Receive, sort, and send mail, courier packages, and faxes
  • Create and maintain efficient and detailed electronic and paper file management processes
  • Accountable for the upkeep and visual display of program brochures, employee request forms, and daily papers
  • Maintain regular communication with other SIIT Administrative Staff to ensure consistency in communications, SIIT practices and procedures
  • Additional support as required


Eligible Participants:

  • First Nations and Inuit secondary and post-secondary students aged 15 to 30 inclusive
  • Ordinarily resident on reserve or in recognized communities or on community lands
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Registered as full-time students during the preceding academic year and who intend to return to school on a full-time basis in the next academic year


Required Qualifications and Experience:

  • Prior experience working with Microsoft Office suite of programs is an asset. The position may be required to work a blend of remote and in-office through the duration of the term.


Required Competencies: Effective Communication, Flexible & Adaptable, Relationship Building, Results Oriented, Attention to Detail, Client Focus, Self-Management, Initiative.


This work term runs until August 26, 2022.

title: Administrative Assistant to the AMOH
description:
Job Description:

Administrative Assistant to the Associate Medical Officer of Health

Health Services â€“ Office of the Medical Officer of Health

Contract Full-time Approximately 16-Months

 

This challenging, fast paced position will report directly to two Associate Medical Officers of Health (AMOH). You will provide confidential administrative support services and interact with a dynamic department management team to ensure a coordinated and cohesive approach to administrative matters.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Control the information and paper flow to and from the AMOH office, ensuring the appropriate handling of mail, requests, reports and documents
  • Research and respond to complaints
  • Manage routine correspondence and requests with a commitment to high standards of service
  • Organize and maintain appropriate reports, files, systems and documentation and actively managing a follow-up system to ensure work proceeds in a smooth fashion
  • Prepare agendas and taking minutes of meetings
  • Prioritize, organize and schedule appointments, meetings, deadlines, etc.
  • Book conferences and travel arrangements
  • Coordinate medical resident and medical student placements
  • Provide coverage for the Administrative Assistants and manage other duties in the Office of the Medical Officer of Health as needed  

Qualifications:

  • Secondary school graduate plus post-secondary office administrative education or related field combined with a minimum of three years relevant experience or an equivalent combination of experience and education may be considered
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to deal effectively and discretely with internal and external contacts in a highly confidential manner
  • Proven ability to proactively manage multiple tasks and competing demands in a fast paced environment
  • A strong ability to effectively manage time
  • Exceptional customer service orientation to interact with internal and external clients at all levels
  • Demonstrated strong self-motivation and self-direction within a collaborative team environment
  • Advanced computer skills: MS Outlook, MS Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
  • Knowledge of the Health Departmentâ€™s structure and services would be an asset

 

Location:  In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at the 7120 Hurontario Street, Mississauga worksite.    The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario.  

 

Hours of Work: 35 hours per week  


The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.â€¯    

 

Interview: Our  recruitment  process  will  be  completed  with video conference technology.  

 

If  this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.

 

As part of the Regionâ€™s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.

 

New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.

 

The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.

About Us:

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.

Our 20-year vision for Peel is â€œCommunity for Life.â€ Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.

To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore  peelregion.ca.

Additional Information:

The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.

 

The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request.  If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact

zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.ca

.  We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

 

Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.
