title: Secrétaire administrative
description:
Nous sommes à la recherche d'une secrétaire administrative permanente pour les bureaux de notre client situés près du métro Charlevoix.

Le poste est à combler dès que possible et les horaires de travail sont de 8h30 à 16h30.

Exemples de tâches et de responsabilités:

- Assiste son supérieur dans l'ensemble de ses fonctions.

- Traite la correspondance reçue, rédige et signe la correspondance d'ordre général, assemble la documentation nécessaire au personnel de l'unité pour le traitement des dossiers.

- Préparation et suivi des demandes à la Régie du logement et suivi des demandes de réclamation pour dommages injustifiés.

- Préparation et suivi des ententes avec les nouveaux propriétaires.

- Participe à la coordination et au suivi des différents dossiers traités au sein de l’unité et suggère des méthodes de fonctionnement.

- Assure le suivi et la compilation des relevés d’assiduité du personnel, complète ou prépare les formulaires relatifs aux vacances, maladie, demandes de remboursement ou autres documents relatifs à la gestion du personnel.

- Exécute la réception, le filtrage et l'acheminement du courrier, des appels téléphoniques, des courriels et des visiteurs.

- Fixe ou déplace les rendez-vous du supérieur selon les priorités, lui rappelle les dates de ses réunions et prépare la documentation requise, confirme sa présence à des réunions ou propose un remplaçant au besoin. Fait des arrangements relatifs aux déplacements de son supérieur (transport, hébergement, avance de fonds, etc.).

- Recueille les données nécessaires à la préparation ou à la révision des réquisitions et des budgets, et s'assure de la disponibilité des crédits; procède à la vérification et au paiement de factures, à des transferts budgétaires et au suivi du budget dans le système financier. Peut être appelé à gérer une petite caisse pour le remboursement de factures internes.

- Procède aux commandes et à la gestion des fournitures de bureau.

- Effectue le classement, le déclassement annuel et la gestion documentaire des documents de l’unité administrative.

- Assiste à des réunions, prend note des échanges et rédige des comptes rendus ou des procès-verbaux reflétant l'esprit des discussions et des décisions intervenues.

- Assure la transmission d'informations relatives aux politiques, aux procédures, aux lois et aux règlements régissant les activités des unités administratives.

- Rédige ou participe à la rédaction de recommandations pour la direction et le conseil d’administration.

- Effectue la révision finale des documents émis par le personnel de l’unité afin de s'assurer de la qualité de la présentation, de l'absence d'erreurs grammaticales, d'orthographe ou autre. Assure, au besoin, la mise à jour de documents et de renseignements dans l’Intranet et l’Internet.

- Assure, lorsque requis de le faire, l'exécution de toute autre activité connexe qu'il est raisonnablement en mesure d'accomplir.

Candidat idéal:

- Excellente maîtrise du français à l’oral comme à l’écrit

- Anglais intermédiaire

- Confidentialité

- Très bonnes aptitudes à la communication et aux relations interpersonnelles

- Analyse et synthèse

- Organisation et coordination de plusieurs dossiers simultanément

- Expérience en facturation

- Autonomie et débrouillardise

- Maîtrise de la suite Office et être à l’aise à travailler avec les nouvelles technologies

Envoyez-nous votre CV immédiatement!

En tant qu'employeur souscrivant aux principes d'équité en emploi, Personnel Alter Ego valorise la diversité au sein de son personnel, et vise à maintenir une juste représentation de tous les groupes. Les candidats/es qui postulent doivent avoir le droit de travailler au Canada.
skills: ['Envoyez-nous votre CV immédiatement!', "Nous sommes à la recherche d'une secrétaire administrative permanente pour les bureaux de notre client situés près du métro Charlevoix."]

title: Assistant Coordinator, Administrative Student Services
description:
Athabasca University's Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences is currently recruiting for the permanent part-time (0.6 FTE) position of Assistant Coordinator, Administrative Student Services.

Please note, the salary for this role will be pro-rated to a 0.6 FTE

Reporting to the Coordinator, Administrative Student Services, this position leads two major Faculty functions:

  1. Academic programs and partnership activities, including the Heritage Resource Internship Program
  2. All FHSS alternative assessments

The position also plays a primary leadership role in the recruitment and appointment of graduate research assistants and the coordination of all FHSS webpages. The incumbent's leadership in each of these areas is essential to the success of FHSS as the largest Faculty at Athabasca University. The scale of FHSS, in terms of the number of students, courses, faculty members and tutors, significantly impacts the breath of work that this position is responsible for within these areas of responsibility.

The program coordination duties may include, but are not limited to, coordination of all processes involved in student/intern applications, admissions, registrations, and progress in the HRM and other programs, as needed. The position is responsible for the process of advising students/interns on program policies, procedures, regulations, and schedules. This requires detailed knowledge of FHSS programs, the requirements for admission/registration in FHSS programs, as well as the appropriate institutional admission and registration policies. The incumbent must be able to discern whether prospective students are interested in graduate-level study or undergraduate level study. The functions include communications with program directors, faculty, professionals and external SMEs, instructors, and authors. This position attends Program Steering/Program Council Committees as required and represents FHSS on University Committees as required.

The alternative assessment and webpages duties may include, but are not limited to, process and system development and improvement; metrics, analysis, and reporting; correspondences across other AU units to identify and implement best practices; outreach; and communications with FHSS faculty members and students.

Qualifications: 

  • A University Diploma in related field, 2 years of work experience and/or training in an area related to academic programs, experience in working with students/interns, and with external organizations, institutions, etc. A combination of equivalent education and experience may be considered.
  • Experience in the AU or similar environment with knowledge of student admissions, advising and assessment related processes is considered an asset.
  • Experience in the AU or similar environment with exposure to systems and procedures used in AU such as Banner, Library systems, Registry systems, Learning Services Tutorial systems, and Finance systems is considered an asset.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Access, Internet, Student Relationship Management (SRM), electronic mail and html is required.
  • Proven capabilities to adapt to new technology.
  • Excellent interpersonal, administrative, time management, organizational and presentation skills. Must be able to coordinate several activities at once and maintain accuracy along with meeting strict deadlines.
  • The ability to show initiative with problem solving and recommendations for improvement.
  • The ability to work effectively under pressure with several conflicting agendas.
  • The ability to work independently without supervision prioritizing and re-prioritizing work routinely.
  • The ability to work as part of a team to facilitate the student/intern's learning process.
  • Extensive knowledge of AU's policies and procedures, especially those that pertain to the Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences, is considered an asset.

The full job description can be viewed at: Assistant Coordinator, Administrative Student Services 

For further information regarding this position, please contact Krista Morland, Coordinator, Administrative Student Services, at

kristam@athabascau.ca

.

 

About AU: 

Our Mission: Athabasca University, Canada's Open University, is dedicated to the removal of barriers that restrict access to and success in university-level study and to increasing equality of educational opportunity for adult learners worldwide.

I-CARE Values: The students and staff of Athabasca University hold a set of complementary values that are fundamental to Athabasca University's identity and functioning:

  • Integrity
  • Community
  • Adaptability
  • Respect
  • Excellence

What AU Offers: 

Benefits and Pension eligibility differs based on employee group and may include:

  • Defined Benefits Pension Plan
  • Alberta Health Care
  • Extended Health Care
  • Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance
  • Disability Coverage
  • Vacation
  • Office Closure between Christmas and New Year's Day
  • Discretionary Benefit Fund
  • AU Course Allowance
  • A Variety of Leaves (i.e. Maternity/Parental/Adoption, Compassionate Care, etc.)
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program (EFAP)

The scale of FHSS, in terms of the number of students, courses, faculty members and tutors, significantly impacts the breath of work that this position is responsible for within these areas of responsibility.", 'Excellent interpersonal, administrative, time management, organizational and presentation skills. title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant 
Primary Location: CA-QC-Laurentides-St-Jerome  
 
Employee Status: Regular  
 
Schedule: Full-time  Number of hours (if position is part-time indicate the number of hours): 37.5 
 

​​​​​​

National Bank is currently recruiting for an Administrative Assistant and that person could be you!

Within the Commercial sector, you will be part of a team that stands out for its exceptional level of collaboration. This position reports to three Associate Vice Presidents to ensure the success of the team. 



Your main challenges:

 

  • Support the department by performing various administrative tasks independently.
  • Prepare, revise and improve various letters and documents.
  • Prepare presentations or improve their formatting.
  • Welcome and direct visitors by providing courteous and high quality service to ensure the satisfaction of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Manage calls by answering questions and ensuring that calls are returned.
  • More specifically, you will:
  • Keep your manager's agenda up to date, make his/her appointments, coordinate the logistics of meetings and trips, and suggest improvements to ensure work efficiency.
  • Autonomously monitor the budget and prepare vouchers of budget discrepancies for your manager.
  • Master all the systems software required for your duties.
  • Act as a resource person for all the employees in your sector with regard to requests for information about the Bank's administrative policies and procedures.
  • Support sector managers in performing certain administrative tasks.

 

 

 
  • High school diploma and 3½ years' relevant experience or a college diploma and 1½ years' relevant experience
  • Experience in secretarial duties
  • Experience in proactive agenda management
  • Experience working with various collaborative tools such Yammer, SharePoint, Skype, etc. (an asset)
  • Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Sense of initiative, proactivity and good collaborative approach
  • Open-minded and adaptable
  • Strong ability to determine priorities and urgent items
  • Autonomy and organizational skills
  • Thoroughness and professionalism
  • Interpersonal skills (customer-focused)
  • Bilingualism, both spoken and written (English and French), an asset 


***Note that the candidate will be required to take grammar tests in English and French.

 

 

Your benefits

Upon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:

  • Health and wellness program, including many benefits
  • Flexible group insurance
  • Defined benefit pension plan
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan
  • Employee and family assistance program
  • Preferred banking services
  • Volunteer program
  • Telemedicine
  • Virtual sleep clinic

These are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic.

 

We're putting people first

We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have a positive impact on peoples' lives.

Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that is accessible to all employees.

We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodations, feel free to let us know during your first conversations with us.

We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?

Ready to live your ambitions?

 

 

 
Job field: Administrative Support and Coordination
Job Posting: May 3, 2022
Unposting Date: May 18, 2022
Work Postal Code: J7Z5A1 
Job Number: ADM001M5

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Description

Administrative Assistant / Adjoint(e) Administratif(ive)

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction, and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

SNC-Lavalin is currently looking for an Administrative Assistant.

How will you contribute to the team?

  • Greet visitors in a courteous and professional manner both on the phone and in person.
  • Provide administrative support to directors and teams within the framework of engineering projects.
  • Write and format documents (letters, minutes of meetings, visit reports, monthly reports, and quotes) according to company standards templates and maintain quality results.
  • Enter and revise the texts of the proposals to ensure that they respect the specifications of the calls for tenders and the requests for qualification.
  • Ensure the numbering, classification and archiving of computer and paper files relating to project engineering documents, such as reports, plans and specifications.
  • Organize, classify and maintain various documents (corporate CV, project sheets).
  • Layout documents according to the procedures established by the company and ensure the quality of their presentation.
  • Classify documents related to projects according to the established procedure as well as carry out document control related tasks.
  • Perform all other related tasks.

What will you contribute?

  • Administrative assistant diploma or any other training with experience in the field.
  • 5-7 years of experience.
  • Document control and proposals experience will be considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of the engineering industry will be considered an asset.
  • Excellent knowledge of MS suite Office.
  • Be able to communicate and right in English.
  • Organized and ability to prioritize.
  • Collaborative approach.
  • Have a security clearance.
  • Autonomous, discrete, and responsible.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (i.e.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology, and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

--------------------------------------------

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

SNC-Lavalin fournit des solutions d'ingénierie de pointe pour des projets dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde. De l'Arctique canadien à l'Afrique et à l'Australie, notre main-d'œuvre multiculturelle est animée par une fierté et une vision pionnière.

SNC-Lavalin est un chef de file mondial dans son domaine et a été choisie pour concevoir et construire certains des projets les plus prestigieux au monde.

SNC-Lavalin est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) adjoint(e) administratif(ive).

Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

  • Accueillir les visiteurs de façon courtoise et professionnelle tant au téléphone qu’en personne.
  • Assurer le support administratif aux directeurs ainsi qu’aux équipes dans le cadre de projets d'ingénierie.
  • Rédiger et mettre en page les documents (lettres, comptes rendus de réunions, rapports de visite, rapports mensuels et devis) selon les normes et gabarits de l’entreprise et maintenir des résultats de qualité.
  • Saisir et réviser les textes des propositions pour s’assurer qu’ils respectent les spécifications des appels d’offres et des demandes de qualification.
  • Assurer la numérotation, le classement ainsi que l’archivage des fichiers informatiques et papier, relatifs aux documents d’ingénierie de projets, tels que rapports, plans et devis.
  • Organiser, conserver et maintenir à jour divers documents (CV corporatif, fiches projet).
  • Mettre en page des documents selon les procédures établies par l’entreprise et en assurer la qualité de présentation.
  • Classer les documents reliés aux projets selon la procédure établie ainsi que d’effectuer un contrôle documentaire.
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches en lien avec la nature de ces fonctions.

Que recherchons-nous?

  • Détenir un A.E.C. ou un D.E.C. en bureautique ou toute autre formation avec une expérience dans le domaine.
  • Avoir 5-7 ans d’expérience pertinente au domaine.
  • Avoir de l’expérience au niveau de la gestion documentaire ou des offres de services est un atout.
  • Avoir une connaissance du domaine du génie-conseil est un atout.
  • Excellente connaissance des fonctions avancées des logiciels de la suite Office.
  • Excellente maîtrise du français.
  • Maitrise de la langue anglaise est un atout.
  • Bonne gestion du stress et sens de l’organisation.
  • Aptitude pour le travail d’équipe.
  • Habilitation de sécurité.
  • Autonomie, discrétion, flexibilité, polyvalence, responsabilité, ponctualité.

Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin :

Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, régime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).

Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

**************************

Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d’alléger le texte.

Les mesures d'adaptation appropriées seront fournies sur demande tout au long du processus de recrutement et d'embauche, conformément à la politique de l'entreprise et à la Loi sur l'accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l'Ontario (LAPHO).

Les candidats retenus seront informés des politiques d'adaptation de SNC-Lavalin au moment de l'offre d'emploi, et l'information sera communiquée aux nouveaux employés pendant le processus d'intégration.

Chez SNC-Lavalin, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiées. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences. 

SNC-Lavalin se préoccupe de votre confidentialité. SNC-Lavalin et les autres filiales ou entreprises affiliées de SNC-Lavalin (communément désignées « SNC-Lavalin ») sont déterminées à protéger votre confidentialité. Veuillez consulter notre Avis de confidentialité sur notre site Carrières pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous recueillons, utilisons et transférons vos données personnelles.

En fournissant vos renseignements personnels à SNC-Lavalin, vous confirmez que vous avez lu notre Avis de confidentialité et que vous l’acceptez.

Fondée en 1911, SNC-Lavalin est une entreprise spécialisée en gestion de projet offrant des services professionnels entièrement intégrés, exploitant des bureaux dans le monde entier et dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, technologie et données afin de concevoir, de réaliser et d’exploiter les projets les plus complexes. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif – consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de la construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. – et nous les offrons aux clients dans des secteurs stratégiques tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital. D’autres nouvelles et renseignements sont accessibles sur le site snclavalin.com ou suivez-nous sur LinkedIn et Twitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Office Administrator (Entry Level)
description:
Responsibilities:

  • General Administrative duties, filing, faxing, and photocopying
  • Provide Administrative support
  • Enter data accurately and efficiently into database
  • Respond to incoming inquiries
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • College Education in related field (Business, Administration) or related experience
  • 0-1 year office administrative experience
  • Organizational skills and detail oriented
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem-solving ability, time management skills and interpersonal skills
  •  Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook

What we Offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program 
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-Life Balance
  • Employee assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform 
  • Career Progression 
  • Casual Work Environment 
  • Social Events and Sports Teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz

title: Administrative Assistant - Office Support
description:
About MRU

Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University grew into a vibrant college in the 1930s and became a mid-sized university in 2009. Mount Royal has carved out a distinct niche by offering smaller class sizes, a robust liberal education and unique undergraduate programs. Currently, more than 15,000 credit students choose from 13 bachelor degrees and 38 majors.

Mount Royal University is located in the traditional territories of the Niitsitapi (Blackfoot) and the people of the Treaty 7 region in southern Alberta, which includes the Siksika, the Piikani, the Kainai, the Tsuut'ina and the Iyarhe Nakoda. We are situated on land where the Bow River meets the Elbow River. The traditional Blackfoot name of this place is "Mohkinstsis," which we now call the city of Calgary. The city of Calgary is also home to the Métis Nation.

Mount Royal University is committed to removing barriers and fostering the inclusion of voices that have been historically underrepresented or discouraged in our society. In support of our belief that diversity in our faculty and staff enriches the work, learning and research experiences for the entire campus community, we strongly encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply and self-identify.

 

About the Department of Residence Services

Mount Royal University’s Residence Services is committed to providing a safe, secure and supportive living learning community. We strive to be inclusive, responsive and respectful of the individual. The environment is designed to enhance and develop both the personal growth and academic success of the student and their role as a responsible community member.

 

About the Role

The Administrative Assistant – Office Support, reports directly to the Manager, Residence Services.  The Administrative Assistant – Office Support provides support for the Front Desk Administrative Assistant, and the Front Office and Assignments Coordinator.  This position offers opportunities for problem solving and creating positive client relations to achieve department goals. The responsibilities of the position are achieved through administrative support, data entry, office staff support and direct customer service to students, guests and the general public. Many of these services are provided in person, by phone, or by other electronic avenues. 

This position is a full-time limited term role, ending September 5, 2022

 

 

Responsibilities

 

Administrative Support (50%):

 

  • Administrative support including preparation of correspondence, report compilation, filing, word processing, and scheduling.
  • Processing payments by clients and students as directed.
  • Assist in the accurate entry of records into the Star Rez system for students, guests, and other needs as required.
  • Receives and organizes student and client requests related to their accommodations and ensures that all information has been collected. Ensures these requests are then responded to or directed to the appropriate person.
  • Prepare mail-outs as required.
  • Assist with the preparation of Residence Services print materials and packages.
  • Generates reports from StarRez as needed.

 

Office and Department Support (45%):

 

  • Assist the Front Office & Assignments Coordinator and the Manager, Residence Services with correspondence, daily tasks and scheduling as required.
  • Assist the Front Office & Assignments Coordinator with administrative tasks related to Student and Conference Housing.
  • Provide back up in the coordination of facility bookings.
  • Assist with special events such as move in and move out days.
  • Organize and maintain office filing system according to University standards.
  • Actively participate in staff and planning meetings to continue the improvement of department functions and goals.
  • Maintain and update Residence Services social media and website information
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Project Assistance (5%):

Assist the Front Office & Assignments Coordinator and , Manager, Residence Services on specifically assigned projects.

 

Qualifications 

 

  • 1 year post secondary certificate or at least 1 year of post secondary program completion
  • Must have experience in post secondary education to better understand and relate to student needs, and expectations
  • Experience in a campus residential environment is an asset
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office software
  • Customer service experience or training, and cash handling skills
  • Office administration experience or training

 

What We Offer

Talented and committed employees are the driving force behind student success. We strive to be an employer of choice among Canadian post-secondary institutions. 

At Mount Royal University, we recognize that people are a combination of many intersecting identities; we work to cultivate an environment that welcomes the whole person, and harnesses the strength that is available in our diversity, creating a rich and inclusive workplace.

Investing in the learning and development of our employees benefits the individual and the University. A variety of services, resources and programs encourage a healthy, productive workplace. Mount Royal University offers a competitive total compensation package including health and dental benefits, pension, health and personal spending accounts, paid vacation, personal days and a free membership in our fully equipped recreation centre.

Our campus offers the convenience of a full medical clinic, dentist and pharmacy, as well as a variety of wellness services such as physiotherapists and massage therapists. Campus Recreation offers many activities, including personal training, climbing, aquatics, sports and certifications for students, employees and the public.

 

MRU supports full immunization as the best way to protect yourself and our campus community and strongly recommends vaccination against COVID-19.

 

Salary:                                  $20.97 - 21.81 per hour 

Closing Date:                     Open until a suitable candidate is found

 

A cover letter and resume should be submitted in one .pdf document. Please title your .pdf document as follows: [Last Name], [Requisition Number], [Document Title].pdf (ex. Smith, 999999, CV.pdf).

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Administrative Assistant in the oil & gas sector in Port Moody/Vancouver, British Columbia.
Our client in the Oil & Gas sector is looking for a Administrative Assistant to join their team for a full time, one year contract in Vancouver. If this sounds like something you would be interested in, please apply without a delay.
A typical day:
  • Provides administrative support to a department or individual. Duties may include: typing, filing, answering phones, scheduling, calendaring, record keeping, coordinating meetings and conferences, obtaining supplies and/or sorting/distributing mail. May work on special projects to include recording, compiling, retrieving, reporting and analyzing information. Must be able to multi-task and prioritize. Strong communication skills and organizational skills are required. Proficiency with MS Office required. Position will receive direction and support.
  • This position level would typically include junior Administrative Assistant with basic administrative tasks. Prior extensive experience not required.

Successful candidates will have:
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and email systems, strong administrative coordination abilities, customer service experience.

Total rewards:
  • Competitive compensation

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email sthirupathi@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Office Administrator - Part Time
description:
The Office Administrator is responsible for the organization and supervision of all cash, debit and credit card transactions. You will supervise the cash handling procedures for all bar and service team members as well as provide Home Office support and communication for banking, deposits and financial reporting.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Supervision and management of all tasks with regards to banking deposits, receipts and records preparation, daily labor calculations and other financial analysis.
  • Other duties as assigned by the General Manager.

QUALIFICATIONS & KEY ATTRIBUTES

  • Experience in a similar role is an asset.
  • Required: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
  • Required: Proficient in the English Language, spoken and written.
  • Strong Organizational Skills.
  • Deadline and Detail Oriented
  • Positive Attitude and a be a Team Player
  • Have the ability to excel in a fast paced environment.

title: Adjoint administratif
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Renaud-Bray, entreprise reconnue pour son dynamisme et son esprit novateur, connait une forte croissance. Avec 33 magasins répartis sur le territoire québécois, une plateforme de commerce électronique et deux centres de distribution, le plus grand réseau de librairies francophones en Amérique du Nord cherche à recruter.

Description du poste

  • Gestion de l’agenda, des déplacements et des communications de la haute direction.
  • Création et analyse de rapports et de documents, selon la demande.
  • Rédaction de notes de service, d’annonces organisationnelles et de toute autre communication interne et externe requise.
  • Agir à titre de liaison entre l’exécutif et les différents services du siège social.
  • Travailler sur divers projets et initiatives, selon les besoins de l’entreprise.
  • Organisation de réunions et/ou d’évènements spéciaux, en collaboration avec divers intervenants.
Qualifications

  • Diplôme d’études postsecondaire dans un domaine pertinent (un atout).
  • Posséder de cinq (5) à sept (7) années d’expérience à titre d’adjointe administrative ou exécutive.
  • Faire preuve de jugement, de confidentialité, de rigueur et d’un grand sens des priorités. La personne sélectionnée devra être d’une grande confiance.
  • Maitrise de la suite Microsoft Office, plus particulièrement d’Excel et d’Outlook.
  • Qualité du français écrit impeccable.
  • Niveau d’anglais professionnel.


Informations complémentaires

Des avantages diversifiés vous attendent :

  • Nous offrons un salaire compétitif, en fonction de votre expérience.
  • Vous compterez sur un régime de vacances annuelles et de congés fériés supérieur à celui des Normes du travail et ce, dès la première année.
  • Horaire estival flexible (projet pilote) : d’avril à août 2022, un horaire d’été devancé est en vigueur dans la plupart des départements, permettant, sous réserve des besoins opérationnels, de répartir l’horaire de travail sur 4 ou 4.5 jours, sans réduction de salaire ou d'effectuer le mercredi en télétravail.
  • Nous offrons un régime modulable d’assurances médicaments, soins médicaux, soins dentaires et invalidité.
  • Contribuez au régime de retraite en place et l’employeur y contribuera annuellement !
  • Vous bénéficierez d’un rabais substantiel sur la grande majorité de nos produits. La culture devient ainsi encore plus accessible.
  • Vous œuvrerez dans un environnement convivial et dynamique, dans une tenue de travail décontractée.
  • Notre siège social est facilement accessible : nous disposons d’un grand stationnement gratuit et sommes situés à quelques minutes d'une station Bixi et du métro Assomption (ligne verte).
  • Grâce à son grand réseau de succursales à travers le Québec, et à sa forte croissance, notre organisation offre de nombreuses opportunités d’avancement et nous croyons en l’établissement d’une relève motivée. Joindre notre entreprise, c’est s’offrir un plan de carrière au sein d’une organisation qui a le vent dans les voiles.

Vous avez des questions ou des commentaires? Contactez-nous par courriel au recrutement@renaud-bray.com et un membre de notre équipe vous répondra dans les plus brefs délais.

title: Adjoint administratif principal
description:
Description

Appartenir à Air Canada, c’est appartenir à un symbole canadien, Air Canada récemment élue meilleur transporteur aérien en Amérique du Nord. Faites décoller votre carrière en vous joignant à notre équipe novatrice et diversifiée à l’avant-garde du transport aérien de passagers.
 
L’adjoint administratif principal fournit un soutien administratif au directeur général – Affaires commerciales – Air Canada Cargo. La personne retenue est responsable des principales fonctions d’administration du service, dont la compilation et la préparation de rapports, de présentations PowerPoint, de tableurs et de documents de correspondance générale interne et externe. La confidentialité est un élément essentiel de ce poste et doit être respectée en tout temps. Le candidat idéal possède des normes de travail méticuleuses, un grand souci du détail, d’excellentes relations interpersonnelles et compétences en communication, et prend plaisir à travailler avec une équipe d’employés dynamiques et avant-gardistes.
 
Rôle et responsabilités 
  • Fournir une orientation et un soutien administratif.
  • Assurer l’efficacité du suivi du déroulement des procédures et des processus.
  • Traiter directement les questions confidentielles, dans la correspondance, les demandes de renseignements téléphoniques, etc.
  • Gérer toute la correspondance interne et externe, et y répondre au besoin, de la façon appropriée.
  • Posséder une connaissance de base des outils de communication d’information, d’intelligence d’affaires ou de gestion de la relation client pour contribuer à compiler et à préparer des rapports, au besoin.
  • Coordonner les réunions sur place et à l’extérieur : réserver les salles de conférence, préparer les avis de convocation, réserver les vols et l’hébergement, etc.
  • Préparer, coordonner et distribuer les documents des réunions, comme l’ordre du jour, les rapports, etc.
  • Gérer le calendrier (Outlook) au quotidien et modifier l’horaire de manière proactive en fonction des priorités.
  • Préparer au besoin des présentations PowerPoint, des tableurs, des graphiques et des rapports.
  • Créer et tenir à jour des listes et des tableurs de coordonnées.
  • Remplir des rapports de dépenses.
  • Gérer les congés annuels et l’assiduité du groupe, au besoin. 
  • Assurer la surveillance du budget du service et fournir des mises à jour à ce sujet.
  • Tenir les dossiers à jour avec précision et les classer.
  • Contribuer à la réalisation de projets spéciaux, selon les besoins.
  • Assurer un suivi proactif auprès des membres de l’équipe pour veiller à ce que tous les livrables soient terminés à temps.
  • Effectuer d’autres tâches, le cas échéant.

Qualifications

  • Au moins un diplôme d’études collégiales et plus de cinq années d’expérience dans le soutien administratif en affaires à des cadres supérieurs.
  • Connaissance approfondie et maîtrise des outils informatiques, notamment Word, Excel et PowerPoint.
  • Excellent sens de l’organisation : planification, établissement des priorités et gestion à l’aide des systèmes.
  • Excellentes habiletés pour la communication.
  • Excellentes habiletés pour les relations interpersonnelles : résolution de problèmes, souci du client et accessibilité.
  • Sens aigu de la diplomatie, discrétion, maturité professionnelle et discernement.
  • Habileté à exécuter des tâches multiples en ne négligeant jamais la qualité.
  • Orientation client avérée et habileté à travailler avec des clients de divers niveaux.
  • Habileté à bien travailler sous pression tout en gardant son sang-froid et à respecter les échéances, avec le minimum de supervision.
  • Connaissance du secteur du transport aérien, un atout.
  • Expérience de la conception graphique, un atout.
  • Souplesse et volonté de faire des heures supplémentaires à l’occasion.
  • Certains déplacements occasionnels pourraient être nécessaires. 
  • Modalités de flexibilité au travail offertes. 
Conditions d’emploi :
  • Les candidats doivent avoir le droit de travailler dans le pays choisi au moment où un emploi leur est offert. Il incombe entièrement aux employés posant leur candidature d’obtenir les permis de travail, les visas ou toutes autres autorisationsrequises pour le poste.
  • Vaccination contre la COVID-19 requise
 
Exigences Linguistiques

À compétences égales, la préférence sera accordée aux candidats bilingues.
 
Diversité et inclusion
 
Air Canada est résolument engagée en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion et vise à créer un milieu de travail sain, accessible et gratifiant qui met en valeur la contribution unique de nos employés au succès de notre entreprise.
 
En tant qu'employeur qui garantit l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, nous encourageons les candidatures les plus diverses afin de pouvoir nous doter d’un effectif varié et représentatif de nos clients et des communautés où nous vivons et offrons nos services.
Air Canada remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées.

title: Office Coordinator
description:
Kinetic Construction Ltd. (Kinetic) provides Construction Manager and General Contracting services on the Lower Mainland and Vancouver Island. “Relationships, Passion and Continuous Improvement” is who we are, in our day- to-day activities these values operationalize as “Together Building Better”.

Kinetic provides a variety of project delivery methods for large commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential projects for private and public clientele. The organization is 100% employee owned with offices in Vancouver, Victoria, and Courtenay.

Kinetic is always looking for ways to be better. From our use of the newest technology to our endless search for more efficient methods and processes, everything is derived from our passion for continuous improvement. All our employees are empowered with the mission of reducing waste and delivering better value for our clients and industry partners.

Our people are the most important factor in our shared success. We provide a collaborative, caring culture, and the support for everyone to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you see yourself as a continuous learner and curious and driven to succeed as a team, we want you to be part of our team.

Kinetic Construction Ltd. has an opportunity within our Victoria Branch for an experienced Office Coordinator.  You will be the first point of contact for the Vancouver office. In this role, you will maintain a professional presentation and provide excellent client service experience. You will support the branch operations through effective administration as well as assisting various departments to add value to the overall business. This role can provide a flexible work schedule. 

  • 1-3 years' experience in an administrative position
  • Post-secondary considered an asset
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
  • General Construction knowledge is considered an asset
  • Excellent knowledge of computer-based systems, including
  • Strong communicator, relationship builder and business leader
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Self-management skills to plan, organize and prioritize tasks with conflicting deadlines.
  • Ability to act with discretion when handling confidential and privileged information.
  • Ability to effectively handle difficult calls and situations and remain calm under pressure.
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective stakeholder relationships.
  • Ability to create, edit, proofread and format documents/presentations.
  • Excellent analytical, reasoning and problem-solving skills
  • Detail oriented, process driven, and efficiency seeker skills are all highly beneficial

Key Attributes:

  • Teamwork: Collaborates and proactively assists and involves others
  • Passion: Inspired to meet and exceed goals both individually and as a team
  • Respect: Contributes to a positive working environment
  • Excellence: Consistently challenges the status quo in the spirit of continuous improvement
  • Integrity: Accountable and transparent; ethical and fair
  • Community Minded: Actively involved in the communities in which we live and work

Together Building Better:

  • 100% employee owned
  • Competitive compensation and bonus
  • Strong benefits package
  • Substantial vacation time
  • Stable work-life balance
  • Training, education, and development opportunities
  • Employee appreciation events
  • Supportive culture
  • A healthy and positive work environment
  • Perks through our strategic partners

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected to move forward in the application process will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Administrative Assistant - Financial Statements
description:
IT’S MORE THAN A JOB… IT’S an experience!

ABOUT MAZARS:

Mazars is an internationally integrated partnership, specializing in audit, accountancy, advisory and tax services. Operating in over 90 countries around the world, we draw on the expertise of 40,400 professionals – 24,400 in Mazars’ integrated partnership and 16,000 via the Mazars North America Alliance – to assist clients of all sizes at every stage in their development. In Canada, our firm is located in Montreal and Toronto and which has nearly 130 professionals, specialists, partners and support staff.

Mazars is also a lot more than that. You don’t join Mazars by coincidence, you choose Mazars: a global school of excellence where you will be challenged to develop and grow.

  • More than 60% growth in the last 5 years;
  • 53% of our global staff are women and 96% of Mazars’ women leaders would recommend the firm to women graduates;
  • Globalaccess to LinkedIn Learning;
  • 87% of all Mazarians contribute to charities;
  • International mobility;
  • Opportunities throughout your career.

IF YOU WANT TO WORK IN A FIRM THAT AIMS TO:

  • Focus on values and culture;
  • Allow you to bring out your entrepreneurial spirit;
  • Get involved in its transformation and growth;
  • Foster innovation and creativity;
  • Promote a living environment where collegiality and collaboration take precedence.

We are currently looking for an administrative assistant specialized in financial statements.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES :

  • Prepare layout for all financial statements;
  • Prepare layout for all financial statements;
  • Review linguistic letters and financial statements;
  • Convert documents in secured PDF;
  • Scan signed documents and upload it in CaseWare;
  • Upload documents on our platforms;
  • Print and assemble all financial statements, letters and tax return.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

  • College diploma in secretary or an equivalent;
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar role;
  • Bilingualism is required (spoken and written);
  • Knowledge of typography standards in French and in English;
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint;
  • Knowledge of Adobe Acrobat;
  • Knowledge of CaseWare and Caseview (an asset).

SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • Manage priorities and deadlines;
  • Details oriented and follow-up skills;
  • Team spirit, respect and courtesy;
  • Sens of initiative and organization;
  • Ability to adapt and to work under pressure.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Mazars Canada is committed to the well-being of its employees. We are constantly working to innovate in this direction to ensure that the measures put in place facilitate a balance between work and personal life. We also support several causes such as the Enbridge’s Ride to Conquer Cancer and CPA Without Borders.

  • Competitive salary;
  • Possibility of working remotely (hybrid role);
  • A number of weeks of vacation which takes into account your professional experience;
  • Casual dress code;
  • A bank of personal days;
  • Virtual healthcare services;
  • Annual allowance to improve your well-being;
  • Group insurance (life insurance, MMA, medical and dental insurance, short- and long- term disability) according to the (50/50) cost-sharing agreement in force;
  • Group retirement savings plan: contributions according to the terms and conditions in force;
  • A dynamic, diverse and exciting work environment.

If you are interested in this job offer, meet the above criteria and would like to join a remarkable and stimulating company, send us your CV. We thank all candidates; however we will only contact those selected for a job interview.

Mazars is an employer who values equal opportunities and the diversity of its workforce and encourages the application of any qualified person.

At Mazars, you have the opportunity to make a real difference!

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
The Art Gallery of Greater Victoria is located just 20 minutes from downtown Victoria in a beautiful park-like setting. The Gallery is housed in a combination of contemporary exhibition spaces and the remarkable 1889 Spencer mansion. It is the largest public art gallery on Vancouver Island and one of the most significant in Canada with its important collection of visual and decorative arts.

The Gallery currently has an opening for an Administrative Coordinator. The primary functions of this position are to provide professional administrative support and project coordination to the Director, the Board of Directors of the Art Gallery of Greater Victoria (AGGV), and Senior Management of the Gallery.

Excellent organizational and communication skills and the ability to prioritize tasks, exercise good initiative and judgement are required. We're looking for a bright and enthusiastic individual who loves administration and can be relied on do things efficiently and accurately, including handling confidential information and compliance administration.

The successful candidate will have a knack for creating efficient administrative systems and 2-3 years previous work experience in a similar position providing senior administrative support, performed according to clearly defined methods and procedures, both independently and under the direction of senior management.

This position is a 28-hour per week role which includes some evening and weekend hours. There is a potential for the role to periodically increase to 35 hours per week based on project needs. Work can be completed in office on set days of the week with the potential for remaining work to be completed remotely.

Application Information:

The complete job description and details regarding compensation can be found at the link below. If this dynamic opportunity sounds like a great fit for you, please apply with your resume and cover letter.

This posting will remain open until 1:00 pm PST on May 13, 2022.

We thank all those who apply; only those that are shortlisted will be contacted.

We're looking for a bright and enthusiastic individual who loves administration and can be relied on do things efficiently and accurately, including handling confidential information and compliance administration."]

title: Administrative Assistant-Full Time-Mon to Fri, 7:30am-4:30pm -Calgary -
description:
Job Description

PURPOSE OF JOB

To provide effective amp; efficient administrative support to the FC Manager and FC team.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

FC Operations: 60%

  • Process reports in Access to help in FC productivity.
  • Support Kronos entries and submissions as required.
  • Participate in daily calls with Staples Operations.
  • Participate in daily calls with Staples Delivery Operations and third-party carriers, by analyzing the MOSD report for shortages.
  • Research all errors (POA) reported, compile information and present to Supervisors.
  • Submit work orders for any required repairs.
  • Prepare invoices for payment for FCM.
  • Prepare presentations and compile information as required for Town Hall Meetings.
  • Attend all Joint Health and Safety Meetings, take minutes of meeting.

Administration 40%

  • General correspondence and compilation of reports for Managers.
  • Order supplies for warehouse use through designated vendors using internal PO system.
  • Prepare invoices for payment for FCM.
  • Prepare presentations and compile information as required for Town Hall Meetings.
  • Manage and track all expenses reports according to the approved budget.
  • Manage and coordinate hotel and flight booking for FCM for his/her business travel.
  • Organize and prepare events with the FC team (Monthly operational meeting, social activityhellip;)

Qualifications

KNOWLEDGE / SKILL REQUIREMENTS

  • Excellent PC skills, including MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access as well as other software applications.
  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams as required.
  • Knowledge of Sunrise, Sunbeam and Busdep (training provided)
  • Ability to interact with Senior-level associates in a professional manner.
  • Exceptional Follow Up skills.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Office Environment in Fulfillment Centre

RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of administrative or retail experience or equivalent.

Education:

  • Secondary education with a focus on administrative studies.
Job : Canada Distribution/Warehouse/Transportation
Location(s): CA-AB-Calgary
Schedule Full-time

title: Temporary Part-Time Administrative Assistant
description:
Office Administrator - Temporary 15-20 hours per week

We support diversity and inclusivity in our community and in our workplace and we offer a friendly, supportive and flexible work environment.

We are currently seeking a temporary office administrator for our NW client.

The role of office administrator is a critical one.

The successful candidate must be personable and helpful, able to work in a positive manner with members of the community and the general public. Strong communication skills, including grammar and spelling, computer and word processing, are essential. The candidate must be able to handle confidential information in a professional and appropriate manner.

Duties include:

  1. Reception and answering phones
  2. Providing support and direction to groups using the facilities
  3. Directing calls, emails and walk-in enquiries to the appropriate individual
  4. Communicating with minister, staff and church members
  5. Preparing media (including slides) for worship service
  6. Maintaining website and formatting a weekly e-newsletter for subscribers
  7. Maintaining membership database
  8. Sending and receiving regular mail
  9. Handling incoming receipts and outgoing payments
  10. Ordering office supplies and other items
  11. Assisting in requests for bookings and scheduling
  12. Maintaining light covid protocols (sanitizing and sterilizing) in the reception/office area

The office administrator will report directly to one person and will be accountable to the Executive board as well.

Initial training in our specific programs and protocols will be provided, but the candidate should have good office and administrative skills.

title: BILINGUAL OFFICE COORDINATOR
description:
Our client provides objective consumer complaint resolution support in the financial services sector across Canada.  We are looking for a Bilingual Office Coordinator to provide administrative support in this Not For Profit environment

What’s interesting for you?

This role will be of interest if you have strong administration, project coordination, and interpersonal skills.  You will be responsible for:

  • providing support to the CEO, Board, and overall team;   
  • office operations (located in downtown Toronto)
  • maintaining member firm databases and interacting with member firm representatives to ensure contact accuracy

You can expect:  competitive compensation and benefits, opportunity for flexible work arrangements, and the opportunity to be part of a strong, collaborative team, with learning and growth support.

If this is of interest to you, please apply and we will be happy to share additional information about the role and our client.

title: Front Office Coordinator
description:
Front Office Coordinator


Are you passionate about supporting organizations to achieve results and seeking the opportunity to join a team of customer-oriented Professionals?


A.S.P. Incorporated has provided security and customer service solutions for over 22 years to Canadian clients. We employ over 2000 employees and are a subsidiary of ICTS EUROPE, which is operating in 22 countries and employing more than 17000 professionals. A.S.P provides services to some of the largest airports in Canada and has a significant presence in the Commercial and Residential spaces in Ontario and Alberta.

A.S.P. is looking for a Front Office Coordinator who will undertake all receptionist and clerical duties at the desk of our main entrance in North York as well as supporting all paper flow from the field for all divisions. A successful candidate will be required to work with integrity, respect, and take responsibility to maintain confidentiality.


What you will do:

  • Greeting and welcoming visitors, clients, employees, and applicants at the office.
  • Collect time sheets from the field site users and upload these to shared document file after verification weekly
  • Managing meeting room calendars, facilitating meetings, and taking minutes of meetings in company format
  • Complete job requisitions as directed for all divisions
  • Investigating and completing pay discrepancy reports as required
  • Complete quarterly physical inventory counts as well as Aligning all uniform requirements for onboarding
  • Full cycle uniform distribution and collection
  • Processing incoming and outgoing mail
  • Monitoring office supplies and placing orders, when necessary, process business cards order for staff.
  • Maintaining office/kitchen environment cleanliness daily
  • Save time sheets sent by security guards daily and sending to the accounts departments biweekly
  • Coordinating with quarterly newsletter submissions.
  • Schedule creation for various sites and transferred to templates
  • Ensuring building operations and maintenance are functioning in proper order.
  • Support HR department in company wide communication, surveys, data management and reporting
  • Act as full-service administrator for Operations Management team - tasks as assigned

Who you are:

  • Must have experience as front desk / Receptionist duties
  • Should be eligible to work in Canada full-time.
  • Familiarity with office machines ex. Phone, Fax, Printer.
  • Advanced knowledge and experience in MS Office especially MS Word and PowerPoint.
  • Strong communication (spoken and written) and people skills.
  • Good organization and multi-tasking abilities.
  • High school diploma and additional qualifications will be a plus.
  • The statements in this job description are intended to represent the key duties and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be ALL responsibilities or qualifications of the job.

Why you should work with A.S.P:

  • We care about our team and their personal and professional success.
  • We offer competitive salaries.
  • You can have flexible schedules.



A.S.P. Incorporated is committed to supporting a diverse workforce from various communities within which we operate. We encourage all qualified professionals without regard to race, gender identity, colour, sex, marital / family status, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, aboriginal status, age, etc. to apply.

To apply please send your cover letter and resume to

sgallagher@security-asp.com

.


We hire for PERSONALITY. We train for the job.

title: Agent(e) - Soutien administratif
description:
(Lieu de travail: Montréal)

Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.

Niveau d'emploi

NV-04

L'équipe Administration des contrats, Soutien aux opérations est à la recherche d’un(e) agent(e) pour rejoindre l'équipe. On vous reconnait par votre dynamisme, votre débrouillardise, votre entregent ainsi que votre collaboration. Cette opportunité est pour vous!

À titre d’Agent(e) - Administration des produits, vous contribuez aux activités de nature administrative en soutien aux composantes du Mouvement en ce qui a trait à l’administration de divers produits spécialisés et de comptes membres et clients.

Votre rôle consiste à accomplir différentes activités ainsi que différents travaux de soutien administratif et de suivi propres aux activités courantes et aux processus nécessaires à la réalisation des objectifs opérationnels et des mandats de votre unité, conformément aux directives détaillées établies. L’aptitude à viser les résultats devient alors une compétence essentielle.

Vous assurez un soutien dans le traitement d’informations particulières en lien avec votre domaine. Vous participez à la résolution de problèmes simples et courants, et mettez à profit votre capacité d’adaptation, au besoin. Vous répondez aux questions de nature administrative ou opérationnelle.

Responsabilités principales

  • Contribuer à la réalisation des processus opérationnels administratifs de l’unité

  • Participer à des analyses et à la production de rapports et de statistiques

  • Accomplir différents travaux administratifs liés à la cueillette, à la saisie, à la modification, à la compilation et à la codification de données

  • Fournir différents renseignements liés aux procédures et aux processus dans votre domaine

  • Procéder à des recherches pour obtenir des informations supplémentaires en lien avec les activités de votre unité.

Conditions particulières

  • Poste temporaire – Date de fin prévue : 30 décembre 2022

  • Nombre d’emplois disponibles : 2

Profil recherché

  • Diplôme d'études professionnelles (DEP) dans une discipline appropriée

  • Un minimum de deux ans d’expérience pertinente

Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées

  • Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire

Compétences transversales Desjardins

Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action

Compétences clés au profil recherché

S’adapter aux situations, Viser les résultats

Lieu de travail

Complexe Desjardins Montréal

Syndicat

DSF-MTL-SEPB 575

Date de fin d'affichage

title: Administrative Assistant
company: Thales Canada Inc., Defence and Security
description:
Location: Ottawa, Canada

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

For decades, Ottawa has been a global technology leader. Today, Canada’s capital holds one of the brightest and most diverse technological ecosystems in North America. Voted as Canada’s best place to live 2017 by Maclean's, Ottawa offers a low cost of living with a high quality of life. The Thales Ottawa office has been a major supplier and long-term trusted partner to DND, enabling the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Coast Guard to achieve mission success.

Position Summary

The Administrative Assistant will be responsible for providing a wide range of administrative services to assist Program Manager(s) and project team in day-to-day running of programs. The Administrative Assistant shall ensure that all project deliverables are prepared, formatted, internally reviewed, and delivered to the customer in an effective and timely manner with highest quality. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Prepare and format reports and contract deliverables using in-house templates as well as customer provided templates;
  • Coordinate and track project deliverables and outstanding actions to ensure timely delivery;
  • Set-up internal document reviews in Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS) and closely track for completion;
  • Monitor workflow process to ensure the document is reviewed, approved in a timely fashion and escalate Work Items (WI) of concern to the PM;
  • Deliver documentation to the customer (via email or courier), pdf and file correspondence in TFS;
  • Follow company policies and processes and maintain all aspects of electronic filing systems including logging, retention, and disposal;
  • Work with both internal and external tools such as TFS, SFTP, SharePoint, Aras to manage activities and workflow issues (monthly reports, deliverables, etc.);
  • Manage all aspects of incoming and outgoing correspondence in the project mailbox and respond to project team members’ inquiries;
  • Manage competing priorities while supporting several projects;
  • Create SAP purchase requisitions as required;
  • Work closely with cross functional teams such as Finance, Contracts & Legal, Procurement, and Quality on project requirements;
  • Assist with on-boarding new team members to the project, processing PIN numbers in a timely manner;
  • Assist in the preparation of letters, quotes, and proposals and provide formatting support on large bids as assigned;
  • Support with any off-site event/meeting/training/team building by booking the venue, PR creation, facilitating payment and on-site administrative support;
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Project Managers and Administration Manager;
  • Provide backup to other Administrative staff as required and cross-train as required;
  • Prepare for all aspects of in-house meetings, including coordination, record of discussion and action items tracking;
  • Order catering, track details and assist with the setup/clean-up;
  • Provide backup reception.

Key Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Diploma in Office Administration or equivalent
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to balance multiple priorities
  • Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Word and knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint
  • Attention to detail
  • An interest in working in a fast-paced, demanding environment with a steep learning curve
  • Ability to work independently
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • All applicants must be able to obtain a Canadian NATO Secret security clearance and meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Registration Program and ITAR Program

Thales is required to follow mandatory customer policies as well as Federal and Provincial legislation, now and in the future. This includes, but is not limited to, vaccination mandates and travel requirements. This role requires you to work on a customer site and/or travel. Therefore you must follow all mandatory customer policies and Federal and Provincial legislation as a condition of employment.

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Administrative Assistant - Temporary 7 Months
description:
Job Description

We are Canada Life

 

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

 

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

 

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing. 

  

Be your best at Canada Life.

 

We are looking for an Administrative Assistant - Temporary 7 Months

 

The Administrative Assistant is responsible for the timely and accurate distribution of billings, commission statements as well as BEN Reports to clients and consultants.  The successful candidate will be responsible for downloading, formatting and distributing various reports, handling the Department Inboxes and providing administrative support to leaders and the entire Payment Administration Department.

 

What you will do 

  • Responsible for the timely sorting, packaging and distribution of various billings and reports
  • Download and prepare reports using Microsoft Excel
  • Assist with all Group Client arrears
  • Handle daily inquiries from Clients, Group Sales office and other Canada Life departments 

What you will bring 

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle pressures of deadlines, fluctuating workloads, and changing priorities
  • High attention to detail and accuracy required
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Well-developed skills using Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Knowledge of Group Insurance products and TOCS system would be considered an asset
  • Ability to excel within a Purpose/Vision driven environment 
  • You are comfortable with technology, using multiple computer and business programs

Due to the high profile of a number of our clients, a Federal Government Enhanced Screening is a job requirement and this will involve fingerprinting and a credit check and will require a consent to fully participate in the process.

 

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today 

 

We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!

 

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.  

   

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.  

   

   

Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted
