title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
Horizon North, part of Dexterra Group, is dedicated to driving performance and productivity in Canada's most remote regions. We are experts in providing diverse, integrated workforce accommodations, hospitality solutions, and infrastructure services to help our clients meet their project needs and budget. The right blend of experience, expertise, and an unwavering devotion to customer satisfaction: that's the Horizon North advantage. We pride ourselves in developing strong customer relationships and enabling productivity.

Dexterra Group has been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together - offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

As a Proposal Coordinator you will be a key member of the Workforce Accommodations, Forestry, and Energy Services' Sales & Marketing team. Working collaboratively with Sales, Business Development, Operations, and other stakeholders you will coordinate the development of world-class proposal outputs for Horizon North. 

The ideal candidate will be organized, detail orientated, and take pride in the quality of their work.

The Proposal Coordinator performs the following duties:

  • Coordinate the end-to-end process for the development and submission of responses to: Requests for Proposal (RFP), Requests for Information (RFI), Requests for Quotations (RFQ), and Expressions of Interest (EOI).
  • Facilitate strategy discussions and work closely with subject matter experts (across the country) identifying benefits and value-add content for proposal submissions.
  • Comprehensively immerse him/herself in the company to understand and learn our service offerings.
  • Perform document control activities including downloading RFPs and clarifications and storing approvals as required.
  • Follow Horizon North's branding, content-writing, and editing standards.
  • Manage quality control of submissions and ensuring timely delivery.
  • Monitor the proposal process and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Participate in the development and maintenance of the proposal library.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Security - in a time when other companies are downsizing, we are growing.
  • Very competitive compensation and benefits package.
  • Advancement opportunities.
  • Be #1 on day 1, by joining an industry leader.

Follow Horizon North on LinkedIn.

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Post-secondary education; college diploma and/or university degree.
  • 3 years of relevant working experience.
  • Proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
  • Familiarity with RFPIO, Visio, and Adobe Creative Suite is an asset.
  • Proficiency working across various e-bidding/procurement sites (Ariba, APC, BC Bid, MERX, etc.).
  • Excellent written and communication skills.
  • French language ability seen as an asset.
  • Excellent project management skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and operate within tight deadlines.
  • Strong organization and analytical skills.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Administrative Support
description:
*Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French

Tu es le genre de personne qui aime réaliser des tâches bien définies au quotidien? Le travail d’équipe et la résolution de problème te motivent? Tu as envie de travailler au sein d’une entreprise en constante croissance offrant des possibilités d’avancement intéressantes? Voici l’occasion que tu attendais!

Au sein de notre équipe, tu contribueras au succès de l’entreprise en veillant à la satisfaction de toutes les parties prenantes, soit les fournisseurs, les groupes d’affaires et les équipiers.

Voici ce qui t’attend au quotidien :

  • Tu mettras à jour les dossiers fournisseurs et différents documents administratifs en collaboration avec l’équipe.
  • Tu chercheras différentes informations pour trouver des réponses à tes questions.
  • Tu contribueras à la mise en place d’indicateurs d’équipe.
  • Tu participeras à l’élaboration de procédures d’équipe.
  • Tu communiqueras avec nos clients internes et nos fournisseurs externes.
  • Tu effectueras de la saisie de données et tu t’assureras de leur exactitude.

Te reconnais-tu dans ce profil?  

  • Tu aimes réaliser différentes tâches administratives.
  • Tu aimes le contact avec les clients que procure le service à la clientèle.
  • Tu es habile avec la suite Microsoft Office.
  • Tu aimes que ton travail soit bien fait et tu as le souci du détail. Rien ne t’échappe!
  • Tu cherches un emploi stable qui offre des horaires réguliers.
  • Tu aimes le travail d’équipe.
  • Tu te débrouilles bien en anglais – un atout.

Chez Premier Tech, profite d’un horaire stable du lundi au vendredi, les fins de semaine sont réservées au repos! Nos équipiers possèdent des avantages concurrentiels tels que des assurances, la possibilité de cotiser à un REER collectif et bien plus encore. Nous sommes même prêts à offrir un montant forfaitaire pour le déménagement d’un nouveau collègue de travail. Qu’attends-tu pour te joindre à nous?

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Tes yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

title: Office Assistant
description:
Downtown company is looking for a junior administrative assistant to provide general office support and administrative support. This is an ideal position for someone interested in gaining more office experience. To be a good fit for this position, you will need to be organized, good with computers, have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, have a strong dose of common sense and have the ability to multi-task.

Office assistant responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Maintain the file room.
  • Assist with mailouts.
  • Arrange courier pickups.
  • Photocopy and scan document.
  • Vacuum and dispose of garbage.
  • Maintain a tidy office including a reception area, boardroom, kitchen, supply room, and common area.

Requirements:
  • Minimum 1-year previous office experience.
  • Strong computer skills (Word, Excel, Outlook).
  • Ability to multi-task.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively over the telephone, in person, and via email.
  • Team player who is able to work with a wide range of people.
  • Someone who is able to take initiative and ensures tasks are completed fully.

The start date is as soon as possible. This is a full-time position.

Salary: $17 - $19/hour, depending on experience.

Please submit a cover letter and resume by email.

Only suitable applicants should apply.

title: Project Administrative Support Coordinator
description:
Please note that this position is remote. Candidates must have an eligible work permit for Canada and be fluent in French. 

Do you want to experience the essence of a large organization in a company with a personal touch? Come and work with us! We are looking for creative, innovative, and collaborative people like you to join our team.

At the heart of Alithya’s values is the well-being of our employees and their families. That's why, we continue to follow the Public Health Agency of Canada’s recommendations closely. 

We remain close to you, while keeping our distance viaPhone, Microsoft Teams, Zoom or however you like. 

Take your ambitions to the next level

The Project Administrative Support Coordinator works to ensure the smooth operation of projects by providing logistical assistance to project teams, including keeping the Alithya Digital Solutions Center (ADSC) metrics and repositories up to date.

  • Share responsibility with other project logistics support coordinators for maintaining the ADSC team repositories, evaluating team metrics (when not automated), supporting administrative activities necessary to conduct projects;
  • Maintain the ADSC repositories:
    • Team Directory, Resume Bank, Expertise Directory;
    • Business Processes, ISO Compliance, FAQs.
  • Collaborate with the content revision team and follow up with ADSC collaborators;
  • Perform tasks related to the onboarding of new collaborators (e.g., registration for software used by the ADSC, project intake, etc.);
  • Manage employee departure logistics (e.g., closing access to software used by the ADSC);
  • Support the process of:
    • opening projects, including obtaining and filing legal documents;
    • project closure;
    • production of SR&ED reports.
  • Perform input and update of selected company systems (as determined by manager, logistical support to projects);
  • Provide support for assignments;
  • Support the manager in relation to training requests;
  • Support the time sheet process.
When it just clicks!
Does this sound like you?
  • DEC or AEC in administration or in a related field or a combination such as or DEP in secretarial work and relevant experience;
  • Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of experience in a similar position;
  • Excellent knowledge of Office suite;
  • Ability to demonstrate rigour and concern for the quality of services offered;
  • Good stress management;
  • Comfortable with collaboration tools and strong ability to learn new collaboration tools;
  • Availability to work overtime when required during peak periods;
  • Strong communication skills, both oral and written, in French and English are required. Level expected:
    • French: 4/4
    • English: 3/4 
      42674 #LI-Remote

title: Administrative Assistant / Front Desk
description:
The Company

Fast Epp is an internationally recognized structural engineering firm with a team that prioritizes creativity and simplicity. We work with all materials but are well known for our mass timber and timber-hybrid projects. We love working on architecturally expressive structures, on every scale from single-family homes to large institutional buildings. We enjoy work with a high premium on structural expression. We strive to improve peopleâ€™s lives through practical, holistic structural design.

Description

We are searching for a personable, reliable, proactive Front Desk Admin Assistant to work at our Vancouver office. You are an ideal candidate if you have excellent communication and customer service skills, and an understanding of administrative procedures. This is a great opportunity for someone with customer service experience looking to transition into an office environment.

This role is Monday to Friday, 8:30 AM â€“ 5:00 PM in the office.

Responsibilities

â€¢ Answer, screen and direct phone calls in a polite and friendly manner

â€¢ Welcome and assist visitors

â€¢ Respond to general information requests with accurate information

â€¢ Oversee mail deliveries (including sorting and distribution), packages, and couriers

â€¢ Update calendars and schedule meetings

â€¢ Ensure reception, meeting rooms and other common areas are tidy and clean

â€¢ General kitchen duties

â€¢ Assist in organizing and maintaining Library

â€¢ Keep internal distribution list current

â€¢ Order office supplies and maintain inventory

â€¢ Coordinate onsite visits and communicate with vendors

â€¢ Scanning, archiving and data entry

â€¢ Perform other clerical and administrative duties as required to the highest standard

 

Required Knowledge and Skills

â€¢ Minimum 6 monthsâ€™ work experience in a reception, front desk or customer service/hospitality role

â€¢  Personable, professional and team oriented; enjoys meeting and connecting with people

â€¢ Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

â€¢ Ability to be resourceful and proactive when issues arise

â€¢ Exceptional organizational and time management skills

â€¢ Experience managing competing tasks and deadlines

 

Why Work For Us?

  • Work for an industry leader; contribute to exciting and challenging projects!
  • We are committed to your professional development, with offered tuition assistance
  • Flexible working hours with the ability to utilize "Flex Time" for additional paid time off.
  • Annual company profitability and discretionary bonuses
  • Office closure between Christmas and New Years Day.
  • A positive working atmosphere
  • Social events and activities - we like to have fun too!
  • Customized to your liking extended health plan, Dental coverage, a health care spending account and RRSP matching
  • Located in a very transit friendly location, complete with a generous Transit subsidy

title: Administrative Assistant Student Placement
company: Fort St. John Association for Community Living
description:
The Fort St. John Association for Community Living has been providing support to adults with developmental disabilities and complex needs for over 60 years.

We are seeking a motivated student to join our administrative team thorough the summer months and qualify for the Canada Summer Jobs Grant. The ideal candidate should be excited about a career in the non-profit sector, and be passionate about making a difference in the lives of others.

This role includes working the reception desk. 

 

Key Responsibilities:

 

  • Greeting and directing visitors, directing phone calls, answering inquiries, and taking/relaying messages to the correct department.
  • Maintaining and ordering office supplies, coffee-room supplies, janitorial equipment, and personal protective equipment. Ensure training and meeting rooms are prepared in advance of use.
  • Supporting and setting up new employees during orientation and training.
  • General data entry, filing, and maintenance of personnel files and employee records, as directed.
  • Provide administrative support to Human Resources, as directed.
  • Booking off-site training for staff, as directed.

 

Qualifications:

  • Excellent customer service skills, written communication skills, and verbal communication skills.
  • Capable of handling multiple projects and staying focused despite interruptions.
  • Proficiency with computer software such as Word, Excel, Outlook, etc. Capable of learning and maintaining a variety of web-based training, scheduling, finance, and data-collection platforms.
  • Capable of trouble-shooting photocopiers, phone systems, and computers.
  • Capable of working independently without direction, or collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Must have a team-mentality, professional presentation, and positive attitude.
  • Must pass a criminal record check, maintain confidentiality, and provide documentation of double vaccination against the coronavirus.

 

 

This is a union-excluded position.

Starting wage is $21.63/hour.

Opportunities for advancement, based on performance.

The role requires 35 hours per week. Hours are Monday-Friday, 8:30AM-4:30PM, with lunch hour from noon-1PM. Must be able to work extended hours during fundraising and special events.

 

Closing Date: May 13th, 2022

title: Office & People Coordinator
description:
Weâ€™re so proud of our HQ office. The location is great: weâ€™re steps from Union station, there is a streetcar right outside our door, two bike share stations across the street, and weâ€™re a short walk from many amazing and local restaurants and cafes. Best of all - weâ€™re right on the water. Weâ€™ve got an incredible view, weâ€™re right on the boardwalk and thereâ€™s an outdoor skating rink right next door. We need your help to create the best in-person experience for our Humigos using this space. If youâ€™re a people-lover, love curating experiences and enjoy thinking outside the box, then this role is for you!

Who are we?

Humiâ€™s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset â€“ their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the worldâ€™s leading angel investors.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider, applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. 

Why join Humi?

  • As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving 
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiative
  • Opportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to

https://www.humi.ca/about

What will you be doing as an Office & People Coordinator?

This role will be 100% based in our Queens Quay office location. In this role, you will support all departments for any office related inquiries (Client Experience, Sales, Marketing, Insurance, Finance, Operations, Engineering and People), greet and welcome guests and Humigoâ€™s in the office, partner with our Experience and Culture team on projects and initiatives as well as helping our HR team with administrative work. From time to time you may also assist with special requests from our CEO.

  • You will be in charge of maintaining our in-office booking system Officely (sending reminders for survey responses, adding guests, adding Newmigos to the system, coordinating Vaccine Passport Proof & recording, coordinating with our IT Specialist to get virtual key cards set up).
  • You will assist with the packaging & delivery of onboarding packages.
  • You will be the main point of contact to communicate any issues with the unit to building management.
  • You will assist with in-office Tech Inquiries (setting up meeting rooms, grabbing equipment) - in the case our IT Specialist is absent.
  • You will be responsible for making sure the office is up and running daily (ordering replenishing our snacks, unloading/loading the dishwasher, coffee machine maintenance, stocking up our beverage fridges (beer, coffee, soft drinks! general tidiness, appropriate signage in accordance to COVID-19 policies in place, making sure all sanitization stations are stocked, assist in beautifying the space).
  • You will support our HR and Talent Acquisition team with light administrative duties such as posting jobs, entering or pulling data from our ATS, setting up or sending surveys and more.

Bonus points if you:

  • Have worked in a scaling start-up or growing small-business environment
  • Prior experience in HR as an asset (posting jobs, scheduling interviews, pulling data from the ATS, updating candidate profiles etc.)

In your first 30 days, you will:

  • Goal setting session with the Director, People Operations
  • Walkthrough current processes and procedures
  • Continue supporting our in-office experience and maintain the physical space
  • Training with HR & Office tools: Humi, Notion, Slack, Peakon, Fellow.app, Officely etc.

In your first 60 days, you will:

  • Maintain and edit any new/existing policies, documentation and internal projects
  • Identify 1 special project or policy that will help enhance the office experience at Humi
  • Maintain the office experience budget with Director, People Operations
  • Become familiar with Humiâ€™s suppliers in order to enhance the office experience

In your first 90 days, you will: 

  • Be an expert on the tools and technology we use at Humi
  • Demonstrate exceptional knowledge of the Humi culture and embody that in-person and when working online
  • Present your overall findings of procedures that are working, areas that can be improved, and make at least one creative recommendation for an existing initiative 
  • Participate in your first quarterly performance review

In your first year, you will: 

  • Demonstrate strong industry knowledge in recruiting and onboarding best practices by creating creative experiences for Humigos
  • Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with colleagues
  • Have an affinity for finding a problem and recommending a creative solution
  • Participate in your first annual review

What are we looking for in an Office & People Coordinator?

  • Prior experience managing and supporting office duties (greeting visitors, light clean up, setting up meeting rooms, ordering supplies & snacks, accepting and signing packages, putting together new hire onboarding packages etc.)
  • Experience with Google Suite, Slack, Fellow.app, Notion, Officely and Open Path 
  • Exposure to the HR space
  • Flexible, detail oriented, accurate and strong communication skills required
  • Passionate when it comes to delivering a great internal employee experience
  • Willingness to step up to the plate to help team members
  • Proactive mentality and highly organized
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion at all times

Please note that all successful candidates will only receive offers through the Humi platform and we do not issue offers outside of our platform. We do not make any offers of employment via social media. Please see our resource library for the best ways to detect fraud and fraudulent activity.

title: Administrative Assistant - Lift Operations - Full Time - Summer Seasonal - Whistler Blackcomb
description:
We’re looking for team members whose legendary attention to detail and commitment to phenomenal service comes naturally. Pursue a lifestyle that will elevate your expectation of what work can look like. Nothing is too big or too small for the staff to bravely pursue and elevate the expectations of the guest. Do you possess a calling for delivering world-class events and amenities? Explore Employment Opportunities with Whistler Blackcomb! www.vailresortscareers.com/whistlerblackcomb


As of Nov. 15, 2021, Vail Resorts will be requiring all employees across North America to be vaccinated for COVID-19.


Daily/Weekly tasks


+ Scheduling, payroll, checking voicemails, general filing

+ Managing Lift Operations shared email folder

+ Leading the weekly electronic staff communication

+ Stock inventory – place orders as required

+ Staff administration

+ Updating personal files, name tag requests, track training and notify leadership of deficiencies.

+ Payroll

+ Check timesheets and notify supervisors of missed and late punches for team of 200+ employees

+ Add vacation pay, as requested by employee, for both hourly and salary staff

+ Resolve payroll issues in a timely manner

+ Billing (Payroll Hours)

+ Kadenwood and other departments

+ Coupa (Ordering)

+ Quotes from suppliers

+ Creating Purchase Orders

+ Setting up vendors

+ Recording/tracking purchases

+ Creating order guide for ease of access and consistent ordering

+ Onbase

+ Check and Submit for invoices

+ Resolve issues in timely manner

+ Ensure contractors are paid on time

+ Concur

+ Correctly add expenses to monthly report, ensuing billing info is correct

+ Contact other departments for billing info is required

+ Submit correct receipts and keep records

+ Complete and notify manager before month end to ensure transactions hit the budget correct

+ Paperwork

+ Print out daily paperwork as needed for the lifts and gondolas

+ Update lift specific manuals with new procedures

+ Assist in staff recognition program

+ Tracking staff time off

+ Following up and tracking COVID-19 sick policy


Benefits include:


+ Discount lift tickets for friends and family

+ Discounted lodging, food, gear and mountain shuttles

+ Discounted bike haul & golf

+ Medical, Dental, and Vision plans (full-time positions)

+ 401(k) Retirement Plan

+ Excellent training and professional development


Whistler Blackcomb’s Mission Statement is “Experience of a Lifetime” Love what you do! Because that’s what we’re all about. The Whistler Blackcomb staff is comprised of individuals who thrive in the outdoors, love the mountains, and are passionate about what they do. We look for applicants who share in this passion, whether you are looking for a seasonal job or wanting to build an exciting career, don’t miss the chance to work and play in BC’s winter wonderland. If you sound like our ideal applicant please apply online and show us what you’ve got. #wbworklove


_Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law._


Requisition ID 433247

title: Personal Assistant – Māori Sector and Māori Government Sector
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Kia hiwa rā Kia hiwa rā
Kia hiwa rā ki tēnei tuku
Kia hiwa rā ki tērā tuku
Kia tū Kia oho Kia mataara
Tihei Mauri Ora.
E whai iho nei, ko te tono mo tētahi tūranga mahi ka wātea mai kei roto i a KPMG ki Aotearoa. Tītokona tō tātou tōnuitanga, mō Aotearoa, mō tātou te take.
Nō reira pānuitia. Ki te pīrangi koe, tukua mai to tono.
Mauri Ora

Mō tēnei tūranga mahi | About this role

KPMG New Zealand is part of the international KPMG network, one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. We provide business advisory, accounting, audit and tax services to Māori organisations and businesses, government agencies, individuals, SMEs, not-for-profit organisations, and multi-nationals. 

Our people experience is anchored in a clearly articulated purpose of ‘Fuelling New Zealand’s prosperity’ and our contribution to the shared wealth and lasting well-being for all New Zealanders. In order to deliver this, we must attract, develop and retain the very best people and create a workplace environment in which everyone is able to flourish. We are proud of our reputation for values-driven behaviour that guide our actions and defines what it means to work at and be part of KPMG. We believe in Integrity – We do what is right; Excellence – We never stop learning and improving; Courage – We think and act boldly; Together – We respect each other and draw strength from our differences; and For Better – We do what matters.

The focus of our Māori Sector and Māori Government Sector partners is on partnering with Māori organisations, government agencies and business to develop solutions that help to transform outcomes for whānau and our communities of Aotearoa. We aim to put whānau at the centre of everything and draw on tikanga to inform our approach to our mahi. We weave together indigenous Māori and global approaches in a way that is meaningful, respectful and focused on outcomes that enable our mokopuna to thrive in a rapidly changing world. It takes vision, resilience, hard work and leadership, and we’re here right behind you and beside you every step of the way.


Life at KPMG

We offer rewarding careers to talented individuals and a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstance. As a KPMG employee, we will offer you:
— Hybrid Working – a mix of working in the office and at home to enhance your work/life balance
— Flexible leave options, including the ability to purchase additional annual leave
— Access to ‘Whanau@KPMG’ – 18 weeks’ paid flexible leave for all new parents - primary and secondary carers
— Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning, with bespoke learning pathways for all employees.
— Discounts on a range of lifestyle goods and services.
— Opportunity to join any of our Inclusion, Diversity and Equity networks as a participant and ally.
— Opportunity to join our Social club and enjoy activities such as cooking classes, painting, quiz nights and more.

We believe that diversity of background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, clients and communities. Our goal is to be recognised as an employer of choice for all, irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability. Further info can be found on our website

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.</section>

title: OFFICE COORDINATOR
description:
At Matrix Solutions we collaborate across services, disciplines, and geographies to deliver responsive, locally connected, and scalable solutions customized to our clients’ projects and environmental challenges. Our integrated approach is supported by talented professionals and a project management model that encourages synergies, promotes service excellence, and provides cost and time savings.


WHO WE ARE

A Canadian‑owned environmental and engineering consulting company, with employees strategically located across the country from British Columbia to Ontario.



OUR MISSION

Our people fuel a solutions powerhouse, tailoring our work for clients and projects where environmental stewardship matters and where we can make a difference.



OUR VISION

To be a company where our people and clients can’t imagine working with anyone else.



OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION

Our team is made up of diverse people working collaboratively towards common goals. We value the contributions and perspectives of all employees and are committed to equity and diversity initiatives to create a feeling of belonging for all of our people. When we are inclusive and diverse in a way that reflects the broader world we serve, we are able to draw from a wider community of excellence within the regions we operate.



WHAT WE DO

We partner with clients and communities to solve challenges. It’s our job to power progress and shape a better future where our clients, people, communities, and environment thrive.



Are you looking to…



  • Work on interesting environmental projects and solve environmental challenges in your community
  • Take part in our mentorship program and further your career development
  • Have the opportunity to interact and work with a community of technical experts from other Matrix regions
  • Join a well-respected environmental consulting company where the majority of employees are also shareholders



Our Virden, Manitoba office is seeking a Office Coordinator to support our growing assessment, remediation, reclamation and monitoring (ARRM) team. The successful applicant will be involved in a broad range of office-based projects with responsibilities as follows:



Office Functionality:

  • Maintain supplies, materials, and equipment for the office
  • Ensure a presentable reception area, kitchen, and common spaces
  • Coordinate cleaning contractors
  • Support Matrix’s facilities for separating recyclables
  • Serve as a liaison between Matrix occupants and the landlord, identifying and resolving current and potential maintenance problems. Coordinate repairs and maintenance, as necessary
  • Meet with vendors, contractors, and suppliers to assess if their services fit the needs of the Virden office
  • Manage and review contracts in relation to furniture, cleaning, office equipment leases, office supplies, stationery, kitchen supplies, service agreements, maintenance, and repairs. Liaise with Calgary Facilities staff, as necessary



Equipment Support:

  • Actively participate in maintaining Matrix’s strong safety culture
  • Inspect, clean, calibrate, and repair environmental field equipment including, but not limited to, safety equipment, water quality instruments, vehicles, boats, groundwater monitoring equipment, fish nets, and GPS units
  • Clean and conduct walkarounds of light duty vehicles and facilitate their maintenance with third party mechanics
  • Maintain inventory levels/stock of equipment and consumables by monitoring stock levels and identifying and ordering items as needed
  • Act as a point of contact regarding equipment available for field projects. This includes supporting the field technicians in selecting equipment. As part of this responsibility, you will develop an understanding of what the equipment is used for and how it works
  • Preserve a strong working relationship with customers and vendors
  • Aid with the coordination of internal equipment orders/requests
  • Coordinate shipping and receiving between offices and vendors
  • Assist in the tidiness of warehouse facilities and equipment
  • Support the General Managers in maintaining office Health and Safety standards by identifying and reporting hazards, maintaining equipment, and attending and taking minutes at committee meetings



Technical Functionality:

  • Collect, compile and assess Phase 1 Environmental Site Assessment data including:
  • Perform file reviews including summarizing previous technical reports
  • Travel to client offices to gather information from a variety of files
  • Make orders of public information
  • Conduct Landowner telephone interviews
  • Submit forms to request information from various agencies
  • Review and interpret Aerial photographs including identifying locations and infrastructure
  • Author Phase 1 ESA reports
  • Track budgets for a variety of projects
  • Other duties as assigned



What We Are Looking For


  • Relevant post-secondary certificate, diploma or equivalent
  • Mechanically and/or technically inclined
  • Previous experience in consulting or the energy industry is preferred
  • Previous experience with asset tracking and scheduling would be considered an asset
  • Knowledge of basic vehicle repair would be considered an asset
  • Customer service oriented
  • Detail oriented with the ability to multitask
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite including Outlook, Excel, and Word
  • A valid class 5 driver’s license with no restrictions and clean driving record


Why Choose Matrix


At Matrix you will be part of an amazing community of collaborative people who live our values and bring industry-leading technical expertise to their work every day. We offer a comprehensive compensation package, which includes RRSP matching, vacation + flex time, profit sharing, and opportunities to become a shareholder. We are also committed to flexible work hours and schedules, team-based work, and cross-training opportunities.



Click the Apply button.



Are you the one we're looking for? Please apply to us directly. As a note, we are not accepting third party agency applicants at this time.



Matrix is committed to providing a safe and productive work environment and to promoting the health, safety and well-being of our employees. In keeping with our Health & Safety Policy, individuals in safety sensitive positions are subject to pre-employment, pre-access (and in some client cases, random) alcohol & drug testing as well as drivers abstract reviews.



Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada with no restrictions.



We welcome and promote diversity and inclusion in our workplace and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Matrix provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities; including accommodation that takes into account an applicant’s accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources directly.



Please follow us on LinkedIn (Matrix Solutions Inc) for ongoing updates about our people and business.

For more information about Matrix Solutions, please visit our website at www.matrix-solutions.com and don’t forget to our bookmark our careers page.



While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Our client, located in downtown Calgary is looking for a professional Administrative Assistant to join their busy downtown office.

Qualifications:
  • Minimum 2 years experience in office administration with a demonstrated ability to operate in a client-focused environment.
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration or similar would be an asset.
  • Strong administrative skills, flexible, well-organized, and able to manage competing priorities.
  • Exceptional attention to detail with a desire to meet the highest standards.
  • Advanced MS Office skills.

Responsibilities:
  • Type/ format/ proofread documents and correspondence.
  • Handle client contact lists, including database management.
  • Create PowerPoint presentations and Excel spreadsheets.
  • Receive telephone calls, manage couriers and mail, etc.
  • Coordinate events, schedule and organize complex calendar activities such as meetings, agendas, and travel plans.
  • Enter expense reports.
  • Administrative support for various departments.
This position is ideal for candidates with a background in administration, who are self-motivated and enjoy multi-tasking. If this sounds like you apply now, this great opportunity won’t last long!

title: Emploi étudiant - Support administratif - Anjou, QC
description:
Job ID:  400745

 

Permacon est le leader et chef de file dans la fabrication de produits de béton destinés aux marchés de l’aménagement extérieur et de la maçonnerie. Permacon qui compte 9 usines au Québec et en Ontario, est une division d’Oldcastle APG.

 

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un(e) étudiant(e) pour combler un poste de support administratif au département de la facturation, à notre siège social de Anjou.

 

L’horaire de travail est de 4 jours par semaine, du mardi au vendredi, 8h00 à 16h30.

 

 

Principales responsabilités :

 

  • Effectuer de la saisie de données
  • Faire l’entrée, la vérification et la numérisation de factures
  • Vérification des billets de transport et des états de compte
  • Assister et supporter l’équipe au compte payable

 

 

Qualifications requises

 

  • Être présentement aux études
  • Habileté à travailler efficacement, puis de manière autonome
  • Connaissances informatiques de base, notamment avec la suite Microsoft office
  • Avoir le souci du détail

 

 

Pourquoi travailler chez Permacon cet été ?

 

  • Opportunité d’acquérir de l’expérience dans une grande organisation
  • Milieu de travail enrichissant et ambiance agréable
  • Travail de bureau, à l’abri des intempéries !
  • Salaire horaire 17.00$/h
  • Établissement à proximité de services de transport en commun

Vous êtes prêts à relever le défi ?  Postulez dès maintenant !

 

 

Chez Permacon, la diversité est l'un de nos principaux atouts ! Nous invitons donc les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques et les personnes vivant avec un handicap à soumettre leur candidature.

 

L'utilisation du genre masculin peut être adopté afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
S3 is looking for talented individuals with an eye for detail. Give us your best and we will give you ours.

Why Work at S3 Group?
Challenge, variety and opportunities to grow are characteristic of every position at S3.

Job Overview:

  • Clerical support: data entry, filing, and communicating with the team
  • Provide administrative assistance in a confidential, professional manner
  • Maintaining and organizing information in current forms and spreadsheets
  • Processing basic accounting transactions
  • Compiling data required by different departments
  • Perform other tasks as assigned

Requirements:

  • Punctuality and professionalism
  • Consistency, the ability to perform transactions with accuracy, and in appropriate priority
  • Detail-oriented and conscientious
  • Ability to organize information and communicate or store it so it is useful to others
  • Organized speaking and writing abilities
  • Proficient in Word and Excel
  • Solid math skills
  • Committed to achieving deadlines
  • Initiative in problem solving
  • Valid driver's license

title: Office Administrator
description:
Company Description

Delsan-AIM is the largest decommissioning and demolition contractor in Canada. With a rapidly growing team of over 300 people, we are always looking for motivated, career-oriented individuals to join the team. With offices in Montreal, Quebec City, Ottawa, and Toronto, we are looking to add to our Toronto team to help further grow our platform.

Job Description

We have an opportunity in our Toronto office for an Office Administrator, reporting directly to our Toronto District Manager. This individual will be responsible for several areas of the Toronto Office, including the following:

  • Monitor incoming emails to the general corporate email address.
  • Manage the Estimating Department’s bid list showing open and closed tenders.
  • Open new Bid Numbers for the Estimating Department including hard copy and digital filing of the RFPs and subsequent addenda.
  • Printing and organising RFP documents including drawings.
  • Prepare Proposal Letters and Budget Letters with input from Estimators.
  • Assist Project Managers and Coordinators with document management, timesheet tracking and paperwork.
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or diploma in a related field.
  • Minimum 3 to 5 year of experience in the construction/demolition industry.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project, Outlook, Excel and Word.
  • Organized, responsible, autonomous, resourceful and dynamic.


Additional Information

Additional information :

  • Work schedule: Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm;
  • Complete Group Insurance (after 3 months)
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution (after 6 months)
  • Full time, permanent position.

The American Iron & Metal Company and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to all. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant, Fleet Operations
description:
Job Description :

"We connect communities and customers to the people and places important in their livesâ€

 

Taking care of our employees is a top priority for us, and to do that, we offer benefits that help you stay healthy in all ways. Some of our great benefits include:

  • Competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits package
  • Public Service Pension Plan (a paycheque every month when you retire!)
  • Vacation starting at a minimum 3 weeks
  • Maternity leave employer top up
  • Passes for ferry travel
  • Amazing colleagues who share a common goal
  • Discounts in our gift shops and with many businesses on Vancouver Island and the Lower Mainland
  • Career progression and training and development opportunities

 

ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT, FLEET OPERATIONS

Victoria

 

Working as part of a dynamic results-driven team, you provide high level, efficient and confidential administrative services to the Executive Director, Fleet Operations.

 

You are responsible for planning and coordinating the provision of executive support services to the office and for ensuring the Executive Director, Fleet Operations is fully briefed on all emerging and ongoing issues. You act as the principle liaison between various offices and senior management, provide administrative support, and provide budgetary assistance. You carry out confidential and sensitive assignments; and manage administrative operations to ensure effective coordination and timely completion of administrative tasks.

 

You bring a wide breadth of experience as an administrative professional with a certificate or diploma in Business or Office Administration and a minimum of five yearsâ€™ experience as an Administrative Assistant. You are a self-starter with high initiative and excellent judgement. You are highly organized with a strong commitment to customer service and a proficient team player able to work with multiple departments simultaneously. You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, and an ability to work well under time constraints and prioritize competing tasks appropriately. Prior experience in a senior administrative role would be considered an asset.

 

Please apply by May 6, 2022.

 

At BC Ferries, our employees are our most important assets in delivering our commitment to customer safety, service and satisfaction. We offer a unique West Coast working environment with diverse challenges and opportunities. Whether your goal is to work behind the scenes, onboard our ships, or within our land based operations, you are a key contributor to the BC Ferries team.

 

With 47 ports of call and around 500 sailings every day, BC Ferries is the largest independently-owned ferry company in the world. Dedicated to safety, excellence, innovation, and people, we are committed to continuously improving the west coast travel experience of our customers.

 

BC Ferries supports employment equity and diversity in the workplace and we encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who reflect our ever-changing workplace.

 

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Adjointe administrative
description:
Si vous aspirez à faire progresser votre carrière, tout en apportant une contribution importante à une entreprise dynamique en croissance rapide dans le secteur de la construction – gestion de projets, prenez alors le temps de prendre en considération cette opportunité offerte pour le poste de :

ADJOINTE ADMINISTRATIVE (AVEC TÂCHES COMPTABLES)

TÂCHES ADMINISTRATIVES :

1) Répondre au téléphone et accueillir les visiteurs

2) Gérer les boîtes courriels générales (comptabilité et info)

3) Sauvegarder les documents reçus sur le serveur et les acheminer aux différentes personnes concernées

4) Assister le département d’estimation pour l’obtention des documents administratifs requis pour le dépôt d’une soumission tels que cautionnements, assurances spécifiques, attestations de conformité, etc

5) Effectuer une révision mathématique des soumissions avant leur dépôt

6) Faire la gestion des envois par messagerie

7) Assister la directrice administratif et financier dans la rédaction des contrats aux clients et en assurer la réception

8) Ajouter les contacts d’un projet dans le système comptable

9) Effectuer le suivi des assurances chantiers et leur renouvellement si requis avant leur échéance en collaboration avec la directrice administratif et financier

10) Classement

11) Effectuer toute tâche inhérente à la fonction et/ou à la demande du supérieur immédiat

12) Assister l’équipe dans l’obtention des documents de fins de projets.

TÂCHES COMPTABLES :

13) Gestion des comptes fournisseurs

14) Préparation des bons de commande pour les locations d’équipement et de main-d’œuvre

15) Jumeler les bons de livraison et bons de travail avec les factures de fournisseurs

16) Comptabiliser les factures d’achat dans le système comptable

17) Transférer et faire le suivi des factures auprès des chargés de projets pour approbation

18) Concilier les états de comptes des fournisseurs pour suivi de paiements

19) Vérifier, traiter et procéder au paiement des comptes payables selon les termes établis.

20) Recevoir et enregistrer dans le système comptable les quittances reçues

PRÉ REQUIS

· Détenir un DEP ou DEC en comptabilité

· Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience similaire en construction

· Connaissance du logiciel comptable Maestro (un atout)

· Connaissance des logiciels Microsoft (Word, Excel, Outlook)

APTITUDES

· Maîtrise du français écrit

· Bon niveau d’anglais

· Excellente gestion des priorités

· Sens de l’organisation

· Rigueur

· Gestion du stress

· Autonomie et proactivité

· Sens de la communication

· Esprit d’équipe et de collaboration développé

Si vous êtes intéressés par cette opportunité de carrière qui optimisera votre potentiel de croissance professionnelle et personnelle et si ce type de défi vous stimule, nous désirons vous rencontrer !

Veuillez noter que seul(e)s les candidat(e)s qui répondent au profil recherché seront contacté(e)s.

title: Administrative Assistant - Infrastructure Development
description:
Reporting to the Vice-President - Infrastructure Development, the incumbent provides administrative support to the Vice-President and the departmental staff and is mainly involved in the bidding process. The assistant ensures the proper follow-up of files and is involved in the preparation of various departmental projects with the team in place.

  • Prepares the bid documents and contracts for consultants and contractors, using templates and models;
  • Makes the final correction to documents, after the project managers’ modifications are done;
  • Validates internally (OHS and environment) if specific clauses need to be added;
  • Ensures following up with the legal compliance department for various contracts and bids;
  • Issues and follows up on bids on the MERX and SEAO web sites;
  • Collaborates in the development of addendums and amendments for projects;
  • Files and classifies the various documents created during project manager’s activities;
  • Is involved in the administrative follow-up of projects;
  • Writes, edits and formats the required project progress and follow-up documents;
  • Ensures the follow up on action points determined during team meetings when needed;
  • Provides support to other team members and to his immediate supervisor;
  • Greets visitors and provides them with general information;
  • Monitors, sorts and distributes mails and e-mails to team members;
  • Carries out other related duties.

CANDIDATE PROFILE

Requirements:

  • College degree in office administration (or equivalent);
  • At least 4 years of experience in similar functions (including the preparation of bids);
  • Mastery of the Office Suite (Word, Excel, Visio, Power Point and MS Project) and Adobe PDF;
  • Good writing skills and excellent mastery of French (written and spoken);
  • Good management of priorities and organizational skills;
  • Ability to manage several files simultaneously;
  • Ability to work in a team;
  • High level of tact and discretion;
  • Thoroughness and attention to detail.

Assets:

  • Mastery of the English language;
  • Mastery of the MERX and SEAO bidding sites;
  • Knowledge of the marine environment.

A combination of education and/or relevant experience may be considered as equivalent.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
How you will make an impact at Intertek:

Administration for Chemicals Group – CG

  • Group project management:
    • Develop and maintain Project Management Spreadsheets.
    • Ensure that logs are updated and Project Managers (PMs)/Scientific Staff are aware of changes.
    • Maintenance and communication of Technical Staff Workload.
    • Maintenance of the Chemicals Database.
  • Group meetings:
    • Prepare for, arrange and lead Group meetings on a weekly to monthly basis, including Goto Meeting, Microsoft Teams Meetings, Conference Call phone and technology set-up.
    • Maintain CG Activity log.
    • Maintain Hazard Communication log.
    • Follow up on leads and opportunities in iConnect.
  • Project initiation:
    • Prepare/edit Proposals as required.
    • Coordinate credit checks with Accounting.
    • Oversee Corporate Risk Assessment, Legal Review and Project Initiation processes for new projects and agreements.
    • Liaise with clients and Intertek legal regarding Agreements (Non-disclosure Agreements (NDA), Master Service Agreements (MSA), Terms and Conditions (T&Cs) and Subcontractor).
    • iConnect Lead and Opportunity entry.
  • Webinars:
    • Manage iConnect leads from webinars.
    • Review webinars for content and format according to brand guidelines.
    • Provide technical support on day of webinar.
  • Request Purchase Orders (POs) from Corporate Operations as requested by CG staff for subcontractor invoices. 
  • Keep the Business Sources and Agreements tracker up to date including tracking clients with blanket agreements, clients with special payment terms, and conference leads.
  • Arrange outgoing couriers, record courier dates for New Substance Notification (NSN) dossiers, and track outgoing couriers via internet.
  • Photocopy and/or scan to pdf of documents, couriers, faxes, letters as required by staff according to CG protocols.
  • Prepare Universal Serial Bus (USB) keys for submission of information to the Government and delivery to clients as requested by staff.
  • Compose and create letters, memos, fax cover sheets, binder materials, presentations, promotional material, graphs and charts as required.
  • Prepare Payment Request Forms for Accounting for all non-travel CG group expenses (e.g. Government fees for submissions).
  • Document control including securing PDFs containing staff signatures and restricting editing in Word documents.
  • Updating Chemicals Group CVs and one-page Biographies as required.
  • Prepare and oversee logistics for client meetings.
  • Arrange all travel requirements for senior scientific staff using Concur.
  • Coordinate group members vacation requests with Corporate Operations and track vacation in the shared calendar.
  • Organize work and social events for the team including preparing an agenda, preparing documents or presentations for meetings, and organizing group lunches or team building events.
  • Support Government submission process including dossier preparation, Government correspondence and status tracking.  Manage all government correspondence and update the Government Submissions Tracker and CG database as required.
  • Develop and write Standard Operating Procedures for all admin functions within the group.
  • Weekly/Monthly assigned project work, which often involves word processing and updating of tracking sheets.
  • Liaising with and supporting staff in remote offices.
  • iConnect:
    • Following up with scientific staff on open leads.
    • Entering/Winning/Losing Opportunities.
    • Entering in New Accounts and Contacts.
  • Assist Accounting processes including timesheets, invoicing and project initiation. Support Accounting during audits to ensure quick and easy access to any requested files.
  • Edit and format CG members PowerPoint presentations according to brand guidelines.
  • Prepare expense reports for all senior staff. Ensuring all receipts are included and the Employee Travel Expense Report is filled out according to company policy.
  • Train new staff on all procedures specific to the CG group. Help new staff complete their Onboarding Checklist by scheduling meetings and performing any other required administrative functions.  
  • Translations:
    • Work with one of several translation companies to ensure translations of documents are done accurately and in a timely manner.
    • Obtain multiple translation quotes if requested by the Project Manager.
    • Track completed translation fees in the Translation Request Invoice Log.
    • Track completed translations in the Translation Request Log and the Non-Library Phrases Log.

General Administration for Intertek Health Sciences

  • Act as administrative support for other groups to cover vacations and excess work.
  • Perform reception duties if Corporate Operations is unavailable. Direct general call inquiries to the appropriate group member.
  • Monthly administrative meetings:
    • Provide feedback from CG staff at monthly administrative meeting to ensure that topics that are important to the group and discussed at the admin level.
    • Advise group of any changes to policy as discussed in the administrative meeting or provide a training session on new procedures as necessary.

 

What it takes to be successful in this role:

  • Post Secondary Education - science background (environmental science, toxicology, human biology, biology, chemistry; biochemistry, etc.);
  • Minimum 1-2 years experience in an office environment.

Personal characteristics:

  • Strong organizational skills (time management).
  • Team player with ability to multi-task.
  • Advanced Executive skills, e.g., letter writing, grammar, spelling, etc.
  • Able to work with Windows software.
  • Knowledge of Outlook/Word/Excel/Adobe/SharePoint/PowerPoint.
  • Very detail oriented with high quality standards and ability to establish priorities.
  • Knowledge of office equipment, i.e., faxes, printers, etc.
  • Possesses good judgment and works independently.
  • Interpersonal skills both oral and written. Advanced organizational skills.
  • Ability to self-monitor and edit own work and that of others.
  • Scientific/technical aptitude to support growth in role.

 

Why work at Intertek?

Intertek is a world leader in the $250 billion Quality Assurance market, with a proven, high-quality business model and a global network of customer-focused operations and highly engaged subject matter experts. At Intertek, we exercise our spirit of innovation, the passion of our people and our unmatched customer commitment to realize our purpose of making the world an ever better, safer, and more sustainable place for all. Learn more about Our History and What We Do.

Intertek is committed to a safe work environment for our employees and clients. Learn more about our COVID-19 Policy.

What we have to offer:

When Working with Intertek, you can expect salary and benefit package competitively placed within the local market.

About Us

Intertek Assuris is a leading Total Quality Assurance provider to industries worldwide. Our network of more than 1,000 laboratories and offices in more than 100 countries, delivers innovative and bespoke Assurance, Testing, Inspection and Certification (ATIC) solutions for our customers' operations and supply chains. Working at Intertek means joining a global network of state-of-the-art facilities and passionate people who deliver superior customer service with a purpose of bringing quality, safety, and sustainability to life.

 

About the Team

Intertek Assuris’ business line is renowned for its high-quality solutions delivered through its global network of world-class scientific, engineering, toxicological and regulatory experts.  Additionally, Intertek Assuris provides regulatory compliance support, as well as industry-agnostic solutions pertaining to sustainability, quality, and safety, empowering companies to mitigate risks and make informed decisions relating to their products and processes.

title: Secrétaire-réceptionniste
description:
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

Tu cherches un milieu de travail dynamique où tu pourras acquérir de l'expérience en soutien administratif ?
Tu apprécies le fait d'offrir un excellent service à la clientèle et tu entre facilement en contact avec les autres ?

Tu es allumée, dynamique, proactive et tu aimes apprendre de nouvelles choses ?
Tu as une bonne gestion des priorités et ton anglais est de niveau avancé à bilingue ?

Ce rôle te permettra de t'accomplir au quotidien en soutien administratif et au service à la clientèle.

Ce poste vous intéresse ? Contactez-nous dès maintenant!
Vous souhaitez en apprendre davantage sur le rôle?

Communiquez avec nous par téléphone au : 418.525.1191
Par courriel au :
elise.dumas-roy@randstad.ca
ivonne.carrillo@randstad.ca
myriam.lheureux@randstad.ca

Avantages
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

-Salaire compétitif ;
-Horaire flexible ; 40h/semaine ;
-Poste permanent, du lundi au vendredi ;
-Congés fériés payés ;
-Congé mobile (1 journée) ;
-REER ;
-Environnement dynamique ;
-Bureau nouvellement rénové ;
-Gym sur place ;
-Café gratuit ;
-Et bien plus encore !

Responsabilités
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

- Gestion de la réception; courrier, appels et accueils client
- Effectuer le soutien administratifs tels que : saisie de données, facturations, classement, rédaction de mémos, etc. ;
- Gestion des courriels
- Assurer un suivi sur la satisfaction clients (sondage clients)

Qualifications
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

- Connaître la Suite Office ;
- Anglais de niveau avancé à bilingue ;
- Excellente communication interpersonnelle ;
- Aimer le multitâche !


Sommaire
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

Tu cherches un milieu de travail dynamique où tu pourras acquérir de l'expérience en soutien administratif ?
Tu apprécies le fait d'offrir un excellent service à la clientèle et tu entre facilement en contact avec les autres ?

Tu es allumée, dynamique, proactive et tu aimes apprendre de nouvelles choses ?
Tu as une bonne gestion des priorités et ton anglais est de niveau avancé à bilingue ?

Dans ce poste de secrétaire-réceptionniste, tu seras amené à faire du multitâche.
Ce rôle te permettra de t'accomplir au quotidien en soutien administratif et au service à la clientèle.
Œuvrant dans le milieu manufacturier, cette entreprise offre un environnement de travail dynamique où les bureaux sont tout neuf.
Tu seras amené à collaborer et être souvent en contact avec tes collègues de travail.

Ce poste vous intéresse ? Contactez-nous dès maintenant!
Vous souhaitez en apprendre davantage sur le rôle?

Communiquez avec nous par téléphone au : 418.525.1191
Par courriel au :
elise.dumas-roy@randstad.ca
ivonne.carrillo@randstad.ca
myriam.lheureux@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Обзор работы

Наша организация ищет помощника по административным вопросам для работы с hullabaloo на рабочем месте, в соответствии со сложными графиками, надзором за персоналом и выполнением обязательств перед высшим руководством. Мы ищем человека, который опытен в административной поддержке и открыт для работы с разнообразной командой. 

обязанности

  • Управляйте рабочим процессом, распределяя назначения среди других регулирующих сотрудников.
  • Опыт подготовки напоминаний, сообщений и отчетов при необходимости.
  • Оказание помощи в обучении персонала физических лиц и новых сотрудников.
  • Внедряйте и проверяйте программы по согласованию с администрацией и доводите проекты до конца.
  • Отвечать на запросы и звонки для всех видов информации, связанной с организацией.
  • Ожидайте оказания помощи с другими административными обязанностями.
  • Обслуживание ПК, факсов и копировальных машин.
  • Сохраняйте запасы в офисе, проверяя запас и запрашивая различные предметы, когда это необходимо.

Требования

  • Степень бакалавра в любой дисциплине.
  • Доказанный 2-летний опыт работы в качестве административного помощника
  • Опытный в MS Office.
  • Способен анализировать и использовать методы работы на рабочем месте для повышения производительности.
  • Возможность обрабатывать несколько задач одновременно.
  • Исключительные организационные, аналитические и коммуникативные (устные и письменные) навыки
  • Ориентированность на детали и отличное решение проблем.
skills: ['Опыт подготовки напоминаний, сообщений и отчетов при необходимости.']

title: Site Administrative Assistant
description:
Considering a change? Challenge yourself with Fluor!

Fluor is one of Canada's top employers and recognized globally as a leader in the Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, and Maintenance industry. Our focus on innovation and providing cost effective technology based solutions to address our client's needs is second to none. As we look to the future, we need creative, ambitious, and innovative professionals who can help us achieve our goals.

Fluor team members are at the core of Fluor’s successes and instrumental in executing projects safely, smartly and with the highest quality. If you value teamwork, empowerment in your career and are eager to champion Fluor’s project execution, this opportunity just may be for you!

The Site Administrative Assistant reports directly to the Office Manager as part of a larger Site Administration Team. Responsible for all administrative functions which support the Construction Operations with minimum supervision.

PRIMARY JOB DUTIES/FUNCTIONS:
• Works closely with the Office Manager and Construction Management personnel handling any and all administrative responsibilities as assigned.
• Consistent utilization of commonly used computer software including excel, word, and outlook.
• Utilization of proprietary software will be required. Training to be provided. (Coreworx and Metastorm)
• Coordinates and organizes department or project meetings and celebrations (introductions, coordinating visitors, booking meeting rooms, and catering management).
• Administers and maintains highly confidential and specialized information and records.
• Exercises an in depth understanding of organizational policies, procedures, and operations.
• Composes, answers and signs correspondence as required, as well as provides support in checking voicemails, taking messages, and answering the telephone.
• Distribute, sort, read and annotate incoming mail and documents, attaching the appropriate files to facilitate necessary action.
• Schedules appointments and coordinates the interface with other company organizations, clients, and external groups.
• Establishes and maintains required department/project files.
• Research, abstracts information and supporting data in preparation for meetings, work/special projects, reports, and presentations.
• Orders and maintains supplies and equipment for departments/project.
• Studies management methods in order to improve workflow and implement cost reductions.
• Coordination of office space allocations, including phones and computers for department project personnel. This includes updating seating plan drawings.
• Calendar management: actively manages calendars, meetings, appointments, and teleconferences.
• Other duties as assigned.

Working Conditions:
• Construction site office working conditions.
• Generally favorable indoor office workspace.
• May utilize site bussing system to travel to different work locations on site.

title: Administrative and Planning Officer
description:
Administrative and Planning Officer

 

Downsview Healthcare is dedicated to rebuilding the quality of life of our patients who have been affected by injury by providing the highest quality of care possible and creating a positive experience for our patients. Our facilities are open late and on weekends to serve our patients better.

 

We help access and coordinate the most effective rehabilitation for our patients. We develop strong relationships with our patients, their families and other healthcare professionals to make sure that we understand all the issues and that we accomplish what is necessary to help you and your family.

 

Due to the ongoing expansion of our operations, we are currently looking for a hard-working and experienced Administrative and Planning Officer to join our team.

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Assist in preparation and management of operational budgets and maintain inventory and budgetary controls
  • Prepare periodic target and regional market trend analyses
  • Prepare inventory and procurement forecast reports within a timely manner
  • Review quarterly forecast and maintain proper inventory level of products and other necessary supplies at all times
  • Develop internal service control procedures and ensure all files are accounted for
  • Establish work procedures and priorities to ensure that deadlines are met, company procedures are followed, and business goals are achieved
  • Oversee and co-ordinate day-to-day office organizational procedures and evaluate and develop new practices as deemed necessary by the company

 

Requirements:

 

  • Secondary School Diploma
  • A college diploma or bachelor’s degree in administrative services, business administration, records management, or related field is an asset
  • Minimum 2 years of experience as an Administrative Planning Officer, Administrative Coordinator, or similar role
  • Strong knowledge of the English language – both written and oral
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented

 

Compensation and Conditions:

 

  • $26.00 per hour for a 35-hour work week (overtime pay will apply after 44 hours of work per week, if applicable)
  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Location of work: 1170 Sheppard Avenue West, Unit 53, Toronto, ON, M3K 2A3

 

How to apply:

 

Please apply with your resume and cover letter by email to recruiting.downsviewhealth@gmail.com. Please do not contact the office directly, as resumes and cover letters submitted will be assessed by management before interviews are scheduled.

 

All employees are given an equal opportunity in compliance with the provisions in the Ontario Human Rights Code, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, the Federal Contractors Program, and any other applicable legislation. 

 

If you are selected for an interview and require accommodation, please notify us during the recruitment process.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

Allegis Global Solutions is founded on a culture that is passionate about transforming the way the world acquires talent by delivering client-focused solutions that make a difference for businesses worldwide. From refining how you manage your contingent workforce to strengthening your employer brand to recruit top talent, our integrated talent solutions drive the business results you need. 

As an industry leader, we draw upon decades of experience to design innovative tools, products and processes. We develop competitive practices that position organizations for growth and we deliver the insight needed to succeed in today’s global marketplace.

Job Description

Job Summary

 

The Administrative Assistant directly supports the leadership team while assisting with other office administrative responsibilities, as needed. The Administrative Assistant will include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs and managing general administrative activities. The Administrative Assistant responsibilities include making travel and meeting arrangements, preparing reports and maintaining appropriate filing systems. The person in this role possesses excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to organize their work using tools, like MS Excel and office equipment.

 

Duties may include, but are not limited to:

·       The Administrative Assistant is a proficient expert in sound operational processes to ensure superior administrative support to leadership and the entire team.

·       Provides routine administrative support to include calendar management, composing and typing documents, answer direct lines for executives being supported, create spreadsheets, send emails, filing, faxing, etc.

·       Coordinate meetings, meals, conference calls, travel, etc. for leadership which entail such things as organizing attendees and picking up food.

·       Manage and reconcile expense reports.

·       Complete special projects on an as-needed basis

·       Ordering supplies, generating requisitions for funds, coordination with vendors

·       Office maintenance – liaising with building management, printer/network maintenance/issues

·       Mail/Courier management

·       Maintain office roster

·       Manage and maintain parking tags and badging

·       Other administrative duties, as assigned

Qualifications

Requirements:

·       High School Diploma or equivalent. 

·       2 or 4 year college degree preferred.

·       Minimum one year of administrative experience, to include typing skills of at least 40 wpm.

·       Proficient in Microsoft Office products, including Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook

·       Excellent verbal / written communication skills.

·       Must be highly-organized and detail-oriented

·       Ability to multi-task and interact effectively in a team environment.

·       Consistently displays high character and a strong work ethic

·       Criminal background check required



Additional Information

As a workplace, we focus on relationships – with each other, our clients and our candidates - in fact serving others is one of our core values. We support open communication and recognize that giving constructive criticism can be even harder than receiving it. We appreciate the fearless and the passionate, who force us to be better. Everything we do sits on a pillar of diversity - diverse perspectives, backgrounds and ideas drive innovation and make us successful.

See what it’s like to work at AGS by searching #LifeAtAGS on any social network.

 

AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to disability, please call 844-604-7059

title: Office Coordinator (FT)
description:
Versatile, Resourceful, Kind, Creative OFFICE COORDINATOR Wanted

The head office of an established Property Management company seeks a full-time Office Coordinator with the following skills and experience:
  • Accounts payable
  • Accounts receivables
  • Human resources (payroll, recruitment, etc.)
  • Must have a vehicle and be willing to travel to various housing communities throughout
    the GTA (travel allowance provided) 
  • General office administration (filling, correspondence, etc.)
If you are an agreeable person who easily smiles, works hard, sincerely enjoys helping people and wants to establish yourself in the very secure sector of property management please forward your resume today. Immediate opening. 




    About Precision Property Management:

    http://www.ppmgmt.ca

title: Coordonnateur(trice) Administratif(ve)
description:
Vous êtes le pilier de votre réseau. La personne qui rassemble, qui organise, qui prend en charge. Vous avez à cœur d’apporter une contribution concrète dans la vie des gens.

La Fondation du rein a besoin de vous! Nous vous proposons un rôle clé au sein de notre organisation en tant que coordonnateur(trice) - Administration, finances et service àa la clientèle.

Relevant du directeur(trice) - Engagement et relations avec la communauté, vous serez responsable :

  • De gérer les demandes clients (donateurs) et d’optimiser, avec notre partenaire, les opérations du programme Auto-Rein;
  • De coordonner la gestion financière de la Division Québec selon le calendrier établi (réception des dons et paiement des factures, procédures de fin d’année, production de rapports, suivi des baux et contrats);
  • De contribuer à la gestion du personnel de la Division Québec (mise à jourdes dossiers employés, planification d’activités de mobilisation);
  • D’apporter un soutien administratif à l'équipe de gestion, au Conseil d'administration de la Division et aux comités du conseil (réunions, ordres du jour, rédaction, correspondance, planification d’événements, etc.)

Nous vous offrons :

  • Une semaine de travail de 35 heures;
  • Une politique de télétravail flexible;
  • Des assurances collectives incluant l’assurance vie;
  • Un REER avec participation de l’employeur;
  • Un programme d’aide aux employés et de mieux-être au travail;
  • Bientôt des bureaux neufs et modernes près d’une station de métro.

Vous êtes notre candidat(e) idéal(e) si vous possédez :

  • Un DEC en administration ou autre formation pertinente;
  • 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire;
  • Une connaissance de la suite MS Office;
  • Bilinguisme français-anglais;
  • Un bon sens de l’organisation et de la planification;
  • Le souci du détail.
