title: Administrative Coordinator/Program Coordinator
description:
Position: Administrative Coordinator What does an Administrative Coordinator with Paul Davis do? 
  • Fields calls from customers and team members and builds rapport
  • Participates in minor accounting tasks.
  • Sets up files and assists with opening up required software applications.
  • Multi-tasks continually.
  • Problem solves and helps people find solutions
  • Improves the community by serving others
  • Learns new things about construction and building homes
  • Has fun and is part of a growing business
  • Ensure compliance with standards and regulations utilizing internal office systems
 Why The Team Needs You? 

Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We are a fast-paced, progressive company with a hands-off approach management style.  We need someone who can take charge, problem solve, build relationships, and complete tasks while being a stickler for the details. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results.  Why Join The Team? 

We are an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. Built upon principles of customer service and leadership, not only living our company values to be more than just a service provider, but to restore communities.  Skills Desired of Team Member:
  • Organized, analytical administrative coordinator who likes a fast-paced environment
  • Loves talking to people and building relationships
  • Likes to problem-solve and help people find solutions
  • Enjoys completing tasks 
  • Is a stickler for the details
  • Likes math and working with numbers.
  • Can review data and deductively think through what information might be missing
  • Proactive, assertive personality
  • Likes to create and follow systems while helping others to follow them as well
  • Enjoys taking care of others
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Professional appearance and courteous manner

title: Administrative Specialist
description:
Autism Speaks Canada

Located at
Unit 400 - 2450 Victora Park Avenue , Toronto , Ontario , M2J 4A2

Requires a full timeAdministrative Specialist

22.53 per hourfor30 hours per week

title: Training Assistant - Administrative Support
description:
Primary Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Coordinate the day-to-day administration and logistics of training across multiple departments
  • Manage filing, organising and archiving of training materials and related documents
  • Schedule face-to-face and online training courses
  • Set up learners and trainers profiles in the company's learning management systems (LMS)
  • Collect proofs of training from the managers and instructors (copy of training materials, signed attendance sheets, completed questionnaires, etc.)
  • Maintain the LMS systems by recording on a daily basis all training sessions and attendance sheets
  • Maintain the employees' training records by filing all the papers into their dedicated training folders
  • Follow-up with managers to get updated training documentation
  • Answer e-mail and phone enquiries about scheduled training courses and forward e-mail and phone enquiries about other services
  • Support trainers with formatting and branding of materials and ensure the smooth running of all courses
  • Support the development of needs assessment surveys, feedback and monitoring systems
  • Provide reports for analysis of the participants for the different training programs
  • Assist HR Manager to set up courses in the LMS: updating and setting up instructions, uploading course materials and producing training materials
  • Support tailor-made training courses that have an online component, as requested
  • Assist with any other tasks required to support the HR department

Work conditions:

  • Position based in Mississauga
  • Salary: 45 K$ to 50 K$ per year depending on profile
  • Day shift 8 am to 5 pm
  • Working Monday to Friday
  • Permanent position, 40 hours per week
  • This is an administrative position, requiring an extensive volume of data entry and filing

Keyword: administrative assistant
Required Experience:
  • Strong computer skills: typing documents, using online learning platform, scanning files, editing PowerPoints, etc.
  • Prior experience as administrative assistant or secretary is required
  • Completed Education in Human Resources field is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills in English both written and verbal
  • Authorized to work in Canada for any employer
  • Available to work physically from the office 4 days per week (1 day can be worked from home)
  • Full benefits: group health coverage, pension plan with employer's matching, paid sick days

ABOUT US:

AMMEGA is a global leader in product quality and service excellence for PTFE, Lightweight Conveyor Belts, Power Transmission Belts, and Rubber Hose products. Our core mission is to fully enable the most dedicated, knowledgeable and creative team in the industry so that we remain the leading innovator in belting.
We cultivate internal talents, tradition of fabrication, and technical expertise to excel in management performance and operational efficiency in order to deliver enduring value to our customers.
Explore our websites to get more information about our company & brands:

https://www.ammega.com/brands/

https://www.greenbelting.com/

https://www.ammega.com/about-us/global-footprint/

https://www.ammeraalbeltech.com/en-CA/

AMMEGA. We make your business move.

AMMEGA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally protected factors. We foster an inclusive and accessible environment and are committed to providing support to applicants and employees with disabilities.

title: Office Administrator (Part-Time)
description:
Overview:

Location: Halifax, NS

Department: Facilities

Start date: ASAP

 

Hybrid work: Employees work in a hybrid model balancing collaboration in our office and remote work.

 

Find a job that lets your imagination run wild!

WildBrain is made up of a team of innovators and creators who bring industry-leading kidsâ€™ content and brands to families globally. We inspire imagination, put creativity first, and believe in the power of storytelling. We are constantly connecting the powers of our global team, making WildBrain a collaborative, openminded and passionate environment to work in.

To work at WildBrain means you get to create stories that lets imaginations run wild. Join our team today to become part of the story!

 

About the Role

Reporting to the Director, Facilities, the Office Administrator (Part-time; 20-hrs per week) will oversee the daily operations for our Halifax office to ensure it is running smoothly and will be the first point of contact and support to the team in Halifax.  

Responsibilities:
  • Act as first point of contact for the office, greeting internal and external stakeholders, managing and routing phone calls and correspondence (e-mail, letters etc.)
  • Responsible for coordinating, tracking, and receiving of all incoming and outgoing mail and deliveries
  • Front line administrator for office security (e.g., programming cards for new employees internally and scheduling office access, when needed)
  • Coordinate any necessary cleaning and building maintenance required through the landlord and various contractors/vendors
  • Monitor office supply inventory, which includes stationery, printing supplies etc., and arranging for paper shredding service as needed
  • Responsible for monitoring and ordering supplies for the kitchen, which includes the coffee machine and water cooler delivery
  • General upkeep and ensuring office equipment including copiers are maintained, cleaned and in good working order and stocked with supplies including copiers and coffee machine
  • Assist with printing, scanning, and filing of documents as requested
  • Review and identify areas of opportunity regarding the overall office layout and cubicle furniture
  • Provide overall admin support, as needed, to the team in the Halifax office
Qualifications:
  • Experience as an office administrator, receptionist, or related role
  • Strong customer service, communication (written and verbal) and organizational skills
  • Ability to multitask, be flexible and adaptable
  • Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Self-motivated, takes initiative and ability to work with minimum supervision
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, MS Word, MS Excel, PowerPoint)

What We Offer

Working at WildBrain is more than a job â€” itâ€™s the opportunity to join forces with extraordinary, insightful and imaginative people who will recognize your talents and encourage your professional growth and development in a work environment that promotes creativity and individuality. We offer competitive family-focused benefits, we invest in our people and their future with generous RRSP matching, plus bonus time-off, because you deserve it!

 

Our commitment

Diversity and Inclusion are in our DNA. As a global leader in kids and family entertainment, we strive to reflect and honour the diversity of our audiences around the world. We believe that creating diverse and inclusive content & brands begins with fostering a culture of belonging at WildBrain. To us, a culture of belonging is one where we celebrate and welcome the diversity of all employees, stakeholders, and external partners and strive to create an environment where every individual feels valued, respected, and brings their authentic self to work.

 

We demonstrate our commitment to this by striving to provide a supportive work environment and a corporate culture that welcomes and encourages equal opportunities for all employees. We recognize that people bring experience and talent that goes beyond the technical skills and requirements of a job. If you possess similar experience that is close to what weâ€™ve listed here, we encourage you to please still consider applying. We strongly believe that diverse experience, transferable skills, and passion are key! WildBrain accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required.

 

About WildBrain:

At WildBrain we make great content for kids and families. With approximately 13,000 half-hours of filmed entertainment in our library â€“ one of the worldâ€™s most extensive â€“ we are home to such brands as Peanuts, Teletubbies, Strawberry Shortcake, Caillou, Inspector Gadget, Johnny Test and Degrassi. Our shows are seen in more than 150 countries on over 500 telecasters and streaming platforms. WildBrainâ€™s portfolio spans all areas of the entertainment industry: WildBrain Studios, where we develop and produce hit animated and live actions series; WildBrain Television, which is composed of prominent kidsâ€™ television channels in Canada (Family Channel, Family CHRGD, Family Jr. and TÃ©lÃ©magino); home to Peanuts Worldwide; brand management to some of the worldâ€™s most-loved kids brands; celebrated global licensing and distribution teams with WildBrain CPLG, and a leading childrenâ€™s YouTube network in WildBrain Spark, one of the largest networks of kidsâ€™ channels on YouTube, with over 168 million subscribers.

 

WildBrain is headquartered in Canada with offices worldwide and trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: WILD). Visit wildbrain.com to learn more!

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (Casual) – Extendicare Michener Hill
description:
ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (Casual) – Extendicare Michener Hill

 Candidates are invited to apply for the casual position of Administrative Assistant at our Michener Hill, long-term care home in Red Deer, Alberta.

Reporting to the Office Manager, the Administrative Assistant will perform a variety of clerical duties and services focused primarily on scheduling and other payroll duties.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist with staff scheduling and other payroll duties as assigned
  • Greeting visitors, determine purpose of visit, and direct visitors to proper location as appropriate
  • Answer telephone and place outgoing calls as requested
  • Performs Accounts Payable work as assigned
  • Performs clerical work as assigned
  • Computer input as required (e.g. reports, accreditation)
  • Maintain resident database in computer system
  • Carry out all other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Organizational skills are essential
  • 1 year Community College diploma/certificate in business or related program an asset
  • Ability to operate office equipment
  • Ability to read, write and communicate effectively in English. Applicants must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and presentation
  • Proficiency in MS Word and Excel a must
  • Previous experience in providing general office support preferred

CLOSING DATE:   May 13, 2022

Interested applicants may forward their resume in confidence to the attention of:

Roxanne Stillings Office Manager, Extendicare Michener Hill

RStillings@Extendicare.com

Employment_michenerhill@extendicare.com

 

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Quality Systems Administrative Coordinator
description:
Quality Systems Administrative Coordinator

Location: 

Stratford, CA, N4Z 1H3

Job Requisition ID: 4915

 

Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.  

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Provides autonomous administrative support for a dedicated team or Manager in the organization.
  • Organizes office, assists to optimize procedures, sorts and distributes communications (i.e. .inbound/outbound correspondence, visitors, effective information flow).
  • Handles administrative requests and queries, and organizes/schedules appointments, plans meetings and takes minutes.
  • Takes over time and travel management and/or travel expenses for team members or Manager.
  • Coordinates with other departments and/or maintains relationships with external parties as involved (i.e. suppliers, customers, authorities).
  • Creates and updates records ensuring accuracy and validity of information, and assists in the preparation of qualified reports or presentations.

Your Qualifications

  • Vocationally trained
  • 1 to 3 years

OR

  • Associates degree
  • 1 to 3 years

 

Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your application.

 

 

Your contact

Schaeffler Aerospace CDN 

Erica Lynn King 

+15192766627 

 

Schaeffler Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Administrative and Mail Assistant
description:
Are you looking for a stimulating and dynamic job in the surrounding area of Halifax? Would you like to be part of a team that believes in your potential and of a great company that will help you advance in your career? This is the job for you! We are currently looking for an Administrative and Mail Assistant for one of our clients.

What is in it for you:
• 12 months contract, schedule from Monday to Friday, fulltime, daytime
• Salary of 15,11$/h
• Dynamic and professional environment

A day in the life of an Administrative and Mail Assistant:
• Ensure customer issues and escalations are resolved or further escalated as appropriate
• Conduct quality checks on own work to ensure accuracy and required output is to standards
• Perform basic digital print production and adhere to all safety procedures
• Perform backfill duties for absent coworkers and other duties as assigned by Manager Office
• Prepare charge-back reporting for postage, courier, etc.
• Use of software to update or maintain mailing addresses.
• Provide mailing address clean-up (may include use of mail cleansing software)
• Set up and operate high level mail equipment in an automated high speed / high volume environment
• Use of specialized equipment for material handling (e.g., Forklift certified)
• Liaison with clients advising on available services and negotiation of turnaround times
• Clean and maintain finishing equipment to ensure optimal use
• Perform colour calibration using densitometers and perform colour adjustments
• Record meter reads, process production forms and maintain records
• Carry out regular preventative maintenance checks on client fleet of machines
• Carry out first level issue resolution utilizing basic product and/or technical skills, escalating in accordance with agreed procedures for next level maintenance and technical support on client fleet equipment
• Records Management +B5Index, store, retrieve electronic documents in a mass storage system
• Convert digital files to formats such as PDF, TIFF, PostScript, XML, etc. for import into document repository and management systems
• Manage document storage system to meet client`s archiving requirements
• Catalogue electronic documents to media such as CDROM, disk or tap and distribute as required
• Professionally greet and direct visitors adhering to security / badge requirements
• Complete and maintain all logs and reports including month-end reports
• Input Meridian (billing system) requisitions
• Order and replenish consumables, forms inventory and other supplies items as required.
• Organize business travel (flights, hotels, rental cars) for Xerox customers
• Support site continuous improvement programs including 5S, a site efficiency methodology

What you need to succeed:
• High School Diploma or equivalent certification
• Health and safety certification (WHMIS)
• 1 year of experience in customer facing, customer service role
• Proven ability to work under pressure handling multiple tasks to ensure timely completion
• Able to communicate effectively, to read, to write, and to follow basic English instructions
• Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds
• Basic math (add, multiply, divide) and computer skills (keyboard, mouse functions
• Possess a valid driver’s license (as required)
• Effective organizational and mechanical troubleshooting/repair skills

Why Recruit Action?
We give you the opportunity to accelerate your career. Recrute Action provides recruitment services through quality support and a personalized approach to job seekers and businesses. Thank you for your interest in this position. Only qualified candidates who match hiring criteria will be contacted.



Administrative and Mail Assistant

title: Administrative Assistant, #4032
description:
Administrative Assistant, Job ID #4032

ISTEM â€“ Job Search Workshop (JSW)

Full-time / One year contract with possibility of renewal / Starting ASAP / Toronto North

Program Overview
Funded by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) as part of ISTEM, the Job Search Workshop program provides information, orientation and counselling to newcomers at the initial stages of their job search in Canada. The Workshops offer essential information on Canadian labour market, technical, transferrable and soft skills as well as interview, networking and self-marketing techniques to facilitate newcomer integration into the Canadian workplace and society. 

The individual in this position will be responsible for providing administrative services and will work as part of a team to support the operation of the Job Search Workshop (JSW) program.

Weâ€™re looking for someone who will: 

  • Provide program information to potential clients and referral sources; screen clients for eligibility 
  • Greet and direct clients to JSW and other programs 
  • Follow-up on and track client progress throughout the program and post-completion; maintain relevant participant records 
  • Enter and maintain data into agency-used systems; compile and verify data for reporting as required by management
  • Create and maintain hard copies of client files, ensuring all documentation is collected and filed
  • Conduct client registration for workshops, including attendance monitoring and follow up
  • Prepare workshop materials and set up equipment for presentations
  • Assist with organizing events, outreach activities, etc.
  • Share reception duties and provide customer service to all clients, employers and visitors; evening coverage as needed
  • Support other programs and conduct data entry across the Newcomer division; assist staff with all administrative related duties 
  • Provide clerical support, editing and formatting reports, word processing of correspondence, reports and other materials
  • Travel to itinerant locations

Flexible hours / evenings / weekends may be required for this position.
 
Minimum Qualifications & Experience:

  • High school diploma
  • 2 years of administrative experience
  • Customer service oriented
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Effective interpersonal skills; ability to assist a wide range of individuals with different cultural backgrounds and vocational barriers 
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team 
  • Effective organization and time management skills; ability to work well under pressure and prioritize competing deadlines
  • Computer literate; the ability to learn systems used by the agency (e.g. SalesForce, ICARE)
  • A clear Police Vulnerable Sector check is required for this position

Our ideal candidate will also have:

  • Knowledge of a second language to work with the communities we serve 

 
Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resume & covering letter here. 
JVS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. If you require accommodation in order to submit your application, please contact JVS directly. 
Our agency embraces diversity and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest in our agency, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant I (CSJ - Summer Student) (TPT 0.9)
description:
What youth participants are eligible?

To be eligible, youth must:

  • be between 15 and 30 years of age at the beginning of the employment period*;
  • be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment**
  • have a valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and be legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial or territorial legislation and regulations

Requisition Details:

Employment Status: Students (Paid)
Program Name: Home Support
Number of Hours Bi-Weekly: 70
Work Schedule: Days
Anticipated End Date: 08/05/2022
On Call: No

Job Summary:

The Administrative Assistant I is responsible for administrative support functions to assist VON in providing quality service to the public. The position acts as a resource for the site management team and other team members in the office by collecting and responding to incoming correspondence, creating and formatting documents, and other related job functions.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responds to any general inquiries including answering telephone calls and ensuring staff, volunteers, clients and visitors are greeted and directed to the appropriate resource in a friendly courteous manner.
  • Responds to messages from the answering service as required.
  • Greets and directs all in-office visitors and in-coming calls.
  • Ensures incoming and outgoing correspondence is distributed accordingly and in a timely manner.
  • Responsible for the mail pick-up and drop off.
  • Answers general inquiries regarding the VON organization with informed and satisfactory responses.
  • Distributes departmental mail, including mail outs, postal meter, and internal departmental mail.
  • Schedules and organizes meetings and appointments as requested.
  • Prepares all general correspondences, memos, forms, minutes, brochures, invitations, staff lists, reports and other documents as directed.
  • Assists in the production of newsletters (including collection of material, typing/formatting and photocopying/printing) and in standardizing processes and forms.
  • Manages filing systems for all client, personnel and general files, ensuring accuracy, security and confidentiality.
  • Updates policies/procedures and manuals as required.
  • Inputs relevant information and produce reports, statistics and data as directed for the efficient operation of the function.
  • Orders supplies, receives and maintains an inventory of required supplies.
  • Collaborates with teams for to organize logistics for special projects, events and seminars.
  • Receives and receipts donation, and bill payments.
  • Prepares bank deposits. 
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

External and Internal Relationships:

  • Communicates regularly and follow up with employees, managers and corporate services staff.

Education, Designations and Experience:

  • Post-secondary education in office administration, office information technology or a related field or related relevant experience
  • Proficiency in Windows OS and MS Office Suite programs
  • Experience with scheduling software and Cognos is considered an asset
  • Experience with a unionized environment is considered an asset.

Skill Requirements:

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills with an ability to prioritize and multi-task
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Able to work both independently and within a team
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times

Other:

  • Criminal records and vulnerable sector check  
  • The use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) may be required

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: fast-paced environment; attention to detail; lift and carry using appropriate lifting techniques; walk, sit, stand, and climb stairs; grip and fine hand movements.

VON Canada is committed to meeting the needs of persons with disabilities and to providing accessibility accommodations for candidates who require them. If you are in need of accessibility support, please visit our website at http://www.von.ca/en/accessibility for further details.

title: Administrative Coordinator/Program Coordinator
description:
Position: Administrative Coordinator/Program Coordinator What does an Administrative Coordinator with Paul Davis do? 
  • Fields calls from customers and team members and builds rapport
  • Oversees office administrative operations
  • Creates office systems 
  • Problem solves and helps people find solutions
  • Improves the community by serving others
  • Learns new things about construction and building homes
  • Has fun and is part of a growing business
  • Ensure compliance with standards and regulations utilizing internal office systems
 Why The Team Needs You? Serving others in their time of need is not easy. We are a fast-paced, progressive company with a hands-off approach management style.  We need someone who can take charge, problem solve, build relationships, and complete tasks while being a stickler for the details. We also want a fun personality that enjoys getting results.  Why Join The Team? We are an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and commercial properties throughout the United States and Canada. Built upon principles of customer service and leadership, not only living our company values to be more than just a service provider, but to restore communities.  Skills Desired of Team Member:
  • Organized, analytical administrative coordinator who likes a fast-paced environment
  • Loves talking to people and building relationships
  • Likes to problem-solve and help people find solutions
  • Enjoys completing tasks 
  • Is a stickler for the details
  • Likes math (geometry) and working with numbers and measurements
  • Can review data and deductively think through what information might be missing
  • Proactive, assertive personality
  • Likes to create and follow systems while helping others to follow them as well
  • Enjoys taking care of others
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Professional appearance and courteous manner

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are looking for a Permanent, Full Time Administrative Assistant to join our team in La Ronge office. It is a great opportunity for individual who wants to be part of a collegial team that promotes a collaborative and respectful working environment. Our staff at our Northern office besides entitlement of 6 weeks off per annum and 13 Statutory Holidays, in addition to only applicable to the Northern office earns additional week of vacation.

Key Responsibilities

Reporting to the Legal Director, some of the key responsibilities of the Administrative Assistant are:

  • Type and review letters, documents and other materials from instructions or precedents
  • Answer the phone, respond to inquiries and relay messages
  • Maintain strict client confidentiality and adhere to government privacy legislation
  • Provide information to the public and to clients
  • Set appointments for professional staff, assess and refer unusual situations to supervisor
  • Maintain client files, filing systems and electronic client database
  • Performdata entry and maintain statistical records
  • Provide other clerical functions, including receiving and sending mail

Position Requirements

  • High school diploma with one-year of relevant post-secondary education or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Able to use a database, operate computers and is skilled in using Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word and Excel)
  • Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated client service focus
  • General knowledge of the practice of law is considered an asset

title: Inside Sales Rep & Administrative Assistant - Brandon, MB
description:
Inside Sales / Administrative Assistant

Cascadia Metals is seeking an experienced and motivated Inside Sales & Administrative Assistantto join our growing team. This role will be a permanent, full-time position and is located at our Brandon, Manitoba branch.

Who We Are?

At Cascadia Metals, we have never wavered from the original drive that has founded our business. Our success is rooted from the continued commitment of our owners and can be seen through the rapid growth of our organization. We invest not only in land and machinery, but also in our people...our employees. Still strong and unrelenting, we will continue to become more efficient and progressive in our thoughts moving forward. Through our optimistic view of the future, we believe there will always be room for creative, innovative distribution in the future.

Who We're Looking for?

We are looking for a driven team member, who shares our champion mindset and values. This role includes opportunities for the successful candidate to continue to learn and expand their skill set. This position will involve, customer service and sales support related functions and administrative duties as assigned.

As an Inside Sales & Administrative Assistant, you will assume the duty of an Inside Sales associate which includes but is not limited to answering customer calls, cold calling potential customers, quoting, and general customer support. Also, clerical and administrative support to optimize workflow procedures in the office. You will assist the Branch Manager by supporting them with any tasks or duties they may require you to complete.

Responsibilities:

  • Good instincts for sales and building relationships with customers
  • Managing system traceability for MTR's
  • Backup reception, answer phone calls and redirect them when necessary
  • Proficiency in MS Office particularly: Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Outgoing, friendly personality, team player
  • Assist the Branch Manager where required
  • Maintain /update existing spreadsheets and current filing system for the general office
  • Data entry, filing, copying
  • Other duties as assigned

Skills & Responsibilities:

  • Familiarity with office organization and environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, time management skills, Effective use of technology
  • Work independently and as a team player with strong self-motivation
  • Strong sense of confidentiality, Integrity and professionalism
  • Superior work ethic with attention to detail, diligent, organized, and resourceful

Why Work for Us?

We believe in work that stays at work by offering our employees a work-life balance along with exceptional benefits.

  • Company paid benefits package, including Extended Medical, Dental, Life Insurance and Vision
  • 2 Weeks vacation, and up to 6 personal paid days off
  • Taxable Spending Account
  • 4% RRSP matching program after 3 months
  • the proper equipment to allow you to succeed in your job
  • an opportunity to grow with a progressive company

While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.

If you are a self-motivated team player with a positive attitude, please submit your cover letter and resume in confidence. Only those who qualify will be contacted for interviews. No walk ins or phone calls

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Are you detail oriented and organized? Do you enjoy working around people, multi-tasking and can handle distractions easily? We have temporary opening for an Administrative Assistant to cover a maternity leave for 12 - 18 months at our Redvers location. Main responsibilities include greeting customers, answering phones, and general day to day office duties. Basic Accounts Payable duties may be assigned. Even though this opportunity is temporary, there may be opportunity for permanent employment.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Minimum of 2 years solid administrative assistant experience
  • Ability to use standard applications and equipment such as Office 365, computers, printers, and copiers.
  • Understanding of accounting basics such as debits, credits, accounts receivables and payables an asset but not required
  • High School diploma and a business or office diploma an asset.
  • Valid Saskatchewan Driver's license required.

Please apply online only.

Since 1959, Nelson Motors & Equipment has been a growing, family-owned, John Deere dealership spanning 5 locations in southeast Saskatchewan. We believe in taking care of our people by offering career development, competitive compensation, matched pension, and comprehensive benefits package. We pride ourselves on bridging our core family values to our customers through our great people.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings is not only is the worldâ€™s largest car rental operator, but also an industry leader in mobility technology as well as one of the top global travel companies, ranking ahead of many airlines and most cruise lines, hotels, tour operators and online travel agencies. And no matter what transportation challenges our customers face, we have an innovative  solution.

Enterprise Holdings operates the Enterprise Rent-A-Car, National Car Rental and Alamo Rent A Car brands via more than 10,000 fully staffed neighborhood and airport offices in 100 countries and territories. Every year, these branch offices collectively handle more than 70 million consumer transactions worldwide and spend millions of dollars with local dealerships and vendors.

We are excited to announce an opening for an Administrative Assistant position based out of our British Columbia Headquarters in Surrey, BC. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is extremely organized, detail-oriented, and highly cognizant of the importance of maintaining confidentiality.

The Administrative Assistant will provide clerical and administrative support for  the General Manager and Group Rental Manager (file, mail distribution, data entry, copy tasks and basic business correspondence).

 

This is a full time position working Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm.

 

Location: 13160 88 AVE SURREY, BC V3W 3K3

 

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities:

  • Preparation/organization of miscellaneous meetings and Group events
  • Arrange lodging, air, ground transportation for Management and Department Personnel as needed for various meetings  
  • Event  planning and vendor negotiations for meetings and events  
  • Handling of customer  and account inquiries
  • Preparation of daily, weekly, and monthly reports & analysis
  • Office management and supply ordering and distribution
  • Maintain the filing system in an accurate, systematic and timely manner
  • Maintain confidentiality and security of all activities and records
  • General administrative duties and   various miscellaneous tasks
Qualifications:

Qualifications:

  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • 2-year College Diploma or 4-year Bachelorâ€™s Degree required
  • Must have Advanced Level of Proficiency with Excel, Word, PowerPoint and  Outlook
  • Must have 1 year of administrative experience
  • Must have 1 year of customer service experience
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI)  in past 5 years
  • Must have a valid BC class 5 driver's license with no more than two chargeable moving violations or accidents within the last three years.  

Qualified Candidates must also possess the following knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Effective verbal and interpersonal communication skills
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Dependable and self-motivated
  • Ability to prioritize, follow-up, multi-task and meet assigned deadlines
  • Comfortable working independently and in a team environment

title: Administrative Assistant/Receptionist – New Brunswick
description:
POSITION TITLE:        Administrative Assistant/Receptionist – New Brunswick

DEPARTMENT:             People & Culture

REPORTS TO:               People & Culture Coordinator

DATE:                               ASAP

This important position is responsible for the provisions of general administration support of onboarding new employees and processing existing employee compliance files to stay current. This is a challenging and dynamic assignment for an individual who is self-motivated, has the ability to manage a variety of assignments and is seeking career advancement opportunity.

Why Choose Paladin

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Co-Pay Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

Job Description

  • Reception coverage
  • Greet applicants as they enter the office
  • Answer and direct all incoming calls
  • Screen resumes and conduct telephone interviews on perspective applicants
  • Recruitment including reference checks
  • Prepare employment hire packages
  • Process of employee’s files, compliance and benefits 
  • Create employee ID’s Badges
  • Tracking of immunization & referrals
  • Maintaining electric / hard copy office records and filing systems
  • Assist office staff with administrative duties as required

Qualifications

  • Minimum 1-2 years’ experience in a similar role
  • Efficient in all MS Office applications
  • Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Significant demonstrated experience providing administrative support in a broad variety of administrative and clerical functions, including customer service and record management
  • Ability to exercise initiative and work independently
  • Bilingual (French/English) is required

Your Impact

Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!

title: Operations Administrator
description:
Operations Administrator
North American REIT
Calgary, AB


THE COMPANY
Our client, one of the largest commercial REITs in Canada. The company’s national portfolio consists of industrial, retail and office properties in both Canada and the USA.

THE ROLE
The Administrative Assistant provides proactive administrative services for the Calgary Operations team. The services provided range from sourcing and stocking supplies, drafting and maintaining communication and information on the Operations website.  In addition, you will monitor building supplies and assist the Operations Manager with maintaining inventory, communicate on-call schedule to the Operations and Property Management teams.

WHAT YOUR DAY LOOKS LIKE
  • Track approved Building Operator time-off and communicate to the Operations & Property Management team, adjusting as required.
  • Track approved overtime and submit to Payroll bi-weekly.
  • Run monthly reports to analyze and review data on average response times and service outliers.
  • Maintain and update tenant information.
  • Dispatch Operators; track and close work orders through Angus.  
  • Coordinate monthly Operations team meeting logistics (agenda, book room, take minutes).
  • Participate in occupational health and safety committee and communicate action items/decisions back to the Operations team.
  • Track all building service contracts.
WHAT TO DO NOW

If you believe this position could be the perfect fit for you please submit your resume below. We thank all applicants, however, only those who meet the requirements of the position above will be contacted.

title: Coordonnateur administratif - Granby - À partir de 17$/h
description:
Est-ce que tu es capable de:

  • Faire vivre la magie sur le camp
  • Gérer les dossiers administratifs;
  • Donner les premiers soins;
  • Gérer les demandes des clients;

 

Si tu as répondu oui, YOPI t’offre le job de l’été!

  • Congé soirs et fins de semaine;
  • Un bel esprit d’équipe;
  • Jusqu’à 5000 $ en salaire pour l’été;
  • Formations payées;
  • Un bel environnement de travail;

Un plus pour toi si tu as de l’expérience en:

  • Camp de jour;
  • Gestion de personnel;

Conditions de travail :

  • Du lundi au vendredi;

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
WESCO is seeking an Administrative Assistant. In this role, you will provide administrative support in a variety of functions to an individual, team, department or another group in an organization (vs. an entire office). You will collect, review and analyze data and prepares reports, charts, budgets, and other presentation materials. You will respond to or routes routine inquiries from external or internal sources with own correspondence or other messaging. You will schedule and coordinate meetings, travel, and other group activities. You may be responsible for creating reports and distributing on a regular schedule. In addition, you may handle confidential and sensitive material and make some independent decisions regarding planning, organizing, and scheduling work.


Responsibilities:


+ Compiles and analyzes basic information for inclusion in reports or presentation materials, prepares charts, graphs, or tables as necessary.

+ Receives and responds to routine correspondence following established procedures not requiring management review.

+ Assists in the performance of general administrative procedures, including data entry, equipment identification, equipment service, and preventive maintenance.

+ Contributes to proper resource utilization, cost containment, procedural compliance, and customer service levels.


Qualifications: :


+ 2 years required, 3 years preferred of administrative support preferably in similar industry.

+ Principles and processes for providing customer and personal services, including customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, evaluating customer satisfaction.

+ Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, transcription, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology.

+ Ability to explain and teach appropriate policies, procedures and practices. In the purchasing role, negotiating with suppliers on discounts and payment terms and influencing their involvement in problem resolution.

+ Strong verbal and written communication skills.

+ Strong computer skills.

+ Awareness of products, suppliers and trade discounts related to procurement activities is preferred.

+ Strong comprehension of WESCO systems, policies and procedures concerning purchasing, inventory, quality and administration is preferred.


_WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination._

title: Adminstrative Assistant (Hybrid)
description:
Company Description

Do you want to be part of our successful business supporting our Managing Director for Turner & Townsend in Canada?  We are hiring a forward thinking and energetic  Administrative Assistant to join our Cost Management team.

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver.  As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

Who are you?

You are an Administrative Assistant or Team Assistant with 3-5 years post-graduate experience looking for the next step or are currently undertaking a similar role in a similar environment.

Job Description

  • Produce all Toronto Cost Management  boiler and fee letters including coordination with central Business Generation team as necessary
  • Be accountable for the maintenance of case studies, client CV’s, best practice methodologies, etc. for the Toronto Cost Management team including interface with central Business Generation team as necessary
  • Coordination of bespoke proposals with central BG team
  • Manage Contact & Marketing Database entries on behalf of the team
  •  Assist in Risk Management (RM) contract uploads for the team
  • Assist in Commission Execution Plan (CEP) online management 
  •  Assist in creation of invoicing: note: responsibility for approval of invoicing is to remain with the Commission Managers and Directors
  • Creation of new client codes for creation of new client with Finance Management System (FMS)
  • Coordination of Team events and meetings
  • Any other ad-hoc duties
Qualifications

  • Knowledge of Office Administrator responsibilities, systems and procedures
  • Proficiency in MS Office (MS Word, PowerPoint, Acrobat , Excel, Outlook, Visio)
  • Hands on experience with office equipment
  • Proficient in communication platforms  Skype for Business, Zoom
  • Maintain and ensure strict confidentiality. High professional conduct, handling confidential matters with the utmost discretion and having a diplomatic approach to resolving issues are requirements at all times
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task, think quickly and prioritize work
  • Attention to detail and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational and planning skills in a fast-paced environment
  • A creative mind with an ability to suggest improvements


Additional Information

Turner & Townsend is a leading independent professional services company specializing in program management, project management, cost management and consulting across the property, infrastructure and natural resources sectors. With 108 offices in 45 countries, we draw on our extensive global and industry experience to manage risk while maximizing value and performance during the construction and operation of our clients’ assets. We are an Equal opportunity employer who will ensure accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities upon request

Turner & Townsend does not accept any speculative or unsolicited CV’s that have been sent to our internal recruitment team or hiring managers from agencies outside of our preferred supplier list. Any speculative or unsolicited CV’s will be treated as a direct application.

title: Office Coordinator
description:
Company Description

This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening

The Moving Picture Company (MPC) is a global creative studio with a single goal: to create experiences that move people. With decades of storytelling experience, we are perpetually pushing the limits of what is technologically and artistically possible to tell visually stunning stories.

MPC continues to lead in an ever-evolving industry, building authentic and long-lasting connections with audiences across all channels.

Job Description

The Office Coordinator is responsible for supporting the Office Manager to ensure that the facility is kept in efficient running order on a daily basis.

The Office Coordinator will have strong administrative skills, a pride in the quality of their work and will have the drive and determination to get things done.

The Office Coordinator will work closely with our Runners and the Facilities Team, and reporting to the Office Manager.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate and monitor all office supplies, kitchen supplies, staff meals and office flowers
  • Ensure that the Runners understand/complete their duties
  • Update all documents (including training manuals) for Runners
  • Maintain petty cash and credit card expense reports
  • Coordinate company sponsored classes, lunchtime production, after hours classes and all other on-site special events and updating company calendar
  • Coordinate any requested video conference/client meetings
  • Coordinate and purchase all branded items  
  • Managing the facility and taking part in regular Facilities walk-about to check on any new issues
  • Support and backup for calendar/expenses management
  • Ad hoc tasks as requested by the Office Manager
  • Translation of documents and general admin support to Management.
  • Keeping track and ordering of all inventory
Qualifications

  • A minimum of 2 years of admin/coordination experience in a professional environment
  • Demonstrable organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to build and maintain excellent working relationships
  • Ability to problem solve and communicate effectively in a high pressured working environment
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office/Excel/Outlook


Additional Information

Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.

TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law

description:

This role is based in office in Burnaby, BC.

About the role:

  • Arranging meetings, appointments & logistics
  • Assemble, collate, edit and format a variety of technical and administrative materials
  • Managing calendars

title: Proposal Specialist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Long View. A career that helps you get more out of life. 

A Long View career helps you get more out of life. We don’t just say it, we prove it. Every day. We’re proud of our reputation as one of North America’s most dynamic IT providers — and we’re even prouder of our culture that allows our people to live life to its fullest. At Long View, we create an environment of collaboration and support, of innovation and enthusiasm, of inclusion and belonging. As a member of the Long View team, you’ll see how our company’s core pillars — Integrity, Competence, Value, and Fun — resonate through the workplace. And in a recent survey, 92% of Long View team members rated Long View as a good or great place to work!

 Are you passionate about achieving results and working for a company that values teamwork?

We are looking for a dedicated, driven and business-oriented Senior Proposal Specialist for our Head Office located in Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver or Toronto to work closely with the Sales Team and technical experts to create winning proposals, which will range in length from a few pages to hundreds of pages!




Want to learn more about our culture and life at Long View? Check us out on LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram!

Long View’s mission of building the best and most sustainable team-driven organization requires dedicated and ambitious people. Through employee resource groups, impactful and effective conversations, townhalls and various company-wide training, including how to reduce unconscious bias, we are fostering an inclusive environment. We are committed to taking consistent, positive and lifelong action to be a diverse and equitable workplace because we know that the most effective companies are made up of people with varied identities, experiences and backgrounds.

Long View is an equal opportunity employer. If you have any accommodation requests for your interview or the role, please let your friendly Recruiter know.</section>

title: Office Administrator
description:
Hill+Knowlton Strategies, the nation’s leading strategic communications consultancy, is looking for a highly organized, professional, and client service-oriented Office Administrator to provide administrative services and support for our various groups in the Ottawa office. The successful applicant will report to the Office Services Manager and serve as a key member of the Office Services team.

The Office Administrator will be a member of our Joint Health and Safety Committee and act as a back-up to fire wardens, helping with office evacuation procedures for fire drills, or in the event of an emergency. 

We are looking for not only incredible talent, but also a great attitude, energy, and passion for the H+K brand. Our people bring their individualism and creativity to work every day and love what they do.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
This job description does not imply that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee in this capacity. They will be expected to perform other related duties as required. 

  • Assist business and client account team leaders with daily administrative duties involving a variety of tasks that include managing calendars of appointments; completing expense reports; processing invoices; composing and preparing correspondence; arranging travel plans, itineraries, and agendas, and compiling documents for meetings.
  • Draft reports, presentations, charts with adherence to the company’s brand guidelines; prepare and coordinate oral and written communication with internal and external parties at all levels.
  • Support the preparation of written materials such as agendas, activity reports, stakeholder maps, briefing documents, presentations, submissions, and leave-behinds.  
  • Working with teams to plan and execute virtual and in-person events and meetings.
  • Managing and updating databases as required, organizing, and maintaining files.
  • Monitoring, interpreting, and reporting on government activities – including the political, parliamentary, legislative, and regulatory landscapes.
  • Assist with drafting agreements and liaise with internal departments for review and to ensure compliance. 
Requirements  
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience as an Administrative Assistant.
  • Bilingualism (English and French).
  • Client service business experience is considered an asset.
  • Interest in government policy, politics, and communications is an asset.
  • Excellent document and presentation development, formatting, and production skills (using MS Office PowerPoint, Excel, , etc.).
  • Ability to work proactively, taking ownership of areas of responsibility.
  • Excellent attention and commitment to accuracy, detail, and quality.
  • Possess strong time management skills, to meet often tight deadlines.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and work independently with little supervision.
  • Team player with a creative flair and a positive, energetic attitude, with a professional approach.
  • Highly organized problem-solver.
  • Proven ability to practice discretion and deal with difficult personalities in a tactful and effective manner.
  • An interest in internal communications and being engaged in workplace culture.
  • Working hours in the office are generally 8:30 – 5:00; however, flexibility is sometimes required.
  • This role operates within a shared, open office environment with regular interruptions. 
Asset Qualifications
  • Joint Health and Safety Committee member training.
  • First Aid Training and Certification.

 What’s in it for you?

  • Full health benefits package—including health paid time off, schedule flexibility, fitness reimbursement, and more.
  • A career working with and influencing bold, creative teams and client accounts.
  • A passionate, smart, fun, and creative office culture.
  • Strong leadership with a focus on entrepreneurial thinking, training, and mentoring to help you grow, expand your skills, and become your professional best.

Accommodation Statement:
Hill+Knowlton Strategies welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. If as a qualified job applicant, you wish to make a request, please provide a cover letter, when applying to this position. We will consult with you and provide reasonable accommodations according to your accessibility needs.

Background Check Statement:
The successful candidate to this role may be asked to complete a background screen, which may include criminal, credit, employment, educational checks. All offers of employment are conditional on the receipt of satisfactory results of any applicable check 

Covid-19 Statement:
Hill+Knowlton Strategies is committed to the safety and well-being of all our employees; therefore, we require employees, contractors, and business partners to be fully vaccinated with relevant dose(s) of a Health Canada approved vaccine. Exemptions will only be granted for medical reasons or on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.  

Diversity & Inclusivity Statement:
Hill+Knowlton Strategies provides services in one of the most diverse countries in the world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of their race, creed, color, age, religion, sex, gender expression and presentation, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military status, socioeconomic status, national origin, or ancestry. 

At Hill+Knowlton Strategies, we believe the work we do together should empower everyone impacted to thrive—including and especially those from underrepresented groups. Through our national Diversity, Equity + Inclusion Strategy, we are committed to addressing bias and systemic racism in our industry; see diversity as an asset to our organization and communities; and strive to build a workforce that reflects the society in which we work. We commit to promoting better understanding and appreciation of our human diversity; a commitment best realized through our individual and collective effort. Together, we’re building an environment where we embrace the whole of each person; where everyone is treated with humanity and acts with empathy; and where everybody who works with us has what they need to thrive. 

Working in Canada:
Unless otherwise stated, applications are only being accepted from candidates who are legally entitled to work in Canada, without sponsorship. 

Message to Agencies:
Hill+Knowlton Strategies does not accept unsolicited referrals from any source other than direct from candidates. Unsolicited referrals will be deemed gratuitous, and will not be obligated or bound in any way to pay any fee if a candidate referred by a third-party source is subsequently hired.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

 

Bartlett Tree Experts is looking for an Administrative Assistant to join our team. We are looking for an individual who understands the importance and value of our clients and recognizes the significance of team support!

 

Bartlett Tree Experts is a 100+-year-old scientific tree and shrub care company with over 130 offices in the United States, Canada, Great Britain, and Ireland. Built on family values and the pursuit of scientific tree care, we are proud of the quality of our work, level of service, award-winning safety record, and, most of all, our people. With services including pruning, insect and disease management, soil care and fertilization, and cabling and bracing, we strive to keep trees healthy and beautiful. We believe that every tree deserves a champion and are always looking for new champions to join the team!

 

Benefits:

 

We offer competitive compensation, as well as:

  • A safety-first culture and professional  workplace
  • Advancement opportunities - we promote from within

  • Life, LTD, ADD, medical and dental

  • RPP Plan, Healthcare spending account, and paid vacation and holidays

  • Bonus program
  • Access to training, continuing education programs, and a variety of resources provided by the Bartlett Tree Experts Research Laboratories

Starting Wage: $23-$25  

 

To find out more about what life is like at Bartlett, check us out on Instagram @LifeatBartlett.  

 

Responsibilities:
  • Answers incoming phone calls in a high call volume environment while making outbound calls related to customer service and sales.
  • Work directly with Arborists and clients to facilitate sales, increase brand awareness and build a satisfied customer base.
  • Performs customer service/administrative tasks while supporting office and production team members and all company policies.
  • Works well independently and takes initiative. A strong ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time efficiently is paramount.
  • Treats all team members with equality and respect.
  • All duties to be performed in the local office during business hours.
Qualifications:
  • Strong phone and problem solving skills  
  • Utilize excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Fosters a positive work environment.
  • Highly motivated and able to multi-task in a fast paced office.
  • Works well independently and takes initiative.
  • Excellent time management.
  • Strong organizational capabilities.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office suite.
  • Ability to learn and work within various proprietary operating systems.
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Detail oriented with accurate data entry skills.

No phone calls or emails, please.

 

The F. A. Bartlett Tree Expert Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Office Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

As an Office Administrative Assistant, you will be empowered to ensure our guests receive both accurate expectations about the FlyOver Canada experience as well as a friendly, memorable impression of the attraction. This position requires staying up-to-date on current procedures, events and any other relevant information ensuring to provide the correct information to inquiring guests and team members. Representing a popular attraction in Vancouver, the Office Administrative Assistant is responsible for creating and sustaining a fun environment for fellow team members and guests alike. Office Administrative Assistant should always strive to represent both FlyOver Canada as well as Vancouver in a positive attitude.

 

This role is paid at $18-$18.50 per hour.

Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Administrative Supervisor and working closely with the Guest Experience Supervisors, your duties include, but are not limited to:


/ Scheduling the team and contributing to discussions on hiring needed and labor management
/ Completing daily cash control duties including; cash reconciliations with the cash recycler, verifying and correcting cash variance, cash deposits, creating coin order request, reconciling monthly petty cash
/ Processing vouchers and assisting the accounts receivable team issuing invoices
/ Assisting Sales & Central Reservations Teams with group bookings and attraction information
/ Assisting with Familiarization and Complimentary ticket requests
/ Basic guest service duties including, providing guests with resolutions for issues, including ensuring accurate information & expectations are provided to guests for their FlyOver Canada experience

/ Providing online reservation assistance including; issuing and updating Ticket Times, upgrading tickets, processing online transactions, authorizing & processing refunds
/ Responding to, escalating, and distributing emails from general information inboxes
/ Providing support to Supervisors and Managers
/ General office organization; filing, document auditing, purchasing supplies
/ Collection & distribution of mail
/ Assisting and completing other administrative tasks as needed


This list describes a lot of what an Office Administrative Assistant does, but no job description can anticipate every single issue or project that could come up. Pursuit and FlyOver Canada might need to reduce, add or change job tasks from time to time.

Qualifications:

/ Availability to work a variety of hours, including weekends and holidays
/ Internally motivated, good problem-solving ability and high attention to detail
/ Consistent outstanding guest service skills
/ Ability to work effectively both in a team as well as unsupervised
/ Excellent interpersonal skills and a positive, friendly demeanor
/ Point of Sales proficiency
/ Clear in both oral and written communications in English language
/ Solid competency in basic MS Office tools including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint; Work with MS Chat, MS Teams a plus.
/ Extensive knowledge about Vancouver and local area an asset
/ 1+ year/s experience at FlyOver Canada an asset
/ Reception experience in a tourism/hospitality industry an asset
/ Fluency in a second language is an asset
/ Familiarity with ADP or scheduling experience is an asset
/ Be prepared â€“ this role requires legal ability to work in Canada.

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Vancouver and legal ability to work in Canada is required. Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Work Environment:

ABOUT FLYOVER ATTRACTIONS
The FlyOver attractions team brings new attractions to life and oversees existing operations. FlyOver, the Ultimate Flying Ride, utilizes state-of-the-art technology to give you the feeling of flight. You hang suspended, feet dangling, before a 20-metre spherical screen while our film whisks you away on an exhilarating journey across some of the worldâ€™s most iconic landscapes. Special effects, including wind, mist and scents, combine with the rideâ€™s motion to create an unforgettable experience. Currently, there are FlyOverâ€™s located in Vancouver, B.C., Reykjavik, Iceland, Las Vegas Nevada and coming soon â€“ in Toronto and Chicago. Several future FlyOver locations are proposed and are in the development stage.

 

ABOUT PURSUIT
Pursuit is a hospitality and attractions company that connects guests and staff to iconic places through unforgettable and inspiring experiences and strives to become the worldâ€™s leading provider of experiential adventure travel. Pursuit generates revenue and shareholder value as one of two business units operated by Viad, an S&P SmallCap 600 international experiential services company, traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol VVI. We deliver rich travel experiences to the global market in iconic destinations through its unique hotels and lodges, recreational attractions, ground transportation services, retail, food and beverage, sightseeing, tours and travel products.

EEO Information:Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Overview:

Over 100 years in business, the Arrow Group of Companies has led the way in developing service focused transportation solutions by working with a broad range of customers, hauling a wider variety of products, and expanding our presence throughout Canada and the United States. Arrow is an industry leading transportation, distribution and materials handling organization.

 

Arrow Environmental provides organics management services for the agricultural, industrial, and municipal sectors. We find innovative ways to put organics to good use, safely and responsibly. Our organics management solutions help local communities achieve their specific environmental goals and address the challenges of responsible waste reduction.

Streamline is a wholly owned subsidiary of Arrow group of companies. Streamline is a Canadian based technology company that develops innovative solutions and advanced fleet management software for the transportation industry. Our driving purpose is to make products that are easy to use, highly adaptable and comprehensive.

 

We are looking for a Full-Time Office Administrator to join the team to support our Arrow Environmental and Streamline divisions in Kamloops.

 

Great People Work Here!

 

We Offer:
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Pension matching program
  • Extended medical benefits including Dental and Pharmaceutical
  • Free Parking
  • Direct Deposit Pay
  • Shift: Monday-Friday 8:00am-4:30pm
  • Overtime as required
  • The stability of a 100+ year old company and the spirit of an innovative and entrepreneurial organization
Responsibilities:

This Office Administratorâ€™s principal role is to ensures the efficient, effective and accurate flow of financial information for the division. The Administrator ensures financial and business processes are followed and items are completed Arrow and Streamline's various software applications on an ongoing basis and according to deadlines. The Administrator will also be responsible for reception, office management, shipping and other general office duties.

 

Major Responsibilities include:

  • Code, enter, verify and reconcile transactions such as accounts payable, receivable, payroll, purchase orders, invoices, petty cash transactions and visa statements in the appropriate computer systems.
  • Calculate, prepare and issue documents related to accounts such as bills, invoices, inventory reports using computerized and manual systems.
  • Prepare analysis and/or reports as required by division, internal and/or external customers.
  • Ensure all Payroll and related paperwork is completed and filed appropriately.
  • Ensure all files are organized and maintained.
  • Assist in streamlining all office processes.
  • Order office supplies, service office equipment and arrange for servicing in the case of major maintenance.
  • Provide excellent service to internal and external customers.
  • Perform clerical duties such as word processing, maintaining filing and record systems and photocopying.
  • Process incoming and outgoing mail.
  • Respond to telephone, in person or electronic enquiries or forward to appropriate person.
  • Provide general information to customers and the public.
  • Process Credit Card payments.
  • Set up new customers and vendors and ensure accuracy of payable and receivable information.
  • Perform comprehensive reconciliations of accounts.
  • Follow all workplace safety policies and compliance regulations and participate in identifying hazards.
  • Comply with all rules and regulations, protocols and established metrics.
  • Other duties as assigned.
You Possess:
  • Understanding of and experience  with the accounting cycle  i.e. accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, month end and year end processes
  • Relevant education and experience such as accounting, bookkeeping, office management, etc.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel and ability to quickly learn new computer applications
  • Excellent alphanumeric typing skills  
  • Demonstrates strong communication skills both verbally and  written  
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude  
  • Organizational skills and keen attention to detail  
  • Strong concern for the accuracy and quality of work  
  • Internal and external customer service skills      
  • Problem Solving ability  
  • Proven Initiative    
  • Strong safety mindset  
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Needs to be responsible, accountable and  dependable  
  • Professional appearance/demeanor whether in person, via email or on the telephone

We are an equal opportunity employer.
