title: Reception / Administrative Support
description:
Northland Properties is looking for a responsible person whose main duties and responsibilities include providing administrative support to Executives and greet and direct visitors to the support centre. They should be a multi-tasker with excellent communication skills and an upbeat attitude; and should have the ability to effectively communicate via phone and email ensuring that the duties are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner. Position will be located at our Support Centre in Vancouver.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Performs general clerical duties to include but not limited to: photocopying, faxing, mail distribution and filing.
  • As a front-line worker, present a positive and professional image of the organization to all visitors, suppliers, inquiries, and other interactions.
  • Provide information to staff and/or clients about special activities.
  • Serves visitors by greeting, welcoming, and directing them appropriately.
  • Creates and modifies various documents using Microsoft Office.
  • Type forms, letters, reports, and memos as necessary.
  • Receive and distribute all forms of paper correspondence.
  • Organize, maintain, and coordinate office records and files in their proper locations.
  • Support the senior executives through the effective management of their Outlook calendars, maintaining them in current and accurate status.
  • Ability to manage multiple Outlook calendars.
  • Coordinates meetings and conference calls as needed or anticipated.
  • Prepares meeting materials and takes minutes.
  • Coordinates travel arrangements as needed.
  • Answer phones promptly and uses good judgment to prioritize the distribution of messages in a timely manner.
  • Prepare expense reports and debit notes.
  • Consistently use sound judgment to recognize and handle confidential information in an ethical, professional, and discreet manner.
  • Performs all other related duties as assigned.
  • Administer and manage inbound/outbound mail, including priority post, packages, courier services, and other correspondence.
  • Maintain the reception in a tidy and presentable manner.
  • Accept and monitor inbound shipments as necessary.

Requirements:

  • College diploma preferred
  • 2 year of administrative support experience with increasing responsibility
  • Microsoft Word: Mail merging, embedding documents, formatting and printing, page setup, template building.
  • Microsoft Excel: Building spreadsheets from scratch, formulas functions, tables, formatting and conditional formatting. Transferring Word documents to Excel and editing spreadsheets.
  • Microsoft Power Point: Creating presentations. Preparing graphs, charts, custom slides and templates. Adding text, pictures, graphics, and spreadsheet tables.
  • Microsoft Outlook: Advanced calendar management, email communication, and contact management. Setting up tasks, follow-ups, notes, and reminders.
  • Time management, self-motivation, adaptability and decision making are soft skills inherent in the job.

Assets:

  • Familiarity with basic Accounting principles: GL coding, budgets etc.
  • Previous experience in the hospitality industry
  • Basic knowledge of Maestro PMS and/or Opera preferred but not required
  • Bilingual English/French is a plus but not necessary

Core Competencies:

  • Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills required.
  • Must have the ability to multi-task in a fast paced and deadline driven environment.
  • Must be able to maintain professionalism and a positive service attitude at all times.
  • Must be able to work Monday to Friday, 8:30am-5:30pm and be flexible if required

Compensation:

  • Salary based on skills and experience
  • Benefit package to include medical/dental, hotel and restaurant discounts

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with Northland Properties, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Position Description:

Are you a self-starter always thinking of better ways to do things? Are you looking to be part of a dynamic team focused on providing top-quality services to customers? If yes, please keep reading!   As a member of Sercoâ€™s dynamic team, your expertise and collaborative skills will make a positive impact towards our military defense and safety of our soldiers.

 

15 Wing, headquartered in Moose Jaw, is the centre of RCAF aircrew training and is comprised of 2 Canadian Forces Flying Training School (CFFTS) and 431 Air Demonstration Squadron (CF Snowbirds) both located in Moose Jaw, SK. The Wing is the principal site of the NATO Flying Training in Canada (NFTC). 15 Wing is responsible for three different aircraft platforms that include: CT-156 Harvard II, CT-155 Hawk, CT-114 Tutor, and any visiting aircraft.

 

You will be part of a team that works closely with the military customer and other Serco teams to deliver quality and efficent Air Traffic Management System maintenance, Aeronautical informatio services and VFR air traffic services to DND's NFTC program. The Serco team has been recognized as one of Atlantic Canadaâ€™s Top Employers for 4 years in a row and received the prestigious Atlantic Canadian Aerospace and Defence Association. Industry Excellence Recognition Award for Gender and Diversity Excellence.

 

Office Administrator Support (Part-time)

 

Purpose of the Job:

To provide part-time administrative support to the Office Administrator and Program Manager.

 

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform related clerical duties, such as word processing, maintaining filing and record systems, faxing and photocopying.
  • Assist with compiling, verifying, and recording ISO Certificates, Supplier Evaluations, Supplier Questionnaires, and other forms and documents in accordance with established ISO procedures and schedules, using computerized and manual processing systems
  • Assist with updating employee data, employee files, training files etc
  • Transcribe official minutes of meetings
  • Any other administrative duties approved by the program manager
  • Assist with photocopying and collating documents for distribution, mailing and filing
  • Process incoming and outgoing mail, manually or electronically
  • Send and receive messages and documents using fax machine or electronic mail
  • Maintain inventory of office supplies, service office equipment and arrange for servicing in the case of major repairs.
  • Assist with employee engagement activities e.g.: event planning and execution
  • When tasked, compare supplies received against purchase orders and track back orders.
  • Clear back orders before supplier invoices are processed for payment
  • When tasked, determine method of shipment and arrange shipping; prepare bills of lading, customs forms, invoices and other shipping documents manually or by computer
  • Assemble packages, cartons and containers, record contents manually or in computer system, pack goods to be shipped and affix identifying information and shipping instructions
  • Inspect and verify incoming shipments against invoices or other documents, record shortages and reject damaged goods
  • When tasked, unpack, record and route goods to appropriate department areas
  • Maintain internal, manual or computerized record-keeping systems
  • Assist with GFE inventories, as required
  • Other duties as assigned

Skills:

  • Intermediate to expert level computer skills in MS Office are required.
  • Excellent organizational skills and high attention to detail.
  • Ability to multi-task, manage changing priorities, respond to requests in a timely manner.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, being able to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization and externally.
  • Exhibits high levels of professionalism and confidentiality as a representative of the Company.
  • Demonstrated experience in gathering and reporting information and preparing presentations.
  • Possession of a valid Saskatchewan driversâ€™ licence.

Health and Safety

  • Work in compliance with all regulations, policies and procedures pertaining to the operations including occupational health and safety, environmental, and quality.

Security Clearance:

    • Must be able to obtain a securuty clearance

 

 

 

 

Qualifications:

Knowledge and Experience:

  • A minimum of 1-2 years administrative experience
  • College diploma or equivalent work experience.
  • Proficient with computer literate such as Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint
Company Overview:

Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state and local governments, and commercial clients. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, Serco Americas has over 9,000 employees and is part of a $4 billion global business that helps transform government and public services around the world. At Serco, our employees are our most valuable asset - we listen, respect and support them throughout their career at Serco. We invite you to become part of our dynamic team. Serco is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying our workforce (Race/ Color/ Sex/ Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity/ Religion/ National Origin/ Disability/ Vets).

 

To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco.

 

If you require an accommodation with the application process please email:

careers@serco-na.com

or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.

 

Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email

Agencies@serco-na.com

.

 

COVID-19 Regulations: Serco complies with all applicable COVID-19 requirements. This may require employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, provide attestations regarding vaccination status and/or COVID-19 testing, or satisfy other conditions of employment that Serco deems appropriate, and employees may be required to show proof of vaccination and/or negative COVID-19 test results as a condition of employment (except in limited circumstances where an employee is legally entitled to an accommodation).

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant

Apply now »



Date:Apr 19, 2022


Location: Mississauga, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 13341


Job Description



+ Answers phones, directs calls, takes messages and provides general office support to AP, AR, Payroll, Operations and Field Crews. Meets and greets visitors.


+ Provides general office support by performing administrative and clerical duties such as opening and sorting mail, preparing courier, maintaining office supplies, maintaining spreadsheets and databases, photocopying, filing, hotel bookings, flight bookings, maintaining gas cards receipts, collect vehicle mileage, office keys, security system codes, cleaners, building landlord.


+ Order, track and manage assets such as iPhones and iPads. Manage Bell Mobility bill and office phone list.


+ Event planning: Organize annual golf tournament and holiday party for all Ontario divisions which includes budget planning, ordering promotional items, attending and managing events.


+ Manage Facebook page, write newsletter, and manage print jobs and business card orders.


+ Assists in special projects as required and performs other related duties as assigned.






Requirements



+ High School Graduation supplemented by completion of a post-secondary program in Business Administration.


+ A minimum of two (2) years of recent related office and accounting experience. Experience in the construction industry or project based environment is preferred.


+ Proficiency in the use of software applications such as MS Office; SharePoint; Social Media; Websites.


+ Demonstrated ability to multi-task, organize work, prioritize and work to deadlines.


+ Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.


+ Superior problem solving skills and ability to use judgment and common sense.


+ Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information and to perform with a high level of professionalism and integrity.









#LI-RG1-PNR


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.

title: Administrative Assistant - II
description:
We are currently seeking a "Administrative Assistant" for a contract role with one of our clients in Vancouver,BC . Please apply if you would be interested and available for it.
 
Duration - 24 Months 

Job Description:
• Greets, escorts and directs visitors from Front Desk/Reception
• Provides general information to callers or visitors (both internal and external)
• The role requires a strong focus and background in coordination/communication, specifically via calendaring and other items
• Administrative work to alleviate work from executive assistant and Business Operations Manager
• If possible, technical ability sufficient to make changes on websites as needed
• Ad-hoc assignments to alleviate workload from executive assistant, by taking on admin work such that the executive assistant can focus on other duties
• Strong administrative/coordinator skills required
• Previous experience within the administrative coordinator space
• Works in a diverse and moderately complex environment
• Includes some customer and executive contact
• Performs moderately complex administrative activities such as composing letters and reports, preparing/editing presentations, and arranging site/team events
• Requires strong written and verbal communication skills
• Has intermediate to advanced computer skills including MS Office, word processing, SharePoint, and basic presentation or database applications
• Provides assistance to other administrative staff and is a team player
• Possesses strong interpersonal skills, leadership, negotiation, analytical and problem solving skills
• Associate’s degree (required)

Regards,
Yakshendra Bhardwaj
Cell: 289-633-4031
Email:

Pramesh.dubey@artech.com

title: Adjointe Coordonnatrice Administrative (poste stagiaire) / Assistant Administrative Coordinator (Intern position)
description:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science.In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

Assistant Administrative Coordinator (Intern Position)

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Supporting the Coordinator Team, this role has the following key responsibilities:

The provision of administrative support to the Head office Coordinator Team (consisting of 10 individuals) to enable teams to work effectively and efficiently, including:

  • Assist in coordination of on-boarding, off-boarding, e-setups, distribution list maintenance, office set-up, organizational charts.
  • Preparation and review of expense reports (validating guidelines and policies have been followed and no potential audit deviations exist).
  • Preparation of correspondence and other internal communication.
  • Assist in coordination of team meetings, events, as well as generating ideas and coordinating group activities.
  • Active support of specific department projects;
  • Processing of translation requests.
  • Support of various Sharepoint sites.
  • Ad hoc special projects in support of the coordinator team

2. Identification of new ideas and opportunities for efficiency, improvement, simplification and cost saving.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

  • Administrative experience supporting diverse teams at different levels in a business environment is an asset;
  • Demonstrated experience in working collaboratively with multiple stakeholders to support business needs is an asset;
  • Experience in working in a fast-paced environment and demonstrated flexibility in adapting to changing requirements and business needs is an asset;

KNOWLEDGE & ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects simultaneously;
  • Positive work attitude and highly collaborative approach to working within a team;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in both languages;
  • Ability to review and proofread English and French text is an asset
  • Confidence in using/learning new technologies, and demonstrate willingness to train others as required;
  • Good working knowledge of MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Powerpoint and Excel);
  • Close attention to detail and ability to manage relatively complex tasks and projects autonomously;
  • Demonstrates excellent judgement and has the ability to handle confidential and sensitive information;
  • Performs with tact and professionalism.

Adjointe Coordonnatrice Administrative (poste stagiaire)

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITS

Apportant son soutien lquipe de coordonnatrices, le titulaire du poste assume les responsabilits cls suivantes:

Fournir, un soutien administratif lquipe de coordonnatrices du bureau chef de manire leur permettre de travailler avec efficacit et efficience, notamment par l'excution des activits suivantes:

  • Soutien la coordination de l'accueil des nouveaux employs, des dparts, des configurations lectroniques, de la tenue des listes de distribution, de l'amnagement des postes de travail et des organigrammes.
  • Prparation et rvision des comptes de dpenses (validation des politiques et quaucune dviation existe)
  • Prparation de la correspondance et autres communications internes.
  • Soutien la coordination des runions et des activits des quipes.
  • Ssoutien actif de projets particuliers du service.
  • Traitement des demandes de traduction.
  • Soutien de diffrents sites sharepoints.
  • Soutien de projets spciaux en soutien lquipe de coordinatrices

2. Rechercher de nouvelles ides et occasions favorisant l'efficacit, l'amlioration, la simplification et la rduction des cots.

EXPRIENCE REQUISE

  • Exprience dans le soutien administratif d'quipes diversifies divers chelons dans un contexte commercial est un atout;
  • Exprience de collaboration dmontre avec des intervenants multiples pour rpondre aux besoins commerciaux est un autout.
  • Exprience de travail dans un environnement qui volue rapidement et souplesse dmontre pour s'adapter aux exigences et aux besoins commerciaux changeants est un atout.

CONNAISSANCES ET QUALITS EXIGES

  • Solides comptences organisationnelles et capacit d'tablir des priorits pour grer de multiples tches et projets simultanment.
  • Attitude positive au travail et approche hautement collaborative au sein d'une quipe.
  • Solides aptitudes en communication crite et orale dans les deux langues.
  • Aisance rviser et relire les textes en anglais et en franais
  • Aisance se familiariser avec de nouvelles technologies et les utiliser, et volont d'enseigner, le cas chant, leur utilisation aux autres.
  • Bonne connaissance pratique de la suite MSOffice (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel).
  • Grand souci du dtail et capacit de grer de faon autonome des tches et des projets relativement complexes.
  • Excellent jugement dmontr et capacit de traiter de l'information sensible et confidentielle.
  • Tact et professionnalisme.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

title: Office Administrator
description:
At Amarr Garage Doors we strive to be the best. And as an ESSENTIAL business we not only have stayed OPEN during the pandemic, we have THRIVED (while staying safe!).

We need HARD WORKING, MOTIVATED people to join our warehouse team but NO WAREHOUSE EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

We are proud to be a Second Chance Employer. To see a list of our background standards please visit www.amarr.com/careers/hiring.

The Details:
This position is Monday - Friday from 7:00am - 4:30pm with occasional overtime. The pay rate starts at $23.00 based on experience, plus a bonus for driving!

The Benefits:

  • Benefits include medical, dental, vision after 60 days
  • PAID HOLIDAYS IMMEDIATELY
  • Paid Time Off you start earning on your first day
Position Summary:
The Office Administrator responsibilities entail answering the telephones, handling the
Administrative functions, customer account inquiries, and providing support for Door Center Management.

Essential Functions:
1. Perform all assigned duties safely.
2. Answer and respond to telephone calls and customers’ needs.
3. Receive and process customer orders and invoices on a daily basis.
4. Assist in inventory control (may include cycle counts).
5. Responsible for daily receipts and bank statements.
6. Courteous, customer service oriented attitude.
7. Participate in warehouse-related activities at the Door Center in order to continually develop and improve
their product knowledge.
8. Maintain customer files.
9. Maintain customer pricing in Amarr’s software.
10. Provide product quotes to our customers.
11. Maintain and order office supplies.
12. Purchase order receipts and transfers for inventory.
13. Prepare end of day paperwork; includes all summary reports.
14. Adhere to end of month procedures; includes all summary reports and computer close down.
15. Assist in production, product pick-up and product delivery schedules.
16. Assist in the development of a semi-annual 2D and meet all training targets as spelled out in the 2D.
17. Other reasonably related duties as assigned.

Other Job Responsibilities and Physical Requirements:
1. Extended computer use.
2. Extended telephone use.
3. Light lifting (up to 25 lbs.).

Qualifications of Job:
1. High School Education.
2. Strong PC skills (various software applications).
3. One year prior office administrative experience or related experience.
4. Ability to handle multiple tasks.
5. Clear and effective written and oral communication skills.
6. Satisfactory completion of 10-week training program after joining the company.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant Position Summary:

This position will support the Operations and District Manager administration and coordinate with all lines of business. Candidate must have strong customer service skills, problem solving, organization, and multitasking and have strong attention to detail. Advanced computer skills including word, excel & Microsoft outlook are preferred.

 Duties and Responsibilities

  • Inspecting Customer Vehicles for Cosmetic Damages
  • Answering phones
  • Light office cleaning
  • Handle all billing
  • Coordinate with drivers for pick up of vehicles
  • Process estimates for customer through project software system (*Training will be provided)
  • Inspect field estimates for proper photos and information
  • Ensure accounting and invoices are properly submitted and paid
  • Maintain supplies inventory by checking stock to determine inventory level, placing and expediting orders for supplies, verifying receipt of supplies.

 

Qualifications

  • Knowledgeable of Microsoft Outlook, Word & Excel.
  • Must have strong time management and organizational skills.
  • 1-2 years of admin experience
  • Experience in automotive industry is preferred but not required

PREVIOUS BODY SHOP EXPERIENCE A BIG PLUS!!

 

Dent Wizard offers a rewarding career with a comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance through RBC Extended Health Care and Manual Life RPP. (Registered Pension Plan.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
AyA Kitchens is one of Canada's leading cabinet manufacturers.  We are currently seeking an experienced Administrative Assistant to work along side the VP of Sales.

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in a fast paced environment, an ability to work independently with strong time management skills and able to prioritize several assignments simultaneously while maintaining a degree of professionalism and confidentiality.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Provide administrative support for VP of Sales while maintaining high level of confidentiality;
  • Manage daily calendars, emails, appointments and travel arrangements;
  • Liaison between company executives and various individuals both internally and externally, at all levels of the organization;
  • Prepare material for presentations;
  • Manage expense reports;
  • Attend and document meeting minutes as required;
  • Respond to general inquiries and forwarding inquiries to various people/departments
  • Undertake administrative projects as assigned by VP of sales; and,
  • Other administrative duties as assigned.

Education & Experience

  • Post secondary degree in Business, Communication, Marketing or Design
  • 3-4 years’ experience working in an administrative role.
  • Excellent communication skills (oral, written and listening);
  • Must be able to handle confidential and sensitive information with diplomacy;
  • Self-motivated, independent thinker who is able to work independently as well in team environment;
  • Able to perform well under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Flexible and adaptive in response to rapidly changing environment
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Excellent MS Office skills
AyA offers its employees a comprehensive benefit package including health, dental, vision, pension, Employee Assistance Program, free onsite parking, onsite gym and cafeteria

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (LEGAL)
description:
ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (LEGAL)

 

Employer:                    Quadro Law

 

Employer address:      300 – 1090 Homer Street

                                    Vancouver BC V6B 2W9

 

Position name:            Administrative Assistant (Legal)

 

Number of vacancies: One

 

Location of work:        300 – 1090 Homer Street

                                    Vancouver BC V6B 2W9

 

Nature of position:      Permanent, full-time (30 hours per week)

 

Wage:                          $39,000 per annum

 

Vacation:                     15 days per annum

 

Language required:     English, spoken and written

 

Other benefits:            Extended medical and dental plan; bonus may be paid, at the sole discretion of the employer

 

How to apply:              Please send your cover letter and resume to info@quadrolaw.com.

 

 

 

JOB DUTIES. The following duties will be performed in this position:

 

  • Prepare and key in correspondence and legal documents;
  • Review and proofread documents to ensure compliance with legal procedures and grammatical usage;
  • Establish and maintain office policies and procedures;
  • Schedule consultations and ensure required information is received in advance of consultation;
  • Open files and conduct conflict checks on new clients;
  • Manage office info account and distribute email as required;
  • Manage firm social media accounts to drive new business;
  • Post blogs written by lawyers and staff;
  • Ensure firm website is up-to-date and update as required;
  • Coordinate photos and other training of hew hires, as determined by office manager;
  • Order office supplies and maintain inventory;
  • Coordinate and complete special projects; and
  • Perform general office work as required.

 

REQUIREMENTS. The successful applicant will possess, at a minimum, the following skills and experience:

 

  • Completion of secondary school;
  • Completion of a one or two year college program or other program for administrative assistants, or at least one year of previous experience as an administrative assistant;
  • Some previous experience in a law firm;
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word and Excel;
  • Familiarity with operation of popular social media services, such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, and TikTok for business accounts;
  • General affinity for technology and finding new ways to do things;
  • Comfortable working from home and also within an office environment;

  • Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English; and
  • Attention to detail.

 

We would like to thank you for your interest in this position. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
company: Desjardins Financial Security Independent Network - Southwestern Ontario
description:
Administrative Assistant

Fantastic opportunity for an experienced Administrative Assistant to join a successful, innovative, and rapidly growing financial practice in London, Ontario. 

As a front stage role, this person is the ambassador of goodwill, presenting a positive and professional image of the organization to all. The ideal candidate will possess a positive attitude and a willingness to help wherever needed.  This person is a goal-oriented team player who is self-managing, progressive and has a growth mindset.

Responsibilities (may include but not limited to)

  • Greeting clients, answering phones, and fielding client service requests
  • Coordinate schedules and book meetings
  • Manage and prepare documents for submission
  • Provide administrative assistance to the team as required

Core Competencies

  • Self-motivated and thrives in a fast-paced setting
  • Professional, calm demeanor with excellent customer service skills
  • Detail oriented and organized
  • Strong ability to prioritize, multi-task and focus in a busy environment

Qualifications

  • Experience in the financial services or employee benefits industry is an asset
  • Minimum 2 years experience in an administrative role
  • Post secondary education in administration or financial services
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office 365
  • Technically savvy – able to use multiple software applications

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, opportunity for growth and development and extraordinary workplace culture that focuses on flexibility and work-life balance. Buss Financial Group is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability status.

Please submit a cover letter with your resume.

We thank you for your interest; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for follow-up.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
This position supports the regional operations team, and is responsible for providing administrative supportand clerical services, in order to ensure effective and efficient administrative operations.Department

Operations

Reports to

Supervisor, Utility Administration

Compensation

$50,000 - $56,000

Who we are

Our Purpose is to help people enjoy a better life and communities thrive. Corix has been building, operating, and maintaining water, wastewater, electric, gas and sustainable energy utility infrastructure for many years across Canada and the U.S. Our vision is to be the preferred utility delivering co-created solutions our customers want. Throughout our history, we have helped communities to grow and thrive by implementing safe and efficient infrastructure solutions that meet their unique needs. At Corix our values are safety, integrity, excellence, and connection.

The Corix team has an opportunity for a Administrative Assistant based in Kamloops, BC. The Administrative Assistant has strong communication skills and excellent attention to detail. They manage multiple tasks and responsibilities and are continuously re-prioritizing duties . This fast-paced office environment is the main hub for the operations team and with a positive attitude, the Administrative Assistant encourages their team members to overcome obstacles to complete assignments. Working cohesively with peers throughout Corix, the Administrative Assistant maintains solid customer relationships by handling questions and concerns with speed and professionalism.

What you'll do

Major Accountabilities
  • Support the regional operations team, participating in the development and implementation of operating/administrative processes, annual capital/operating budgets, and customer and contractor agreements.
  • Provide administrative support and reception duties to regional operations team.
  • Perform AP/AR duties in compliance with company policies and procedures, including the timely processing of invoices, issuing purchase orders, and maintaining accounting records.
  • Organize and maintain various filing systems, including an electronic management system and document retention program.

General Responsibilities
  • Support the Area Manager and Area Supervisor, participating in the development and implementation of operating/administrative processes, annual capital/operating budgets, and customer and contractor agreements, performing data analysis, and assisting in the preparation of supporting documentation for capital expenditures
  • Perform general administrative tasks and reception duties, such as planning meetings, completion of expense claims, timesheets and job costing, assisting in document preparation, greeting visitors, and directing calls and mail as appropriate
  • Perform AP/AR duties in compliance with company policies and procedures, including the timely processing of invoices, issuing purchase orders, and maintaining accounting records
  • Complete month end contract invoice processing.
  • Organize and maintain various filing systems, including an electronic management system and document retention program.
  • Work with Customer Care team to ensure proper billing and customer setup are completed for the region, communicating the appropriate rates and contact information, and preparing and distributing customer invoices as required
  • Assist with health and safety program, updating emergency manuals and contact numbers as required, maintaining emergency contact information for the operations staff, and preparing and distributing monthly safety minutes
  • Assist operations during utility emergencies, recording relevant information related to those emergencies, and contacting appropriate responders and agencies according to jurisdiction
  • Perform other related duties as required

What you bring

Education / Experience:
  • High school diploma
  • 2 years related experience
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills

Please note:
  • Work life balance and flexibility
  • Normal office setting
  • Travel may be required in service area

Management maintains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.

Corix Group of Companies is an E-Verify participating employer.

People Focused and Inclusive Culture

We attract and develop connected, high performing people of diverse background, ethnicities and experiences, who achieve their goals in alignment with our purpose, vision, and values. Creating an inclusive and respectful work environment where everyone is included and able to do their best work and feel as though they belong.

Corix is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible candidate experience. Accommodations are available upon request. We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those shortlisted will be contacted.

We're doing some great things at Corix. Find out more about working here at www.corix.com

title: Commis (Aucun soir et aucune FDS)
company: Groupe Bergeron Dupuis et Associés, GBDA
description:
La pharmacie Uniprix Guillaume Fleury, François Dupuis et Pierre Bergeron située au 1445, rue Victoria à Saint-Lambert est présentement à la recherche dun commis à temps plein pour compléter son équipe.


Conditions demploi:


  • Poste à temps plein (permanent);
  • Horaire du lundi au vendredi de 9h00 à 17h00.

Vos tâches:


  • Assurer le marchandisage du magasin, dont létalage, la présentation et létiquetage de la marchandise, ainsi que le remplissage et la rotation des marchandises;
  • Recevoir les différents fournisseurs et leurs marchandises;
  • Gérer l’emplacement des produits dans l’entrepôt et la rotation de ceux-ci;
  • Contrôler le vol a létalage par une surveillance accrue;
  • Acheminer la papeterie et les fournitures aux différents départements;
  • Assurer ménage et nettoyage des surfaces (vider les poubelles, désinfections dans le cadre des mesures covid).

Qualifications:


  • Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires (DES);
  • Avoir de lexpérience dans un poste similaire, un atout
  • Avoir une bonne forme physique; Capacité à soulever des charges ,lourdes et à travailler debout

Compétences:


  • Posséder de très bonnes habiletés d’organisation de travail et de gestion des priorités
  • Savoir utiliser un système de réception de marchandises, un atout
  • Savoir résister au stress
  • Avoir le souci du détail
  • Démontrer de l’initiative et être capable de travailler seul.

title: Secrétaire-réceptionniste
description:
Les Jardins Lebourgneuf, une résidence du Groupe LOKIA expert en résidences pour aînés, a comme mission doffrir une qualité de vie supérieure dans un milieu chaleureux, respectueux et stimulant tout en maintenant l’autonomie. À la fois chaleureuse et souriante, léquipe prône les valeurs de respect, dexcellence, dempathie et dattitude positive.

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche de :

Secrétaire-réceptionniste 

Si vous savez apporter sourire et compréhension aux personnes aînées, vous serez heureux dans notre milieu de vie.

ON DIT DE VOUS QUE VOUS ÊTES:

  • Une personne respectueuse et que vous aimez travailler avec les personnes âgées;
  • Sociable et que le travail déquipe est important pour vous;
  • À lécoute des besoins des aînés et vous avez à cœur de respecter leurs attentes;
  • Reconnu pour être positif et capable de développer facilement des liens.

VOS TALENTS ET COMPÉTENCES VOUS PERMETTENT:

  • De répondre aux demandes de renseignements reçues par téléphone et par courrier électronique;
  • De transmettre les appels téléphoniques et les messages;
  • Daccueillir les visiteurs, déterminer le but de leur visite et les orienter;
  • De fixer et confirmer les rendez-vous et les réunions de la direction;
  • Préparer, saisir à lordinateur et réviser les documents;
  • Tenir à jour différents tableaux et registres;
  • S’acquitter de toutes autres tâches, suivant les instructions de la direction.


VOUS DÉTENEZ LES EXIGENCES SUIVANTES:
  • Diplôme détudes professionnelles en secrétariat OU expériences pertinentes dans le domaine;
  • Ponctuelle, minutieuse, fiable et autonome;
  • Très bonne connaissance informatique (suite google un atout);
  • Bonne vitesse dexécution.

VOICI CE QUE NOUS NOUS ENGAGEONS À VOUS OFFRIR:

  • Un environnement où le personnel est au cœur de nos préoccupations;
  • Lencadrement nécessaire pour développer vos compétences (Programme de formation et de développement);
  • Une belle ambiance de travail avec une équipe dynamique et de bonnes valeurs;
  • Assurances collectives;
  • REER avec participation de lemployeur;
  • Formation continue;
  • Uniforme;
  • Une sécurité d’emploi;
  • Certaines gratuités comme les repas, le stationnement, la salle d’entrainement, etc. (dépendamment de la résidence LOKIA);
  • Des conditions de travail avantageuses et concurrentielles;
  • Des activités sociales organisées par lentreprise;
  • Et encore plus


HORAIRE DE TRAVAIL:
  • Poste à temps plein du lundi au vendredi


Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons quavec les personnes dont la candidature est retenue pour une entrevue.

title: Business Associate
description:
U-Offer is an education technology corporation founded by an elite team from top tech companies in Silicon Valley. Our mission is to help students join the world's leading companies, relying on our strong resources, networks, and mentor teams throughout Silicon Valley and Wall Street. U-Offer provides students with career development, consulting, and vocational skill training services. We cover industry trends such in computer science, AI, finance, management consulting, business analysis, FMCG/CPG, culture/creative industries, and more. As a result, we send thousands of trainees to Silicon Valley and top companies in various industries around the world every year.

Job Summary:

We are looking for a Business Associate to assist in ensuring U-Offer activities and objectives are aligned with the overall Firm strategy. This role needs to gather market information on potential partners and competitors to identify opportunities that meet U-Offer business development strategy.

â€¢ Work independently and collaboratively to develop and implement appropriate prospect communication plans

â€¢ Respond quickly to the internet, phone, and live chat inquiries using email, scripts, and templates 

â€¢ Analyze industry dynamics and the competitive landscape

â€¢ Build and maintain strong relationships at different levels of the client organizations.

â€¢ Review and analyze relevant documentation to ensure the understanding of an organizations function and capabilities.

â€¢ Conduct relevant research to increase understanding in support of developing comprehensive solutions.

â€¢ Logically structure recommendations and supporting data to formulate a solid, logical and understandable business case.

â€¢ Write up results of analysis and prepares presentations as needed

â€¢ Research industry trends and support innovative ideas for practice thought leaders.

 

What Youâ€™ll Have:

â€¢ Excellent communication, English skill in both writing and speaking and relationship building skills

â€¢ Positive and hardworking personality

â€¢ Pro-active personality to prospect and conduct introductory calls and meetings to identify business challenges

â€¢ Be good at navigating interpersonal relationships, and be able to identify and handle sensitive issues

 

What Youâ€™ll need:

â€¢ Experience in B2B cooperation

â€¢ Fluent in both Chinese and English

â€¢ Ideal candidates can communicate effectively, learn quickly, takes ownership of their work to deliver results, and is a true collaborator

â€¢ Strong general business acumen

â€¢ Direct experience with one or more of the following functions: product development, business development, marketing and sales functions.

â€¢ Ability to create business cases, analyze industry trends and create market reports.

 

What Youâ€˜ll obtain:

â€¢ Perfect opportunity to join a fast-growing company

â€¢ Work in a high-energy, fast-paced environment that is both competitive and fun

â€¢ Build a high-level network

â€¢ Exclusive U-Offer events

title: Sales Administrative Coordinator -6 month Term
description:
Overview:

Sales Administrative Coordinator

We are looking for a Sales Administrative Coordinator  to join a global engineering and manufacturing leader in tech that does cool stuff that matters.

In this role, you will be a hunter and gatherer of missing information across cross-functional teams to ensure all information required is available. You will coordinate with functional areas to obtain information and meet specific requirements to facilitate business with our Customers,  while continually following up to ensure task completion. The successful candidate will join our Sales Administration team and be a liaison between our international sales team members and various internal departments across the Autonomy & Positioning division. The ideal individual will be results-oriented, self-driven and possess exemplary organizational skills. Interacting effectively by using strong interpersonal skills, tenacity, and diplomacy will be essential for success.This is a 6 month temporary role reporting to the Director, Inside Sales.

 

The  Company:Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications. Youâ€™ll be joining over 22,000 people in 50 countries on the leading edge of your field.    

 

This position is with Hexagonâ€™s Autonomy & Positioning division, a global technology leader, pioneering end-to-end solutions industry leaders rely on for assured positioning and autonomy on land, sea and air. Our work touches every aspect of life, from sustainability on Earth to enabling autonomy. Within the Autonomy & Positioning division your work will contribute to the operation of our brand(s) NovAtel, AutonomouStuff, VERIPOS and Antcom.

 
The Location: Hexagon is a global company with locations around the world. This position is based in Calgary, AB.  

Responsibilities:

As the  Sales Administrative Coordinator,  you will:

  • Gather and submit various company information to facilitate onboarding as a new Supplier or Vendor
  • Provide documents and reports to facilitate closing customer purchase orders and related activities
  • Coordinate and submit approved Representations and Certifications (â€œReps & Certsâ€) on behalf of our companies in support of business activities
  • Register for and maintain Customer Portals on behalf of our companies
  • Provide exceptional administrative support for global Sales teams to help ensure sales orders are completed
  • Provide updates for RFQs and sales orders as required
  • Reporting and data management administration in company ERP and CRM systems as assigned
Qualifications:

 Must Have:

  • Minimum 1-year experience in a dynamic and time-sensitive environment
  • Well organized and an effective multi-tasker who is capable of handling shifting priorities and concurrent tasks
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with strong customer service orientation
  • Self-starter who can work with minimal supervision
  • Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities; exercises good judgement
  • Proficiency with MS Outlook, Excel, and Word

Key Success factors:

  • Goal oriented and results driven with demonstrated ability to meet deadlines
  • Ability to create strong working relationships with customers and internal stakeholders
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work with various teams
  • Adaptable to a changing environment with multiple priorities

Nice to Have:

  • Business administration diploma or similar
  • Experience with Salesforce.com CRM and ERP systems an asset

title: Desk Assistant (Part-Time) - Campus1 MTL
description:
The Desk Assistant is a representative of the staff, serving an important role in developing a sense of community. The desk assistant is responsible for three areas of accountability. These areas are the keys to the orderly operation of the front desk. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (other duties may be assigned):

MAINTAIN COMMUNITY STANDARDS AND SAFETY

  • Assist in identifying and reporting maintenance and safety problems.
  • Assist in managing fire and other emergency situations, always notifying professional staff first if time permits.
  • Know the location of the nearest fire extinguisher, and be familiar with the operation of the fire alarm panel and of fire safety equipment.
  • Assist in security checks of the property while on duty.
  • Know emergency telephone numbers.
  • Assist in the supervision of student conduct and noise levels throughout the Community (i.e. periodic checks of front fire lane and other areas as assigned), and the notification of the On-Call PA's for other issues.
  • Assist in the communication and interpretation of policies and regulations.
  • Assist in maintaining established quiet hours.
  • Stay up to date in policies by reading newsletters, staff memos, etc.
  • The core of Canadian Campus culture involves everyone being fully invested in everything that we do down to picking up the smallest piece of garbage. No matter their position or duration at any given property, everyone picks up garbage.

ASSIST STUDENTS: PROVIDE CUSTOMER SERVICE

  • Assist in the welcoming and orientation of new residents (i.e. helping in the location of rooms and available facilities, etc.)
  • Assist in providing information on campus services and agencies.
  • Ensure that proper procedures are adhered to in the issuance and return of equipment.
  • Assists guests in contacting the resident they are visiting and ensuring their compliance with procedures regarding visitors.

PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS

  • Assist the professional staff during check-in and check-out.
  • Maintain all administrative logs as designated by the professional staff.
  • Perform other tasks as assigned by the management staff.
  • Maintain punctuality to assigned shifts.

Canadian Campus Communities Culture Commitments

  • Our people are devoted to a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality in the workplace and our communities.  We are committed to intentionally executing an evolving set of goals specific to inclusion, diversity, and accountability, driven by empathetic leadership and embraced by all.
  • The core of Canadian Campus culture involves everyone being fully invested in everything that we do down to picking up the smallest piece of trash. No matter their position or duration at any given property, everyone picks up trash because we take pride in our community.
  • Serve as an American Campus representative and liaison in all interactions.
  • Certain activities involved in this position may be photographed and/or video and audio recorded for quality control and/or training purposes. Compliance with the Photo, Video and Voice Recording Policy is a condition of employment

To be successful in this position, you should have:

  • Customer Service skills
  • A degree in progress
  • Bilingual French/English preferred

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant  - Temporary 

Location: Kelowna, B.C.

Who You’ll Work For

REEF’s mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences. With an ecosystem of 5,00 locations and a team of 18,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in North America.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way.

What You’ll Do

 As a multifunctional Administrative Assistant, you’ll own all of the functions performed in our customer-facing storefront as well as supporting our management and operations teams.  You’ll craft and employ standardized processes, drive new methods and playbooks, and cultivate innovative tools to improve our operation. If you’re eager to develop a deep expertise in our current and future office processes, we’ve got a Administrative Assistant role just for you!

    • Customer Service
    • A/P invoice processing
    • Monthly Parking account processing
    • Support all aspects of our parking office
    • strong customer service background.
    • Ability to work under pressure.
    • Ability to multitask
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
    • Proficiency in Microsoft office software.
    • Strong team player

What We Want From You: economics)

  • Administrative Experience
  • Computer Literacy
  • Excellent Customer Service Skills
  • A Positive Attitude

What We’ll Provide

Medical
Dental
Vision

Life and Disability
Paid Time Off (PTO)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

  • Frequently operate small office equipment such as a computer, tablet, and copier/printer, telephone.
  • Work is performed in a professional office environment.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Work is performed indoors for extended periods of time including up to the entire duration of shift.

 

REEF Technology is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. REEF does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. REEF complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

About Huawei

With 194,000 employees and operating in more than 170 countries and regions, Huawei is a leading global creator and provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. Integrated solutions span across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services. Huawei is committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

About Huawei Canada

Huawei Canada focuses on fundamental research and development aimed at solving complex technical problems in emerging technologies like 5G, AI, Human Computer Interaction and Autonomous Driving. With ongoing research initiatives with 10 Universities across Canada and strategic collaboration agreements with several Universities, we support Canada’s rich research community.  In 2020, Huawei Canada ranked among the Top 20 corporate R&D investors in the country with a huge 40% increase in R&D investment year over year. Huawei Canada was established in 2008 and now has a total workforce of 1,200 in our six research centers across Canada. 

“Huawei will continue to be an important contributor to Canada’s knowledge-based economy,” “Openness and diversity are Canada’s great strengths. They help attract global talent and business. Huawei Canada’s R&D spending creates jobs, trains talents, supports fundamental research, and accelerates knowledge-to-impact in Canada. We are proud of all of that.”

Changtian Cai, President, Huawei Canada R&D.

Why work with Huawei Canada?

You will have the opportunity to work on real world problems that impact people across the globe.  Many of our researchers are actively involved in publishing conference and journal papers, inventing patents and solving challenging technical problems. With cutting edge tools, access to highly specialized leaders and researchers, and significant funding, you will be well supported to fulfil your potential and pursue your professional dreams.

Job Description

  • Handling procurement tasks for the HR Department
  • Maintain, record and update PO and related PO tracking files.
  • Contract (renewal) and milestone incentive administration
  • Assist in invoicing functions, interacting with Finance, AP, Project Management team
  • Document management, receipt and acceptance of invoices.
  • Ensure amounts paid are accurate and that all information on invoices is correct according to good accepted/services delivered.
  • Monitor all vendor payment agreements.
  • Responsible to submit all received invoices to Accounts Payable team.

 

Qualifications

  • Ability to use Microsoft productivity software such as Excel and Word
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • 1-2 years of Administrative duties
  • Strong organizational ability
  • Effective corporate communications skills
  • Ability to consistently meet all deadline

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
REFERRAL BONUS 150$

Are you reliable, dedicated, and eager to learn? Our client, a bakery company, requires your services like receptionist/administration assistant. This is a great opportunity to benefit from excellent working conditions and acquire a permanent position; Join the team today!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

- General office duties including answering phone calls and emails, order entry, and customer service.

- Carry out administrative duties such as filing, typing, copying, scanning, etc.

- Distribute correspondence memos, letters, faxes, and forms.

- You will be the first point of contact for the company, and you will provide administrative support across the organization.

JOB BENEFITS

- Three salary increases in the first year

- Starting salary for 18-19$/hr

- 5 days a week

⏰ Monday – Friday 9:00pm – 5:00 pm

- Weekly pay

- Subsidized meals

- Permanent full-time position

- Located at Boulevard Saint Michele

OUR REQUIREMENTS

Experience in administration/relative position required

Must be bilingual, both written and verbal

Knowledge in Microsoft office, QuickBooks literate

CONTACT

Canada Global Recruitment

Talent Acquisition team

☎514-548-3505

• WhatsApp and Text messages accepted

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
***Emails regarding next steps will come from Bamboo HR - Please Ensure to check your junk mail when applying for jobs***

Cannon Automotive a division of Cleveland-Cliffs Tooling and Stamping is looking for an Administrative Assistant in Windsor, Ontario. 

Cleveland-Cliffs is the largest flat-rolled steel company and the largest iron ore pellet producer in North America. The company is vertically integrated from mining through iron making, steelmaking, rolling, finishing and downstream with hot and cold stamping of steel parts and components.

Duties and Responsibilities: 

  • To provide administrative support to all areas of the organization  
  • Prepare, key in, edit and proofread correspondence, invoices, presentations, brochures, publications, reports and related material from machine dictation and handwritten documents 
  • Open and distribute incoming regular and electronic mail and other material, co-ordinate the flow of information internally and with other departments and organizations  
  • Schedule and confirm appointments and meetings as required 
  • Order and maintain office supply inventory   
  • Answer and relay phone and electronic enquiries  
  • Assist in the organization of company events  
  • Set up and maintain manual and computerized information filing systems  
  • Determine and establish office procedures  
  • Greet visitors, ascertain nature of business and direct visitors to appropriate personnel  
  • Record and prepare meetings minutes 
  • Schedule travel arrangements 
  • Other duties as assigned 
  • Abide by all Company policies including, but not limited to the following: Health and Safety, Environmental, Quality, Human Resources policies, and the Employee Handbook 

Requirements: 

  • Completion of secondary school is required  
  • Post-Secondary education for administrative assistant or secretarial work is an asset  
  • Proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Sharepoint 
  • Strong written and oral communication skills  
  • Experience working with sensitive and confidential information  
  • Previous clerical experience is required 

We thank all who apply, but only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

As a company, we are doing what we can to keep all our employees safe and healthy. It is the current expectation that, subject to any exceptional human rights accommodations, all Cleveland-Cliffs employees will be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as soon as possible. Before accepting an offer of employment, you must certify that you are fully vaccinated or will be before commencing employment, or you must request and be approved for a human rights accommodation. Cleveland-Cliffs reserves the right to require proof of vaccination. Failure to adhere to this requirement will render any offer of employment frustrated, null and void, and you will not be eligible for employment with Cleveland-Cliffs.

Cleveland-Cliffs Inc., including its affiliates and subsidiaries (collectively, “Cleveland-Cliffs”), is an equal opportunity employer and complies with its obligations under applicable human rights legislation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability, or other protected grounds under applicable human rights legislation. Cleveland-Cliffs requires all prospective employees to undergo a pre-employment background check.

Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities or other needs based on protected human rights grounds. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

title: Administrative Assistant (Accounting)
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The administrative assistant is responsible for admin support for the project accountants as well as accounts payable clerks. The accounting clerk provides support for the accounting department ensuring timely processing of contract management, vendor set up, recording deposits, subtrade compliance, and other duties as requested by their manager. 

  • Process all subcontract documents using Docusign
  • Manage the vendor master files
  • Responsible for gathering and reviewing subtrade compliance
  • Record daily bank deposit
Qualifications

  • Accounting post-secondary preferred, but not required
  • Computer literate, with strong data entry skills and effective working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Strong desire to learn.
  • Good attention to detail in all areas of work.
  • Able to work efficiently as part of a team and/or independently.
  • Able to communicate effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
  • Able to adapt to and to learn software (i.e. Viewpoint).


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

As of November 15, 2021, Chandos Construction requires all employees across the country to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. This is in line with our values and commitment to all stakeholders.

title: Part-Time Administrative Assistant (Tillsonburg Kia)
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!

 

Location: 11 Simcoe St, Tillsonburg


Wage: $15.00 per hour to start!


Hours: Monday - Thursday 4:00pm to 8:00pm & Saturday 8:00am to 5:00pm  


We are seeking someone with a positive and energetic personality! In this role, you are the first person our customers meet when they enter through our doors and we want to ensure we provide everyone with a warm welcome and bright smile.

  
Role and Responsibilities:   

  • Answer a high volume of incoming calls on a multi-line phone and direct them to the appropriate department  
  • Responsible for receiving payments (cash, checks, and credit card payments) from customers.  
  • Greet customers with a clear, friendly voice, along with a professional demeanor  
  • Licensing paperwork  
  • Additional duties as assigned  
      

Qualifications and Skills:  

  • Completion of High School  
  • Strong communication skills, professionalism and maturity  
  • Multitasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks  
  • Above average computer skills  
  • Multi line phone experience is considered an asset  
  • Valid G Driver's License and acceptable driving record 
  • Dealership experience is not required, but considered an asset 

 

The 401 Auto RV is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.

title: Administrative Project Coordinator
description:
LMC Healthcare (LMC) is Canada’s largest specialist care provider in diabetes, endocrinology & metabolism. We’re transforming diabetes care by making it more accessible, comprehensive and patient-centric than ever before.  LMC has 15 multi-disciplinary centers of excellence and 20 clinical research sites located in 3 provinces (Ontario, Alberta, and Quebec). Our 60+ Endocrinologists, many of whom are nationally renowned for their areas of expertise, are supported by an interdisciplinary team of highly qualified Medical Office Administrators, Medical Assistants, Registered Nurses, Registered Dietitians, Physician Assistants, Pharmacists, Optometrists, Opticians, Optical Assistants, Chiropodists and Clinical Research Professionals.

Currently, our rapidly expanding team is in need of an Administrative Project Coordinator who can work for us on a permanent full-time basis  at our Head Office location, supporting and reporting to the Chief Medical Officer and Chief Executive Officer. The Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative and project support to the Chief Medical Officer and the Chief Executive Officer, as well as support as needed to other members of the senior management team. 

Responsibilities:

  • Managing the calendar for the executive team
  • Prepare a wide variety of letters, documents, correspondence and biographies
  • Planning and coordinating meetings, teleconferences, and travel (domestic and international)
  • Conduct background research on medical projects; manuscript preparation and journal submissions; reference management
  • Corporate and educational event planning, management and support
  • Recording key management meetings
  • Formatting of reports, presentations and briefs
  • Liaison for document design and printing
  • Support Assistant Medical Director with LMC Continuing Medical Education (CME) Events (e.g. drafting and sending sponsorship request letters, managing list of attendees, scheduling the mailing of promotional material, etc.)

Skills and Requirements:

  • Undergraduate degree
  • 1 - 3 years of administrative or research experience
  • Superior multi-tasking skills
  • Strong writing and research skills
  • Proficiency in Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Adaptable in a fast paced environment
  • Fluency in Pubmed and other scientific search platforms
  • Ability to take initiative and problem-solve independently
  • Required to occasionally work in the evening and weekends
  • Great zoom/webinar organizational skills

Why LMC might be right for you!

  • Competitive Salary
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits
  • RRSP contribution matching
  • Education allowance (days and funding)
  • Ongoing career training and development
  • Employee Appreciation Days Off
  • Additional Holiday Closure

LMC Healthcare values the health and well-being of our employees, clients and patients and as such we have instituted a COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination policy for all employees.  All candidates attending interviews in-person or receiving job offers will be required to provide proof of vaccination prior to entering our facilities. Accommodations will be provided for those who cannot be vaccinated for a reason protected by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

LMC Healthcare is an organization committed to ensuring accessible services and communications to individuals with disabilities. Once an applicant has been selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their accommodation needs known when contacted. If you require accessibility accommodations to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know.

We thank all candidates, however, only those candidates selected for an interview.

title: Corporate Administrative Assistant
description:
Location

North Vancouver

Description

Hatfield has been awardedBC’s Top Employers for 2022and we’re looking for more outstanding people to join our team! We do interesting and meaningful work with opportunities for career and professional growth. We also offer a competitive compensation package, flexible work hours, vacation allowances, and comprehensive health benefits including extended health coverage, an employee and family assistance program, and a RRSP matching plan.

Hatfield Consultants is seeking a Corporate Administrative Assistant to support our corporate management and operations teams. This is a full-time position based out of our North Vancouver head office. Reporting to the Hatfield COO, the ideal candidate will have strong administrative, organizational and written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to maintain a realistic balance among multiple and sometimes conflicting priorities. The Corporate Administrative Assistant will have the ability to work independently and must be able to work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of activities and confidential matters with discretion.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide general support to senior management on a broad range of administrative tasks;
  • Provide follow-up and support for ongoing or outstanding matters and action items identified by the senior management;
  • Organize and coordinate internal and external meetings and events;
  • Assist with subcontractor management including generating draft agreements and monitoring compliance via a tracking system;
  • Coordinate training and professional development activities and maintain training and professional development records;
  • Track and maintain key renewal files for various insurance coverages, including E&O and General Liability and other professional memberships and licenses;
  • Provide back-up for front desk coverage and duties when Receptionist is away; and
  • Assist the administration team to operate effectively and efficiently and assist with other administrative duties as required.

Education and Experience:

  • A degree or diploma in a business-related field with 5 years relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Qualifications:

  • Broad knowledge and experience of general office and administrative practices and logistics;
  • Strong organization skills and an ability to prioritize work, multi-task, and work under strict deadlines;
  • Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to work well with others from all levels of an organization;
  • Intermediate user of Microsoft Office Suite; and
  • Familiarity and experience with corporate legal governance is an asset.

Hatfield is committed to employment equity and workplace diversity. We strive for equity, inclusiveness and diversity, irrespective of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression or disability.

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV describing your experience and salary expectations in confidence through the online form or email:

resumes@hatfieldgroup.catsone.com

(no phone calls please). Please indicate“Corporate Administrative Assistant” in your subject line. Due to the volume of applicants, only short-listed candidates will be notified but we will retain your resume for any future openings.
