title: Intermediate Project Assistant
description:
30703BR

Requisition ID:


30703BR


Business Unit:


NAU


Job Description:


- Provides clerical and administrative support to the project team members for wastewater treatment plant projects at client site; these tasks may include but are not limited to: organizes and maintains project records, files, and correspondence, copies project documentation as requested; coordinates meeting schedules

- Prepares project correspondence from basic to moderately complex and/or confidential source materials and proofreads for accuracy

- Compiles and computes project data and document control from various sources of a basic to moderately complex nature for staff review and action

- Prepares project presentations as required

- Assists with submitting and obtaining permits and vendor pricing as needed

- Schedules and coordinates project activities such as travel arrangements, business meetings and appointments

- Serve as a liaison between subcontractors/vendors, accounting, and procurement, as necessary to process project invoices

- May administer time cards for field staff

- Work with project managers and management team to resolve issues that arise with projects or clients

- Performs other duties as required.


Job Title:


Intermediate Project Assistant


Group:


WNG


Employment Type:


Regular


Minimum Qualifications:


- High School diploma or equivalent

- 3 years of related experience

- Domestic and/or international travel may be required. The frequency of travel is contingent on specific duties, responsibilities, and the essential functions of the position, which may vary depending on workload and project demands.


Why CDM Smith?:


CDM Smith provides lasting and integrated solutions in water, environment, transportation, energy and facilities to public and private clients worldwide. As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle.


Job Site Location:


Canada - Burnaby (Vancouver)


Agency Disclaimer:


All vendors must have a signed CDM Smith Placement Agreement from the CDM Smith Recruitment Center Manager to receive payment for your placement. Verbal or written commitments from any other member of the CDM Smith staff will not be considered binding terms. All unsolicited resumes sent to CDM Smith and any resume submitted to any employee outside of CDM Smith Recruiting Center Team (RCT) will be considered property of CDM Smith. CDM Smith will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.


Amount of Travel Required:


0%


Assignment Category:


Fulltime-Regular


Background Check and Drug Testing Information:


CDM Smith reserves the right to require background checks including criminal, employment, education, licensure, etc. as well as credit and motor vehicle when applicable for certain positions. In addition, CDM Smith may conduct drug testing for designated positions. Background checks are conducted after an offer of employment has been made in the United States. The timing of when background checks will be conducted on candidates for positions outside the United States will vary based on country statutory law but in no case, will the background check precede an interview. CDM Smith will conduct interviews of qualified individuals prior to requesting a criminal background check, and no job application submitted prior to such interview shall inquire into an applicant's criminal history. If this position is subject to a background check for any convictions related to its responsibilities and requirements, employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history. Criminal history will not automatically disqualify a candidate. In addition, during employment individuals may be required by CDM Smith or a CDM Smith client to successfully complete additional background checks, including motor vehicle record as well as drug testing.

title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
• Support the Proposal Manager, Business Line Capture Managers, and other team members to coordinate proposal management activities and efforts to deliver high-quality bid submissions across various business lines, primarily Transportation & Infrastructure, Buildings & Facilities, and Energy & Utilities.
  • Support the Proposal Manager in coordinating the proposal strategy development, production of proposals and presentations, and leadership through the stages of the Comtech Pursuits Process.
  • Support the Proposal Manager in facilitating the proposal reviews to ensure the bid team stays on schedule, managing bid work-back schedules and task lists, and following up with bid team members on outstanding actions. 
  • Support proposal quality assurance and control efforts, working with the Proposal Manager to deliver a high-quality and compliant bid submission, aligned with all Request for Proposal Requirements. 
  • Coordinate and communicate with internal and external technical and consultant staff to foster ongoing development and coordination of documents.
  • Work with the Proposal Manager to synthesize proposal materials into the final client-ready bid package (proposal production).
  • Support the development and assurance of proposal style guides and consistency of our proposal material.
  • Provide creative support for the design and production of targeted proposal documents.
  • Maintain continuous improvement of the Comtech digital proposal content library/knowledge hub by working with Subject Matter Experts and pursuits team leads in updating content (i.e., project ‘cut sheets’, past performance citations, resumes, methodologies, win themes).
  • Work collaboratively with the assigned Capture Manager(s) and Subject Matter Expert(s) to develop and maintain project profiles/cut sheets and key personnel CVs.
  • Support the documentation of lessons learned, working with the Proposal Manager and Director of Project Pursuits to share best practices and lessons learned across all Comtech business lines.
  • Lead the development of high-quality proposal templates (InDesign and Word) following the company’s branding standards.
  • Other ad-hoc responsibilities as assigned.
  • Reports to the Proposal Manager.


Job Requirements:
  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in proposal/bid coordination.
  • Our ideal candidate has experience using the Adobe Suite (InDesign, Photoshop) as well Visio, PowerPoint, and other software.
  • Must be proficient in working with digital collaboration tools such as MS Teams, Office 365, and SharePoint.
  • Experience in the engineering or business consulting industry would be an asset.
  • Experience with coordinating both Canadian and US public sector proposals is an asset.
  • Bachelor’s degree or College Diploma in Business, Marketing, Arts, Graphic Design or equivalent.
  • Excellent business writing, oral communication, organizational and analytical abilities.

  • Proven ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks successfully.
  • Ability to be able to prioritize work based on changing priorities and deadlines.

title: Splunk Admin
description:
Ideally you will have a minimum 2-3 years of hands-on Splunk administration or engineering experience. Enterprise App experience or exposure to cloud environments is a plus.

A strong background in security operations and/or understanding of security audit and compliance requirements in a highly regulated environment.

This role will work closely with asset owners to define onboarding requirements, and troubleshoot onboarding, reporting and alerting outputs in meeting individual application use case requirements.

A great opportunity to further develop security engineering skills and work with enormous flows of data.

Primary responsibilities:

  • Data Onboarding of Applications into Splunk (full lifecycle from requirements gathering to onboard configuration)
  • Dashboards & Alerting (Email & ServiceNow) (Operational)
  • BAU Dashboard enhancement, Reporting, and Alerting
  • Assets and Identity management
  • Splunk ITSI would be an asset

title: Administrative Assistant - Operations
description:
Company Description

Make an impact with SGS! With more than 97,000 employees and 2,600 offices and laboratories across the world, SGS is a silent force working hard behind the scenes to deliver quality and integrity to businesses across nine industries. As the world’s leader in providing inspection, verification, testing and certification services, Forbes ranked the SGS Group as one of the world’s top multinationals and one of the world’s most innovative companies. The Dow Jones Sustainability Index has also recognized the SGS Group for its sustainability processes. In Canada, SGS employs over 2,000 team members across 70 locations.

Job Description

Position Start Date: Immediate Opening

On-site work required during the training and few days per week for efficiency purpose.

Location:  Richmond or Burnaby, British Columbia

Specific Responsibilities:

·       Data entry

·       Maintaining records & files

·       Reception duties

·       Boss (oracle) experience

·       Purchasing experience

·       Shipping, receiving experience

·       Typing speed of at least 35 wpm

·       Attention to detail

·       General office and basic machinery knowledge

 

Qualifications

Education: A post secondary education in a recognized administration program would be an asset

Experience: 2 years of previous experience in an administrative role would be an asset.

Proficiency in the use of computer programs:   

  • Microsoft Office
  • Oracle
  • Timekeeper Kronos
  • OIE User
  • Internet Procurement

Successfully pass a criminal background check before his/her first day of employment

Must have and maintain a clean and valid driver’s license.

Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.

Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.

Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.



Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Administrative Assistant.VE - Secretariat
description:
In the secretary of the Community, the person holding the position attends and provides rigorous administrative, clerical and office support to departments responsible for the management of their daily activities. It will be brought to:

  • Participate in the organization of various meetings, conferences and assemblies;
  • prepare various administrative documents and ensure the updating of relevant databases ;
  • Revise and layout documents such as agendas, minutes, etc.;
  • Manage the schedule and agenda of immediate superiors ;
  • classify paper and electronic documents and ensure archiving;
  • Send convocations to people involved for meetings and assemblies, analyze the availability of people and determine the dates of Convocations that match the availability of the majority;
  • prepare, receive and route the paper and electronic correspondence to the data subjects of the department and perform the necessary follow-ups;
  • receive, sort and route the Calls to people involved;
  • support the team in writing tenders and in AF Software required (SEAO, public notice);
  • Produce expenditure allowances and manage the travel of its superior and / or other members of the department;
  • proceed to Displaying the Secretariat documents on the Community website and the publication of notice in the newspaper related to the schedule and the new regulations entered into force;
  • participate in support and communication with elected (transfer information and documentation to facilitate decision-making, followed by the signatures of the conventions, etc.);
  • ensure replacement of the receptionist in his absence.

The required knowledge and skills are:

  • hold a college diploma (DEC) in secretarial, legal secretariat, office automation or any other field deemed relevant to the post;
  • have a minimum experience of three (3) years as an administrative adjoint or in a similar role;
  • Possess an excellent command of French (oral and written) as well as a functional English and strong linguistic revision skills;
  • have a very good command of the Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint );
  • have a sense of organization and management of highly developed priorities;
  • show versatility and flexibility;
  • demonstrate professional ethics irreproachable and a concern for confidentiality;
  • have good interpersonal skills;
  • show resourcefulness and judgment.

Are assets

  • have experience in a role of legal secretary;
  • have experience with paperless board software, in particular Beeon of Ico Solutions;
  • have programming skills and customization software customization (configure and administer databases in Microsoft Access; Configure macros in Microsoft Excel; Create a SharePoint site, etc.);
  • have worked in the corporate secretariat of a public body;
  • have knowledge of the municipal environment.

title: Coordinator, Office Systems & Administration
description:
About PDAC:

The Prospectors & Developers Association of Canada (PDAC) is the leading voice of the mineral exploration and development community, an industry that supports 719,000 people in direct and indirect employment, and contributes $106 billion to Canada's GDP every year. Representing over 4,400 members around the world, PDAC's work centers on supporting a competitive, responsible, and sustainable mineral sector. The annual PDAC Convention is the world's premier international event for the minerals and mining industry. In recent years it has attracted more than 25,000 people from 135 countries in live format and close to 8,000 in virtual format. PDAC fosters an employee environment of flexibility and collaboration.

 

The Opportunity:

PDAC is looking for an enthusiastic, resourceful and collaborative team player who enjoys challenge and variety. Reporting to the Manager, IT & Administration you will be handling a wide range of tasks to ensure the smooth and efficient running of the PDAC office systems. You will be engaging with vendors and suppliers for sourcing and ordering of office supplies, equipment and services. The successful candidate will have a positive attitude and will be driven by supporting people and resolving problems as they arise.

 

What You Will Do:

  • Receive and evaluate requests for assistance from staff related to office systems;
  • Provide support with the operation and maintenance of all office systems included but not limited to computer hardware and software, telephone and video conferencing systems, web based applications etc. Escalate or engage vendors as necessary to resolve issues in an efficient manner;
  • Train or assist team members with technology as needed;
  • Research products and services, collect quotes and provide recommendations to increase efficiency, productivity and/or cost-savings;
  • Oversee and maintain various accounts;
  • Partake in the setup, orientation and training of new team members;
  • Coordinate with building management and vendors on facilities and maintenance issues;
  • Maintain up-to-date record of office furniture and equipment;
  • Monitor inventory of and order office supplies and stationery as needed;
  • Assist with basic updates to the PDAC website;
  • Assist with onsite meeting room setup as needed;
  • Undertake other duties, as required, dependent upon the needs of the association.

Qualifications Required

You have:

  • College degree in a relevant field of study or a combination of equivalent education, job related training and /or experience;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience working in a similar role;
  • Advanced knowledge and/or experience working with Windows systems, MS Office, web-based applications;
  • Ability to diagnose and analyze technology issues and willingness to persist while searching for short and long term solutions;
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills in English;
  • Experience with website and graphic design is an asset;
  • Knowledge of or experience with database administration is an asset

You are:

  • Analytical thinker with strong attention to detail and focus on problem solving;
  • Resourceful team player with ability to maintain integrity, confidentiality and accountability;
  • Self-motivated learner with demonstrated organization and time management skills;
  • Able to work well independently and as part of a team;
  • Capable to adapt and thrive in changing environment.

This position will be working remotely from home until the PDAC office reopens. The PDAC office is located at 170 University Avenue, Suite 800, Toronto, Ontario.

Applicants are requested to submit a cover letter and resume to Applicants@Bromelin.ca.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

The PDAC is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. The PDAC, will provide, on request, accommodations for disabilities to support your participation in all aspects of the recruitment process

title: AGENT ADMINISTRATIF
description:
Description de l'emploi


Voir au-delà des chiffres MC
À la Banque Laurentienne, nous croyons que nous pouvons changer l'expérience bancaire pour le mieux. Fondée à Montréal en 1846, la Banque Laurentienne aide les familles, les entreprises et les collectivités à prospérer. Aujourd'hui, nous comptons plus que 2 800 employés qui travaillent ensemble, comme Une Équipe, pour offrir une vaste gamme de services financiers et de solutions axée sur le conseil à nos clients partout au Canada et aux États-Unis. Nous obtenons des résultats en plaçant nos clients au premier plan, en faisant le meilleur choix, en agissant avec courage et en croyant que chacun a sa place.

Ce poste est à pourvoir au sein de Banque Laurentienne, une filiale de Banque Laurentienne Groupe Financier.

Le titulaire de poste appuie le directeur afin d'assurer le bon fonctionnement des activités des opérations de services aux entreprises au sein de la Banque Laurentienne. Le titulaire est responsable de supporter ses collègues dans les cas plus complexes pour l'analyse, l'administration et le traitement quotidiens des produits financiers conformément aux normes, politiques et procédures de la Banque Laurentienne. Il est également responsable de la maintenance et de la mise à jour des rapports, ainsi que de la réponse aux demandes des clients internes et externes concernant les produits administrés au sein du département, tout en assurant un niveau constant de service client supérieur.

Responsabilités


º Assure un support aux agents de l'équipe pour la gestion des priorités et des cas plus complexes.
º Passe en revue l'intégralité, l'exactitude et l'ambiguïté de tous les documents et demandes.
º Analyse, administre et traite les transactions financières et non financières propres au produit, conformément aux normes, politiques et procédures de la Banque Laurentienne.
º Détecte les irrégularités dans les demandes à traiter et propose des solutions pour procéder aux transactions en fonction des exigences du secteur d'activité.
º Soumet des recommandations pour améliorer les processus de travail.
º Gère les priorités des tâches assignées.
º Recherche, prépare, traite, concilie et assure le contrôle de la qualité de toutes les transactions financières et non financières exécutées.
º Gère les dossiers des clients, assure une extraction efficace des documents et archive les fichiers fermés pour un accès facile.
º Recherche et répond aux demandes de renseignements des clients internes et externes concernant les produits et les problèmes de traitement et entretient de bonnes relations de travail avec les clients internes et externes.
º Escalade et fait des recommandations à l'autorité appropriée sur toute demande de renseignements ou toute question dépassant leur portée.
º Propose des solutions à tout problème rencontré dans son travail et maintient l'efficacité et la qualité au premier rang de ses priorités.
º Vérifie l'exactitude, la clarté et l'exhaustivité de son propre travail et du travail des autres membres de l'équipe du département, et veille au respect des audits internes et externes et des exigences réglementaires.
º Effectue la charge de travail quotidienne dans les délais impartis par les Services aux entreprises de la Banque Laurentienne et règle les problèmes avec le superviseur.
º Participe aux réunions de département et contribue au processus de planification pour atteindre les objectifs du département et personnels, ainsi que communique tout problème ou toute préoccupation.
º Se met à jour concernant la législation, les politiques et les procédures relatives aux produits et services.
º Participe à des projets spéciaux et exécute toute autre tâche similaire ou générale à la demande de son supérieur ou qui peut être requis par ses fonctions.

Qualifications


º Diplôme d'études collégiales en administration ou dans un domaine connexe.
º Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle liée à l'administration ou au traitement, de préférence dans une institution financière.
º Bilinguisme à l'oral et à l'écrit (Français et Anglais).
º Grande capacité à gérer les priorités des demandes.
º Connaissance des produits bancaires commerciaux (prêts hypothécaires, prêts à l'investissement, autres prêts et autres produits).
º Excellent souci du détail et de la précision.
º Doit posséder des compétences intermédiaires à avancées en MS Excel. Connaissances informatiques de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel et PowerPoint) et d'Outlook indispensables.
º Familiarité avec des systèmes de bases de données et capacité d'apprendre les fonctions de recherche dans les systèmes de traitement de back-office.
º Bonnes compétences interpersonnelles.
º Excellentes compétences en matière de service à la clientèle et aptitude à communiquer efficacement des informations.
º Capable de travailler dans un environnement à volume de travail élevé avec des délais extrêmement exigeants.
º Solides compétences en organisation, gestion du temps et multi-tâches.
º Très motivé par le désir de réussir et de progresser.
º Capacité à travailler efficacement avec les autres dans le cadre d'une équipe.

Renseignements supplémentaires


Équité, diversité et inclusion
Nous sommes fiers d'être un employeur respectueux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, nous nous engageons à favoriser un environnement de travail inclusif et accessible qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et de nos communautés. Nous accueillons et encourageons les candidatures de personnes de tous les groupes, y compris les peuples autochtones, les femmes, les minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées, indépendamment de la race, de l'origine nationale ou ethnique, de la couleur, de la religion, de l'âge, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité ou de l'expression de genre, de l'état matrimonial, de la situation familiale, des caractéristiques génétiques, du handicap ou tout autre motif protégé par la loi.

Accessibilité
Des accommodements pour les personnes en situation de handicap sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats, et ce, tout au long du processus de recrutement.

LPRDE
Nous pouvons recueillir, utiliser ou divulguer vos informations personnelles dans le but d'établir une relation de travail avec vous.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

At Farm Boy, it is our mission to create a fun, fresh experience for all! Whether you are a team member or a customer, Farm Boy is passionate about creating a unique fresh food shopping experience and ensuring that we deliver on our commitments.

As we continue to grow within Ontario, Farm Boy is excited to welcome new team members that share our passion for providing the best fresh shopping experience!

Job Description

The position is responsible for supporting the retail team by performing various administrative and clerical duties.  The performance of the duties must ensure a quality service approach to all employees, customers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Farm Boy Way.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for assisting with department inventory i.e., uniforms, office/store supplies.
  • Responsible for assisting with the organization and maintenance of confidential store-level files.
  • Assist with recruitment administration in SmartRecruiters, including screening candidates and scheduling interviews.
  • Preparation and presentation of new hire documents, including participating in orientations.
  • May be required to assist with payroll functions including timecard corrections and reporting.
  • Responsible for logging invoices as well as ensuring the corresponding paperwork is attached to the invoices.
  • Coordinate with Finance and Store Manager regarding queries on invoices.
  • Responsible for contacting employees regarding any schedule changes.
  • Provide assistance with the organization and maintenance of the employee Training Master.
  • Responsible for printing, posting, collecting, and filing of SOP’s, sweep logs, high touch sanitation sheets and Covid screening logs.
  • Ensure that scheduled periodic reporting is sent out on time and accurately.
  • Assist with ad hoc requests like preparation of name tags, assisting employees with locker information, etc.
  • Assist employees on filing expense reports, secure necessary approvals and submit for reimbursement.
  • Coordinate meetings for Store Manager / Regional Director / Vice President and take minutes when required.
  • Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and share with appropriate stakeholders.
  • May be requested to undertake other related duties to support our stores.
Qualifications

  • Typically requires completion of a post-secondary education with an emphasis in Office Administration plus a minimum of 2 years related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Above average interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.
  • Superior customer service skills with ability to handle complaints and communicate calmly and professionally.
  • Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.
  • Superior time management and organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
  • Positive, team-oriented attitude and ability to work with minimal supervision and solve problems.
  • Ability to handle confidential materials in a sensitive and appropriate manner.
  • Reliable, responsible and adaptable to change and learning new tasks.
  • Fluency in both official languages would be considered an asset.
  • Able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and holidays as required.

Work & Sensory Environment:

  • Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines
  • Performing extensive and repetitive data entry
  • Sitting for long periods of time at workstation
  • Possible exposure to eye strain from computer terminals
  • Exposure to distractions cause by open office noise and frequent interruptions


Additional Information

Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Discover what you’ve been missing!

Snore MD is a world class sleep clinic that’s expanding in BC. We combine 5 star patient care with an exceptional team-first environment to provide a select few, highly qualified individuals, a truly unique opportunity to take their careers to – a – whole – new – level!

Accepting highly qualified applicants for an Administrative Assistant position in our Kamloops Sleep Apnea Clinic. Full time, weekdays 9-5

Snore MD proudly offers:
  • $20-$24 per hour, with plenty of room to grow
  • Extensive and unique benefits package worth:
    • $4,300 in yrs 2-3, $7,300 in yrs 4-7 & growing to $14,700 in yr 12+
    • including medical, dental, vision, RRSPs and health club memberships
  • A positive, team-first culture where you’ll feel right at home
  • A ‘Changing Patients Lives’ mission that will inspire you daily
  • Extensive online and in-clinic training program to ensure your success
  • A 10+ year career where you’re appreciated, rewarded and you truly enjoy it!
Responsibilities:
  • General Administrative duties
  • Post journal entries
  • Accounts receivable & payable
  • Reconciliation
  • Prepare and submit weekly/monthly reports
  • Update financial data in databases to ensure that information will be accurate and immediately available when needed
  • Assist Accounting Manager in the preparation of monthly/yearly closings
Experience in accounting and basic bookkeeping is an asset but not a requirement

 
Snore MD – Administrative Assistant – Kamloops

Admin Assistant/Bookkeeping/Accountant/Administrative Assistant/Accounts Payable/Accounts Receivable/Accounting Technician/Jr Accountant

title: Office Assistant
description:
Job description

 

Summary: The Office Assistant is primarily responsible for supporting various members of the team in completing Data Entry, Filing, Marketing, Customer Service and Administrative tasks. This includes accurately filing physical and virtual documents, entering accounts payables, answering the phones, general data entry and additional office duties as required.

The office assistant is to work diligently to help maintain smooth office operations and is also reliable and hardworking with great communication skills.

Core Competencies

  • Adaptability
  • Dependability
  • Communication
  • Organization
  • Follows Laws, Rules and Regulations
  • Time Management
  • Teamwork

Job Duties

  • Answering and transferring of incoming telephone calls
  • Scheduling service calls and projects
  • Co-ordinating and planning company events
  • Marketing
  • Organizing & Scheduling Training Documents
  • Accounts Payables / Accounts Receivable
  • Filing and data entry
  • Maintain safe working conditions and adhere to all company policies, employment standards, occupational health and safety regulations
  • Assisting with HR duties as required
  • Other duties may be assigned as required.

Requirements

  • Ability to work independently and/or in a team atmosphere within a busy environment
  • Flexible, with solid interpersonal skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbally and in writing
  • Attention to detail
  • Very good organizational and multi-tasking abilities
  • Familiarity with office procedures and basic accounting principles
  • Working knowledge of office devices and processes
  • Very good knowledge of MS Office
  • Experience working with QuickBooks is an asset
  • Cleaning and Organizing the office and shop areas
  • Light outdoor Maintenance and gardening duties

Work Conditions

· Physical ability to lift to 20lbs over head

· Standing or Sitting for extended periods of time

· Work both indoors and outdoors

· Must follow our Covid-19 Prevention Policies and Procedures

title: Real Estate Office Assistant
description:
We’re looking for a driven and dedicated real estate administrative assistant to join our growing team. Your job will be to complete and file the appropriate paperwork for transactions, oversee important deadlines and notify clients when necessary, adhere to legal and tax withholding requirements, and coordinate schedules for final walkthroughs and other appointments. You’ll also work with the team to manage the production of all marketing materials and facilitate local events to foster connections with people in the community. Our ideal candidate has superb organizational skills, a knack for customer service, and a strong understanding of the real estate transaction process. Does this position interest you? Apply today!!
Compensation:

17 - 20 hourly

Responsibilities:
  • Respond to customer needs with urgency and attentiveness
  • Take part in employee development programs to strengthen existing skill sets in real estate administration
  • Monitor deadlines and provide notices to appropriate parties when necessary
  • Comply with tax withholding processes and legal requirements
  • Compile and distribute weekly/monthly reports and communicate key results to the rest of the team to ensure company goals are being met
Qualifications:
  • Flexible working schedule to accommodate clients on nights and weekends
  • Must have high school diploma or GED
  • Possesses a basic understanding of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and customer database systems
  • Either already has or is working towards real estate license
  • Background in real estate is required for this position
About Company

Our team has been helping Buyers and Sellers since 2008. We have helped hundreds of clients achieve their real estate goals. We are ranked as #1 in Canada for Century 21. We have received awards and we believe in giving our best representation possible. We are in the business of helping people, we just happen to sell real estate.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Who we are:
Founded in 2001, Vivid Seats (NASDAQ: SEAT) is a leading online ticket marketplace committed to becoming the ultimate partner for connecting fans to the live events, artists, and teams they love. We believe in the power of experiences and are fiercely dedicated to building products that inspire human connections. Named as one of Built In Chicago’s top 10 places to work in 2021, we believe that our People are our greatest competitive advantage. To support our People, we have built a company culture that empowers our employees to embrace challenges, encourages unity through collaboration, and seeks to constantly evolve by leveraging data and inspiring innovation.

The Opportunity:
As the Toronto Office Receptionist you are the face and voice of the organization. You’ll be responsible for greeting all guests and callers, including answering phone calls, welcoming and directing visitors, and assisting with overall office maintenance. This position will also work with a variety of vendors for tasks such as shipping, deliveries, and building maintenance. To succeed in this position, you must be able to provide general administrative services support, maintain professional communication, have the ability to multitask, work independently, and stay organized. As the point person for all day-to-day facilities operations for our Toronto office space, you will guarantee that everything runs smoothly, identifying inefficiencies before they become a problem and creating processes that are built to scale.

How your role contributes to the success of Vivid Seats:

  • Provide organizational and administrative support for a growing office of 40+ employees.
  • Procure and manage facilities services and vendors.
  • Maintain all office supplies, equipment, and food and beverage offerings.
  • Play a meaningful role in our employee experience journey, creating and maintaining a welcoming, amenity rich, and innovative environment.
  • Oversee Toronto operational needs—including kitchen and office inventory, space planning, security, maintenance, and deliveries—with an eye toward automation and predictability.
  • Distribute company-wide announcements and plan company events and outings, both small and large scale.
  • Ensure all visitors and callers are greeted and routed efficiently and professionally.
  • Manage direct communications with building management regarding items specific to our suite as well as updates regarding the building and local events.


How your role expectations will progress as a Receptionist in the first 30, 90, and 180 days:

30 days in
  • Complete new hire orientation, gaining the resources you need to be successful.
  • Learn how ticket marketplaces operate and how you’ll contribute to providing great experiences for our customers.
  • Acclimate to team and company norms, business objectives, and Vivid Seats values.
  • Meet with Toronto employees to begin understanding their office needs and regular office functions.
  • 90 days in
  • Contribute to our approaches, methods, or technologies to support overall office goals and drive team efficiencies.
  • Maintain, harvest and aid internal and external vendor relationships to improve the office working environment.
  • Champion Vivid Seats values for the Toronto office location and contribute to employee experience and engagement initiatives.

180 days in

  • Apply methods to execute individual tasks that positively impacts the team. Play an active role in continued learnings to advance skill sets necessary for team goals.
  • Evaluate and consolidate vendors to save on office costs and realize efficiencies.
  • Play a leading role in delivering a People Program that impacts the full company of 300+ employees across multiple locations.
What You’ll Bring:
  • Experience in an office receptionist, administration, or related position.
  • Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures.
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks at the same time.
  • Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
  • Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills and the desire to provide the highest level of customer service.
  • Experience or interest in leveraging physical office space to create meaningful employee experiences.

Our Commitment:
We are an equal opportunity employer that values the critical importance of a diverse workforce and sense of belonging. Many of our roles have flexible requirements and we encourage you to apply regardless of whether you meet every qualification.
Vivid Seats provides competitive compensation; bonus incentives; FLEX PTO; mental health days; medical, dental, and vision insurance; 401K matching; monthly credits and discounts for attending live events; remote work and snack allowances; and a variety of additional workplace perks.

Location: Toronto

title: Assistant(e) Administratif(ve)- Emploi d'été
description:

Les ‘étudiants étrangers’ (détenteurs d’un permis d’études) ne sont pas admissibles
Lieu de travail : Hamilton Contrat de 16 semaines à raison de 30 heures / semaine Salaire : 15 $ de l’heure; date de début souhaitée : 2 mai 2022 Responsabilité Générale Sous la supervision de la directrice des Services en soins de santé primaire et communautaire et de la coordonnatrice, l’assistant(e) administratif (ve) assiste les intervenants à la Réception
Il/elle accomplit des tâches de soutien administratif général
Responsabilités Spécifiques : Effectuer des appels téléphoniques Accueillir la clientèle du Centre de santé à la Réception et au téléphone Orienter les clients vers les services appropriés Procéder au dépistage du COVID-19 auprès de la clientèle S’assurer du respect des consignes sanitaires en place Procéder à l'entrée des données électroniques Mettre à jour les dossiers des clients Effectuer les appels téléphoniques nécessaires à la mise à jour des dossiers Enregistrer les rendez-vous de la clientèle Procéder à la désinfection des aires à forte circulation Recevoir, trier et diffuser le courrier Réaliser des tâches générales de bureau telles que le classement, les photocopies, etc
Fournir tout soutien administratif nécessaire aux Services Toute autre tâche connexe jugée pertinente par le superviseur Qualifications, Aptitudes et Exigences Spécifiques : Être âgé(e) entre 15 à 30 ans Excellente connaissance du français et de l’anglais à l'oral et à l'écrit Diplôme d’études secondaires complété ou en cours Diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaires en cours serait un atout Éducation et/ou expérience en informatique ou en secrétariat serait un atout Disponible à travailler une soirée par semaine (jusqu’à 20 h le soir) Capacité d'organiser et de prioriser les tâches Excellente aptitude à la communication avec la clientèle de tous âges et toutes origines Excellentes connaissances de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc
) Bonnes compétences interpersonnelles Capacité de respecter la confidentialité Flexibilité quant aux heures de travail Fournir une vérification du casier judiciaire pour le secteur vulnérable satisfaisant (si âgé de plus de 18 ans) Veuillez nous envoyer votre lettre de motivation et votre CV en français ou en anglais Le CSCHN souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi
Des mesures d'adaptation aux besoins des personnes handicapées sont offertes sur demande par le CSCHN
Nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature aura été retenue pour une entrevue

International students' (with a study permit) are not eligible
Location : Hamilton 16 week contract with 30 hours per week Salary: $15 per hour; desired start date: May 2, 2022 General Responsibility Under the supervision of the Director of Primary Health Care Services and the Coordinator, the Administrative Assistant assists the Receptionists
He/she performs general administrative support duties
Specific Responsibilities: Make telephone calls Greet the Health Centre's clientele at the reception desk and on the telephone Refer clients to appropriate services Screen clients for COVID-19 Ensure compliance with the health regulations in place Perform electronic data entry Update client files Make telephone calls to update files Record customer appointments Disinfect high traffic areas Receive, sort and distribute mail Perform general office duties such as filing, photocopying, etc
Provide any necessary administrative support to the Services Any other related duties as deemed appropriate by the supervisor Specific Qualifications, Skills and Requirements: Must be between 15 and 30 years of age Excellent knowledge of French and English, both written and spoken High school diploma completed or in progress College or university degree in progress would be an asset Education and/or experience in computer or secretarial skills would be an asset Available to work one evening per week (up to 8:00 p
m
in the evening) Ability to organize and prioritize tasks Excellent communication skills with clients of all ages and backgrounds Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc
) Good interpersonal skills Ability to respect confidentiality Flexibility in terms of work hours Provide a satisfactory vulnerable sector criminal record check (if over 18 years of age) Please send us your cover letter and resume in French or English
The CSC is committed to the principle of equal access to employment
Accommodations are available upon request
Only those selected for an interview will be contacted

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

We’re looking for an administrative assistant to support a busy commercial property management office!

RESPONSIBILITIES

Customer Service
  • Complete tenant maintenance requests in a timely manner; take action on complaints if needed
  • Coordinate Move-in/Move out inspections with tenants
  • Develop and maintain an excellent line of communication among building operators, staff, management, contractors and tenants and other external parties; maintaining excellent working relationships
  • Communicate any unusual operational issues to the appropriate Property Manager
  • Assist in setting up tenant functions and events

Administration and Reporting
  • Update capital reports
  • Assist property managers in the organization and follow-up on tenant renovations and improvements
  • Prepare tendering and contract documents and assist in the preparation of formal leases, offers to lease and other documentation as required
  • Cross-train for vacation/sick day coverage of AP/AR and Tenant Services Coordinator roles
  • Assist in due diligence of property acquisitions as needed
  • Communicate and/or send out tenant advisory notices
  • Assist with the set up and maintenance of a computerized preventative maintenance program (ANGUS)
  • Assist with budget preparation and reporting
  • Perform various administrative duties including typing, filing, expense reports, travel arrangements, etc
  • Other duties as required 

QUALIFICATIONS
 
  • 2+ years of experience working in an administrative role
  • Post-secondary education in related discipline
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office products (MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint
  • Knowledge of Yardi will be considered an asset
  • Eager for exposure to a fast-paced commercial real estate office
  • Ability to deal with confidential/sensitive issues using discretion
  • Excellent problem solving, organizational, interpersonal, and time management skills
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills
  • Proven analytical ability and judgment skills;
  • Adaptable and eager to thrive in a dynamic work environment with tight deadlines and support a multi-person team with a professional and service-oriented attitude

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Administrative Assistant -Kitimat, BC
description:
Job Description

As site Administrative Assistant you will be responsible for the following:

  • Receive and monitor Notice of Inspections (NOI’s)
  • Schedule, track and monitor daily inspection activities.  Maintain tracking spreadsheet and calendar.
  • Set up surveillance assignments as required
  • Provides clear and concise assignment instructions to the field inspectors in accordance with client instruction(s)
  • Print documents for inspectors and client
  • Assist with any travel, transportation, tools required by inspectors
  • Other administrative functions as assigned by management and team leads. 
     

Qualifications

  • Have received a high school/GED or higher education
  • Ability to multi-task and work under time constraints is critical
  • Strong computer software and database skills – specifically with Word and Excel.
  • Must be self-motivated with good organizational and time management skills. 
  • Ability to work with a high volume of e-mails in Outlook including bulk e-mails, sending/setting reminders and following flags.
  • Be able to read, write, and speak English.


Intertek offers a culture where motivated, customer-oriented employees can flourish, experience professional fulfillment, and reach their highest potential. We offer a salary and benefit package competitively placed within the local market, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, RRSP with company match, tuition reimbursement and more.

title: Office Administrator (Vaughan)
description:
Job Title

Office Administrator

Department

Office Administration

Reporting to

Office Manager

Hours

7:00 am to 4:00 pm or as required


About:

Our client has been an industry leader in intensively managed security solutions for clients across Canada and the United States for over 20 years. We are currently expanding our team and have an opening for a highly motivated individual with excellent organizational and communication skills combined with the ability to multi-task in a high-paced environment.

 

General Role Description

We are seeking a flexible problem solver with superb communication skills with a detail-oriented mindset to fill our client's Office Administrator position. With prior experience thriving in an administrative capacity in an office environment, you will be responsible for a variety of tasks, including but not limited to, managing, and coordinating the logistics of the installation calendar, working closely with leadership team to handle scheduling of projects and meetings, and ensuring the facility is organized and operationally efficient.

Candidates with the unique ability to handle the unexpected and multitask are strongly encouraged to apply.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Scheduling meetings as requested
  • Managing the logistics of the installation calendar
  • Create agendas and take meeting notes
  • Managing the administration of all related documents
  • Prepare calendar takeout
  • Organizing and reviewing Alarm.com reports daily
  • Managing customer support mailbox
  • Handling all incoming calls
  • Managing incoming and outgoing mail
  • Other administrative and clerical duties as required

 

Work & Education and Experience Requirements:

  • 1-2 years experience working within an administrative position.
  • Diploma or bachelorâ€™s degree in business administration or equivalent is considered an asset

 

Key Skills & Core Competencies:

  • Effective communication (Manager/Client)
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Organized and Efficient
  • Commitment to Excellence
  • Problem Solving
  • Time management

 

Mandatory Requirements:

The successful candidate will be required to provide a clean Criminal Background Check for the past 5 years from Canada upon hiring.  At this time, we will not be accepting applications outside of the Province of Ontario. The successful candidate must be legally able to work in Canada.

title: Newcomer Program Assistant - Canada Summer Jobs (2022-722-CP)
description:
Employment Type:

Contract (ending September 2nd, 2022), Bargaining Unit,

2 Vacancies â€“ 41 Chauncey

Work Hours:

35 hours/week

Salary:

A - $15.36/hour

Application Deadline:

Open until filled

Program Overview â€“ Adult Settlement Services, Community Programs

WoodGreenâ€™s Newcomer Programs & Services has served newcomers and refugees in Toronto for over four decades. Its mandate is to help newcomers and refugees settle, adjust, and integrate into society. Funded by the three levels of government, WoodGreen Newcomer Programs & Services operates English language training programs, settlement services, employment support programs, mentorship, networking activities, and social and recreational activities. Newcomer Programs & Services is committed to providing friendly and professional services to all newcomers to help them connect with Canadian society and their new way of life.

 

What You Will Do

  • Conduct research on programs and services that are available to newcomers within WoodGreenâ€™s Toronto West Local Immigration Partnership (TWLIP) catchment area and compile all the information.
  • Work with Settlement Counsellors to support newcomer related workshops and events.
  • Conduct outreach activities to strengthen the relationship between WoodGreen and its partner organizations.
  • Assist the TWLIP team with development of research tools, data collection, and data analysis.
  • Conduct appropriate outreach in the Toronto West area to engage community stakeholders to support the needs of the community.
  • Collect, compile, and analyze program evaluation results and assist with summarizing key findings.
  • Provide administrative program support including; organizing program related information and materials, data entry, filing, and front desk duties.
  • Update Agency and Program Marketing material as per branding guidelines.

 

Must meet the participant requirements under the Canada Summer Jobs Agreement with Employment and Social Development Canada as outlined:

  • Is between 15 and 30 years of age (inclusive) at the start of employment;
  • Is a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person on whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and;
  • Is legally entitled to work according to the relevant provincial/territorial legislation and regulations.

 

What You Bring to the Team

  • Experience in community engagement and outreach.
  • Understanding of newcomer issues, barriers, and services to support these needs.
  • Excellent attention to detail; strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, research, and analytical skills.
  • Ability to use all MS Office applications, including Power Point, Outlook, Word, and Excel.
  • Ability to work within a team environment with limited supervision.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, learn quickly, adapt, be flexible and resourceful with the ability to set and meet deadlines and targets.  

 

What Will Set You Apart

  • Post-Secondary education in Social Services/Human Services/Immigration and Settlement is considered an asset.

title: Administrative Assistant-Office (NOC 1241)
description:
One (1) permanent full-time position of Administrative Assistant-Office (NOC 1241) available at Autolinx Logistics Inc. located at 375 Market Drive, Milton, ON, L9T 3H5.

 

Main Duties to be completed as per the lead statement of NOC 1241:

 

  • Determine & establish important role in the administration of the company, ensuring the procedures & routines are followed.
  • Provide various administrative & clerical support including including mailing, scanning, faxing, copying, record keeping, billing, invoices and maintaining hardcopy & electronic filing system.
  • Prepare & compile reports and records including correspondence, drafts, memos and emails.
  • Open, sort and distribute incoming regular and electronic correspondence and other material.
  • Coordinate the flow of information internally and with other departments of the company.
  • Coordinates with transportation safety department for safety measures to be followed.
  • Maintain calendar, schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments and travel arrangements for Managers,
  • Schedules and confirms maintenance and repair work.
  • Orders office supplies and maintains inventory electronically and manually.
  • Drafts minutes of the monthly staff meeting for managerial review.
  • Answers general phone and email inquiries in a professional and courteous manner and direct inquiries to the appropriate staff members.
  • Maintain office supplies for department
  • Must have knowledge of Microsoft tools i.e. Outlook, MS Office, Electronic schedular etc.

 

Requirements:
Minimum One (1) year of work experience
Completion of Secondary School required

Wage rate: $25.00/hour
Hours: 40 hrs/week

title: Awesome Administrative Assistant - Exhibition and LBE - 19 Month Contract
description:
Job Description

Are you a "Problem Solver", a "Fixer", and "Organizer" and a "Doer" who enjoys a fast paced environment, offering Administrative Support to part of the Cineplex Executive Team, than this contract role (19 Months) is for you! 

The National Operations department at our Home Office in Toronto is currently seeking an Administrative Assistant Exhibition & LBE, reporting directly to the Executive Vice President Exhibition & Location Based Entertainment 

What The Role Is:

  • Provide administrative support to the Executive VP Exhibition & LBE, Senior VP National Operations, and two VPs National Operations 

  • Manage and maintain Outlook Calendars, coordinate travel, and complete expense reports 

  • Coordinate onsite/offsite meetings and activities including Agendas, materials, AV, logistics, and catering 

  • Oversee logistics and planning of an annual large-scale 3-day conference, including organizing events, venue coordination, managing budget and invoices, and connecting with Executive VP Exhibition & LBE and Senior VP National Operations, planning committee, and regional teams  

  • Assist in coordinating schedule and logistics for annual Road Show and theatre visits throughout the year  

  • Ensure Exhibition and Location Based Entertainment teams function cohesively and efficiently  

  • Prepare expenditure documents, code invoices, and maintain related tracking 

  • Handle time sensitive projects and confidential files, monitor and maintain timelines for projects and internal processes 

  • Monitor departmental out of office/vacation schedules 

  • Prepare correspondence, reports, and PowerPoint presentations 

  • Manage mail/couriers and maintain files 

 

  •  
Qualifications

What You Offer:

  • Five years of experience as an Administrative Assistant with at least two years assisting at the Executive level  

  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office and basic accounting skills 

  • Intermediate knowledge of expense reporting and accounting systems 

What Sets You Apart:

  • Be a self-starter with the ability to take initiative and work effectively in a team or independently 

  • Have a demonstrated ability to manage effective communication and working relationships with head office, multiple remote offices and theatres throughout Canada 

  • Be detail oriented, have excellent oral and written communication skills, and have demonstrated ability to manage conflicting priorities 

  • Possess a strong guest service focus and have effective interpersonal and time management skills 

  • Use discretion and judgment necessary to treat confidential items and assignments appropriately 

  • Background in theatre management, retail or hospitality environments is an asset 

  • Bilingual in French and English is an asset 



Additional Information

Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable. 

Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

 

Life at Cineplex:

Cineplex is synonymous with entertainment. Known as Canada’s largest and most innovative film exhibitor, we’re so much more than movies - operating The Rec Room, Canada’s favourite destination for ‘Eats & Entertainment’ and Playdium, specially designed for teens and families.

At Cineplex, change and disruption are nothing new. Infusing innovation into everything we do has fueled our evolution as a fully-integrated, diversified and growing organization with exciting career opportunities in our locations and corporate functions. Grow with us, and explore roles in operations, food services, hospitality, digital commerce (CineplexStore.com), digital (Cineplex Digital Media) and cinema media (Cineplex Media), consumer loyalty (SCENE), finance, human resources, technology, amusement solutions (Player One Amusement Group), and more.

Proudly recognized as having one of the country’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, we rally behind our values of Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence. 

We are creative, curious and love thinking big. The next evolution of Cineplex starts here, with you. 

Learn more about our businesses through the links below. 

Cineplex | Cineplex Digital Media |  | Cineplex Media | Cineplex Store | Player One Amusement Group | Playdium | The Rec Room | SCENE 

No Agency Calls Please

title: adjointe administrative / adjoint administratif
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Nous sommes bien plus que votre restaurant du coin. Saviez-vous que d’un océan à l’autre, nous servons nos délicieux produits à plus de 2,5 millions de clients dans plus de 1 400 restaurants chaque jour ou que nous venons en aide, avec grande fierté, à plus de 300 000 familles canadiennes d’enfant malade grâce à l’Œuvre des Manoirs Ronald McDonald?

Informations complémentaires

Principales fonctions

Tâches administratives, répondre au téléphone, gérer l'agenda du franchisé, assistant au contrôleur, archivage, journal quotidien, saisie des données, paie en interne, comptabilité Acomba et système de paie ADP Paie, programme de comptabilité (comptes clients et fournisseurs), fin de mois et année.

Exigences et conditions de travail

Niveau d'études :

Secondaire professionnel (DEP), DEP en secrétariat ou comptabilité terminé

Années d'expérience reliées à l'emploi : 1 à 6 mois d'expérience (ou stage)
Description des compétences : Être capable de communiquer couramment en anglais et en français, écrit et parlé. Avoir des connaissances en informatique, WORD, EXCEL, familier avec les termes et le contexte de comptabilité. Expérience dans la paie serait un atout.

Langues demandées :

langues parlées : français et anglais
langues écrites : français et anglais

Salaire offert : à discuter, selon expérience 
Nombre d'heures par semaine : 40,00
Conditions diverses : 8h30 au 17h00

Statut d'emploi :

Permanent temps plein jour

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
The Canadian Institute of Plumbing & Heating (CIPH) represents the interests of our more than 270 member companies and their over 20,000 employees across Canada. Our members manufacture, sell and distribute Plumbing, Heating, Hydronics, Industrial PVF and Waterworks products and services.

We focus on representing the needs of the industry and ensuring our members are always on the cutting edge. Members get access to unparalleled training, industry news, networking opportunities, and representation.

Job Description

We are looking for a Full Time Administrative Coordinator to undertake a variety of administrative tasks.

To be an excellent administrative coordinator, you must be organized and very detail oriented. Communication skills and multi tasking will set you apart amongst other candidates.

Assist the managers in facilitating the effective management of programs and events according to the association’s standards.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:

· Maintaining the Association database

· Prepare and distribute communications via Campaign Monitor

· Prepare and distribute surveys via Survey Monkey

· Prepare Board Documentation

· Social Media posts (Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube)

· Facilitate webinars through Go To Webinar and Zoom

· General Administrative duties including answering phones and processing mail, preparing courier shipments

Requirements

· Tech-savvy, proficient in MS Office

· Excellent time-management and organizational skills

· Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

· Detail-oriented

· Post-secondary education in related field would be an asset

· Working in a not-for-profit environment would be an asset

· 5 years experience in administrative/coordinator role would be an asset

· Well-organized with multi-tasking skills

· Problem-solving ability

Head office located in Etobicoke (Bloor and West Mall Area)

We offer competitive salary and benefits after 3 months of employment Email Resume and cover letter to Ralph Suppa:

r.suppa@ciph.com

title: Real Estate Office Administrator
description:
We’re looking for a driven and dedicated real estate administrative assistant to join our team. Your job will be to complete and file the appropriate paperwork for transactions, oversee important deadlines and notify clients when necessary, adhere to legal and tax withholding requirements, and coordinate schedules for final walkthroughs and other appointments. You’ll also work with the team to manage the production of all marketing materials and facilitate local events to foster connections with people in the community. Our ideal candidate has superb organizational skills, a knack for customer service, and a strong understanding of the real estate transaction process. Reliable transportation and flexibility in the schedule are needed. Our team offers an exceptional and supportive working environment. We greatly value strong team players. There is plenty of room for growth within our team!

Previous experience working as a Real Estate Administrator in Canada is a MUST.

Compensation:

$42,000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor deadlines and provide notices to appropriate parties when necessary
  • Respond to customer needs with urgency and attentiveness
  • Complete paperwork for all real estate transactions in a timely manner to ensure a deal is closed as quickly as possible
  • Participate in training sessions to improve skills with administrative tasks in the real estate industry
  • Supervise production of all online marketing materials as well as brochures and flyers for events to professionally represent the real estate team
Qualifications:
  • Background in real estate is required for this position
  • Weekend and evening availability
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
About Company

A boutique real estate team specializing in customer care.

title: Commis de bureau (professionnel de l'expérience client) Soutien administratif (Laval, Québec, Canada)
description:
Type de poste : Contrat temporaire 
Numéro de demande: 100182 
Lieu principal : Laval, Québec, Canada 
Emplacements additionnels : Laval 

 

Notre raison d’être
Diversifiez votre carrière au sein du Cabinet.
Travaillez au sein d’un cabinet où le mieux-être est important.
Créez un réseau de collègues pour la vie.
 

Deloitte : une influence marquante. Chaque jour, nous nous dépassons pour faire ce qui compte le plus…pour nos clients, pour nos gens et pour la société.

À quoi ressemblera votre journée type
En tant que soutien administratif, vos principales responsabilités seront de :
•    S’assurer de l’impression de divers documents selon les spécifications reçues. 
•    Traiter et expédier le courrier ainsi que les envois prioritaires.
•    Effectuer les achats à l’aide du système Ariba en lien avec les fournitures de bureau, les breuvages, café, etc.
•    Assurer l’archivage des dossiers et leur destruction selon la ligne directrice en vigueur.
•    Effectuer différentes tâches connexes reliées au travail administratif.
•    Coordonner les demandes d’équipement et/ou mobilier avec les bons départements.
•    Communiquer avec le client si des renseignements supplémentaires sont requis avant d'envoyer la demande aux différents services. 
•    Gérer les attentes des clients et expliquer les démarches.
•    Compilation de factures et codification de la carte de crédit corporative.
 

Renseignements sur l’équipe
Notre équipe de l'expérience client est constituée de Professionnel(le)s de l'expérience client (PEC) qui offre des services de grandes importances dans tous nos bureaux. Les professionnel(le)s de l'expérience client livrent une expérience à la clientèle exceptionnelle et un service exceptionnel alimenté par une attitude positive, un travail d'excellence et une approche novatrice. Notre mandat est de créer un climat accueillant et d'assurer que nos bureaux sont toujours prêts à accueillir notre personnel et nos clients externes.

Assez parlé de nous, parlons de vous
Vous possédez ce qui suit :
•    DEP ou DEC en bureautique ou l'équivalent.
•    Cumulez un minimum de 2 ans d'expérience dans un milieu professionnel.
•    Posséder un excellent français et anglais parlé et écrit.
•    Offrir un service à la clientèle hors pair, tout en respectant la confidentialité du cabinet et de ses clients.
•    Posséder une bonne maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.
•    Avoir la capacité à bâtir d'excellentes relations interpersonnelles et une capacité reconnue à travailler efficacement en équipe.
•    Avoir une attitude professionnelle.
•    Avoir une capacité manifeste à classer les tâches par ordre de priorité, selon leur importance et leur urgence.
•    Détenir de l’expérience à travailler avec des professionnels, dans un milieu où le rythme est rapide et les échéanciers sont souvent serrés.
•    Disponibilité – temps supplémentaire occasionnel

 

Nos valeurs communes

Bien que notre raison d’être nous guide et nous aide à expliquer pourquoi nous existons, nos valeurs communes décrivent les comportements auxquels nous nous attendons les uns des autres au Cabinet.

Elles nous unissent par-delà les cultures et les frontières. De surcroît, elles nous aident à gagner la confiance et le respect de nos principales parties prenantes. Nous nous engageons tous à vivre selon ces valeurs communes, à rester fidèles aux principes qu’elles représentent et à honorer l’héritage dont elles sont issues. Elles sont ce qui nous distingue et ce qui caractérise Deloitte.

Chaque jour, nous incarnons notre vision grâce à cinq valeurs communes :

  • Ouvrir la voie : en plus d’être un chef de file au sein de la profession, Deloitte la réinvente pour l’avenir. Nous nous sommes aussi engagés à créer des occasions et à ouvrir la voie vers un monde plus durable.
     
  • Servir avec intégrité: Deloitte mérite la confiance des clients, des organismes de réglementation et du public depuis 175 ans. Le maintien de cette confiance est notre responsabilité la plus importante.
     
  • Prendre soin les uns des autres : nous nous entraidons, et accordons la priorité au respect, à l’équité, au perfectionnement et au mieux-être.
     
  • Favoriser l’inclusion : nous excellons lorsque nous favorisons une culture inclusive et que nous souscrivons à la diversité sous toutes ses formes. Nous savons que cela attire les meilleurs talents, favorise l’innovation et nous aide à offrir des solutions bien équilibrées aux clients.
     
  • Collaborer pour avoir une influence mesurable : nous démontrons un esprit de collaboration en misant sur le travail d’équipe entre les services, les régions géographiques et les compétences afin d’avoir une influence tangible et mesurable.

 

 

La balle est dans votre camp

L’idée de travailler pour l’unique cabinet vous tente? 

Chez Deloitte, nous avons à cœur de faire des affaires de manière inclusive – cela commence par une diversité parmi les collègues de toutes les compétences! Deloitte encourage tous les candidats qualifiés qui représentent la diversité des collectivités partout au Canada à soumettre leur candidature. Cela comprend, sans s’y limiter, les personnes handicapées, les candidats des communautés autochtones et les candidats de la communauté noire qui souhaitent incarner nos valeurs, participer à la création d’une culture de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion, et contribuer à notre engagement envers notre Plan d’action pour l’accessibilité notre Plan d’action pour la réconciliation  et l’initiative BlackNorth

Nous vous encourageons à communiquer avec nous à

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement dans le cadre du processus de recrutement (y compris d’autres formats de documents, des salles de réunion accessibles ou d’autres accommodements). Vos commentaires sont les bienvenus!

Votre candidature sera évaluée en conformité avec les Normes mondiales de Deloitte en matière de talents. Nous avons conçu ces normes pour fournir une expérience client Deloitte exceptionnelle et uniforme partout dans le monde.
Deloitte Canada compte 30 bureaux et est présent dans la plupart des régions du pays. Nous reconnaissons que nos bureaux sont situés sur des territoires traditionnels, des territoires couverts par des traités et des territoires non cédés faisant partie de l’île de la Tortue, et que ces territoires sont toujours habités par plusieurs membres des Premières Nations, des Métis et des Inuits.Nous sommes tous des peuples visés par un traité.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM RECYCLING?

Take recycling to a global scale.

Join us in our mission to recycle more than 3 000 000 tons of metal every year across the globe. At AIM Recycling, we recycle metals to the maximum of their capacity. For more than 80 years, we have been uniting our strengths to make a positive difference. Join our team to contribute to our company’s growth and to support our recycling activities in North America.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

Job Description

  • Filing cooperate records/documents
  • Closing tickets
  • Shipping trucks / containers & finalizing shipping paperwork
  • Schedule trucking/containers requests
  • Using various software including word processing and spreadsheets,
  • performing office duties that includes managing reports & other duties assigned
Qualifications

  • 1 years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Have some knowledge of Scrap Metal grades is an asset
  • Professional level verbal & communication skill
  • in depth understanding of MS Office including Excel, Word, Etc
  • Ability to organize a daily work load by priorities
  • Must be able to reach deadlines in a fast paced environment
  • A proactive approach to problem solving with strong decision making skills


Additional Information

  • Permanent, full-time position 
  • Group insurance after three months
  • Group RRSP after six months

Join our team to contribute to our company’s growth and to support our recycling activities in North America.']

title: Adjoint(e) administratif(ve) avec profil microédition
description:
Ambioner est à la recherche d’un adjoint administratif avec un profil microédition et hypermédia et un intérêt en marketing. Nous cherchons un candidat polyvalent, minutieux et organisé, qui aiment travailler en équipe.

  • Réaliser et mettre à jour divers supports marketing.
  • Mettre à jour les réseaux sociaux et le site Internet.
  • Préparer et publier les diverses communications internes.
  • Offrir un soutien administratif à l’équipe de développement des affaires.
  • Fournir et modifier différentes sections des propositions.
  • Coordonner l’impression et l’assemblage des propositions.
  • Réviser différentes offres de services provenant des chargés de compte.
  • Effectuer la réception des appels téléphoniques et l’accueil des visiteurs.
  • Offrir un soutien administratif à l’équipe (réservation, gestion des ressources matérielles, mise en page et révision de documents, gestion des formations, etc.).

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Diplôme d’études collégiales en bureautique (ou l’équivalent).
  • Trois années ou plus d’expériences pertinentes.
  • Excellente maîtrise du français à l’oral et à l’écrit.
  • Bonne maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.
  • Bonne maîtrise de la suite Adobe CS6 (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).

AVANTAGES SOCIAUX

  • Horaire variable.
  • Conciliation travail/vie personnelle.
  • Télétravail (modèle hybride).
  • Assurances collectives, télémédecine, programme d’aide aux employés.
  • Assurance vie et invalidité longue durée.
  • Environment de travail stimulant.
