title: Administrative Assistant - Wealth Solutions
description:
Posting Description:

Aon is seeking an Administrative Assistant

As part of a market-leading team, you will contribute to the creation of tangible results for our clients through the application of innovative and effective solutions within our Wealth Solutions Consulting group at Aon in Montreal, Quebec. As an Administrative Assistant, you will work directly under the direction of the Manager of Administrative Operations and provide support to a team of senior consultants.

Your impact as an administrative assistant

Professionalism

 

  • Demonstrates excellent customer service skills and exceptional attention to detail.
  • Superior writing skills: grammar, punctuation, spelling and proofreading.
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills.
  • Works independently with a variety of individuals and teams.
  • Demonstrates strong organizational and management skills.
  • Displays a professional appearance and demeanour in a casual work environment.
  • Demonstrates discretion in highly confidential matters.
  • Possesses a high degree of creativity and flexibility.
  • Suggests approaches to solving problems.
  • Maintains a high level of confidentiality.
  • Motivated teammate, able to work independently with minimal direction.
  • Able to interact effectively with clients and team members, demonstrating professionalism at all times.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment.
  • Self-prioritizes work and projects; achieves measurable progress by communicating effectively, openly and consistently with managers and team members

Responsibilities

  • Supports an executive level manager, which is a manager who is a member of the executive team.
  • Administrative activities include email management, time registration, full calendar management, research or other special projects.
  • Schedules and coordinates meetings, including room reservations and ordering/delivering food, if necessary.
  • Coordinates logistics for complex on-site or off-site meetings; this may include, but is not limited to, budgeting, travel, room reservations, meeting room logistics and equipment, and catering.
  • Interacts daily with internal and external senior managers and their administrative assistants.
  • Coordinates projects and works independently; seeks answers to questions, demonstrates initiative, uses network of resources to resolve issues.
  • Assists others in understanding or obtaining technology or facility support.
  • Provides back-up assistance to other administrative assistants as needed.
  • Able to compose documents from raw notes or independent knowledge of circumstances.
  • Maintains/updates/organizes categories and data in databases, OneNote or SharePoint.
  • Prepares and produces presentations, correspondence, and related documents, including checking for grammar, punctuation, and clarity.
  • Maintains a flexible approach and demeanour toward assisting others; models, coaches and mentors administrative assistants who aspire to advance to the Senior Administrative Assistant level.
  • Acquires and maintains knowledge of internal network and resources.
  • Possesses a thorough knowledge of the Aon brand identity.
  • Seeks additional responsibilities.
  • Acts as a key resource to the team (i.e. independently seeks answers to questions, demonstrates initiative, uses network of resources to resolve issues, and proactively passes on knowledge to peer network).
  • Strategic, solves problems and establishes procedures that result in process improvements.
  • Records hours accurately and submits them in accordance with company guidelines.
  • Self-prioritizes work and projects; achieves measurable progress by communicating openly with managers and team members in a consistent manner and with the highest quality.
  • Acts as a subject matter expert for internal tools and resources.
  • Other duties may be added based on business needs.

Experience and Requirements :

  • Minimum of three (3) years experience in a similar role;
  • Bilingual (English and French), both written and spoken;
  • Proficiency in MS Office software (Word, Excel and PowerPoint);
  • Punctuality and reliability;
  • Organizational skills, initiative, resourcefulness and attention to detail;
  • Flexibility and team spirit;
  • Demonstrated organizational skills;
  • Ability to work independently with a variety of people.

We offer you

A driven total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to ensuring an accessible online application process for all candidates, including individuals with disabilities, by offering an alternative way to apply for job openings. The alternative application method is only available for those who cannot otherwise complete the online application due to a disability or other need for accommodation

Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce.

Disclaimer:

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time

title: Office Administrator
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

We are seeking an energetic and self-motivated Office Administrator to join our team to perform a variety of administrative tasks. The Office Administrator is someone that represents the executive team in a professional manner, maintains confidentiality, is detail oriented, takes initiative and has the ability to work independently and efficiently.

 

Responsibilities include supporting the Executive Assistant/Office Manager in general office operations, accounts payable, meeting and event coordination, reception relief and other tasks as assigned.  

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in general office administration
  • Administrator for company cell phone account
  • Onboarding and offboarding of employees; orientations, seating plan, distribution lists, welcome packages
  • Accounts payable administration; cheque requisitions and purchase orders
  • Manages monthly office expense tracking
  • Contribute to the daily organization of all common office areas; meeting rooms, copy areas, supply/storage room, lunchroom and kitchenettes
  • Assist in meeting logistics (calendar bookings, catering, registration, room set up, visitor assistance)
  • Assist with event planning and coordination
  • Reception relief as needed, including vacation coverage
  • Member of the office OH&S Committee
  • Administrative support to the Executive Assistant / Office Manager
  • Other administrative tasks for operations and projects as assigned

Reception Relief Responsibilities

  • Greet internal and external guests in a courteous and professional manner
  • Answer main phone line and respond to general inquiries from the public
  • Enforce safety culture by providing safety orientations to visitors
  • Prompt distribution and preparation of incoming and outgoing mail, couriers and faxes
  • Ensure all machines in common areas are functioning and arrange services as required (dishwasher, coffee machines, copiers, printers, postage and reception tablet)
Qualifications:

Education:  

Post-Secondary education in Business Administration an asset

 

Required Skills:

  • 2 years + of administrative and/or reception experience
  • Strong MS Word skills are required - Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Sharepoint knowledge is an asset
  • A high degree of tact, discretion and confidentiality
  • Self-motivated, takes initiative and strong work ethic
  • Ability to work independently with strong organizational skills
  • Experience with purchase orders and accounts payable
  • Excellent communication skills; both verbal and written
  • Excellent customer service skills; professional, friendly, energetic and positive attitude
  • Experience with SAP a plus

Competency Profile

  • Integrity, Trust and Confidentiality
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Detail Orientated
  • Interpersonal Savvy
  • Approachability
  • Time Management

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Office Assistant
description:
Looking for a dynamic opportunity with growth potential? STOP – You've found it!

Are you an organized, outgoing self-starter who understands the importance of excellent customer care? Can you juggle cold calling and scheduling with the greatest of ease? If the descriptions right-hand, apprentice, and go-to sound intriguing - read on. We have a fantastic opportunity for a focused, detail-driven Office Assistant to join our growing team.  

Seize the chance to support a dedicated team, craft a career you love and build your customer service skills with this fulfilling role while earning up to $20/per hr. 

What You Can Expect Day-to-Day

·        Cold calling from the existing customer base to schedule service calls 

·        Answer incoming calls 

·        Oversee Accounts Receivable and other accounting functions

·        Process mail 

·        Establish and maintain both hardcopy and computer-based filing systems

·        Service scheduling

·        Perform data entry and maintenance of stored data

·        Ad hoc task

What it Takes 

Minimum Required:

·        IN-OFFICE opportunity – candidates must reside in or around the Brampton area

·        Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

·        Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills (Specifically Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and related IT/computer equipment proficiency 

·        Advanced QuickBooks skills

·        Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

·        Strong ability to multitask and move from project to project

·        Trustworthy, professional demeanor 

·        Ability to work autonomously with little supervision

·        Superior analytical skills, ability to prioritize and anticipate next steps 

·        Strong typing skills

Preferred:

·        College Degree or related experience in Business Administration or Marketing

·        Former administrative assistant experience 

·        Experience in the service industry 

 About Us – We are Committed to Your Success 

We are committed to your success. Premier Lift Equipment is a material handling company operating out of Brampton Ontario Canada close to Bramalea City Centre. We offer a competitive package, dynamic work environment, collaborative team, and space to learn, grow and thrive. If you are a hardworking, customer-driven professional looking for your next team, let’s start a conversation. Www.premierliftequipment.com. Apply today.

title: Education Administrative Assistant
description: ENQUIRIS is looking for an energetic and enthusiastic Education Administrative Assistant to provide support for day-to-day operations, writing documents and connecting with clients, schools and educators. This position works directly with our managing directors.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant, Wealth Management
Halifax – Job #2002

Who we are:

Canaccord Genuity (CG) is a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry:  wealth management and capital markets.  CG is driven by an unwavering commitment to build lasting client relationships – we achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional, and corporate clients through comprehensive wealth management solutions, and investment banking services.  We are a leading independent wealth management firm in Canada, and the leading mid-market provider of investment banking advisory, equity research, sales and trading services for corporations and institutions.

We pride ourselves on understanding our clients’ needs and finding innovative, bespoke solutions.  Our entrepreneurial and friendly team will challenge you to learn and grow every day.  We value great work and collaboration and strive to eliminate bureaucratic thinking.  We’re looking for talented people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to have an impact with innovative ideas and best practices.

Come be a part of our Canadian success story and help deliver superior experiences for our clients. At CG, we recognize that diversity across our business strengthens our client relationships and enables more innovative solutions.  We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. CG provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.

Our Canadian operation, Canaccord Genuity Corp., is currently looking for an energetic, ambitious, detailed, and organized individual to join our Wealth Management team in Halifax.  The successful candidate’s role will support a Wealth Management team in establishing and maintaining strong client relationships. 


Responsibilities:
 
  • Provide day-to-day administrative support to the Investment Advisor and team as needed;
  • Willing to complete relevant licensing requirements;
  • Coordinate business meetings, conferences, and travel arrangements;
  • Assist with providing high level, priority management and calendar management;
  • Prepare or assist in the preparation of business correspondence, presentations, reports and spreadsheets; 
  • Assist with processing expense reports in a timely and accurate manner;
  • Assist with maintaining various databases, records and other documents;
  • Assist with marketing activities and social media;
  • Servicing clients with professionalism, efficiency and upholding confidentiality;
  • Perform general administrative duties;
  • Assist with special projects as required.

Skills & Qualifications:
 
  • CSC, CPH and licensing with IIROC or willingness to complete licensing;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills complemented by exceptional interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to demonstrate a high level of discretion and confidentiality;
  • Detail oriented with strong organizational skills;
  • Excellent prioritization skills with the ability to excel under pressure;
  • Excellent teamwork skills complemented by the ability to work well independently;
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint;
  • Knowledge of Dataphile and NetX 360 is an asset.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Colonnade BridgePort is a full-service real estate company, offering property management and leasing services, acquisition, development, investment management and asset management for commercial and residential properties.

We take the time to understand our clients’ objectives then apply our real estate expertise and market knowledge to drive better performance.

Colonnade BridgePort is headquartered in Ottawa with offices in the Greater Toronto Area (“GTA”), our continued growth and expansion has created an opportunity for an experienced full-time Administrative Assistant located in GTA or Ottawa.

Administrative Assistant

Reporting to the Director, Investment & Asset Management, the Administrative Assistant as part of the Investment & Asset Management team will be responsible for providing administrative and investor relations support to the Investment & Asset Management team. As an integral member to the team, this individual will enable the team to provide a superior level of service to investors and institutional clients by ensuring deadlines are met and regular investor communications are managed on a proactive basis. A key requirement of this role are superior organizational skills and attention to detail.

This is an exciting opportunity for an individual with exceptional multi-tasking, organizational, and communication skills to provide support in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. They will make a difference through utilizing their strong decision-making skills, attention to detail and high level of professionalism while working independently.

So that you know what to expect on any given day, you’ll be doing one or all of these things:

  • Support the IM/AM team by preparing for investor and business-related presentations and/or meetings.
  • Assist and coordinate internal and external team and investor meetings by scheduling, managing deadlines, managing communication, and assembling investor financial packages (i.e. annual reports, monthly updates, quarterly reports, investor pitch decks) and other meeting materials.
  • Draft professional and articulate responses to routine emails, memo’s, correspondence, presentations, etc.
  • Act as a resource and liaison with outside organizations and all levels of management, staff, etc.
  • Coordinate and request appropriate follow-up with Investors for missing documentation or signatures on behalf of the team. For example, updates to financial statements, signatures on loan documents, status updates, and sign off/approvals on recommendations made from asset managment.
  • Record and draft meeting minutes, as well as required post-meeting follow up.
  • Maintain investor lists and documentation on an ongoing basis.
  • Review the Asset Management Agreements for private equity limited partnerships in order to set up timelines, due dates, and consistency in reporting structure and deliverables.
  • Create and maintain methods of documentation, such as forms or templates for investor presentations, annual general meetings, quarterly updates, and email communication.
  • Assist in preparation for AGM meetings by coordinating the documentation process.
  • Maintain a confidential and accurate filing system.
  • Assist, coordinate, update, and track ongoing and ad hoc special projects and associated documentation.
  • Perform general administration support such as tracking, compiling, and submitting expenses.
  • Other duties as required.

The Qualifications we would like you to bring to the position include:

  • 2 or more years’ experience in an administrative or relevant role
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Communications, or relevant discipline
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Strong communication skills, written and verbal, with all levels of any organization
  • Superior organizational, problem solving, and time management skills
  • Attention to detail and pride in producing quality work is essential
  • Experience in real estate, transaction management, Private Equity or Investor Relations considered an asset

The above statements reflect the general details considered necessary to describe functions of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in the job.

Colonnade BridgePort provides a dynamic work environment and offers a competitive salary and benefit package.

In recognition of its obligation to take all necessary precautions to protect the health and safety of its employees, Colonnade BridgePort has introduced a mandatory policy that requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for everyone working in or visiting its properties. Accordingly, an offer of employment will be conditional upon the successful candidate providing proof of full vaccination. Exemption requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated on valid medical or human rights grounds.

Colonnade BridgePort welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Location



Bay Adelaide Centre - 333 Bay Street, Suite C131



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




Reporting directly to the Assistant Property Manager, this position is responsible for all accounts receivable functions, as well as providing administrative services to the Bay Adelaide Centre team.




RESPONSIBILITIES:



+ Responsible for Accounts Receivable functions performed at the property level; including c ommunication/collection of current rents, service requests, percentage rents and tenant billings.


+ Assemble pre-bills, year-end packages and financial reports as required.


+ Prepare meeting minutes, memos, reports, etc. as required.


+ Provide general back up administrative support to Management Office staff.


+ Prepare Contract comparison forms, maintain Contract files and assist with Tender process.


+ Support Axiis app and Social Media administration.


+ Maintain existing and create new tenant files; hard and soft copies.


+ Responsible for administration of tenant mailboxes and Canada Post records.


+ Provide back up support to receptionist.


+ Involved in special projects as required.


+ Provide manager support with all meeting management and file management activities including coordinating meetings, sending invitations, booking space, filing, archiving, mail distribution etc.


+ Assist co-workers in daily tasks and special projects, ensure deadlines are met for day-to-day duties.





SERVICE/PERSONALSKILLS:




The ideal candidate for this position must be service driven with excellent interpersonal, communication (oral & written), organizational and computer skills. Friendly and courteous with a professional image, this candidate must be detail oriented, self-motivated and resourceful with the ability to work independently with little supervision. Must be team oriented and able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills are critical for this role.




EXPERIENCE & TECHINCAL SKILLS:



+ Minimum 3 years’ experience in Property Management administrative capacity.


+ Excellent telephone manner and customer service skills.


+ Aptitude to multi-task and be deadline oriented.


+ Ability to learn new technical software applications.


+ Ability to work in a fast paced, team-oriented environment.


+ Accounts payable experience is preferred.


+ Intermediate working knowledge of MS Office applications.


+ Knowledge of Angus and Yardi Property Management Software is an asset.


+ Solid typing skills and knowledge in grammar and business writing required.







EDUCATION/DESIGNATIONS/LICENSES:





+ Minimum High School Graduate






We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Real Estate Administrative Assistant
description:
We’re searching for a diligent real estate administrative assistant. You’ll be responsible for managing all paperwork in a timely manner, notifying clients of approaching deadlines, ensuring each deal goes through the proper legal channels, scheduling appointments and walkthroughs, and providing superb customer service. In addition, you’ll work with other staff members to market our brand and arrange company events in the community. Applicants should be extremely thorough, possess great interpersonal skills, and have basic knowledge of paperwork processes and database management. If this sounds like you, apply today!Compensation:

$30,000 - $50,000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Fulfill client requests for information or other relevant transaction services in a quick and friendly manner
  • Track important dates and time limits for transactions and notify relevant stakeholders as needed
  • Schedule necessary appointments with all parties, including open houses and the final walkthrough
  • Help organize community outreach events to improve our standing in the local area
  • Supervise production of all online marketing materials as well as brochures and flyers for events to professionally represent the real estate team
Qualifications:
  • Communicates well, both verbally and written
  • Understands how to utilize a database for processing client information and how to use Microsoft Office to create necessary documents

Prior experience in the real estate industry

About Company

The Nancy Forlini Team is a leader in the Real Estate industry in Montreal.

We provide Real Estate services in Residential, Commercial, Industrial and Investment.

title: Office Admin (Organized - Detailed - Love to Learn)
description:
We're looking for the right fit and so should you! We all spend so much time with the people with work with - so we better enjoy where we work and who we work with! 

Here are the basics we feel are essential to being a great fit for our company culture and this role specifically. If this sounds like you, we would love the opportunity to dive deeper and tell you all about who we are, our core values, amazing team, aspirations for the best culture in Canada, giving back, where we're headed and more! 


The basics we're looking for: 
 

Â· High Level of Organization: this is CRUCIAL for this role and for your success at our company.

Â· Detail oriented: Your will be involved in work that requires high attention to detail. Taking notes, listening, asking questions and double checking the work you do is extremely important.

Â· High Computer proficiency: Very comfortable on the computer using outlook, excel and other Microsoft products and learning new tools on the computer.

Â· Love to learn/ Growth Mindset: Whether it be new applications required, processes or ways we do things. The learning will be ongoing and continuous with the objective of improving what/how we do, simplifying and reducing complexity!

Â· Resourceful/Outcome focused: Using different approaches where existing donâ€™t work to achieve the end goal

Â· Great listening skills: Whether instructions or to feedback

Â· Positive Attitude/Energy

Â· Team Player/Love to work with others




What this role will handle:

 

Administrative Tasks:

- Answer phones and direct calls to appropriate team members

- Scanning, filing, faxing and filling of documents as needed

- Support Directors and Management with various requests for scheduling calls, meeting setup, etc.

- Joining meetings for note taking and sending out meeting minutes/follow up actions to team members

- Creation and management of all business contacts into outlook system

- Creation of Process documents to create standardization of processes

- Management and Organization of SharePoint site

- Payments to service providers/ vendors or depositing of cheques

- Organizing/Scheduling of activities or work required

 

Offices Maintenance & Supplies:

- Scheduling Maintenance & Service Providers as needed and recurring schedules across locations

- Cost-effective Supplies Ordering for all offices: Automate and Delegate where possible

- Main point of contact for all work/service providers related to BSC facilities

- Identifying cost-effective and efficient Service providers where needed

- Ensuring Clean and organized office spaces: Implementing and enforcing policies where necessary
 

Business Purchasing:

- Purchasing products/supplies/tools as required by the business regularly

- Ensuring receipts and records are kept of all items purchased as required by accounting team

- Ensure items are received and manage returns end to end where necessary

- Communicating with vendor/service providers to resolve issues

- Follow up on outstanding orders and ensuring that purchases are received.
 

Book Keeping/ Data entry:

- Reconciling expenses/receipts by entering into systems to support Accounting department

- regular scanning of documents for accounting purposes

- Inventory tracking

- Reporting or auditing tasks as needed
 

New Employee Onboarding/Support:

- Support in the onboarding process for new team members including but not limited to facilitating tours, setting up employee workspaces, new employee profile creation in our systems, scheduling of tasks required to be completed.


When/Where/Salary

Hours of Operation: 8:30 - 5:30 Monday- Friday

Job Type: Full-time (Looking for long term - because we're focused on long term growth!)

Location: Markham (Highway 404 and Highway 7)

Salary: $50,000.00 based on experience

 




About Us: 

When we jump on a call we'll share even more details including where we came from, our core values that remain consistent, our culture, our amazing team, Our aspirations for giving back, where we're going and more!

But for now, here is a short summary:

Our company is comprised of an amazing team of individuals of diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We are lean in nature and most team members have multi-functioning positions within the company. We recently passed a decade of existence and have experienced tremendous growth and learnings throughout the years. We're extremely optimistic about the future and are certain we will continue to thrive.

We praise new ideas, new methods of doing things and learning what works and what doesnâ€™t. We promote thinking outside the box to solve problems and often look at how we can simplify or automate any process we do, freeing up valuable time of any team members and making tasks easier to complete!

We strive for an ever evolving company culture and team where we learn, grow and have fun with everyone we work with!

We are looking for the best fit candidate to join our journey and grow with us. If you feel the above sounds like a perfect fit for you, we look forward to hearing from you and diving even deeper on the role, company and yourself!

PS- If you read all of this and are really really interested - Add a " HIRE ME :) " in your note to us when you apply.

title: Office Admin
description:
Summary

Dokainish is currently seeking an Office Admin  to join our boutique consulting firm. The Office Admin will be responsible for a variety of administrative and office tasks, including providing assistance to the HR department and to different levels of employees company wide. This position is for full-time employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Responsibilities

  • Assist with administrative duties and provide support to the HR department;
  • Support onboarding new employees into the office through scheduling and being a point of contact;
  • Review expenses, client invoices, and related accounting transactions;
  • Assist with all workstation set ups (computer) and maintenance; Coordinate IT support requests;
  • Act as a point of contact for employee requests and resolve within required timeframe, and direct employees as appropriate;
  • Participate in continuous improvement within role; Research best practices and recommend improvements to existing practices;
  • Provide support to the team and special projects as required;
  • Assumes other activities and responsibilities from time to time as directed.

Education/Qualifications

  • College/university graduate or equivalent combination of technical skills and experience
  • 1 year of experience in Office and HR Administration within a fast-paced corporate environment
  • Maintains a professional appearance, demeanor, and attitude at all times; Able to discreetly handle confidential matters
  • Ability to learn quickly and adapt to change
  • Proactive and able to work independently; A self-starter that shows initiative
  • MS Office proficiency
  • Must be willing to travel
  • Flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required.

About Us

Since 2011, Dokainish & Company has been providing its clients with world class project consultancy services. Our clients have come to expect the highest delivery quality from our staff. Dokainish & Company focuses on all aspects of Project Services within small or multi-billion dollar capital projects.

title: Real Estate Secretary
description:
Our real estate office is seeking a deals secretary who can effectively assist our valued home buyers and sellers from contract to close. You’ll work to make sure paperwork and invoices are sent to lawyers, assist with documentation, and assure offers and paperwork is complete and compliant. Applicants should enjoy data entry, working on a team, and continually learning how to streamline our processes. Sound like something you’d love? Apply now!

Compensation:

$35,000 - $40,000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Look over all paperwork to confirm they have the correct signatures and dates, assuring that the closing process has been done accurately and efficiently
  • Manage transaction contracts from both home buyers and sellers to close the deal in a timely manner

  • Enter deals into Broker Wolf
  • Communicate with Buyers and Seller from Contract to Close, to assist with a smooth transaction
Qualifications:
  • High school diploma or GED required, preferably some college experience
  • Passionate about providing excellent customer service
  • Must have excellent organizational skills and communication skills

  • Trustworthy and discreet
About Company

RE/MAX CARE Realty is the top RE/MAX Owner Real Estate Team in all of Canada. These heights were achieved through the principles of collaboration, hard work, training, and continuous growth. A continually growing and evolving organization, RE/MAX CARE Realty is supported on 3 pillars: Agent Growth, Admin Support, and Marketing. Through this department, we provide a cohesive marketing and lead generation platform and excellent client experience.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Number: 39656 
Group: Magna Corporate  
Division: Magna IT China - Minhang 
Job Type: Fixed Term Contract 
Location: SHANGHAI 

 

Group Description 

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

 

Role Summary

The overall target of the Administrative Assistant is to support VP, IT Strategy & Architecture to finish various tasks and achieve the goals.

Key Responsibilities

•    Manage complex calendars with an understanding of business priorities, coordinate and organize the periodic internal meeting and business activity
•    Book domestic and oversea business trips, including flights, rental car, accommodation etc.
•    Monitor monthly Tower budget results, assisting on yearly budget planning process.
•    Proactive and effective communication with different department and coordinate with the cross functional team.
•    Assistant VP in administrative works.
•    Collect required documents and reports within team.
•    Organize Annual Team Events, assisting on organizing IT Conference.
•    Support other internal required projects.
 

Key Qualifications/Requirements

•    Excellent communication skills, proficient in both Mandarin and English, and ability to effectively interact with senior management.
•    Well organized with high attention to detail.
•    Effective time management and able to prioritize multiple tasks.
•    Good team player with strong interpersonal skills, capable of working within a globally diverse team.
•    Excellent PC skills
 

Knowledge and Education

Bachelor's Degree or above, no limitation on major.

Work Experience

Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.

title: D'assistante administrative
description:
Company Introduction:


30 Minute Hit is a fast paced, action packed boxing/kickboxing & self defense based circuit style workout designed just for women. As a company we pride ourselves on the quality of instruction we provide to our clients, and on our ability to foster a motivating, fun, and inclusive community of women. Our goal is to provide an unparalleled experience and to show each and every one of our members how amazing they truly are.

Overview:


Vous êtes intéressée à faire partie d'une équipe positive et accueillante? Vous recherchez une qualité de vie avec un emploi près de la maison avec un horaire flexible? Nous désirons vous rencontrer!


Le poste d'assistante administrative est un poste clé au sein de l'entreprise, étant la première image et le premier lien de confiance établi avec notre clientèle.


Nous sommes à la recherche d'une personne parfaitement bilingue, énergétique, et débrouillarde afin de se joindre à notre équipe dynamique.


Les tâches principales qui vous seront attribuées sont :


La gestion des rendez-vous, des paiements et des communications aux clientes.

Gérer les courriels entrants et sortants

Rédiger les diverses correspondances et autres documents

Effectuer des tâches administratives de base dans le bureau.

Toute autre tâche connexe.


Les compétences que nous recherchons sont :

Avoir de l’expérience en service à la clientèle 

Personnalité dynamique 

Binlingue 

La capacité de travailler dans un environnement rapide

La capacité à apprendre rapidement

title: Administrative Coordinator- Proposals Team
description:
About TEKsystems

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

 

Overview

TEKsystems’® unmatched success in the IT Services and Talent Management marketplace is driven by one thing – our employees. Consistently recognized as a top workplace in a thriving IT industry has caused us to grow at a rapid pace. We offer great opportunities for advancement, personal and professional growth, and unlimited earning potential.

 

We are seeking an Administrative Coordinator to support our growing Proposal/Security Team. This individual will be a great multi-tasker with excellent communication skills. They will support our team by managing a central inbox, writing and distributing emails and documents, and coordinating daily website searches.

 

Don’t worry. No IT or industry experience is needed. We’ve got that covered. Our comprehensive training program allows you to learn terminology, job functions, and applicable practices within the industry.


Responsibilities

What you will contribute:

  • Providing administrative support to ensure efficient operation of the team;
  • Coordinating daily searches of tendering sites and distributing opportunities to other team members across the country;
  • Managing a centralized inbox, distributing emails and documents to the right people;
  • Downloading and saving documents and maintaining a filing system;
  • Compiling data and organizing/tracking trends and statistics;
  • Sending monthly reports to be updated
  • Providing ad-hoc support to the Proposal/Security Team, including but not limited to:
    • Packaging proposal submissions;
    • Creating new documents based on existing templates;
    • Formatting proposal content as required; and
    • Filing and managing a document library.

Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

  • Professional experience using in MS Office (Word, Outlook, Excel), Adobe PDF and web browsers
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize work
  • Excellent writing, reading, and comprehension skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Must show initiative and eagerness to learn
  • Must have ability to obtain a Government of Canada security clearance

 

Extra points if you have:

  • College Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in a related field
  • Prior experience managing and distributing emails from a central inbox
  • Eagerness to learn and use new digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace       


The Opportunity

  • Growth potential with various career paths for Proposal Management professionals
  • The opportunity to learn, and in turn train and mentor others
  • Diverse and inclusive team culture

The Perks

  • Remote work with the option to work in our downtown office
  • RRSP Matching Program
  • Annual bonus and profit sharing
  • Tuition reimbursement – up to $5,000 annually
  • Charitable and social responsibility opportunities

We are an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, genetic information, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. To view the EEO is the law poster click here. Applicants with disabilities that require an accommodation or assistance a position, please call 888-472-3411 or email 

mpowers@teksystems.com

. This is a dedicated line designed exclusively to assist job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response. For information on H-1B non-immigrants working at various US locations see Labor Condition Applications (“LCAs”) under the Career tab above.

title: Business Office Coordinator
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

"Sunrise is the best place that I've ever worked, simply because of the people. We provide quality care in an environment that feels like home. Our focus is doing what’s right for the resident. For me, that’s a big breath of fresh air."- Sunrise Leader 

 

At Sunrise, our Business Office Coordinator is responsible for assisting the community with business administration, human resources and system related business processes.

ABOUT SUNRISE

Sunrise Senior Living has championed quality of life in senior care for more than 30 years. We believe team members are our greatest resource and are looking for people who share our commitment to provide quality care for seniors and their families. It's no surprise that many of the world's leading experts in Senior Living entrust their career to Sunrise. At Sunrise, you will…Make a Difference Every DayWe are passionate about our mission — to champion quality of life for all seniors. We deliver high-quality care with a personal touch and encourage our residents to enjoy life to the fullest. 

 

Be Part of a Uniquely Supportive CommunityThe care-focused environment we create for residents extends to our team members. We offer programs, rewards, and benefits to help you live your best. 

 

Ignite Your PotentialWe believe potential has no limits. We offer best-in-class leadership development programs designed to grow our leaders. We are committed to helping our team members achieve their career goals. Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work®

RESPONSIBILITIES & QUALIFICATIONS

 Responsibilities:- Establishing ongoing procedures to collect and review information needed to assist in billing and accounting support services to meet business performance results, deadlines and reporting- Following the monthly accounting calendar to ensure all financial data expectations and deadlines are met- Processing bi-weekly payroll, responding to payroll developments, trends, regulations and business controls- Maintaining team member personnel information, including payroll processing, updating personnel files/binders and training records- Championing the team member on-boarding and welcome orientation process- Maintaining training records and ongoing data entry into training system- Partnering with the Executive Director and other team leaders to form teams, encouraging strong team member engagement, morale and spirit- Clearly and professionally communicating and conveying information and ideas in a manner that engages the audience- Following Sunrise programs and policies for overall quality care in support of our Foundational Beliefs- Completing training and independent study programs designed for the BOC position according to curriculum guidelines- Completing state-required training per regulations 

Qualifications:- Must possess a dedication to seniors and a positive can-do attitude along with demonstrated skills in: - Business computer applications, including Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel) as well as the ability to learn new computer applications- Organization, time management, problem solving/resolution, and decision making- Written and verbal communications and a willingness to facilitate small group presentations- Interpersonal skills- Financial/business principlesCandidates with the following experience are preferred:- PeopleSoft, ADP, Kronos, ProCard and/or BASIS - Associate's or Bachelor's degree

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Reporting to the Director Coordinated Access, the Administrative Assistant, Home and Community Care provides administrative support and confidential services to maintain efficient operations of the department. Areas of responsibility include business requirement coordination under limited supervision in a team environment to ensure the effective management and relationship building of the department within Home and Community Care Support Services Mississauga Halton.

Start Date:     as soon as possible

Category:         Permanent Full-time

Location:        Mississauga Office, 2655 North Sheridan Way (currently working virtually)

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provides organized and proactive administrative support to the Home and Community Care department(s) (Director/Managers/Consultants) including preparation, review, processing and distribution of correspondence, presentations, reports, information packages, briefing materials, or background documents
  • Acts as a liaison with counterparts across Home and Community Care Support Services or the province on matters involving committees the Director/ Manager/ team chairs or participates on
  • Prioritizes and manages the Director/ Manager calendar, sets up meetings on his/her behalf and resolves scheduling conflicts and makes adjustments as necessary based on changing needs and priorities
  • Maintains files and confidential records to ensure corporate compliance
  • Discusses issues, recognizing and bringing forward the urgent issues to the Director/Manager’s attention and forwarding to the appropriate parties for resolution
  • Set up for meetings, books boardrooms, office equipment, catering services as needed
  • Receives, reviews and prioritizes incoming mail, referring materials to appropriate teams for action as appropriate and follows up on outstanding items
  • Handles inquiries from internal and external sources; gathers background information and coordinates routine inquiries on own initiative as required
  • Handles logistics, travel arrangements, and accommodations for events, seminars, meetings, and other Director/ Manager engagements and prepares monthly travel expense claims
  • Edits and maintains the internet/intranet for the department
  • Inputs, updates  or collates patient data for Home and Community Care statistical reporting
  • Takes clear, concise meeting minutes at management, team and other committee meetings
  • Liaises with other Administrative Assistants and Executive Assistants as necessary to resolve administrative problems and ensure the smooth running of the department
  • Participates on internal and/or external committees as required
  • Supports the team and works with team members to ensure department needs are met including absence coverage
  • Performs other related duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Post-secondary Certificate or Diploma in Business/Administration/Secretarial Program, general administration or related field (or equivalent combination of education and experience)
  • Two (2) to three (3) years’ experience providing administrative support to formal leaders (e.g., knowledge of the formal and informal protocols and methods of supporting senior-level staff)
  • Demonstrated experience with administrative procedures, processes and standards
  • Ability to use a variety of software programs, databases and programs including proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite
  • Flexible, adaptable and responsive to change
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information in a discreet and professional manner
  • Demonstrated ability to integrate information from a variety of sources into effective briefing materials, presentations, reports and summaries
  • Detail oriented, well organized and able to manage time and multi-task to accomplish a variety of tasks, sometimes with conflicting priorities and timelines
  • Strong data entry skills with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Basic project management skills

All applications will be reviewed; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Home and Community Care Support Services values the health and safety of its employees and is committed to the prevention of COVID-19 exposure and transmission of infection to employees, patients, caregivers, volunteers, visitors and residents. As a requirement of Home and Community Care Support Services Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all employees must be considered fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (two doses of a two-dose series, or one dose of a single dose series).

Home and Community Care Support Services Mississauga Halton is a respectful, caring and inclusive workplace, committed to Employment Equity.  We welcome diversity in the workplace, and encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities. We will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.  Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant - Employment Training & Post-Secondary Training
description:
The Position

Under the general supervision of the ETAPS Manager and working closely with other support staff, the ETAPS Administrative Assistant provides support to the department Manager as required. Duties include, but are not limited to, attending meetings, preparing agendas, minutes, reports, and in general provide the Manager and staff administrative support to operate the department effectively and efficiently. The ability to take initiative and maintain confidentiality is necessary to succeed in this role; along with the ability to manage multiple and conflicting priorities.

The Candidate:

  • Answer general phone inquiries using a professional and courteous manner
  • Reply to general information requests with the accurate information
  • Use computer word processing, spreadsheet, and database software to prepare reports, memos and documents
  • Meeting Scheduling, agenda preparation, minute taking, distribution
  • Sort incoming mail, faxes, and courier deliveries for distribution
  • Prepare and send outgoing faxes, mail, and courier parcels
  • Forward incoming general emails to the appropriate staff member
  • Purchase, receive and store the office suppliers ensuring that basic supplies are always available
  • ARMS Data Entry
  • Assist with Program and Event logistics, booking spaces, preparing promotional flyers and ensuring appropriate dissemination, and organization food ordering/pick up/delivering/drop off.
  • Code and file material according to the established procedures
  • Update and ensure the accuracy of the organization’s databases
  • Code and file financial material according to established records management procedures
  • Process accounts payable ensuring timelines and accuracy of information
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications, Skills and Abilities:

  • High School Diploma; College or University (Preferred)
  • Post-secondary education in Business, Computers, Administrative Assistant Program or Office Management is an asset
  • 1-3 years’ experience in an office setting
  • Computer skills, Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook, typing 50 w.p.m.
  • Experience answering a multi-line phone system and transferring calls
  • Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy and confidentiality
  • ARMS Data Training is an asset

A full job description is available upon request. If you are interested in the position, send your cover letter and résumé to hr@shishalh.com. This position will remain open until filled. 

Preference will be given to qualified shíshálh band members, community members, and other First Nation’s members, Inuit and Métis. We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest in the position, however only qualified applicants will be contacted for an interview.

title: Project Administrator/Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

Kingspan Insulated Panels North America, a division of the Kingspan Group plc headquartered in Ireland, is a global and trusted leader in the design, manufacturing, and supply of high-performance sustainable building products and solutions for the construction industry. As the most energy-efficient, cost-effective building envelope solutions, insulated metal panels are at the forefront of sustainability. We serve the architectural, commercial/industrial, cold storage and food processing markets, and are committed to delivering the most advanced building products on the market. Learn about our Planet Passionate initiatives: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EEeIS55WMOk
 


At Kingspan, our future success is based on the quality of our people, who's expertise and motivation have helped ensure that we remain at the forefront of the construction materials manufacturing industry. In joining Kingspan you become an important part of a growing organization with a reputation for innovative design and use of technology, technical expertise, product quality, service excellence, and dedication to sustainability.

Ready to be part of our team?  

We are looking for a Project Administrator (Administrative Assistant) for our Langley, BC office!

 

Summary: Responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction through order processing. Assists the Customer Excellence team regarding such matters as order entry, cut list entry, peer check.  

Responsibilities:

Essential Duties:

  • Work collaboratively with Customer Excellence team to ensure the highest levels of customer satisfaction are maintained.
  • Support Project Coordinators and Project Managers for order processing activities.
  • Responsible for entering new orders, add orders, and warranty orders as required.
  • Enter project cut lists as required.
  • Create credit documents as required.
  • Provide order entry review (peer-check) as required to support the team.
  • Provide support to maintain all project information and documentation.
  • Responsible for supporting the Project Managers and Project Coordinators during the project lifecycle.
  • Learn customer excellence processes and tools and support customer requirements.
  • Prepares documents including customized reports and correspondence.
  • Updates various databases as required including Salesforce.
  • Maintain schedules and others reports to track project deliverables, dates, and monitor deadlines.
  • Respond to daily customer calls providing project updates and handling customer needs in a confident, professional manner.
  • Maintain job order files, ensuring all pertinent paperwork is sent to and received from customers, following up as necessary.
  • Formulate/maintain departmental Excel spreadsheets and reports.
  • Create professional written correspondence to customers, both internal and external.
  • Ensure all project close-out documents are sent to customers.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Customer Excellence Supervisor.

 

Qualifications:

Education/Experience:

  • Experience in a Production or Manufacturing Environment preferred.
  • High School Diploma; College preferred.
  • Ability to assist with multiple projects under tight deadlines while dealing with the stress of a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent time management, organizational and follow-up skills.
  • High degree of accuracy and meticulousness about details.
  • A proactive personality with high energy, self-motivation, and strong decision-making skills.
  • Willing and able to work overtime as needed.

 

Computer Skills:

  • Must be proficient in all Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Power Point) and Outlook
  • SAP or other equivalent ERP SAP experience a plus, but not a requirement.
  • Salesforce experience a plus.

 

Other Skills and Requirements:

  • Strong interpersonal skills with a positive work ethic.
  • Good to excellent spelling, grammar, and written communication skills.
  • Excellent telephone and oral communication skills.

 

Physical Demands:

  • The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • Exert up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.
  • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
Employment Disclaimer:

**Kingspan is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

description:
Our culture lifts you up—there is no ego in the way. Our common purpose? We all want to win for our customers. We aim to always be evolving, dynamic, and ambitious. We believe in the power of genuine connections. Each employee is a part of what makes us unique on the market: agile and dedicated.

Time Type:

Regular

Please refer to French posting, this position is in Mtl, Qc.

Montréal, QC

At Cogeco, we know that different backgrounds, perspectives, and beliefs can bring critical value to our business. title: Secretary - TFT - Mental Health
description:
Posting #:2022-892209

Non Union

Position: Secretary

Department: Mental Health

Status:Temporary Full-time for approximately1 year

Hours: Monday to Friday – Days & Evenings,8 Hour Shifts -8:30 to 4:30 (4 days) and 12:00 to 8:00 pm (1 day) (may be required to work some evenings based on operational needs)

Site: Multi-Site (Milton, Georgetown, Acton)

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we take healthcare to a new level to meet the urgent needs of ourcommunity's growing and aging population. We are adistinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

Halton Healthcare’s vision of Exemplary patient experiences, always , goes beyond just the patient experience; it has shaped our entire culture and remains at the core of every interaction in our organization, from our patients & families to our staff, physicians and volunteers. We believe in exemplary PEOPLE experiences always!

This is what you'll be doing:

Provide secretarial support to the psychiatrists,managers,and clinicians of theMental Health Outpatient Program. Duties include, but are not limited to, patient reception - register patients, handle incoming calls and enquiries, accept and pend referrals. General filing and faxing. Set up, maintain and close patient files. Other clerical duties as assigned to meet department needs.

This is what you'll need to do it:

Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.

  • Minimum grade 12 education required.
  • Medical Office Administration diploma from a recognized College and/or recent comparable clerical experience in a mental health setting required
  • Minimum of 1 year relevant experience required
  • Must have Word, Meditech and a willingness to upgrade computer skills as changes to the position
  • Must possess excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication and customer service skills.
  • Skills must include diplomacy, initiative, maturity and judgment.
  • Must be able to prioritize competing demands in a busy, sometimes stressful environment.
  • Must be able to type 30 words per minute
  • Satisfactory employment and attendance record.

Date Posted: February 1, 2022

Internal Applications due by: February 8, 2022

Please apply if you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination and Management Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation. All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Project Assistant Clerk
description:

Dare to join Englobe

title: Administration Intern - Procurement Support (Summer 2022)
description:
Administration Intern - Procurement Support (Summer 2022)Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Smart Power is a global technology leader, with products and solutions that make power supplies smart, connected and protected. Its intelligent products and solutions make power more competitive by improving the energy efficiency, productivity and reliability of almost any operation.Based in Ville St-Laurent, Quebec, the Procurement Support Intern will report to the Team Leader - Planning and Production Follow-up. The intern will work closely with the team members and in direct contact with the production and engineering departments in order to meet deadlines.
This position reports to
Production Manager
Your responsibilities

  • Place material orders and ensure follow-up with suppliers
  • Reconcile invoices in dispute according to purchase orders
  • Follow up on claims and non-conformances
  • Maintain business relations with suppliers
  • Produce the necessary reports for the evaluation of suppliers
  • See to the replacement of defective products
  • Any other related task in connection with these responsibilities.

Your background
  • DEC in Administration or Bachelor in Administration in progress (1st or 2nd year completed)
  • Knowledge of procurement
  • Knowledge of ERP systems
  • Advanced computer skills (MS Office Suite)
  • Bilingualism (French and English) essential
  • Demonstrate initiative, thoroughness and attention to detail
  • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks efficiently

More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Remote #LI-Hybrid

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are currently searching for an Administrative Assistant for our client in the aviation field to support the senior management, primarily including the CEO, for a small-size company in Oakville, ON. This is a full-time role, with potential travel to conferences or meeting clients and it would be an asset if you are Bilingual, English and any other language.

Why is this role important?

The Executive Assistant will be an extension and support to the CEO. You will be making judgement calls on how time is spent, organizing the day-to-day management of general operations with professionalism and time sensitivity and ensuring projects are coordinated well.

Day-to-day activities:

  • Provide daily administrative support to the CEO.
  • Arrange, confirm, and prepare briefings for meetings by obtaining relevant and critical information, materials and research before each session to properly prepare the executive team.
  • Carefully monitor the priorities in the calendar.
  • Arrange travel accommodations and itineraries before trips and conferences, international and domestic.
  • Receive, screen and refer all inbound telephone calls, emails and visitors as required.
  • Manage the executive team’s email; compose emails on behalf of the CEO and provide appropriate follow-ups.
  • Maintain various databases for the office of the executive team.
  • Track all contracts incoming and requiring the executive team’s signature by ensuring the proper staff has reviewed contracts before presenting the agreement for the CEO’s signature; ensure contract requests are followed up on in a timely manner.
  • Maintain high levels of confidentiality
  • Perform other duties as required such as minor personal assistance duties

Who you are:

  • Prior administrative experience is an asset, however not required.
  • Bilingual - English and any other language
  • Post-secondary diploma or degree in Business Administration or relevant discipline.
  • Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks with a sense of urgency and calmness.
  • Advanced written and verbal communication and diplomacy skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment keeping others informed and anticipating needs.
  • Highly discrete and maintains the utmost confidentiality.
  • Comfortable with travel inside and outside of Canada

 

Please submit your resume, and if you are selected for the position to move forward, we will be in contact. Thank you to all applicants.

Inflo HR Ltd. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO), and we welcome candidates from all abilities and backgrounds. We are compliant with AODA legislation and will comply with the accessibility needs of our candidates. Please indicate if you require any accommodations throughout the hiring process.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Administrative Assistant

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses
  • Flextime and the possibility of a compressed schedule

We are currently seeking an Administrative Assistant to work out of our office in Mississauga10109, ON.

Your main responsibilities will be:
  • Apply and promote Englobe’s health and safety rules
  • Providing exceptional customer service internally and externally to employees and clients.
  • Providing project assistance with document correspondence, reviewing, formatting, reproduction, scanning, binding, and filing.
  • Conducting research, compiling data, and preparing documents.
  • Performing administrative responsibilities including maintaining filing systems and databases, managing schedules, booking meetings and travel, maintaining and ordering office supplies, shipping and receiving environmental samples, field gear and documents, recording and distributing meeting minutes.
  • Fulfilling receptionist duties including greeting and assisting clients, accepting and distributing mail, answering phones.
  • Providing accounting support to include: Accounts Receivable, coding and obtaining approval on invoices.
  • Executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans.
  • Performing other related duties as required.

Qualifications:
  • Post-Secondary degree or diploma in Office Administration, Business Administration required.
  • Ability to travel between work-sites locally and within the region as required.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in an administrative role in an office environment required.
  • Experience working in a similar capacity in a Consulting, Engineering, or Science firm would be an asset.
  • Exceptional written and oral English communication skills.
  • Proficient with the use of Microsoft Office program features specifically, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
  • Skilled with the preparation of PDF reports, including links, bookmarks, and searching tools for easy access.
  • Solid understanding of environmental business and service lines.
  • Strong research and writing skills, ability to present information concisely and clearly.
  • Excellent organizational skills, ability to implement and maintain systems of organization.
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines, multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1019

title: Administrative Assistant, Operations
description:
Eventscape has an exciting opportunity for an Administrative Assistant, Operations to join our team. This role will support our Operations Manager and play a critical part in ensuring the effective and efficient operation of our organization. The ideal candidate will be analytical, highly organized, and have the ability to foresee problems and implement and improve processes.

 

WHO ARE WE?

At Eventscape, customization is our focus, architecture is our playground, and fabrication is our expertise. As global leaders in the custom architectural fabrication space, we thrive on challenging design and strive for innovation towards one shared goal: to “build the extraordinary”!

How do we do it? By refining design concepts; by providing expertise on materiality, finishes, details, and fabrication methods; and by embracing R+D as a critical part of each project. Eventscape houses dedicated project managers, design detailers, engineers, fabricators, and installers. All this, combined with state-of-the-art machinery, means we truly are an architectural toy factory—we build things others can’t.

 

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Administrative Assistant, Operations position will:

  • chart, document, and facilitate the development of  new workflow processes, standards, and procedures
  • expand on processes to ensure they have a complete and compliant workflow
  • implement processes and ensure they are being correctly adhered to
  • support management with with process optimization and change management initiatives
  • provide administrative support to the Operations team
  • assist with day-to-day coordination of projects and operational activities
  • coordinate virtual and in-person meetings; prepare agendas and minutes
  • foresee problems and conflicts and offer proactive solutions
  • work with cross-functional teams (Design, PM, Finance, HR, etc.) to support adjacent department initiatives
  • maintain project files in accordance with company procedures
  • monitor project progress and update stakeholders as needed
  • source products and services as required
  • prepare and edit documents, correspondence, and other materials
  • direct phone calls and emails
  • other duties as assigned

 

ABOUT YOU

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 2 years of experience in process implementation
  • outstanding communication and administrative skills
  • a passion for maintaining order and proven organizational skills
  • expert proficiency with Office 365 suite, especially Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • the ability to meet deadlines, manage your time effectively, and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • a proactive approach to problem solving
  • previous experience in engineering, construction, or manufacturing industry an asset
  • experience with ERP/System implementations an asset

 

 

WHY EVENTSCAPE?

  • a fast-paced, creative, collaborative, and highly rewarding work environment
  • access to the state-of-the-art machinery
  • opportunity to work on unique and challenging projects
  • extended health and dental benefits
  • a socially conscious and family-owned company

 

 

APPLY NOW

Apply now with your resume and a brief covering statement.

If you need disability accommodation, contact human resources at (416) 231-8855. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest in Eventscape, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Eventscape is committed to fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, and respected. Eventscape will consider all qualified candidates and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available for all stages of the selection process.
