title: Office Administrator for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
We are currently looking for Office Administrators for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Employee Benefit Program including Medical and Dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Advancement Opportunities

Typical Responsibilities:

  • Daily time entry, including timesheets review and cost coding, for payroll entry and LEM creation of 100+ manpower
  • Review all time entry data changes that affect Payroll processing to ensure accuracy
  • Subcontractor invoice processing for submission to payroll
  • Coordinate with project management on timesheets for contracts and subcontract billings
  • Process daily LEM's for Labour, Equipment and Material for the Client
  • Review third party sub con LEM for client approval
  • Material received and verified against Purchase Orders, and reflected on LEMs
  • Providing daily man counts to ownership, management and client
  • Support project controls and adherence to policies and procedures within the department
  • Support Project Managers and other divisional personnel with document preparation and filing
  • Maintain employee history data records by electronic or manual filing systems while ensuring data integrity and confidentiality
  • Perform other duties as assigned
  • Administers and prepares internal/external cost reports
  • Completes Payroll entry and creates LEM reports
  • High volume receiving responsibilities for LEMs
  • High keying speeds to enter receiving amounts/quantities accurately in accounting system

What you bring:

  • Commensurate experience in administrative role with high volume keying and accuracy
  • Familiarity with time, materials and cost control measures
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excellent MS Office Skill particularly in Excel and Outlook
  • Ability to multi-task, with experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal, communication and customer service skills, with the ability to communicate in a professional manner with tact and diplomacy
  • Effective written and verbal business communication skills
  • Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Dedicated team player
  • Demonstrated ability to handle and maintain confidentiality
  • Previous experience: Administration, Site Administrator, Site Admin, Construction, Oil&Gas

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**

At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 

We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.

Come Grow With Us!

title: Scheduler / Office Admin
description:
Senior Homecare By Angels is hiring a multitasking office professional to assist with all aspects of scheduling for clients and employees. Must love seniors and have excellent computer skills and a winning phone persona. We require a multitasking team player to answer phones, schedule care staff, handle filing and be the first point of contact for clients. You will be required to schedule interviews for potential employees with appropriate qualifications. Maintain computer schedules and ensure timely data entry for schedules and client information. Maintain positive relationships with clients, staff, and referral sources. Must have excellent computer skills and be willing to learn the scheduling program.

The successful candidate will have:

  • a clean criminal record check with the vulnerable persons sector marked.
  • Excellent computer skills.

Those qualified will be contacted for an interview

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant
description:
We are currently seeking a proficient Receptionist/Administrative Assistant who will be the first point of contact for our families in person and on the phone. This position accurately maintains the appointment schedule, directs calls and web-based messages, and provides administrative support to our Funeral Directors and team members. The Receptionist/Administrative Assistant delivers a high level of professionalism and service for which Springfield Funeral Home is known throughout the Okanagan Valley. We are now looking for a part-time/flexible person to join the team.

We offer our team-members competitive wages, excellent benefits and a group RRSP as well an opportunity to work with a great team of professionals committed to serving Okanagan families.

If you would like to be part of a caring team helping families, please apply online by submitting your resume and cover letter to LoveHR.

We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however, you must be here and legal to work in Canada to be considered. We look forward to reviewing your application!



The ideal candidate has the following skills and attributes:

  • 2+ years of experience in a similar role, preferably in a professional, comparable organization
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office; typing speed of 40-65 wpm
  • Works well as part of a team
  • Warm welcoming personality and phone manner
  • Impeccable communication and active listening skills
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Commitment to always presenting themselves in a professional manner
  • Conservative business attire is required
  • Strong organizational skills including prioritization and effective time management
  • Able to work in a fast-paced, busy environment while prioritizing requests
  • Reliable and dependable
  • Self-motivated
  • Experience with Adobe, Photoshop and Illustrator is an asset
  • A genuine desire to serve those in need

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Lynden Logistics is looking for someone who is highly organized and detail oriented to join our dynamic team! 

We are looking for an individual who has the ability to handle interruptions and shifting priorities with ease.  If this describes you…then you are the person we are looking for.

You will provide support to the customer service team and various departments, and perform other administrative functions in an office environment. 

 

 

The Company

Lynden is a family of transportation and logistics companies that provides transportation and logistics solutions in Alaska, Canada, the Pacific Northwest, Hawaii and around the world. We encourage our employees to grow and develop within the company and believe our diverse workforce contributes tremendously to our success.

 

What you will be doing

  • Answering and directing phone calls for customer service and office team
  • Assist customer service team enter orders & returns
  • Providing support to all departments and other administrative staff
  • Perform filing of paperwork and prepare invoices for mailing
  • Acting as an office coordinator for office equipment maintenance issues
  • Maintaining the office workspace and ordering office supplies
  • Planning and coordinating events with our social committee and others
  • Performing other administrative tasks as required 

Responsibilities

What you will be doing

  • Answering and directing phone calls for customer service and office team
  • Assist customer service team enter orders & returns
  • Providing support to all departments and other administrative staff
  • Perform filing of paperwork and prepare invoices for mailing
  • Acting as an office coordinator for office equipment maintenance issues
  • Maintaining the office workspace and ordering office supplies
  • Planning and coordinating events with our social committee and others
  • Performing other administrative tasks as required 

Qualifications

What we are looking for 

Experience:  2 years administrative experience

Education:  High School Diploma or equivalent

Detail Oriented:  Strong attention to detail, high quality of work and accuracy no matter how large or small the task

Organized:  Outstanding time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines

Communication:  Excellent written, oral and active listening skills

Technical Skills:  Proficient in Microsoft Office; Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint,

Collaboration:  Able to work effectively with other employees, departments and companies, both in person and virtually

Why you want to work for Lynden 

Compensation – Competitive pay with a discretionary bonus program

Healthcare – Medical, dental and vision plans

Paid Time Off – 10 vacation days after 1 year of employment

Holidays – 10 paid holidays

The Registered Pension Plan (RPP) – Company funds the plan at the rate of 3.5%

Health and Welfare benefits – Company paid group insurance coverage

 

What you need to know

 

Work Environment:  Corporate office setting

Work Schedule:  This is an in office position, Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 4:30pm, 40 hours per week.  Hours can be slightly flexible, overtime eligible.  Regular attendance and timeliness are essential functions of this job.

COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement:  All employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Other: 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, talk, hear and to handle objects, tools, or controls. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.  The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Lynden International Logistics is an equal opportunity employer

Must pass background check

title: Administrative Generalist - Casual
description:
Position Location: London, ON                

 

 Position Title: Administrative Generalist

 

Position Reports to: TBD

 

Department/Unit Name: Human Resources

 

 

  • limited term & casual positions
  • Flexible hours (7.5-22.5 hours per week depending on department needs)
    The number of positions to be filled has not been identified
  • Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

 

Job Summary: 

Provide administrative support and assistance to the department and/or Director to facilitate efficient operation according to project, corporate, industry and regulatory guidelines and standards. Responsible for the day-to-day management of paper and electronic documents including review, tracking, scanning, filing, and document/file maintenance and retrieval. May need to provide assistance to the department and/or Director for appointment/meeting/travel scheduling, preparation of documents, presentations, correspondence, meeting minutes and/or agendas. May be required to support the Office Coordinators in the monitoring or processing of divisional supplies, equipment, staff absences and/or budget expenses. May be required to provide reception services (phone, e-mail and visitors), general clerical services.

 

Areas of Responsibility: 

 

Project Support

  • Assist functional group to maintain paper and electronic document management, ensuring all documents are reviewed, entered, tracked and filed in accordance with project, corporate, industry and regulatory guidelines and standards.

 

  • Provide information and/or documents to project teams when requested on a timely basis, facilitating the completion, authorization and/or distribution of project related documents, supplies and/or contracts

 

  • Provide input regarding and contribute to the improvement of ongoing document management processes and systems to facilitate the efficient operation of the department.
  • Assist the Total Rewards & Data Specialist on projects as needed
  • Assist in maintaining employee records in the Learning Management System (LMS) and Human Resources Information System (HRIS)

 

Corporate Administrative/Clerical Support

  • Provide support and/or activity coordination for divisional support services; address, redirect and/or provide follow up for inquiries (phone, e-mail, correspondence); coordinate visits/meetings; travel, records, document, data and file maintenance.

 

  • Updating and maintaining document tracking databases, preparing reports, and responding to document inquiries.

 

Qualifications:

Applicants should have a minimum of one to three years of related experience. A minimum of a high school diploma required. The successful candidate must exhibit the following skills: Attention to detail and proficiency in Microsoft suite of products.

 

*Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Samuel, Son & Co. is growing - If you're looking for a rewarding career opportunity with a family run, industry leading organization, bring your experience and motivated attitude to Samuel, Son & Co.!

Here is some of what we have to offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • 3 weeks paid vacation and an annual bonus
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Pension plan with company match
  • Opportunity for fast advancement and career growth

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Relief duties for reception – phones, meeting scheduling, courier admin, scanning/imaging for the plant (Bol, test report, order).
  • Prepare freight statements.
  • Participate in annual physical inventory process.
  • Adjust monthly fuel surcharge.
  • Prepare invoicing for designated branches.
  • Image orders, inbound shipments and other documents.
  • Daily problem solving in ERP system
  • Receiver of Nash Road facility non steel service – testing of material, check invoice coding against packing slip
  • Support teams such as sales, finance and production for adjustments

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High school diploma required.  College diploma or certificate in administration preferred.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience working in office administration supporting sales and operations preferably in a manufacturing environmentProficiency with using Microsoft Office applications (Word and Excel).
  • Experience with ERP systems an asset
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Demonstrated organizational skills and attention to detail

title: Associé principal, Montreal
description:
JOB REQUISITION

Associé principal, Montreal

LOCATION

CAN MONTREAL

JOB DESCRIPTION

À titre d'Associé principal, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes : 

  • Développer et accroître la base clients et de nouvelles occasions d'affaires; 
  • Faire la promotion de nos services par des rencontres en personne, par téléphone ou virtuelles avec des clients nouveaux ou existants de façon à élargir l'utilisation de ces services;  
  • Négocier et de développer des affaires avec des nouveaux et actuels clients;
  • Faire le recrutement, les entrevues et le jumelage de professionnels de la comptabilité et de la finance hautement qualifiés pour faire des affectations contractuelles;
  • Offrir un service à la clientèle exceptionnel aux clients et aux candidats ;
  • Assurer une communication continue envers les candidates ainsi que leurs orientations professionnelles;
  • Participer aux associations professionnelles locales et aux événements de réseautage afin d'accroître la présence de Robert Half dans la communauté d'affaires locale;

Qualifications :

  • Diplôme en comptabilité/finance est un atout;
  • Plus d'un an d'expérience dans le domaine de la finance, de la comptabilité ou de la banque;
  • Plus de 2 ans d'expérience en développement des affaires;
  • Être en mesure de solliciter des dirigeants de petites et moyennes entreprises et de conclure des affaires avec eux, en plus d’entretenir avec eux des relations à long terme mutuellement bénéfiques;
  • Attitude positive et approche professionnelle et engageante;

Top Reasons to Work for Robert Half:

  • EXCITING CAREER OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE INDUSTRY LEADER – For more than 70 years, our history of success and strong client relationships provide a level of stability few companies can match.
  • PERFORMANCE = REWARD – We offer exceptional earning potential and a competitive benefits package, including a base salary; paid time off; group health, life and disability insurance; and retirement savings plans.
  • UPWARD MOBILITY – With more than 300 locations worldwide, we provide excellent career advancement potential, both locally and beyond.
  • TOOLS FOR SUCCESS – We provide world-class training, client relationship management tools and advanced technology to help you succeed.
  • RESPECTED WORLDWIDE – Robert Half has appeared on FORTUNE magazine’s list of “Most Admired Companies” since 1998, as well as numerous “Best Places to Work” lists around the world.
  • OUTSTANDING CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP – We believe in an “Ethics First” philosophy, which means we are committed to social responsibility, promoting inclusion and diversity in the workplace, and actively participating in communities where we live and work. Learn more by downloading Robert Half’s Corporate Citizenship Report at roberthalf.com/about-robert-half/corporate-responsibility.

You may submit your application materials online or call 1.877.912.6253 for additional ways to apply.

Quebec License Number AP-2000503

JOB LOCATION

CAN MONTREAL

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
REPOST

Department: Information Technology
Campus: Barrie
Classification: Support Staff
Posting Date: December 10, 2021
Salary Range: $17.00 - $22.04
Hours per week: Up to 24 hours per week - (Current hours anticipated to be 24 hours per week)
Status: Part-time (Regular)

Reporting to the Director, Information Technology and the Information Technology Managers, the incumbent provides administrative support for the department including frontline customer service, coordinating and supporting meetings, assisting in office procedures. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

• Acting as first point of contact (frontline) for client inquiries (in person, email and telephone) which includes: performing initial triage to determine needs and making referrals when appropriate
• Providing administrative support to the Director including preparing confidential correspondence, managing e-calendar and meeting support, researching projects, scheduling, mail, filing, preparing information / space for new staff, budget assistance and HR paperwork, researching inquiries and or information as required
• Assisting in the maintenance of budget information including verifying costs, chargebacks, reconciling discrepancies, etc., preparing invoices and processing for payment, preparing journal entries, confirming costing allocations and reconciling MasterCard statements
• Coordinating the purchasing process and ordering required equipment
• Creating and submitting submissions to the college news communication as required
• Preparing departmental communications and developing change management materials such as updating guidelines, user FAQs and updating the IT SharePoint sites and teams as required

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Successfully completed a two-year postsecondary diploma in a relevant field of study that may include, but is not limited to office administration or business
• Two years' experience in an office environment providing administrative and general office support to more than one manager (i.e. calendar maintenance, basic accounting, meeting support, purchasing, budget tracking and frontline customer service)
• Proven problem solving and conflict resolution skills
• Experience with data entry and pulling reports from a database
• Experience providing committee support and taking minutes
• Computer skills and experience using Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc.) to answer inquiries, and prepare and maintain information, data bases and HRIS and FIS (preferably PeopleSoft)
• Communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills to answer inquiries and draft documents
• Organizational and time management skills with the ability to multitask to provide day-to-day support while meeting special project deadlines
• The ability to be accurate and detail oriented in order to compile / organize information, prepare reports, and input data
• Proven ability to work independently or within a team environment
• Proven experience working with confidential information
• Experience in an academic institution with knowledge of applicable policies and procedures is an asset

Georgian College supports diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Georgian College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you are contacted to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodations needed with respect to any materials or processes used to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. Alternate formats will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Georgian College has a COVID-19 vaccination procedure in place. As a condition of employment, employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 to work on any campus, or a facility owned, operated or controlled by Georgian College unless they have a valid medical or religious belief/creed reason for not getting vaccinated, which reason will be considered on a case by case basis and which will be subject to the College's accommodation processes.

Applications for this position must be received by 11:59 p.m. January 2, 2022. While we thank all applicants, only those contacted for an interview will be acknowledged.

title: Real Estate Office Assistant
description:
We’re looking for a driven and dedicated real estate administrative assistant to join our growing team. Your job will be to complete and file the appropriate paperwork for transactions, oversee important deadlines and notify clients when necessary, adhere to legal and tax withholding requirements, and coordinate schedules for final walkthroughs and other appointments. You’ll also work with the team to manage the production of all marketing materials and facilitate local events to foster connections with people in the community. Our ideal candidate has superb organizational skills, a knack for customer service, and a strong understanding of the real estate transaction process. Does this position interest you? Apply today!!
Compensation:

$18 - $25 hourly

Responsibilities:
  • Supervise production of all online marketing materials as well as brochures and flyers for events to professionally represent the real estate team
  • Arrange for open houses and other community events to locally spread brand awareness
  • Respond to customer needs with urgency and attentiveness
  • Keep track of all transaction documents in the client database and complete the necessary paperwork
  • Coordinate schedules to ensure optimal open houses and final walkthroughs, travel arrangements, and general appointments
Qualifications:
  • Great written and verbal skills
  • Flexible working schedule to accommodate clients on nights and weekends
  • Has knowledge of Microsoft Office and customer relationship management software
  • Either already has or is working towards real estate license
  • Previous experience in the real estate industry
About Company

Real Estate Homeselling Team is a fast growing real estate team serving the greater Toronto area. We strive to have the highest producing agents in the area! Come join our team!

title: Administrative Associate
description:
• Coordinates documents and gathers and inputs data related to assigned administrative support duties for a team, department, function or other organizational leader/group.
  • Performs activities under a moderate degree of supervision.
  • Provides administrative support by conducting research, preparing statistical reports and addressing routine information requests.
  • Gathers, compiles, and verifies information and enters it accurately into documents such as reports, presentations or forms; and office systems such as databases or spreadsheets.
  • Assists with data collection, data entry and report generation on various departmental related activities.
  • Assists with associate functions such as preparing correspondence, receiving visitors, arranging conference calls and scheduling meetings.
  • Responds to, or redirects, routine inquiries from external or internal sources about the organization/department, its activities, or processes so callers/visitors are answered promptly and accurately.
  • Prepares documentation for payment of vendors, suppliers and other third parties as applicable; submits documentation and enters request for payments into accounting system; responds to inquiries from accounts payable and payees.
  • Documents and maintains departmental policies and procedures.
  • Participates as a team member on departmental related business improvement assignments and projects as needed.
  • Performs other routine administrative activities as needed per the established procedures of the organization and/or department.
  • The candidate will be answering emails, ordering engine parts, filing paperwork, and doing reconciliations.
  • They will be handing a lot of paperwork.
  • They will be a customer supporter and must be organized, a self-starter.
 
Requirements
  • They should have prior administrative experience.
  • They will need to have basic computer knowledge and be able to manipulate/modify Microsoft office suite (including teams).
  • Excellent communication skills – Written/email and verbal.
  • High school diploma. 
 
As an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA prides itself on creating an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons regardless of race, color, gender, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, or disability.

title: Receptionist / Administrative Assistant
description:
Brookfield Properties, Office

At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. Itâ€™s a feat that wouldnâ€™t be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings donâ€™t simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities â€” but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations â€” bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. Itâ€™s why the worldâ€™s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If youâ€™re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Prior to the first day of employment with Brookfield Properties, successful candidates must be fully vaccinated and are required to provide proof in the form of a government issued record.

DESCRIPTION:

This front-line position is responsible for providing exceptional reception and administrative services to the team at Bankers Hall. The ideal candidate will be able to understand and emulate Brookfieldâ€™s Commitment to Outstanding Service by providing this level of service to all internal and external customers on the phone and in person.  This position demands flexibility and a high degree of organizational skills to manage a variety of priorities and changing deadlines.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide reception services including greeting, screening, directing visitors and telephone calls. Handling telephone messages and receiving/redirecting incoming mail, faxes, deliveries, and courier packages. Managing email ensuring that all requests are actioned professionally and in a timely manner.
  • Manage the office inventories to include:
    • Stationary
    • Kitchen Supplies
    • Tickle Trunk
    • Appreciation Gift Cards
  • Work with the Assistant Manager Tenant Services to order supplies as required
  • Maintain tidiness of kitchen, boardroom, printer, filing and reception areas
  • Maintain the office filing system ensuring that the filing area is organized on a weekly basis.
  • Manage the database of contacts both for tenants & contractors ensuring that contact lists kept current and are audited quarterly.  This includes inputting contact information in LiveSafe and managing that database
  • Meeting Coordination:
    • Maintain meeting schedules for the boardrooms ensuring that the rooms are cleaned and ready before each meeting
    • Set up the laptop as and when required
    • Place catering orders when requested to do so
    • Managing RSVPs for various events
    • Assist assigned manager in coordination of â€œFirst Fridayâ€ and other staff events
  • Administrative support:
    • Prepare letters, memos, mail merges, spreadsheets and other documents when requested
    • Take minutes at meetings when required and ensure that minutes are prepared in a timely fashion post meeting
    • Communicate and schedule with contractors regarding food court tenant monthly maintenance and update the monthly tracker.
    • Manage the tenant anniversary database ensuring that anniversary cards are prepared & gifts are ordered
    • Manage registration for BOMA events & annual membership renewals for BOMA members 
    • Preparation of staff birthday, life events, leaving cards & gifts
  • Accounting Support:
    • Prepare purchase orders for departments when required
    • Processing of payables in Yardi specifically for administration & security but also other departments when needed
    • Reconciliation & submission of P-card & T&E card reports monthly for multiple departments
    • Collection of monthly Retail Sales Report and input into Yardi
    • Accrual preparation
  • Work Authorization Permits
    • Process and track all access permits, related insurance certificates and WCB clearance letters same day of receipt of the permit
    • Distribution of approved permits daily
    • Send copy of approved permit to requestor
    • Handle incomplete permits, invalid insurance and WCB with the requestor working towards a successful outcome
    • Ensure an accurate filing system for both permits and insurance documents
  • Monitor Angus throughout the day to ensure tenant requests are completed within benchmarking schedules, following up with technicians as and when required
  • Contract Portal:
    • Monitor contracts and insurance certificates in the Contract Portal
    • Ensure that the managers of the individual contracts are notified of upcoming expiration dates
    • Note any feedback from the manager on renewal decision
    • Upload new approved contracts and insurance documents to the portal
  • Back up support for other department administrative assistant roles.
  • Deputizes for the Operations Administration Assistant & Tenant Services Coordinator when needed
  • Assist with various special projects
  • Other duties as assigned

SERVICE & PERSONAL SKILLS: 

  • Impeccable communication and interpersonal skills (oral & written).
  • Strong service orientation.
  • Mature with high standards of professionalism.
  • Friendly, courteous telephone manner is essential.
  • Impeccable attention to detail.
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced, team-oriented environment.
  • Must have an ability to manage competing priorities; have the ability to prioritize tasks and respond pro-actively
  • Must be able to deal with simultaneously occurring issues which might be competing for time while maintaining a calm environment for both internal and external clients
  • Demonstration of excellent communication skills is essential, as well as possession of analytical and organizational skills.
  • Ability to determine client requirements and provide solutions to urgent needs
  • Ability to deal with issues which are confidential and sensitive in nature requiring professionalism and discretion.
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

  • Minimum of six (6) years administration experience
  • Strong customer service experience required
  • Receptionist and administrative assistant experience required
  • Yardi/Accounts Payable experience is an asset
  • Angus experience is an asset
  • Excellent computer skills with experience in Power Point, graphic software, and MS office including Adobe.
  • Excellent telephone manner and customer service skills
  • Ability to learn new technical software
  • Aptitude to multi-task and deadline oriented
  • Knowledge of telephone systems

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:

  • Post high school business administration qualification, or equivalent years of experience 

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

Brookfield Properties is an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals.

title: administrative assistant
description:
Job Brief:



Responsibilities include but are not limited to: provide administrative support for Construction Administrator / Project Leaders and Managers during construction, including answering phone calls and email inquiries and relaying messages appropriately. This includes a written report which outlines the conversations.





Responsibilities: Answer phones and determine needs of the caller. Address caller’s request or forward to the appropriate associate. ▪ Manage electronic and paper files. ▪ Prepare correspondence as requested for construction personnel. ▪ Manage common office equipment (copier, phones, scanner, postage machine, etc.). ▪ Receiving and validating purchase orders and invoices, as well as liaising between site supervisors and suppliers. ▪ Opportunity to grow and develop.





Skills Required: ▪ High School Diploma with two (2) years college related courses, or equivalent experience. ▪ Intermediate level using Microsoft Suite and strong computer software skills. Experience with Microsoft Project is considered an asset. ▪ Prior experience within the construction industry is considered an asset. ▪ Excellent verbal and written communication skills and comfortable speaking with employees, vendors and suppliers, as well as the general public and potential clients. Must be able to anticipate problems and solve them as required independently. ▪ Must have strong organizational skills, be self-motivated, and comfortable working independently. ▪ Pays attention to details. ▪ Experience with creating and administering schedules is considered an asset. ▪ Data entry capabilities and Quickbooks experience an asset. ▪ Coincide with our company vision, mission and values.

title: Administrative Assistant (West Coast Branch)
description:
Receptionist/Administrative Assistant

Reports to:     Director, Human Resources

PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

The Receptionist/Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing secretarial, clerical and administrative support in order to help ensure office communications and administrative support are effectively and efficiently maintained.

SCOPE

The Receptionist/Administrative Assistant acts as a gatekeeper for incoming communications and will be responsible for distributing them properly and taking messages when required. The Receptionist reports to the Director of Human Resources and is responsible for providing administrative and clerical services.  Failure to properly perform these duties will result in a disruption of the services that Plexxis offers.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Key Responsibilities:

  • Answer calls/greet guests/take messages/create tickets/direct calls as required
  • Support Triage – Take messages when Support is unavailable
  • Maintaining contacts
  • Admin Assistant for Implementations team (Welcome letters etc.)
  • Admin Assistant for Management
  • Management of corporate cell phone account
  • Maintenance of other administrative accounts via online or phone
  • Light housekeeping duties
  • Managing Travel Rewards Points
  • Travel arrangements for Implementations and sales
  • Shirt Orders Review
  • Stocking/cleaning kitchen (changing garbage bags as required)
  • Stocking/ordering supplies (eg. Office supplies, fruits, coffee, milk etc.)
  • Tracking Supplies
  • Meeting preparation (e.g. cleaning boardrooms, asking guests for coffee)
  • Checking mailbox/mailing letters
  • Shipping and Receiving
  • Daily Receipt Collection


SALARY

  • Starting at $50,500.00 

Disclaimer for all posting locations: We thank all applicants in advance for their interest but advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Plexxis is committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion; encouraging applications from all well qualified applicants. Accommodation is available for applicants, including those with disabilities, throughout the recruitment process.

All successful candidates are required to join our team and work at our Langford/Victoria office location. Plexxis does not offer remote work opportunities.

Please Note: If you are offered a position at Plexxis Software, you may be required to agree to a background check.

PLEXXIS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

title: Secrétariat - Besoins immédiats
company: Centre de services scolaire des Rives-du-Saguenay
description:
SECRÉTARIAT - BESOINS IMMÉDIATS jusqu'à la fin de l'année scolaire

Le Centre de services scolaire des Rives-du-Saguenay dessert une clientèle d’environ 16 710 élèves répartis entre 33 écoles primaires, 4 écoles secondaires, 1 centre de formation générale aux adultes et 1 centre de formation professionnelle. Il compte environ 2000 employés qui placent la qualité des services à la clientèle au centre de leurs préoccupations.

PROFIL

Le rôle principal et habituel de la personne salariée de cette classe d’emplois consiste à accomplir divers travaux administratifs de nature complexe selon des méthodes et procédures définies. Elle consiste également à assister une ou plusieurs personnes en exécutant des tâches de secrétariat.

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • La personne salariée de cette classe d'emplois effectue la saisie à l'ordinateur, de textes et de diverses données à partir de manuscrits ou de diverses sources qu'elle présente sous forme de lettres, tableaux, rapports et autres;
  • Elle vérifie l'orthographe et l'application des règles grammaticales dans les textes qu'elle saisit et signale les corrections à apporter;
  • Elle reçoit et achemine les appels téléphoniques et fournit des renseignements généraux;
  • Elle tient à jour des dossiers et des registres et effectue le classement des dossiers et des documents;
  • Toute autre tâche.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Détenir un DEP en secrétariat ou être titulaire d'un diplôme ou d'une attestation d'études dont l'équivalence est reconnue par l'autorité compétente.

AUTRES EXIGENCES

  • Maîtriser le français parlé et écrit;
  • Connaître suffisamment les méthodes et les usages propres à la tenue d'un secrétariat;
  • Avoir la maîtrise des logiciels d'utilisation courante (Suite office)

RÉMUNÉRATION ET CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL

  • Les conditions de travail sont assujetties et conformes aux normes en vigueur dans le réseau de l’éducation;
  • L’échelle de traitement annuel : Selon la convention collective en vigueur.

Secrétaire : Minimum : 22,18$/heure  Maximum : 24,13$/heure

Secrétaire d'école ou de centre : Minimum : 22,81$/heure  Maximum : 27,10$/heure

Secrétaire de gestion : Minimum : 22,54$/heure  Maximum : 26,00$/heure

Agent(e) de bureau, classe 2 : Minimum : 21,73$/heure  Maximum : 22,65$/heure

Agent(e) de bureau, classe 1 : Minimum : 22,36$/heure  Maximum : 25,00$/heure

Agent(e) de bureau, classe principale : Minimum : 23,12$/heure  Maximum : 28.31$/heure

Technicien(ne) en administration : Minimum : 24,21$/heure  Maximum : 32,32$/heure

Les candidats seront évalués (tests (Français, Words, Excel), entrevue, etc.), notamment pour leur niveau de connaissances relatives aux exigences requises.

Le Centre de services scolaire des Rives-du-Saguenay applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi. Dans ce document, le générique masculin est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte.

Le Service des ressources humaines communiquera uniquement avec les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue.

Les personnes intéressées, répondant à ces exigences, sont invitées à soumettre leur candidature en faisant parvenir leur curriculum vitae sur le site du Centre de services scolaire.

title: Office Administrator
description:
Office Coordinator, Toronto ON, Full Time

This role is an in-office role with Covid Safety Protocol in place.

Simply Groupâ€™s Office Administrator is the first point of contact for all our employees, vendors, customers and everyone who walks through Simplyâ€™s doors. They are responsible for the day-to-day operations of the office, and for creating the desired office culture built on our core values. The office coordinator brings a level of energy and at the same time order to the office environment, and pitches in wherever they can. They own their role and are the go-to resource for all office related matters. They are proud of and accountable for the officeâ€™s efficient function and the experience had by all who spend time with us.

Whatâ€™s In It For You?:

  • Competitive Compensation Structure.
  • Full time hours, flexible shifts.
  • A rewarding role with rapid growth and leadership opportunities.
  • Opportunities to give back to our community through Simply Cares charitable foundation. Our charitable partners include, but are not limited to:
    • Georgetown Bread Basket
    • Covenant House
    • United Way (Halton and Hamilton)
    • Support and Housing (Halton Hills)

Reception Duties:

  • Responsible for timely and efficient incoming and outgoing correspondence, including mail, packages and other items requiring shipping and receiving. Ensure mail is routed to appropriate internal departments.
  • Greet and direct walk-in customers, partners, couriers, and vendors in alignment with Simplyâ€™s customer service standards. Ensure proper security and confidentiality measures are taken when working with external stakeholders.
  • Leverage the reception area and role as a vehicle to impart Simplyâ€™s culture, including maintaining cleanliness standards, fostering an appropriate atmosphere, maintaining materials and information, and connecting with our team.

Office Management:

  • Be the go-to resource for all office related matters and own the resolution and outcome of any changes, issues, or conflicts.
  • Establish, communicate, and enforce appropriate office policy and procedure, including operations, process, health and safety, cleanliness, usage and cultural drivers.
  • Act as first point of contact for employee requests and resolve within required timeframe, and direct employees as appropriate.
  • Own and successfully relationship with building and parking management and any other office related partner.
  • Ensure efficient use and operation of shared spaces, including kitchen, boardrooms, copy rooms, storage rooms. This includes appropriate configuration and layout, maintenance of equipment, supplies and cleanliness.
  • Mediate any conflict around shared space usage and occupancy, problem solve for solutions.
  • Own and maintain relationships with vendors as required including marketing material suppliers, office supply providers, equipment/maintenance providers.

HR Responsibilities:

  • Support planning and execution of office culture touch points, like team building activities, team lunches, special events and special projects.
  • Support onboarding new employees into the office through scheduling and being first point of contact.
  • Provide support to admin team by backing up HR Coordinator or executive assistant, and support on special projects as required.

Required Experience:

  • A minimum of 1 year experience as an Office Coordinator is required.
  • A minimum of 1 year receptionist experience is required.
  • Post-Secondary education business administration or equivalent field of study is required.

Skills Required:

  • Exceptional attention to detail skills, with the passion to put in the work in to ensure satisfaction and efficiency.
  • Proven written and oral communication skills, including one on one, in a group and at all levels of an organization.
  • Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to navigate difficult situations.
  • Drive to go above and beyond the call of duty to see success in all tasks.
  • Eager to take on all challenges and see assigned tasks as an opportunity to succeed.
  • Excellent organizational skills to be able to multi-task and ensure nothing is missed.

Simply Group is a family of companies sharing common values, interests, and practices to deliver energy-efficient residential and commercial solutions, so Canadians never have to sacrifice comfort or quality for essential services. With steady year-over-year growth and over $1.45 billion in rental assets, Simply Group is one of Canada's leaders in whole-home comfort. Our team of more than 400 employees takes an innovative approach to offer a comprehensive source of solutions that improve the status quo for ourselves, our communities, and our clients. We are committed to making things better for everyone and advancing the careers of all our employees.

Simply Group serves customers across Canada through multiple brands. Our companies are divided into five categories: home comfort, lending, lighting, new construction, and green living. We are proud to be Great Place to Work-Certified for six straight years and winner of the 2019 Best Business of the Year award from the National CanadianSME Business Awards. Join us on our path to success! https://www.mysimplygroup.com

All candidates will be considered, however only qualified candidates will be contacted. Simply Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Simply Group is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our HR Team will work with applicants requesting accommodations at any stage of the hiring process.

SGNonSales

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Essential duties and responsibilities

  • Responsible for providing effective and competent office support to the Branch in a safe, legal and ethical manner, thus helping to ensure that the Branch’s services to clients are of high quality.
  • Welcomes clients and visitors by greeting them, in person or on the telephone; answering or referring inquiries.
  • This position requires a basic knowledge of computer operation skills to enter incoming sample information into the LIMS. A basic knowledge of microbiology and chemistry is helpful to effectively assign proper sample and test codes. A broad knowledge of personal computer software and data entering skills is necessary to input data into the LIMS and generate special reports. Organizational skills are required to keep track of all sample and documentation. Time management skills are useful to ensure that sample is quickly prepared for testing. Written and oral communication skills are essential to obtain or clarify test instructions with clients. General office skills are useful to complete faxing, filing, and other related duties for the department.   Some monthly invoicing will also be assigned, including intercompany branch allocations and Net Promotor Score management.
  • This position will specifically support our food testing and assurance services in Canada. Tested products will include food ingredients, finished food products, cannabis and cannabinoid-containing food products. Potential clients include food manufacturers, exporters, importers and retail outlets.

Specific Responsibilities

  • Greet and assist clients and visitors
  • Maintain polite and professional communication via phone, e-mail, and mail.
  • Organize and schedule meetings and appointments
  • Maintain computer and manual filing systems
  • Develop and update administrative systems to make them more efficient
  • Maintain client lists
  • Screening phone calls and routing callers to the appropriate party.
  • Receive and log in sample in preparation for analysis. Review sample and any attached documentation to assign identification number and enter information into Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS). Prepare documentation as necessary
  • Contact client, when necessary, to obtain and clarify missing or unclear information to ensure that identification of client code, test code, and sample contents are accurate
  • Prepare packages for pick up by shipping vendors. Follow appropriate procedures to send packages and maintain all related documentation
  • Prepare sample to be shipped to other testing facilities when necessary. Complete appropriate documentation and file accordingly
  • Create customized client reports. Activities include: collection of data and development of report
  • Photocopy, scan and print out documents on behalf of other colleagues
  • Maintain document control in accordance with the requirements in the company’s Management System
  • To assist in the monthly invoicing of our clients as directed by the Administrative Supervisor
  • To compile and submit the monthly NPS (Net Promoter Score) contact list and possible follow up with clients
  • To organize and monitor intercompany monthly branch allocations
  •   To carry out the above responsibilities, and all others which may be assigned, in a manner demonstrating support for and adherence to the Company’s Safety policy and Procedures, Quality Policy and Procedures, Ethics Policy,Environmental Management System, Vision and Strategy, and to exercise good judgment, common sense, and diplomacy in so doing

​​​​​​​Required Qualifications

  • Minimum Grade Twelve Diploma
  • Administrative degree or Diploma in applicable field considered an asset
  • Proficient in computer programs (Microsoft office)
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Good organization/multitasking, oral and written communication and timeline management skills.

title: Secrétaire de gestion, secrétaire d'école et agent(e) de bureau (Candidature spontanée)
company: Centre de services scolaire des Mille-Îles (CSSMI)
description:
Le CSSMI est actuellement à la recherche de personnel administratif pour combler d’éventuels besoins de remplacements dans différents établissements, à titre d'agent de bureau ou de secrétaire. 

Le rôle principal et habituel de la personne salariée de cette classe d’emplois consiste à assister une ou plusieurs personnes en exécutant des tâches de secrétariat, et/ou à effectuer diverses tâches administratives de complexité variable.

ATTRIBUTIONS CARACTÉRISTIQUES

Nous vous invitions à consulter le plan de classification pour en savoir davantage sur les différents types de rôles administratifs en cliquant ici.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Être titulaire d’un diplôme d’études professionnelles en secrétariat ou être titulaire d’un diplôme de 5e année du secondaire ou être titulaire d’un diplôme ou d’une attestation d’études dont l’équivalence est reconnue par l’autorité compétente.
  • Avoir des compétences en bureautique et un bon niveau de français à l’oral et à l’écrit (des tests en lien avec les compétences font partie du processus de sélection)

Veuillez noter que nous poursuivons nos activités de recrutement avec des procédures d’entrevues à distance afin de respecter les recommandations émises par la Santé publique.

Nous communiquons seulement avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue. 

Le CSSMI s’est doté d’un Programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles, les membres des minorités ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Les personnes handicapées qui le désirent peuvent recevoir de l’assistance pour le processus de présélection et de sélection.

Le personnel du CSSMI est soumis à la Loi sur la Laïcité de l’État.  Cette Loi prévoit, entre autres choses, l’interdiction pour le personnel enseignant, les directions et directions adjointes d’établissement, embauchés après le 27 mars 2019, de porter un signe religieux et l’obligation pour l’ensemble du personnel du CSSMI d’exercer ses fonctions à visage découvert. Pour en connaître plus sur cette Loi :  Loi sur la laïcité de l’État.

Le CSSMI remercie tous les candidats de leur intérêt.

title: Administrative Assistant II
description:
At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for an Administrative Assistant II to join our Business Operations team on a Full-Time basis in our Vancouver office.

An overview of your role will include:

  • Printing, Scanning, E-Filing and physical archiving of documents;
  • Archiving company records and library documents while following company retention policies using MS Access, Excel, SharePoint, and other internal programs. Also entails lifting, unpacking and re-boxing of project files;
  • Accurate data-entry;
  • L ibrary shelving/re-filing; respond to requests for file retrievals
  • Office and cubicle move and departure related tasks including; desk tidying and organization, filing, coordinating the return of extra office and IT equipment for redeployment;
  • Assisting Senior team members with coordinating equipment rentals (SAT phones, inReach devices) and coordinating fleet vehicle maintenance;
  • Assist in maintaining a neat and tidy work area that is welcoming to visitors;
  • Providing back up reception coverage; and
  • General office assistance to the Business Support team in the region as required.
Qualifications and Skills:

  • Positive Team Player Attitude!
  • 2 years of work experience in a professional service environment
  • Attention to detail and ownership of delegated tasks
  • Good communication skills (listening, verbal and written), friendly and pleasant manner
  • The ability to take directions and seek clarification as needed
  • Good problem-solving skills with the initiative and ability to identify alternative solutions
  • Established comfort level with technology
  • Proficiency in Office 365 including SharePoint, Word, Excel, and OneDrive is an asset
  • Ability to learn processes quickly and be flexible in changing circumstances
  • Excellent customer service skills to support our internal clients
  • Maturity and flexibility
  • Valid Drivers licence is an asset

Your benefits at Golder will include:

  • Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring, and coaching
  • Global projects and travel opportunities

One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 13 consecutive years

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder, now a member of WSP, is a leading, global consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Golder Associates Ltd. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), and all other applicable legislation. Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities upon request.

To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Do you like to plan parties? Are you a proactive, super organized, multi-tasking, detail driven person with a passion to help others? Are you affable enough to build trust with others, yet professional and able to handle confidential information when the need arises? If so, you might just be the perfect fit for us!

Clearbridge Mobile is an award-winning full stack mobile application development studio. We’ve designed and developed end-to-end custom mobile applications for an extensive list of premium clients, from rapid-growth start-ups to 35+ Fortune 500 companies. Not only is our client list something to brag about, we also work with cutting edge technology to develop award winning apps! We’ve developed a wearable technology news reader app for an international broadcaster; created the world’s first HCE closed loop mobile wallet for a top Canadian coffee chain; and developed TV Everywhere solutions with Chromecast and Apple TV integration for a multinational mass media and entertainment broadcasting conglomerate. We’re just getting started!

We are searching for an Administrative Assistant to help us manage our operations as we continue to grow to new heights. You will gain diverse experience working on exciting projects related to the growth of our organization. Conveniently located right off Highway 400 and only 15 minutes from Yorkdale, we offer a collaborative, team-oriented environment where your contributions will make an impact.

 

Job Description:

In this role, you will support our senior team members with a variety of administrative tasks. You must have strong analytical, interpersonal, and organizational skills. You will collaborate with employees, suppliers and our owners to help with day to day operational activities.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Answering the telephone, office reception
  • Mail Pick-up and distribution
  • Maintaining Databases/data entry
  • Inventory management (office equipment) and office supply maintenance
  • Managing calendars, booking meetings and appointments, and prioritizing requests
  • Handling incoming inquiries and responding appropriately
  • Assisting in the preparation of meetings
  • Preparing meeting agenda, attending and taking minutes
  • Arranging travel, transportation with some financial responsibility
  • Office administration includes; filing, storing and neatly organizing the office space
  • Assist with corporate and executive projects as needed
  • Managing accounts payable
  • Vendor management
  • Social committee management (employee engagement, corporate events)

 

Desired Skills & Experience:

  • 3+ years of administration experience in a fast pace environment
  • High energy, enthusiastic positive individual able to support fast paced business environment
  • Effective in a multi-tasked, fast-paced environment with frequent interruptions with a high level of integrity
  • Flexible to perform a variety of different duties in the office as it relates to office management and executive support
  • Able to prioritize, schedule, and meet deadlines including last minute requests
  • Excellent inter-personal and communication skills – must be a team player
  • Demonstrate innovation, integrity, fairness, and respect
  • Eager to learn and shows initiative
  • Very organized
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Word, and Excel (Microsoft Office Suite)
  • University degree required.

 

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Health benefits
  • Free snacks and drinks
  • Friday lunches
  • Lounge with PS3, WiiU, Ping Pong Table, Foosball Table and much more

 

Who are we?

Clearbridge Mobile has been built on a solid foundation of truly invested leadership. We’re a young company and have formed great connections both internally and externally; together, this creates a culture of teamwork and fun. Why is our culture so important to us? Because work and life intersect and we believe it’s important to be happy and healthy in both! And we’re not going to sugar coat it – sometimes we work long hours. But we also work hard to make sure you get down time. And when we take time to have some fun as a company, we share that time through numerous events and activities, such as knife throwing, where no one gets hurt!

Conveniently located right off Highway 400 and only 15 minutes from Yorkdale, Clearbridge Mobile offers a collaborative, team-oriented environment where your contributions will make an impact. Enter the Clearbridge world and you won’t look back! Yes, we rhymed that on purpose.

 

Interested candidates are asked to email resumes to: 

careers@clearbridgemobile.com

 citing the position title in the subject line. Clearbridge Mobile welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all those interested, however only those whom we wish to contact for further discussion with be contacted.

To learn more, check us out on Facebook

title: Office Coordinator
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">At Kindred, we are on a mission to build human-like intelligence in machines. 

Since 2014, we've been paving the way for a world filled with more powerful and helpful AI systems. We bring together reinforcement learning, machine learning, and remote human guidance to create intelligent robots that solve real-world problems alongside humans in complex, changing environments like today's supply chain.

At Kindred, we are on a mission to build human-like intelligence in machines.

Since 2014, we've been paving the way for a world filled with more powerful and helpful AI systems. We bring together reinforcement learning, machine learning, and remote human guidance to create intelligent robots that solve real-world problems alongside humans in complex, changing environments like today's supply chain.

As our Office Coordinator for our Toronto office, you will be responsible for performing a wide range of administrative and supportive duties to ensure the efficient day-to-day running of our office. We’re looking for an organized, detail-oriented thinker who is energetic and proactive in anticipating the needs of our fast-paced office. The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter, eager to take on new challenges, and enthusiastic about finding the best solutions to those challenges.

This role requires you to be in the office as and when required.</section>

title: Administration Assistant
description:
Administrator required for temporary position. 3-6 months.

Your new company
This not-for-profit organisation provides support to people from all backgrounds and prides themselves on encouraging the positive development of communities and their people.

Your new role
As the Administrator the main aspect of your role will be responding to email and telephone inquiries, data entry, processing invoices, mail-merging of letters to customers and clients. You will also be required to book meetings and complete diary management.

What you'll need to succeed
You will show a proficiency in using Microsoft office, Excel in particular. You will have a great attention to detail, be a proactive worker and will be able to work with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds.

What you'll get in return
You will be offered an attractive hourly rate of $21-$23 dependent on experience with the opportunity to work for a rewarding not-for-profit organisation supporting and helping others.

Please send your Resume

title: Administrative Assistant - III
description:
Legal and Compliance Coordinator

12 month Part-time Contract role - 16-20 hours per week, no Fridays.

The Legal and Compliance Coordinator will support the Legal and Compliance team in a variety of capacities, in addition to assisting with special projects.

The Role:
• Provides administration support to the Legal/Compliance team.
• Prioritizes workload involving multiple projects/timelines. Such projects may include coordinating or leading the implementation of new and/or revised software applications/databases including interfacing with vendors, ensure user training, etc. with minimal guidance.
• Uses advanced level software programs such as Excel and PowerPoint to create graphs, charts, spreadsheets and presentations.
• Position includes routine activities, such as word processing, scheduling assistance for Assoc. General Counsel and team members, assisting with legal accounts and billing matters, assembling reports, expense reports, and general administrative support.
• May provide administrative and clerical support to the department’s interview process, which includes creating, and distributing agendas, collecting assessment forms and scheduling and making travel arrangements.
• Organizes and schedules department and extra-department meetings, including weekly, Legal Team meetings.
• Work is performed independently and proactively.
• Assist Compliance Manager with Due Diligence Program including sending third party questionnaires to appropriate vendors, receive and review vendor questionnaires to ensure completion and other tasks as directed
• Assist Compliance Manager with interview reviews on business processes
• Assist lawyers with Corporate Filings
• Assist lawyers with training including Compliance Week and National Business Meetings

Critical Competencies:
• A minimum of a high school diploma plus 3-5+ years administrative experience; administrative experience in the pharmaceutical industry and/or regulatory affairs is preferred
• Must possess good proofreading and editing skills of technical documents; excellent attention to detail is a must
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
• Collaborative mindset
• Superb project management skills gained in a fast pace setting
• Proactive self-starter with ability to work independently with limited supervision
• Intermediate to Advanced knowledge and experience using several office software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat, Access, etc.
• Knowledge and understanding of administrative and office policies


Client Core Values:
• Integrity (always doing the right thing),
• Teamwork (collaborating in good faith),
• Excellence (working at a high level of commitment and capability)
• Accountability (taking personal responsibility).
• Inclusion (encouraging diversity)

title: Administrative Support
description:
We are urgently seeking for individuals who are currently located in US and Canada, to join our team. We need Administrative Supports to be assigned in our store branches. We offer competitive salary and benefits package based on experience and qualifications.

General Description of Duties

The key role of this position is to attend to customer’s needs. There is no driving, no pick-up, or lifting functions performed. The job involves handling of confidential company information.

Description of Duties and Responsibilities

  • ​Process customer sales transactions and enter information into AXP Express Padala computer system, Money Services Web Based System/Equipment’s and other company’s product and services.
  • Handle customer’s concerns & complaints and help find solutions to resolve the issues.
  • Manage and maintain schedule of boxes for pick-up. Coordinate with CSR Manila for assignment of pick up for the drivers.
  • Prepare daily management report and deposits and reconcile report with the remittances/ transactions for the day. Prepare branch report requested from time to time.
  • ne calls.
  • Perform general administrative duties such as filing, office keep and maintenance.
  • Employee periodic training programs must be executed and updated.
  • Provide customer satisfaction and make them happy (Keep smiling).
  • Perform Marketing/Promotion Sales of Cargo, Travel & Money Remittance Services.
  • Perform all other administrative tasks.

Qualifications

  • Experience in office administration or other related fields
  • Ability to prioritize and multitask
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong organizational skills

title: Administrative/Records Assistant
description:
Job Summary:
  • Reporting to the Chancellor, the Administrative and Records Assistant (Assistant) performs centralized filing services and provides administrative support to the Chancery Office, and occasional support to the Archbishop’s Office.
  • This position works in a fast-paced team environment and requires great attention detail to ensure records are kept up-to-date and organized.
Responsibilities:

The main responsibilities of this position include:
  • Classifying documents, recording electronically, and filing hard copies in files.
  • Retrieving files on request.
  • Transferring inactive files to the Archives.
  • Providing administrative support within the Archbishop and Chancery Offices.
Desired Skills/Experience:
  • Previous experience working in collection management in a library, museum, archives or records management environment would be an asset.
  • Ability to exercise tact, diplomacy and discretion in a highly confidential work environment.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Exercise excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills with the ability to work collaboratively and independently.
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.
  • Knowledge of the Catholic Church within the Archdiocese of Vancouver and its departmental activities.
Working Environment:
  • Normal working hours are 9:00AM to 4:30PM, Monday to Friday.
  • Full time position with excellent benefits and pension plan.
  • Opportunity to work in a faith-based environment.


About RCAV:

The Archdiocese of Vancouver extends from Vancouver and the Sunshine Coast east to Hope and Boston Bar, north to Anahim Lake, and west to Bella Coola, encompassing 77 parishes, 51 schools and a Catholic population in excess of 443,000.The Archbishop is the visible principle and foundation of unity in the particular church entrusted to him. In a unique and visible way, he makes Christ’s mission present and enduring as Shepherd of the Catholic Community. In order to fulfill his mission, the Archbishop employs suitable, chosen collaborators (clerics, religious, or lay people). He shares with them the apostolic mission and entrusts various responsibilities to them (Directory on the Pastoral Ministry of Bishops, 198).Archdiocesan (lay) employees include professional/management, support staff, full-time, part-time, short-term/contract, and casual categories. The Archdiocese develops and maintains personnel policies to foster unity and respect within the workplace and to ensure equity, fairness and sound personnel management in carrying out its functions.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Description

  • Listed examples are illustrative and representative of the tasks required of this position and are not intended to be complete or exclusive.
  • Performing Standard Reception Duties - Ie: Greeting Visitors, Answer/Direct Telephone Calls, Forward messages to appropriate people
  • General Tidiness of the Reception Area, Lunchroom, Client Lounge, Boardrooms and Training Rooms
  • Maintaining/Ordering general office supplies and business cards and ensuring general office equipment if functioning at satisfactory conditions - ie: Copier, Printer, Scanner
  • Performing duties utilizing Microsoft Office software programs - ie: Excel, Outlook, Word
  • Generating and distributing Month End reports in a timely manner
  • Coding and approving Invoices, P/Card coding and approving. Maintaining AP Tracker Expense Spreadsheet
  • Creating Purchase Orders and Set Up Vendors/Suppliers
  • Assisting with issuing General Liability Insurance and Worksafe Certificates
  • Assisting with invoice coding and approval
  • Setting up Conference Room(s) for Visitors and In-House Meetings, arranging/picking up lunch if required
  • Maintain Shared Calendar and Phone List
  • Arrange Cell Phones for issues/replacement of staff
  • Organizing Staff Events - ie: Christmas Party, Summer BBQ, TownHall Meetings
  • Assisting with the Introduction of New Staff ie: Access Cards, Phone Extension, Alarm Code
  • Arranging Shipping with different Courier Companies ie: Fedex, UPS, DHL
  • Maintaining and distributing weekly cheque logs, vehicle/mileage logs, labels for Manufactured Housing
  • Maintaining a high level of confidentiality and using discretion when necessary
  • Performing other work as required
  • Carrying out all responsibilities in a supportive manner with total adherence to: The Company's Health, Safety and Environmental Policies and Procedures, Quality Management System, Compliance and Ethics Policies, Vision, Mission and Strategy, and exercises good judgment, common sense, and diplomacy.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • 2-3 years directly related experience
  • Microsoft Office Skills, must be able to type quickly and accurately
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to analyze and problem solve
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment with great attention to detail
  • Excellent Customer Service and Communication Skills in both verbal and written format, good command of the English Language

Job requires management of all the incoming calls, client interaction, shipping, receiving, clerical duties and facilities coordination, front desk reception, shipping receiving, financials

title: Secrétaire principale / Principal Secretary
description:
SOMMAIRE
Clinique : Laval Duvernay (4731 blvd. Lévesque Est, Laval, QC, H7C 1M9)
Horaire : temps plein (35 heures par semaine)
Quart de travail : jour
Statut : permanent


DESCRIPTION
La clinique Action Sport Physio de Laval Duvernay est à la recherche d’un secrétaire principale à temps plein.  Nous recherchons une personne dynamique qui sait accueillir la clientèle de façon professionnelle.  La personne doit être fervente du travail d’équipe et de la communication avec la clientèle autant qu’avec son équipe.


Le poste consiste à :
- Accueillir des patients, prise d’appels et de rendez-vous;
- S'occuper de la facturation à la clientèle et aux organismes payeurs;
- Préparer les comptes recevables;
- Communiquer avec les professionnels en relation avec la clinique;
- Préparer et classer les dossiers des patients;
- Organiser les horaires;
- Commander le matériel nécessaire pour la clinique;
- Toutes autres tâches connexes.


EXIGENCES
- Connaissance des principaux programmes informatiques, le candidat doit être très confortable avec un ordinateur;
- Connaissance de ClinicMaster (atout);
- Discrétion, autonomie, esprit d’équipe, goût d’être actif au sein d’une équipe dynamique, proactif, apprentissage rapide;
- Bilingue français/anglais;
- Offrir un service à la clientèle hors pair;
- Excellentes capacités de communication;
- Expérience dans une clinique médicale.


HORAIRE
- Lundi au vendredi;
- Horaire de jour, possiblement un soir par semaine pendant une courte période. 



Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé afin d’alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

_________________________________________________________________


DESCRIPTION
The Laval Duvernay Action Sport Physio clinic is looking for a full-time principal secretary. We are looking for a dynamic person who knows how to welcome clients in a professional way. The person must be fervent of teamwork and communication with clients as well as with the team.


The position consists of:
- Welcoming patients, making calls and scheduling appointments
- Handling customer invoicing and paying agencies;
- Preparation of accounts receivable;
- Communicate with professionals in relations with the clinic;
- Prepare and file client records;
- Organizing the schedules;
- Order the necessary material for the clinic;
- Any other related tasks.


REQUIREMENTS
- Knowledge of the main computer programs, the candidate must be very comfortable with a computer;
- Knowledge of ClinicMaster (asset);
- Discretion, autonomy, team spirit, willingness to be active in a dynamic team, proactive, fast learner;
- Bilingual French/English;
- Focused on customer service;
- Excellent communication skills;
- Experience in a medical clinic.


SCHEDULE
- Monday to Friday;
- Daytime schedule, possibly one evening per week for a short time. 



Please note that the masculine is used to simplify the text, without prejudice to the feminine form.


- Connaissance des principaux programmes informatiques, le candidat doit être très confortable avec un ordinateur; - Connaissance de ClinicMaster (atout); - Discrétion, autonomie, esprit d’équipe, goût d’être actif au sein d’une équipe dynamique, proactif, apprentissage rapide; - Bilingue français/anglais; - Offrir un service à la clientèle hors pair; - Excellentes capacités de communication; - Expérience dans une clinique médicale.
