title: Administrative Detail Assistant
description:
The Head Office for Charm Diamond Centres (CJ Limited) is looking to add an Administrative Detail Assistant to our team at our location in Dartmouth, NS.

In business since 1972, CJ Limited is the largest independently owned Canadian Jewellery Company and a Platinum Member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, operating over 80 stores from coast to coast.

It is our passion for people and jewellery that has lead to our success and we seek like-minded individuals who share our excitement and enthusiasm to join our team.



Job Responsibilities

The  Administrative  Detail Assistant  supports Merchandise Category Buyers with general administrative duties including: Data Entry, Product Data Maintenance, Sample Management, Purchase Order Administration, and general clerical tasks.



Required Skills

  • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Word
  • Accurate and fast keyboarding
  • Dedicated to providing outstanding customer service
  • Effective and friendly oral and written communication style
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
  • Organized and detail-oriented

If you are a self-motivated and organized individual and meet these requirements, we would love to meet you! Please apply online by sending your resume and cover letter by end of day Friday, October 8th, 2021.

CJ Limited is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage individuals from diverse backgrounds to apply. We employ individuals without regard to race, age, religion, disability, gender or national origin. Accommodations are available upon request for all individuals with disabilities with the recruitment and selection process.

title: Informatica Admin
description:
• IT industry experience in Analyse, Model, Design, Develop, and Deliver Customised ETL solutions for Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence environment along with Agile Methodologies

  • Expertise in development activities using Unix/Linux/Solaris/AIX shell scripts, Oracle PL/SQL & MS-SQL and Informatica Power Centre as ETL Tool

  • Performing Solutions Architect role to define Organization’s DW/ETL and analytics footprint and future road map using ETL/Informatica

  • Experience in Informatica Administration by Managing & Supporting the Dev/Test/Stage/Prod environments that include Upgrade to latest versions, configuring Informatica Domain on High Availability Grid with Automatic Failover, Implementing Informatica Metadata Manager, RTM, Data Profiling, IDQ & MDM cloud and connectivity with SAP systems

  • Setup, Configure and Integrate Informatica BDM 10.2 with Datalake under Hadoop Cluster beyond KNOX boundary to read/write data to Datalake through HDFS, Hive, HBase, MapR, Yarn, Spark

  • experience in loading data from different Structured and Un-Structure source systems to Hadoop Datalake using Hive, HDFS, Sqoop, Beeline, MapR, Python, Spark, Yarn etc.

  • Proficiency in data modeling using Power Designer, Erwin. Proficient on Data Mapping exercise, Normalization, indexing, different dimensions and facts in the process of building a data warehousing solution

  • Experience in implementation of effective data governance strategies by using Informatica Metadata Manager (IMM) and Data Profiling (DP) to view and manage the delicate interaction of various data flow through multiple systems and deliver a roadmap that collaborate, identify and remediate data quality issues, and maintain data consistency over time

  • Experience on Risk assessment to determine the quantitative or qualitative value of risk related to a concrete situation and a recognized threat

  • Hands on experience IBM DB2 Database software, IBM® Netezza, BMC Remedy Action Request, BMC Control-M, Rational Data Architect (RDA), Rational Clear Case, Tivoli Workload Scheduler Rational Clear Quest


 


Tools Hands on.


 



  • ETL Tool: Informatica 8.6.1, 9.1, 9.5, 10.1, 10.2 Power Exchange, BDM

  • Database skills: Oracle, DB2, Teradata, Netezza, MS SQL Server

  • Data Governance & Profiling Tool: MDM, IMM, IDQ, DP

  • Programming/Scripting Languages: UNIX Shell Script, Python, Hive, Beeline, PL/SQL, VB 6.0

  • Data Modeling Tool: Power Designer, Rational Data Architect

  • Big Data Ecosystems: Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS, Hive, SQOOP, Oozie, Beeline, Spark

  • Methodology: Agile, UML, OOPS, QMS, Lean Six Sigma

  • Quality Assurance: Rational Clear Quest, BMC Remedy Action Request System

  • Job Scheduling Tool: IBM Tivoli, BMC Control-M

  • Operating environments: Win 10, Win 7, Win 2000, Win XP, Solaris, IBM AIX, Linux

  • Software Configuration Management Tools: Rational Clear Case , CVS, MS Visual Source Safe


 



Why Mentor Tech Source?

Mentor Tech Source is the result of 25 plus years of extensive experience in providing Hybrid Model Staffing and Engineering Services in the ever evolving Software Economy.

  • We have a unique hybrid contingent staffing service composed of domestic and international sourcing
  • We have a 24/7 recruitment cycle due to the fact that Mentor has offices in many different time zones
  • We work day and night to provide our consultants and employees with best working environment

title: Borne Industries- Administrative Assistant
description:
POSITION SUMMARY


Formerly known as Charlton & Hill, Borne Industries is the next generation of ownership for Metal Fabrication and HVAC Commercial divisions. 

We are looking for a motivated candidate who is organized and detail-oriented to join our team! The Administrative Assistant will anticipate the needs of our managers, team members and clients, support a smooth operating organization and create a positive, welcoming environment. 

The Administrative Assistant provides administrative support to ensure efficient operation of the office. They offer support to managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication. The Administrative Assistant is responsible for confidential and time-sensitive material. They should be familiar with a variety of the Company’s practices, and procedures. Applicants should be able to assist management and visitors to the company by handling office tasks, providing polite and professional assistance via phone, mail, and e-mail, scheduling appointments, and generally being a helpful and positive presence in the workplace. Administrative assistants must be comfortable with computers, general office tasks, and excel at both verbal and written communication. Most importantly, administrative assistants should have a genuine desire to meet the needs of others.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Full-time position with working hours from Monday through Friday, 8:00am - 4:30pm. However, it is an expectation that all employees will contribute to the team by working additional time hours and/or weekend hours as required to suit the work being completed. This position requires desk seating for long periods of time and the regular use of computers. Starting wage for this position will be $17-$22/ hour, based on experience levels. Merit benefits begin after three (3) months. 


JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Take direction from senior employees and provide input as applicable to goals. 

  • Provide administrative support to management, the sales team and BUC’s to assist with an efficient operation of the office. 

  • Exhibit polite and professional communication via phone, email and in person. 

  • Greet clients and create a welcoming environment. 

  • Assist with shipping and receiving as required. 

  • Work toward administrative efficiency within company software packages; 

    • Operating system (Great Plains, Microsoft Dynamics)

    • Email (Office 365) 

    • Microsoft word and excel 

  • Provide clerical support with duties such as: filing, typing, copying, scanning etc. 

  • Take payments from customers including the use of debit/credit machine(s)

  • Take messages and triage Commercial Service HVAC clients.

  • Cold call commercial businesses to promote our services.

  • Answer phone calls and direct callers to the appropriate party.

  • Anticipate, meet and exceed our customer’s needs. 


PREFERRED COMPETENCIES


  • Communication: Expresses and transmits information with consistency and clarity, using active listening techniques in order to effectively understand provided feedback, summarizes information according to the audience in order to promote engagement and increase understanding. 

 

  • Networking and Relationship Building: Effectively builds constructive, friendly, professional relationships and networks of key contacts with people and colleagues, maintains partnerships that can provide information, assistance and support. 


  • Problem Solving: Possesses the ability to break a situation down into smaller pieces to identify key issues, figuring out cause and effect relationships in order to solve. Uses logic and analytical methods to come to realistic solutions.


  • Service Orientation: Provides superior service to both internal and external customers.


  • Teamwork: Possesses the ability to break a situation down into smaller pieces to identify key issues, figuring out cause and effect relationships in order to solve. Uses logic and analytical methods to come to realistic solutions.



REQUIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & TRAINING:


  • Experience in an administrative position.

  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics is an asset.

  • Excellent communication skills.



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

Interested applicants can submit their resume indicating they are applying for the Administrative Assistant position. This position will be open until a suitable candidate has been found.


Service-oriented, problem solving, communication skills an asset

title: General Administrative Jobs
description:
Please fill out this application if you wish to register with our company for administrative jobs and none of the current postings matches your skills and qualifications. 

We fill roles across Canada so make sure to include your current address and willingness to relocate (if applicable).

Your resume will be stored on our online database and a recruiter will contact you if there is a position that matches your skills.

Please note that the following qualifications may be required:

  • Successfully pass a criminal background check.
  • Authorized to legally work in Canada (eligible to work in the country for the duration of the assignment).
  • If this position is classified as safety-sensitive, you must also be able to pass pre-access drug & alcohol testing per client access requirements

 

Thank you for your interest!

**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**

Looking for more opportunities? Check out our job board at https://fastlaboursolutions.applytojob.com/apply

Don't see a posting that suits you? Apply to our "General Application" and our recruiters will get in touch when they have a job that fits you!

Follow us "Fast Labour Solutions" on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter @FastLabour for all our new postings

title: Online Sales Support Admin
description:
This position will be responsible for administering to existing resale channels and facilitate the growth of open box product sales. This position will also support B2B and B2C resale programs. The incumbent will have an appreciation for business operations and strive for frictionless customer experience.

We practice a remote first working model - this position is a full time work from home opportunity.

Responsibilities

Sales Channel Operations

  • Responsible for day-to-day administration
  • Creating content for the open box product using available product descriptions and pricing models
  • Coordinating the sale of the open box product
  • Reviewing open box product inventory
  • Assisting in establishing targets and developing reporting

Client support (internal/external)

  • Partner with internal clients to coordinate order related processes
  • Ensure communication with all parties is timely
  • Limited interaction with external customers
  • Responsible for updating internal business reports on a regular basis

Required Skills and Experience 

  • 1+ years of business channel support is an asset
  • Reporting experience is preferred
  • Basic to Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills
  • Strong communication, organizational and customer service skills
  • Team player who strives in a collaborative environment

Education Requirements

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent is required
  • Bachelor’s Degree/College Diploma in Business Administration is preferred

How You’ll Benefit

  • Comprehensive rewards package
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • A workplace culture where collaboration is fostered
  • Ongoing training and development opportunities

description:

Location :Ottawa
Position Type :Contract
Experience Level :10 YearsStart Date / End Date :11/01/2021 / 10/31/2023 
Description
LocationOttawa
LanguageEnglish Required
Security ClearanceSecret Security Clearance Required
 

1.Objectives:

The Project Coordinator (Release Management) will support the Business Application Transformation team to achieve:
  • The deployment of a set of modern digital tools that support clients  staff to meet the clients mandate to fuel the growth of its SME clients.
  • The optimization of the client journey across multiple touch points.
  • The creation, migration, integration and deployment of effective business applications and digital channels that support modern management of grants and contributions, programs, and activities. 
  • Increased ease of use, utility and adoption of the clients business applications, for both clients and staff, enabling improved user/client/partner engagement.

  • Improved decision making through accurate and meaningful analytics by ensuring that reliable and secure information and data is available at the right time and in the correct format.
  • Increased operational effectiveness and become more adaptive to change itself - improving processes that expedite changes to the clients digital ecosystem.

title: Assistant/Associate (General)
description:
A video message from Actionable's founder, Chris Taylor:


Are you an individual that likes to make plans, create lists, coordinate people and ensure that things get done the right way quickly? Are you a problem solver? Do you have a servant's heart? Can you keep a secret? If yes, then read on!

The Actionable.co team is looking for an incredibly high performing person who can join our clan of superheroes and help support our clients in any way possible to scale their brilliance.

In fact, we'll be honest and say right from the start: this is a rolling job posting -- we're constantly looking to add assistants/associates to join our team in a number of departments. This could be working as an entry-level within CS, a seasoned Admin within our Operations team, or somewhere in between!

(The important part is that you fit the following)

You must be

  • The kind of person who lives to organize (your pencils sorted by size and color).
  • Someone who puts people and customers first.
  • Eager to do a variety of work, and see it through to completion.
  • Be great with technology, and determined to learn new things quickly.
  • Able to move fast with minimal/no errors.
  • Proudly sporting 1+ years in an assistant/associate role.
  • Fuelled by the quality of your work and personal satisfaction in a job well done.
  • Highly adaptable and driven.
  • Are able to catch the even smallest grammar mitsakes. ;)


Our team works together to help others make their dreams a reality. Now, we need you - yes you - to help scale to new heights and continue to provide incredible support to entrepreneurs.

What You'll Do

The daily responsibilities in this role include, but are not limited to:

  • Process and manage email inbox and calendar (G-Suite & Zoom).
  • Initiating and completing orders and purchases.
  • Completing varied research projects.
  • Research, booking & coordinating travel / accommodations.
  • Working with Customer Success on Client follow-ups.
  • Webinar support.
  • Assisting in Video coaching calls, liaison for questions, etc.
  • Creating surveys/questionnaires (Typeform).
  • Editing copy/content with an efficient, keen eye for detail.
  • Other duties as required.

What You'll Need

Our ideal candidate has these top qualities and qualifications:

  • Must be process-oriented.
  • Must be a people person. Someone who knows how to make others feel special. Going that extra mile for clients. It's all about the little things.
  • Must have comfort with using a variety of software technologies. The software we use includes G-Suite, Slack, Zoom, Hubspot, Breezy, Typeform, etc.
  • Must be smart and resourceful. Someone who can overcome a challenge by thinking outside of the box.
  • Must be open to embracing the entrepreneurial lifestyle.
  • Must have experience working in a fast-paced environment.
  • Must have great grammar and spelling skills with high attention to detail.
  • Experience being a Freelancer is considered an asset - The attitude, drive, and time-management skills to work from anywhere. That's right, there is no office.
  • All around, someone who has the drive and determination to do great things.


Like What You See?
If you're thinking: “This is totally me!” then be sure to apply below. Even if you're thinking: “This definitely could be me!” apply below anyways — we love diverse and non-traditional backgrounds.

To ensure that you've read the whole ad, please sneak the word ‘Books' somewhere into your application.

We can't wait to meet you!

title: Real Estate Administrative Assistant
description:
We’re hiring a motivated real estate administrative assistant to join our growing team. Responsibilities include administrative duties such as keeping track of all transaction documents in the client database for our real estate agents, monitoring and notifying clients of important deadlines, complying with legal procedures, and planning appointments and final walkthroughs. You’ll also support the team by marketing the company on social media and planning company events. The ideal candidate should be a great communicator who is driven and highly detail-oriented. If this position interests you, start your application today!Compensation:

$35,000 - $40,000 yearly

Responsibilities:
  • Fulfill client requests for information or other relevant transaction services in a quick and friendly manner
  • Notify transaction participants when a deadline is approaching
  • Complete paperwork for all real estate transactions in a timely manner to ensure a deal is closed as quickly as possible
  • Participate in training sessions to improve skills with administrative tasks in the real estate industry
  • Comply with tax withholding processes and legal requirements
Qualifications:
  • Has knowledge of Microsoft Office and customer relationship management software
  • Previous experience in the real estate industry
  • Weekend and evening availability
  • High school diploma or equivalent required
About Company

Keller Williams Edge Realty

title: SECRÉTAIRE (BANQUE DE CANDIDATURES)
company: Centre de services scolaire De La Jonquière
description:
AFFICHAGE INTERNE / EXTERNE

 

Le Centre de services scolaire De La Jonquière (CSSDLJ) accueille près de 10 000 élèves répartis dans 22 écoles et centres de formation. Située dans la région administrative du Saguenay-Lac-Saint-Jean, le CSSDLJ est composé de l'arrondissement de Jonquière de la Ville de Saguenay et des municipalités de Bégin, Larouche, Saint-Ambroise et Saint-Charles-de-Bourget.

 

Le CSSDLJ étudiera en continue, les offres de service reçues en vue de constituer une banque de candidatures (besoins immédiats):

 

 

2021-2022-S-02

Banque - Secrétaires

Horaire de jour

CSSDLJ

 

 

Sous la supervision de la direction d’école, du centre ou du service, vos principales responsabilités seront entre autres de :

  • Assister la direction et les employés en exécutant des tâches administratives ou de secrétariat ;
  • Accueillir et oriente la clientèle selon les besoins ;
  • Effectuer des communications téléphoniques d’ordre général ;
  • Rédiger des lettres, des comptes rendus de rencontres et des notes.

 

Ce qui vous distingue et fait de vous la personne que nous recherchons…

  • Vous êtes reconnu pour votre bienveillance et votre aisance à interagir avec différentes clientèles dont des enfants ;
  • Vous avez le sens de l'organisation et de l’accueil ;
  • Vous êtes une personne autonome, faisant preuve d’un sens éthique élevé ;
  • Vous appréciez le travail d’équipe et la collaboration ;
  • Vous êtes fiable et engagé envers une organisation ;
  • Vous êtes reconnu pour votre capacité à travailler sous pression.

 

 

Qualifications requises :

  • Être titulaire d’un diplôme d’études professionnelles en secrétariat ou être titulaire d’un diplôme de 5e année du secondaire ;
  • Maîtrise de la langue française.

 

Classification et taux de traitement :

Échelle de traitement :                      Minimum : 20,55 $ / h             Maximum : 22,35 $ / h

 

Offre de service :

 

Pour tout renseignement supplémentaire, vous pouvez communiquer avec madame MarJorie Boivin, conseillère en gestion de personnel au (418) 542-7551, poste 4262..

 

Sous réserve du processus de sélection, le CSSDLJ s'engage à traiter confidentiellement chacune des candidatures reçues. Cette offre est faite sans préjudice et n'engage pas l’organisation à retenir l'une ou l'autre des candidatures reçues. Seules les personnes retenues dans le processus de sélection seront contactées.

 

Le CSSDLJ applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles, les personnes handicapées, les membres des minorités ethniques et les autochtones à présenter leur candidature.

 

Les « attributions caractéristiques » pour ce corps d'emploi sont décrites dans le « plan classification - personnel de soutien » à l’adresse suivante : Plan de classification - Personnel de soutien.

title: Seasonal Office Administrator (Norwich, ON)
description:
For assistance on how to apply, please click here
Job Description:

Position Overview

This seasonal 5-6 month position is responsible for supporting an office/department through various administrative activities and coordination of assigned processes during peak times.

Key Responsibilities

  • Managing and maintaining data on grain, organics, specialty crop and IP contracts
  • Prepare retail customer grain cheques and ensuring for accuracy
  • Timely and accurately prepare invoices for customers
  • Contacting, communicating and providing transportation providers and customers with shipping information and necessary paperwork
  • Balancing inventory of crop protection products weekly and monthly
  • Respond and assist customers with account inquiries
  • Balancing daily cash receipts and prepare bank deposits
  • Filing and sorting mail received and maintaining office stationary supplies
  • Prepare accounts payable for facility approval
  • Assist in training of new staff in administrative procedures
  • Customer Service - answer telephones and assist customers where possible
  • Other administrative duties as required or assigned

What is expected of you and others at this level

  • Strong organizational skills
  • Good verbal and written communication skills. 
  • Problem solving skills
  • Acquires basic skills to perform routine tasks
  • Work is prescribed and completed with little autonomy
  • Works with either close supervision, or under clearly defined procedures

Minimum Qualifications & Skills

  • Post-secondary education required
  • 1-2 years' relevant experience required

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed. It does not include all responsibilities and skills required of the job and may be changed at any time. All responsibilities must be completed in compliance with all safety protocols, policies, procedures and consistent with the spirit and philosophy of The Andersons' Statement of Principles.

Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed, but are not to be seen as a complete list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Also, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer. The Andersons, Inc. is a Drug-Free Workplace. The Andersons, Inc. is an EO employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Note: The Andersons, Inc. conducts drug, alcohol and/or medical testing of applicants and employees based on type of position. A copy of our testing policy is available by contacting the HR Department at talentacquisition@andersonsinc.com .

We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us.

PHISHING SCAM WARNING:   The Andersons is among several companies recently made aware of a phishing scam involving con artists posing as hiring managers recruiting via email, text and social media. The imposters are creating misleading email accounts, conducting remote "interviews," and making fake job offers in order to collect personal and financial information from unsuspecting individuals. Please note that The Andersons only uses company email addresses, which contain "@andersonsinc.com", to communicate with candidates via email. The company also uses secure tools on our website to receive data from applicants and would never ask them to submit their personal banking information to apply for an open job.  If you are contacted by someone about an open job at The Andersons, please verify the domain of the sender's email address and that they are asking you to apply on this website. If you believe you've been a victim of a phishing scam, please reference this webpage for guidance on your reporting options https://www.dhs.gov/be-cyber-smart/report-incident

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
At MNP we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. We are one firm, one team, collaborating to support you wherever you want to take your career.

 

Join the momentum at MNP. We are currently seeking an Administrative Assistant to join our growing Administration team. MNP is a leading national accounting, tax and business consulting firm in Canada. Strategically supporting the firm, our Administration team anticipates the needs of our team members and Partners. We effectively communicate information for service lines, industry and specialty groups, and operations at all levels throughout the firm. Our administrators support initiatives and ensure efficiency, allowing MNP to better serve our clients and people.


Responsibilities

  • Perform a variety of administrative and clerical office support activities for multiple staff ensuring timely adherence and deadlines
  • Courteously receive and screen all incoming calls and emails
  • Greet, assist and direct all visitors in a professional manner
  • Review, sort and distribute incoming and outgoing mail and couriers
  • Prepare, review and modify general templates, letters, reports, PowerPoint presentations, Word documents, Excel workbooks and other correspondence materials
  • Assist in the preparation of regularly scheduled reports
  • Create, maintain and update spreadsheets
  • Fax, photocopy and scan documents as required
  • Assist with projects and in the creation of presentations, as needed
  • Record minutes at various meetings and distribute or archive them accordingly
  • Uphold electronic and paper filing systems
  • Coordinate and schedule internal and external meetings, appointments and travel arrangements
  • Manage and coordinate multiple calendars
  • Maintain and monitor office supply inventory levels and place orders as required
  • Develop a thorough understanding of internal programs and processes
  • Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes
  • Participate in coordination of team social events

Skills and Experience

  • Completion of related post-secondary education in administration is an asset
  • Related administrative experience is an asset
  • Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Some travel may be required

More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.   

 

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible dress for your day environment and more!

title: Merchant Assistant (Blenheim, ON)
description:
For assistance on how to apply, please click here
Job Description:

Position Overview

This position is responsible for providing primary support to the assigned location in execution of contracts, rates and coordinating logistical support for commodity shipments by rail, truck or containers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Enter contracts, create contract folders and ensure the accuracy of files and documents for production.
  • Assists with invoicing, collections and payments.
  • Manage assigned customer problems with shipments.
  • Reviews receivables and payables needing additional paperwork to complete processing and initiates the follow-up communication.

What is expected of you and others at this level

  • Has developed knowledge and skills through job related training or considerable experience
  • Often entry level for those with work experience in relevant areas
  • Works within established procedure with a moderate degree of supervision
  • Identifies the problem and all relevant issues in straightforward situations; assesses each using standard procedures and makes sound decisions

Minimum Qualifications & Skills

  • Post-secondary education
  • 1-3 years' relevant experience required

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed. It does not include all responsibilities and skills required of the job and may be changed at any time. All responsibilities must be completed in compliance with all safety protocols, policies, procedures and consistent with the spirit and philosophy of The Andersons' Statement of Principles.

Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed, but are not to be seen as a complete list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Also, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer. The Andersons, Inc. is a Drug-Free Workplace. The Andersons, Inc. is an EO employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Note: The Andersons, Inc. conducts drug, alcohol and/or medical testing of applicants and employees based on type of position. A copy of our testing policy is available by contacting the HR Department at talentacquisition@andersonsinc.com .

We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us.

PHISHING SCAM WARNING:   The Andersons is among several companies recently made aware of a phishing scam involving con artists posing as hiring managers recruiting via email, text and social media. The imposters are creating misleading email accounts, conducting remote "interviews," and making fake job offers in order to collect personal and financial information from unsuspecting individuals. Please note that The Andersons only uses company email addresses, which contain "@andersonsinc.com", to communicate with candidates via email. The company also uses secure tools on our website to receive data from applicants and would never ask them to submit their personal banking information to apply for an open job.  If you are contacted by someone about an open job at The Andersons, please verify the domain of the sender's email address and that they are asking you to apply on this website. If you believe you've been a victim of a phishing scam, please reference this webpage for guidance on your reporting options https://www.dhs.gov/be-cyber-smart/report-incident

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
Mier Temporary Staffing  is hiring!

Job Title: Administrative Coordinator 
Location: North GTA, ON
Length of Assignment: Temporary to Permanent

Job Responsibilities:
  • Compile monthly reporting in Excel
  • Data entry of client and customer information
  • Verifying product codes and pricing
  • Track shipments
  • Liaise internally with multiple department including marketing, sales and distribution
  • Communicate with both internal and external customers
  • Various administrative duties

Qualifications:
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • 1+ year of experience in an administrative capacity
  • Intermediate to advanced excel skills (v-look ups & pivot tables)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Previous experience working in consumer packaging goods or food and beverage industry considered an asset.

If you meet the above qualifications, please submit your resume.
Please note that while we appreciate all applications, only those being considered will be contacted.

title: Account Associate - 25729
description:
Description:
Commis au courrier / Mail Clerk
Tâches :
• Accueillir les clients au comptoir et traiter leur demande avec professionnalisme, courtoisie et empressement
• Répondre au téléphone et interagir avec les clients avec professionnalisme et courtoisie, en français et en anglais
• Recevoir, traiter et trier le courrier, les colis et les fournitures livrés par des entreprises de livraison
• Rechercher les destinataires sur un système informatique lorsque requis
• Livrer et ramasser le courrier selon un horaire précis
• Préparer les feuilles de route (lister le nombre de colis et enveloppes entrants et sortants).
• Opérer de l’équipement léger : trancheuse pour enveloppes, numériseur de colis, etc.
• Effectuer de l’entrée de données

Le candidat doit :
• Maîtriser le français et posséder les bases de l’anglais
• Savoir utiliser un ordinateur
• Avoir une grande capacité d’écoute et être habile à communiquer avec efficacité
• Avoir la capacité de lire, d’écrire et de suivre des instructions simples en anglais et en français
• Être capable de travailler debout et de marcher de longues distances durant de longues périodes de temps
• Être capable de soulever et de transporter des charges jusqu’à 50 livres
• Être en mesure d’effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois
• Démontrer de la débrouillardise, faire preuve de rigueur et suivre les consignes de son supérieur
Tasks :
• Welcome clients at the counter and handle demands obligingly with professionalism, and courtesy
• Answer telephone and interact with clients with professionalism and courtesy in French and English
• Receive, sort & process mail documents, packages and supplies delivered by suppliers
• When needed, research addressee in computer system
• Deliver & pick-up mail on scheduled mail runs
• Prepare mail scheduler (list number of incoming and outgoing envelopes and parcels)
• Operate light equipment, such as envelope slicer, parcel scanner, etc.
• Make data entries

The candidate must be able to:
• Communicate in French with minimal basic English notions
• Use a computer
• Listent and communicate effectively
• Read, write and follow basic French and English instructions
• Work standing up and walking long distances during long periods of time
• Lift and carrying charges of up to 50 pounds
• Be an excellent multitasker
• Be resourcefulness, show rigor and follow instructions from superior

title: Account Associate, Canada
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

You’re an original. So are we. 

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™

This role is a key Sales Support Role with a focus on facilitating the sell-in process and the management and delivery of the order files for both internal and external contacts. There will also be a small selling/sales analysis component to the role through communication with customers mostly by email, phone or through the sales reps. You will report to the Sales Manager, Canada Wholesale Sales.

Responsibilities:

  • Maximizing attainment of Annual Financial Plan (AFP) for Independents channel, mainly by managing of orders in partnership with OM team, by proactive communication on delivery issues and opportunities, checking availability, and provide additional visibility to sales reps on order status, with the end goal of maximizing delivery on orders received especially those from our Top and Major Independent accounts.

  • Support role in linking with the accounts, sales team, OM team and DC for all issues concerning product, availability, selling and immediate market opportunities.

  • Support team in set up of new assortment in NuOrder. Also provide back-up support to NuOrder coordinator on daily inventory maintenance.

  • Support and input into Seasonal Assortment plans and communication of assortment to sales. 

  • Support manager with seasonal post-mortems for line assortment planning with Merch as well as with Planning.

  • Support sales process during each seasonal release with sample coordination, development and delivery of sales packages, head office account presentation set-up and electronic item worksheets, UPC set up, etc.

  • Accountable for maintaining weekly sell-thru consolidation from Top accounts as valuable reference on order related issues as well as identifying incremental order opportunities.

  • Support team on size selection process in collaboration with Sizing team

  • Support team in sample management and distribution during each new season.

Qualifications:

  • Strong skills in MS Office, especially in Excel

  • Understanding of basic retail math.

  • Experience with NuOrder or other B2B apps, Fiori or BI Hana are assets.

  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to analyze and disseminate information and make recommendations based on broad business understanding.

  • Generalist approach to understanding and being able to communicate brand strategies and direction.

  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to deal with customers.

  • Good product understanding and an interest in the fashion industry.

  • Customer Focus:  Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of customers.  Gets first hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services.  Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect

  • Planning:  Sets objectives and goals by breaking down work into process steps.  Anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks.  Measures performance against goals and evaluates results.

  • Peer Relationships:  strong team player and works well cross-functionally

Levi Strauss & Co. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. Minorities, females, people with disabilities and veterans are highly encouraged to apply.

LOCATION

Richmond Hill, ON, CAN

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

title: Account Associate
description:
Company Description

We are Influence. Impact. 

Transformation is our DNA and we live and breathe it at MSL.  As part of the fast evolving PR discipline, we are constantly innovating and making it our mission to ensure we are thinking and doing the next and the new.  Which makes our environment a very agile and exciting place to work! 

MSL is an award winning agency, including winner of the SabreAwards, Canadian PR Agency of the Year for 2019!

MSL is known as a consumer powerhouse, specializing in delivering multichannel, creative campaigns for some of the world’s most iconic brands. All our campaigns lead with creative storytelling and are rooted in big ideas driven by sophisticated data insights. 

MSL are trailblazers in influencer marketing, having created some of this country’s most recognized campaigns.  We were there over twelve years ago navigating the social influencer space and as a result, we’ve pioneered truly unique approaches to reaching Canadians through influencer content.   As part of our thirst for continual evolution, we have further transitioned and made the leap to expand our capabilities into digital marketing, managing high profile social and digital campaigns for several CPG and healthcare brands. 

As part of the Publicis One network, we have a close working relationship with our sister agencies, including Leo Burnett, Saatchi & Saatchi and Zenith.

We are passionate about culture. Built on a foundation of collaboration, we are excited by innovation, and our employees are encouraged to aspire to entrepreneurialism. MSL is a place where your voice is heard and your opinion counts. We are leaders in our space on a growth trajectory. Our existing team of highly engaged individuals are constantly pushing themselves to succeed, working on stimulating challenges in a variety of areas that push us to think in a different way. We have a focused commitment to career development and personal success; we care about our people and cultivating a great environment where people feel proud to work.

MSL Canada has offices in Toronto and Montreal and is proud to be a part of MSLGROUP, Publicis Groupe’s global strategic communications and engagement network. 

Job Description

As an Account Associate, you will be working as part of an account team that develops and delivers strategic, creative client programs. Your job is to tell the client’s story and relentlessly pursue the best ROI, with a focus on executing programs and developing client relationships.

We’re looking for a passionate team player with very strong creative, strategic thinking and organizational abilities. A strategic, creative and analytical thinker who can support cross-channel media strategies for our clients.

Ideally, this candidate will have 1 year of experience with consumer brands supporting internal teams broadly integrated marketing strategies.

Some of the amazing work you’ll do:

·        Provide exceptional results for our clients in public relations, events, media relations and social media communications

·        Exhibit a solid understanding of client information including general business strategy, industry issues and key stakeholders

·        Help develop award-winning, insightful and creative ideas to drive results and brand influence for our clients

·        Build strategic social media campaigns to grow client communities and achieve business goals

·        Craft and deliver targeted messages: write, edit and proofread a full range of materials, such as press releases, fact sheets, pitch letters, blog posts, client emails/reports, status grids, activity reports, etc.

·        Be relentless in the pursuit of program effectiveness: manage day-to-day program activities, overall program implementation, monitoring and evaluation

·        Contribute to strategies around customer service related issues to enhance Brand community experience

·        Demonstrate strategic thinking and research capabilities to support the development of innovative campaigns

·        Manage multiple facets of client programs including research and insights, strategy development, campaign execution, paid digital and social advertising, analytics and reporting

·        Draft, edit and provide highly engaging content to all media materials including editorial pieces, media advisories, press releases, fact sheets and briefing books. Strong writing skills are required.

·        Utilize the latest measurement technologies to uncover new insights to inform brand strategy

·        Use strong insights and detailed consumer research to inform campaign creation

·        Support strategic brand campaigns and have the ability to sell in big ideas within an integrated agency model

·        Demonstrate abilities as a creative thinker and encourage others to think outside the box

·        Build strong relationships with media contacts (written and verbal outreach) while effectively managing media lists

·        Provide timely feedback to management on progress against goals

·        Exercise financial and organizational discipline: help manage budgets to ensure agency profitability

·        Event planning and execution experience is a plus

·        Ability to work in a collaborative, creative, entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment

·        Ongoing tracking and knowledge of industry & brand best practices for PR, influencer relations and social media

·        Participate in client presentations and support new business pitches specific to social and web strategies, investigative research, campaign analysis, monitoring, etc.

Qualifications

Our successful candidate will possess some of the following attributes below. This is just a starting point – if you feel you don’t meet the suggested experience and/or skills, we still encourage you to apply!

Who you are:

·        Post-graduate diploma in Public Relations, Corporate Communications or related discipline

·        1 year of experience in public relations with consumer, lifestyle and/or beauty brands

·        Experience in media relations, social media, event management and influencer relations

·        A passion for working with exciting international brands

·        Entrepreneurial spirit and excitement to become an integral part of a new kind of agency 

·        Excellent communication skills, dynamic, team player, excellent time management and organizational skills

·        Experience with social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, etc. is a strong asset

·        Passionately committed to collaboration

·        Ability to be flexible in a changing work environment and work well under pressure



Additional Information

What we’re offering:

·        Meaningful work where you can have a direct impact working on some of the biggest brands out there!

·        A culture of entrepreneurship, creativity, growth and collaboration.

·        Work with top talent at an award-winning agency.

·        A focused commitment to career development and personal success – let us help you!

·        Highly competitive compensation and benefits package including substantial time off policies (like really. It’s a big deal).

·        Oh, and did we mention the perks?! Parental leave top-up program; annual summer offsites; regular social events; teams and clubs; and weekly Pilates just to name a few #workperks.

·        All staff meetings so you’re always in the know.

To apply for this position, click "I'm Interested" and easily submit your resume. Note that only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Thank you very much for your interest in working at MSLGROUP. We look forward to meeting you!

MSL Canada is committed workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process

title: Senior Administrative Assistant
description:
Adjointe administrative senior


Le secteur des centres de prestations de services recherche une adjointe administrative senior qui sera appelée à travailler pour le vice-président senior afin de l'appuyer dans latteinte de ses objectifs daffaires. Elle travaillera aussi en étroite collaboration avec les adjointes de quatre autres vice-présidents des sous-secteurs afin de coordonner les actions du secteur. Elle apportera également un soutien administratif pour une directrice services-conseils.










Donnez un élan à votre carrière.

Le secteur des technologies de linformation (TI) connaît une période extraordinaire. La transformation numérique des organisations continue de saccélérer, et CGI est au premier plan de ce changement. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leur démarche numérique et offrons à nos professionnels des opportunités de carrière stimulantes.

La réussite de CGI repose sur le talent et lengagement de nos professionnels. Ensemble, nous relevons les défis et partageons les bénéfices issus de la croissance de notre entreprise. Cette approche renforce notre culture dactionnaire-propriétaire ainsi, tous nos professionnels bénéficient de la valeur que nous créons collectivement.

Joignez-vous à nous pour prendre part à la croissance de lune des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de services en technologies de linformation (TI) et en gestion des processus daffaires au monde.

Pour en savoir davantage à propos de CGI : www.cgi.com.

Les candidatures non sollicitées provenant de cabinets de recrutement ne seront pas retenues.

CGI favorise léquité en matière demploi.




Senior Administrative Assistant


The Global Delivery Center Sector is seeking a Senior Administrative Assistant to support the Senior Vice President in achieving his business objectives. The Senior Administrative Assistant will also work closely with the assistants of four other sub-sector vice-presidents to coordinate the actions of the sector, and will also provide administrative support for a Director of Consulting Services.










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Accounts Assistant
description:
Accounts Assistant 

Overview

Magna International (‘Magna’) are a highly successful leading global automotive supplier dedicated to delivering new mobility solutions and technology that will change the world.

With annual revenues of over $32.6bn in 2020 and a trading profit at of $1.67bn, Magna operates through 342 manufacturing operations and 91 product development, engineering and sales centres in 27 countries across North America, Europe and China.

Magna have over 158,000 employees focused on delivering superior value to customers through innovative processes and world-class manufacturing. The Group are at the forefront of a new technological revolution in the automotive industry and are leading the way in all areas of future mobility, with a keen focus on electrification and autonomy.

Established in 2001, the Irish division is located in Bagenalstown Co. Carlow, has almost 500 employees with revenues of €80m. The division is fast paced and fast growing, manufactures tooling and die build and produces panels for prestigious automobiles.

Key Responsibilities

Reporting to the Head of Finance, the Accounts Assistant, located in Bagenalstown, will be a key part of a professional and committed team and will play a central role in both the day-to-day and month-end activities of the Finance team.

Responsibilities

  • Bank reconciliations for all bank accounts including multi-currency
  • Preparation of balance sheet reconciliations
  • Maintain fixed asset register, Capital expenditure records and monthly depreciation journals
  • Assist in the preparation of weekly payroll reports to send to payroll provider
  • Review of reports sent back by payroll provider and preparation of files for review by the Head of Finance
  • Prepare weekly KPI reporting for Senior Management review
  • Preparation of bi-annual & monthly VAT and VIES returns for Ireland & UK
  • Support Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable functions
  • Assist with the preparation of monthly management accounts, working with tight deadlines
  • Assist with the preparation of statutory financial accounts
  • Aid in both internal and external audit work for the Company
  • Other ad hoc duties as required

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • 2-3 years’ experience in accounts administration
  • An interest in pursuing or already a part-qualified accountant working towards a professional accounting qualification (ACA/ ACCA/ CIMA)
  • Experience with an ERP package
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office, in particular MS excel
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Possess strong organisational, analytical abilities and excellent attention to detail and accuracy
  • Works well, both in a team and under one’s own initiative
  • English language fluency, both written and verbal

Accounts Assistant

title: Account Associate
description:
Account Associate - ( 22007145 )

Primary Location : Canada-Ontario-Brampton

Other Locations : Canada-Quebec-Anjou, Canada-Ontario-Kitchener

Flexible Work Location Acceptable: : Multiple Location Options

Shift : Day

Travel : No

FLSA Status : Non-exempt

Job : Sales/Marketing

Equal Opportunity Employer

What is the value of a WM job?

The value of a WM job is more than a paycheck. It’s a way to create opportunities for you and your family.

We Are People First: We foster an environment where all teammates feel welcomed, valued and seen

We Are Committed to Growth: Training and progressive opportunities for professional development

We Are Stable: Our WM team performs essential and meaningful work.

We Are Investing in You: Amazing Medical, Dental & Vision, pension with match, discounted stock options, and more!

Who are we? #WeAreWM

_Ready to start your tomorrow, today?_ Click Apply to join the Waste Management team today.

I. Job Summary

The Account Associate I – Bilingual (IAM - TEAM) generates shareholder value by using a consultative retention based selling approach for Small/Medium commercial Waste Management customers as part of a team-based queue. The IAM - TEAM manages existing business relationships focused on achieving budgeted retention goals by developing and implementing sound retention strategies, utilizing strong negotiation efforts to preserve business, and securing and updating contract agreements from WM customers as well as growing revenues from existing customers. The role of the IAM - TEAM is to maintain a net positive business performance in the commercial space through proactive outreach, account retention and revenue protection efforts to maintain a mutually beneficial alignment between the customer and WM’s growth goals.

II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned.

+ Customer interaction (external and internal), response & follow up.

+ Serves as the lead point of contact for customer account management matters as part of a team-based queue, establish and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with internal and external customers, and build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships.

+ Aligns Waste Management products and services with customer needs, propose solutions that are compliant with appropriate local, state and federal regulations, and increase account penetration through consultative selling skills.

+ Negotiates, updates, and renews customer service agreements to maximize profits by providing ongoing education of contract details and use of strong negotiation skills.

+ Resolves challenging customer requests and collaborate with the Inside Sales Manager to resolve all customer escalations or issues.

+ Communicate rates, charges and service strategies with conviction as well as understand and effectively use customer incentives and concessions within appropriate profit targets and level of authority.

+ Collaborates with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within territory and engage additional WM business opportunities, referring internally as appropriate.

+ Administrative work.

+ Use Waste Management sales productivity software tools accurately and consistently (i.e. Salesforce.com/Customer Relationship Management and Pricing Tools).

+ Prepares reports as needed and/or handle general administrative duties as appropriate.

III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

A. Education and Experience

+ Education: High School Diploma or GED (accredited).

+ Experience: One (1) year of business-to-business account management experience at a proficient level (in addition to education requirement).

B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements

+ None required.

C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required

+ Ability to speak fluent conversational French and English.

+ Ability to effectively convert customer cancellation requests into long term relationships.

+ Ability to effectively build relationships across a wide variety of business types.

+ Ability to multi-task and perform computer duties across multiple screens while on phone with customers addressing issues or concerns in a professional tone and temperament.

+ Proficient in time management and in computer skills – Word, Excel, Power Point, etc.

+ Positive attitude that enjoys assisting and providing solutions to others.

+ High impact communication in written and verbal manner.

+ Ability to adapt to change and manage multiple priorities.

+ Ability to negotiate effectively.

+ Ability to utilize sound business practices.

+ Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

V. Work Environment

Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

+ Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the workday;

+ Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than 30 pounds rarely;

+ Normal setting for this job is an office setting.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

Make an impact at Analysis Group, where we provide our clients with thoughtful, pragmatic solutions to their most challenging business and litigation problems. Analysis Group is one of the largest private economics consulting firms, with more than 1,000 professionals across 14 offices in North America, Europe, and Asia. Since 1981, we have provided expertise in economics, finance, health care analytics, and strategy to top law firms, Fortune Global 500 companies, and government agencies worldwide. Our internal experts, together with our network of affiliated experts from academia, industry, and government, offer our clients exceptional breadth and depth of expertise.

 

The Senior Administrative Assistant works closely with the Office Manager and the Administrative Support team to provide administrative support to the Montreal office.

 

Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities:

  • Translation: Assist with the translation of office translations (mostly from EN to FR). Support compliance with OQLF regulations.
  • VP Support:
    • Meeting and Event Support: Ensure conference rooms and other needed resources are coordinated. Assist in preparing agendas, presentations, and related correspondence for meetings, prepare background briefings, and note taking.
    • Travel Management: Coordinate and manage VP travel, utilizing the companyâ€™s dedicated travel agents. Monitor the progress of trips as needed, including after hours. Manage changes and cancellations; keep calendars updated and all parties informed of changes. Provide itinerary for travel as well as all materials needed for trip. Coordinate Passport and Visa applications and renewals.
    • Expense Reimbursement: Expense reports processing and oversight on behalf of VPâ€™s.
  • Administrative Support: Provide administrative support to the Montreal office and provide back up to the Administrative Support team (Office Manager, EA, Sr AA, Receptionist/AA) when needed. Special projects as requested.

Qualifications:

  • Bilingual: Expert French and fluent English required.
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree required.
  • 5 years of substantive relevant experience required.
  • An ideal candidate will have 3 - 6 years of experience in an administrative support function.
  • Prior experience in the professional services industry preferred.
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Advanced PC capability (Microsoft Office: Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams and PowerPoint).
  • An inclusive and growth-oriented mindset, strong interpersonal skills, and an ability to work across differences.
  • Eligible candidates must be authorized to work in Canada without sponsorship nor restriction, now and in the future.

Analysis Group embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a deep and meaningful way. We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We provide equal opportunities across all sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions, races, colors, ethnicities, mental and physical abilities and characteristics, ages, socioeconomic statuses, and religions, and we encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply.


Other Information:
Nothing in this Job Description restricts Analysis Group, Inc.â€™s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this position at any time. This position is at will, which means that it can be terminated by the employee holding the position or by Analysis Group, Inc. at any time, with or without cause or notice.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant
description:
Senior Administrative Assistant

We are interested in working with an outstanding administrative professional who thinks critically and is driven to achieve high-quality results.

 

Counter will consider candidates who

  • have at least four years full-time work experience as an executive or administrative assistant;
  • are a Certified Administrative Professional (CCAP or CAP) or have a Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Commerce or Business Administration;
  • have a Microsoft Office specialist (MOS) certification or equivalent experience using Office; and
  • live in Ontario and are eligible to work in Canada.

 

WhO You Are

You want to join a team focused on delivering exceptional litigation results and experiences. You understand how your work â€“ even the little things â€“ affects the teamâ€™s and clientâ€™s experience and result. You are an integral and respected team member.

You take pride in your work. You donâ€™t stop at the first roadblock or â€œgood enoughâ€ solution. You think deeply and want to contribute value. You work independently and take initiative. You donâ€™t need to be told how to do something. You are a great communicator and assertively ask for what you need.

 

Who We Are

We are purpose-driven to deliver superior litigation outcomes and experiences. We want to add team members who are energized and capable of making progress toward that purpose.

We see that we will not achieve our purpose without equity, diversity, and inclusion. We believe that we increase our collective intelligence when the people on our team have different interests, backgrounds, and experiences. We see that equity, diversity, and inclusion are critical to seeing and thinking in new ways and delivering superior litigation outcomes.

 

Accountabilities

Every Counterpart energizes and divides their time between a few different roles, and weâ€™ll invite you to do the same. Here are some accountabilities that we expect that the successful candidate will deliver.

Office Administration

  • Organizing appointments and delivering smooth online and in-person meeting experiences, including recording meeting notes and organizing follow-ups
  • Triaging and scanning incoming mail to the applicable role
  • Answering phone calls and connecting callers to the best person or resource

Operations Support

  • Coordinating and filing paperwork related to workplace and insurance compliance
  • Managing in-house knowledge sharing database
  • Posting job ads and assisting with hiring

Executive Assistant

  • Completing projects and tasks outsources from other roles
  • Researching potential solutions and comparing options to recommend the best path
  • Selecting and managing external contractors and providers

title: Assistant Senior Administrative Officer (FT)
description:
PURPOSE
The Assistant Senior Administrative Officer (ASAO) is responsible for assisting with the management and administration of various municipal programs and services, helping to ensure business continuity for the Town of Hay River.  This position ensures programs are developed and implemented in an effective and efficient manner and within all legislative, policy, and procedural guidelines. 
 
SCOPE
  • Reporting to the Senior Administrative Officer, the ASAO works directly with the Senior Administrative Officer to support the management and administration of municipal programs and services and the realization of the Council’s established priorities. The ASAO serves as the Acting Senior Administrative Officer in the absence of the Senior Administrative Officer and provides senior management acting coverage for other departments to ensure business continuity as required. 
  • Working as a member of the senior management team, the ASAO provides corporate communication coordination and leadership, developing and implementing internal and external communication strategies for the organization to ensure unified, consistent, and up-to-date information to residents and staff. 
  • The ASAO supports the management of capital infrastructure and special operational projects identified in the multi-year capital plan and within approved operational business plans.  
  • The ASAO will be instrumental in developing the company’s asset management system through coordination of stakeholders, research and content development.
  • Liaising with Town departments, the ASAO researches and writes funding proposals to support the implementation of programs and projects. 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Supports and assists the SAO in leading the Administration of the Town. This includes but is not limited to:
  • Ensures the implementation of the policies and programs of Council and reports on their effectiveness
  • Assists in implementing recommendations for improvements to policies, protocols, and procedures to improve the overall effectiveness of the administrative offices
  • Provides acting leadership as required for SAO, finance, public works, recreation and community services programs and services 
  • Advises the SAO on feedback received from the community
  • Conducts research such as reviewing municipal developments
 
2. Coordinates and implements internal and external communication, corporate branding, and marketing for the Town. This includes but is not limited to:
  • Designs, manages and updates content on the Town’s electronic communication platforms including websites and social media programs
  • Oversees preparation and distribution of periodic public updates including monthly newsletters
  • Generates public awareness of service interruptions, infrastructure upgrades, public meetings, and projects that have a community impact 
  • Promotes municipal programs, bylaws, services and community events and activities
  • Prepares and delivers public and third party presentations on municipal programs and projects.
  • Prepares Council and Management responses to government, resident, and community group inquiries and requests
  • Prepares detailed media reports, press releases, and public notices
  • Builds corporate brand identity and ensures consistent application throughout the corporation 
  • Orders, prepares, and distributes marketing products and materials
  • Attends tradeshows to promote Town programs and the community as a desirable place to live in, do business in, and to visit
 
3. Using formal principles of project management, supports the execution of projects identified in the Town’s capital plan.  This includes but is not limited to:
  • Plans and manages assigned capital projects to ensure they are completed in a timely fashion and within budget 
  • Completes project reporting for assigned projects for communication to stakeholders including project charters, activity schedules, closeout documents, and documentation required as part of third party funding agreements
  • Procures materials, equipment, and supplies necessary for assigned projects.  
  • Prepares tenders, requests for proposals, and expression of interest documents for acquisition of materials, equipment, consulting and contracting services.   Evaluates proponents, prepares and negotiates contracts 

4. Oversees the coordinated development and implementation of an asset management system for core Town infrastructure, equipment and other assets. This includes but is not limited to:
  • Leads the Town through the development of an asset management strategy and policy 
  • Drives an integrated, coordinated and cohesive use of resources in managing and undertaking preventative maintenance to maximize asset lifespan 
  • Develops a tracking system and procedures for maintaining asset inventories that include condition assessments
  • Leads the advancement and maintenance of an electronic work order system to submit, track and schedule corrective maintenance activities    

5. Researches and supports the various Town departments in securing third party funding. 
  • Researches private and public sector funding opportunities and canvases department heads for interest in supporting their programs
  • Consults with industry and government representatives concerning eligibility requirements for funding
  • Writes proposals for funding to support Town programs

6. Performs other related duties as required
 
 
KNOWLEDGE and SKILLS 
The following knowledge and skills are required for an individual to be able to perform the duties of this position: 
  • Proficiency in government program administration, management and delivery
  • Demonstrated strong experience with digital and social media communication channels
  • Strong writing, communication, planning, and problem solving/analytical skills.
  • Demonstrated infrastructure project management experience
  • Experience with asset management and/or asset maintenance systems
  • Procurement and contract writing skills
  • Funding proposal writing experience
  • Strong computer skills – Word, Excel, Outlook
  • Stress and time management skills
  • An understanding of the community, northern cultural and political environment
  • An understanding of the roles and responsibilities of Town Councils

QUALIFICATIONS
The ASAO would normally attain the required knowledge, skills and attitudes through completion of post-secondary education in Public Administration, Business Administration, Public Works / Engineering, or Administration plus five years related experience. Equivalencies will be considered. 
 
 WORKING CONDITIONS
 
Physical Demands
The ASAO may have to work odd or long hours at a time to complete special requests or projects.  The ASAO will have to spend long hours sitting and using office equipment, computers and attending meetings.
 
Environmental Conditions
The ASAO may find the office environment to be busy, noisy and will need excellent organizational and time and stress management skills to complete the required tasks.
 
Sensory Demands
There are no unusual sensory demands with this position.
 
Mental Demands
The ASAO will have to manage many requests and projects at one time.  The incumbent may have to complete many tasks and responsibilities at one time, and must be prepared to deal with emergencies and stressful situations at any time. The incumbent will need to drive the integration of functions and resources to support the comprehensive coordinated preventative maintenance system
  
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
 
Position Security 
Q Position of Trust – criminal records check required

title: Senior Admin Asst/Coordinator
description:
Senior Admin Asst/Coordinator
Ottawa, ON
1 Year

Job Description:
Monitors and reports on projects of the highest complexity and/or scope from contract through implementation and follow-through to ensure projects are kept on schedule and meet budgetary requirements.

Prepares status reports on projects for management, clients, or others, and modifies schedules or plans as required.

Assists with determining project scope, customizing project plans, setting project timelines, and assigning tasks/people to ensure efficient flow of processes.

Works with the stakeholders to determine dependencies, priorities, critical path, and milestones for projects.

Assists with the review of project proposals or plans and provides recommendations on time frames and administrative procedures for accomplishing project.

Observes the work flow process of multiple projects associated with the creation and update of project management information to ensure requirements are quality checked and moving through the work flow process efficiently to meet budget and deadlines.

Assists in the development of presentations, and takes meeting minutes and action items during meetings.

Develops and maintains relationship with client counterpart(s) and serves as the administrative point of contact for coordinating all aspects of the project, keeping client informed of project status.

Collects budget information from department managers, maintains records of expenses to compare with estimated budget, and prepares budget reports for management.

Consults with department managers to ensure adjustments are made in accordance with project changes in order to facilitate long-term planning.

Troubleshoots high level administrative problems/issues, and identifies areas for process improvement.

Coordinates activities of project personnel support staff to ensure projects progress on schedule and within prescribed budget.

Kick-off
• Underwriting group
• The group hosts events, in house training sessions
• Group attends tradeshows
• The group does webinars/hosts webinar
• Candidate will coordinate with internal managers on different events throughout the year
• Manages calender of events
• Deals with contracts, supplier, sign off, internal approval, booking travel/hotels
• Invoicing/payment
• Reporting through Excel-tracking expenses/budgeting for the year
• Bi-lingual is an asset, but not required
