Et grâce au volet mondial, au soutien, à la culture inclusive et à la technologie, vous pourrez devenir la meilleure version de vous-mêmes. Nous comptons sur votre voix et votre point de vue uniques pour aider EY à devenir encore meilleure également. Joignez-vous à nous et créez une expérience exceptionnelle pour vous-mêmes et un monde meilleur pour tous.']

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney is seeking an Administrative Assistant to join our rapidly growing team in Kitimat, BC. As an Administrative Assistant, you are the glue that keeps the team together. Wearing a variety of hats, you will work independently while bringing forward opportunities for improvement within our current processes. You have an approachable demeanor and are comfortable managing competing priorities with ease. In this position, you will provide administrative support to a team of office and field-based staff working across BC.

What You’ll Be Doing: 

  • Provide branch reception services including, answering phone, greeting clients, preparing, and receiving shipments for courier and mail
  • Coordinating and organizing travel plans and accommodations for staff
  • Assisting with various safety-related duties, including tracking and scheduling training
  • Coordinate meetings, schedule and manage boardrooms
  • Assist with composing letters, memoranda, and e-mail correspondence as necessary
  • Perform clerical tasks such as filing, photocopying, scanning, archiving, and disposal of branch documents (i.e., general maintenance of digital and general filing systems)
  • Manage inventory of office supplies and coordinate supply orders
  • Maintain equipment and building maintenance
  • Assist with fleet management, including coordination of vehicles, servicing/outfitting and seasonal maintenance
  • Contribute to a safe, clean, and positive office environment
  • Coordinate internal and external events
  • Establishing and maintaining relationships with suppliers
  • Execute a range of other duties as required

What You’ll Bring:
  • Previous experience in an administrative support role within a professional environment.
  • Previous experience with MS Office 365 (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Project)
  • Strong skills working with technology and systems
  • Exceptional customer service and communication skills (written and verbal),
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Adobe Acrobat, an asset.
  • Attention to detail and ability to multi-task in an efficient and organized manner; and
  • Demonstrated workplace professionalism with the ability to handle confidential/sensitive information with discretion.
  • BC Driver’s License, Class 5 or higher, with a driver’s abstract that demonstrates safe driving behavior is preferred but not required.

 Key Characteristics for Best Fit: 
  • A passion for working collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams
  • Organized with the ability to ‘switch gears’ at a moment’s notice
  • Curious and eager to learn new skills
  • Innovative mindset with the ability to recognize ‘ways to get the job done more efficiently
  • Self-aware individual with the ability to recognize when to defer to the senior supervisor
  • Respectful of team members, contractors, clients, and other stakeholders

What Can We Offer You?
  • Great compensation and benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 

 

Vaccination Requirement

In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

  #LI-AM3  #LI-Junior  #Junior  #Hybrid #LI-Hybrid 

If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Proposal Specialist
description:
• Develop high-quality, solution-oriented proposal responses, narratives and methodologies working collaboratively with Comtech’s Capture Manager, Pursuits Team and Subject Matter Expert(s)  to respond to Requests for Proposals/RFXs for our Buildings & Facilities, Energy & Utilities and Transportation & Infrastructure sectors.
  • Review RFX documents to assess requirements and work with the Capture Manager and bid team to develop compelling proposal narratives.
  • Facilitate proposal kick-off meetings and colour reviews of the Comtech bid management process. Support bid review meetings to dissect the proposal, suggest areas for improvement and execute proper quality assurance and control relating to the proposal positioning relative to the winning strategies and themes
  • Develop proposal graphics, templates and standards to support a consistent look and feel, writing style, and layout of bid submissions. 
  • Draft cover letters, executive summaries, project descriptions, resumes, team qualifications, various management plans, win themes and competitive differentiators.
  • Review and audit material for quality, content requirements, format, accuracy, consistency, compliance and conformance to firm branding policies and standards. Conduct compliance checks against the RFX requirements.
  • Support the company’s strategic pursuits and knowledge hub in developing a library of win themes, solutions, methodologies, graphics, project case studies, CVs and other areas.
  • Develop proposal templates following the company’s branding standards.


Job Requirements:
  • A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a similar role leading the development, execution, and successful completion of complex proposals.
  • Proficient in utilizing Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe In-Design, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat Pro).
  • Preferred experience involving consulting services to Project Owners (e.g. Program/Project Management, Engineering, Technical Advisory, Construction Management).
  • Bachelor’s degree or College Diploma in Business, Arts, Marketing, Graphic Design or equivalent.
  • Highly refined business writing skills combined with exceptional attention to detail.
  • A passion for learning new subject areas, applying new knowledge and working collaboratively with our technical team(s) to develop solution-oriented and quality proposal narratives/content.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and analytical skills.
  • Proven ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks successfully.
  • Ability to be able to prioritize work based on changing priorities and deadlines.
  • Must be proficient in working with digital collaboration tools such as MS Teams, Office 365 and SharePoint

title: Office Administrator
description:
Brandt is currently seeking an Office Administrator in our Barrie location. Primary responsibilities include: general office duties, switchboard, typing and filing. Working on a multi-line switchboard, knowledge of Microsoft Office and strong organizational skills are considered assets.

  • The work requires specialized and comprehensive knowledge of administrative work methods, procedures, approaches, and operations.
  • Two year Diploma or University Degree, or equivalent experience, is preferred
  • 2 years office administration experience is preferred
  • General understanding of mechanical/technical terms is preferred
  • Demonstrated proficiency with all Microsoft Office programs is essential
  • Team player with good intuition and strong sense of urgency about solving problems and getting work completed
  • Adaptable and organized in a fast-paced office
  • Punctual with exceptional customer service and prioritization skills
  • Strong business English skills for creating correspondence, presentations, documents and reports

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
As Canada’s largest residential landlord, CAPREIT prides itself on our customer service and the smooth operation of our properties.  Our Administrative Assistant will report to our Property Manager and Senior Operatoins Manager, and maintains accurate up-to-date systems. In their role, they are responsible for the administration of all site requirements, ensuring all legislation is prepared and executed properly, along with reviewing reports on a weekly basis.

 

Candidates for this position should have experience in customer relations, be proficient with computers, and have excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate has excellent organization skills, the ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment, and be flexible to work varying hours.

 

Please note that applications from all interested individuals are appreciated; however, we will only contact candidates that are selected for an interview.

 

CAPREIT values diversity in the workforce and is an equal opportunity employer. 

CAPREIT welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

The Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative and clerical services in order to ensure effective and efficient operations.

 

Responsibilities:

 

Reception• Answer general phone inquiries in a professional and courteous manner• Direct phone inquires to the appropriate staff member• Reply to general information requests with the accurate information• Greet visitors to the organization in a professional and friendly manner

 

Office administration• Use computer word processing, spreadsheet, and database software• Sort incoming mail, faxes, and deliveries for distribution• Prepare and send outgoing faxes, mail, and packages• Forward incoming general e-mails to the appropriate staff member• Data entry and upkeep of the organization's databases, ensuring a high level of accuracy• Provide administrative support to management and other staff

Perform other duties and tasks as required by Manager.

 

Qualifications:

 

• Excellent interpersonal skills• Team player• Effective verbal and listening communications skills• Attention to detail and high level of accuracy• Effective written communications skills• Computer skills including the ability to operate spreadsheet and word processing programs• Time management skills• Ability to speak the local language• Proficiency in the use of office equipment such as Computer, Voice messaging systems, Fax, photocopier

The ideal candidate has excellent organization skills, the ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment, and be flexible to work varying hours.', '• Excellent interpersonal skills• Team player• Effective verbal and listening communications skills• Attention to detail and high level of accuracy• Effective written communications skills• Computer skills including the ability to operate spreadsheet and word processing programs• Time management skills• Ability to speak the local language• Proficiency in the use of office equipment such as Computer, Voice messaging systems, Fax, photocopier', 'Perform other duties and tasks as required by Manager.']

title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
COMPANY PROFILE:

Crozier is a leading consulting engineering firm committed to growing careers and building communities by delivering multidisciplinary engineering services in private sector land development. Crozier provides services in civil, water resources, traffic/transportation, hydrogeological, structural, mechanical, and electrical engineering, complemented by landscape architecture and building science. With offices in Toronto, Milton, Collingwood, and Bradford, Crozier’s growing team of professionals work collaboratively with developers, builders, planners, architects, landowners, and stakeholder groups to advance residential, industrial, commercial, institutional and recreational resort projects from concept through to construction completion.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

We are looking for a Proposal Coordinator to join our growing Proposal team. We are looking for someone who can apply their project management skills to coordinate content from a multi-disciplinary team to create a single voice response that tells a story in response to clients needs.

If you are a strong writer, a great communicator, energic, and take pride in your organizational skills, we’d like to hear from you.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Conduct thorough analysis of proposal requirements (inclusive of Go-No/Go rationale).
  • Understand strategy to prepare suitable response framework.
  • Prepare and implement a proposal development schedule and communication plan to meet critical milestones (manage kick-off and check-in meetings and prepare/update responsibility matrices as required).
  • Prepare queries to gain clarity on client specific requirements (in support of story development).
  • Develop template structure and maintain ownership of master document throughout proposal development process.
  • Engage technical resources to coordinate and collect content relative to proposal requirements.
  • Proactively follow up with internal and external resources to ensure timely receipt of content.
  • Review and edit content for relevance and accuracy.
  • Search and provide additional content to substantiate story.
  • Complete overall proposal edits to accomplish a single voice submission.
  • Provide illustrative elements (if/when required) to support story telling.
  • Format proposals for final submission.
  • Identify proposal trends such as project types and locations and inform team.

Tool and Content Support

  • Identify and track content for future proposals using a content library.
  • Provide support to manage the content library.
  • Provide support in the development of new proposal tools such as templates, technology, and process implementation.
  • Liaise with marketing to ensure all proposal documentation aligns with corporate branding.

Proposal Team Support

  • Support proposal set ups through internal software (Ajera and network drives).
  • Monitor proposal websites (for example Merx/Biddingo) when required.
  • Provide support to maintain proposal and project files.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • 5+ years proposal writing experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Business, Communications or a related field.
  • Strong communication and project management skills.
  • Highly organized, ability to work on multiple projects, prioritizing and meeting tight deadlines.
  • Analytical, logical thinker (for proposal and opportunity assessments).
  • Understanding of proposal development process and sales.
  • Proficient with Word, Excel and Powerpoint.
  • Working knowledge of InDesign is considered an asset.
  • Experience in the engineering industry is considered an asset but not required.

WE OFFER:

Crozier is a company where our clients, community partners, employees and their families are truly part of our family. Our workplace celebrates the good life, while working hard to help design and engineer communities of the future.

We’re passionate about what we do, so it’s easy to be up for the challenge – even when deadlines loom. A healthy balance of work and play feeds our energy … we work hard, but always find time for fun.

Our culture is based on three core values; Be Entrepreneurial, Bring your Energy and Show you Care!

Competitive Salary and Benefits:  We offer competitive salaries and health benefits, as well as RRSP contribution plans, fitness allowance, Crozier Days, Parental Leave Top Up and a First Time Home Buyers program.

Conveniently Located: With offices in Collingwood, Milton, Bradford and downtown Toronto, we enjoy easy commutes and are always close to our favourite places.

Teams that play together, stay together: We frequently have after-hours get togethers, participate in community events, or play sports. We’re always up for a friendly competition amongst friends, family and co-workers.

Community involvement: We grow together, through shared experiences. We encourage involvement in the community and support our local communities with initiatives, events and sponsorships.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Crozier, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Crozier is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Should you need assistance at any point during the recruitment process please contact Human Resources.

title: Adjointe Administrative
description:
Enviro Connexions / Waste Connections of Canada est un chef de file dans la gestion des déchets solides non dangereux en Amérique du Nord. Nous recherchons un joueur d'équipe soucieux de la SÉCURITÉ, énergique, autonome et proactif, capable de faire une différence dans son équipe et sa communauté.

Nous avons une ouverture immédiate pour un administrateur adjoint à notre bureau de Laval.

En tant qu’administrateur adjoint, et Sous la responsabilité des Directeurs des Operations vous êtes la voix d’Enviro Connexions, supportant l'une de nos principales valeurs opérationnelles. Votre réussite dans ce rôle dépend de votre ardeur au travail et de la qualité de votre communication avec les clients internes et externes. Vos compétences en matière d'organisation et de gestion du temps, ainsi que votre comportement personnel et éthique, sont d'une importance primordiale pour ce poste.

Lieu :

Situer dans le district de Laval (St- François)

Travail présentielle, temps plein de lundi au vendredi de 8h au 4h30

Formation et expérience :

• Détenir un diplôme d’études de secondaire technique ou collégiales en secrétariat et administration ou supplier au diplôme manquant avec l’expérience en années d’expérience pertinents.

• Expérience minimales de 2 and dans un département administratif dans une fonction similaire en soutien.

Exigences:

  • 5 ans en Operations, Logistique de transport dans l’industrie ou un industrie similaire
  • Bilingue : excellente maîtrise du français et de l’anglais tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. Niveau de rédaction supérieur
  • Excelle en calcul
  • Sens de responsabilité et de l’engagement
  • Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps et en priorisation
  • Sens de l’organisation et du suivi
  • Méthodique, structurée et ordonnée
  • Excellentes habileté relationnelles, de communication et de rédaction
  • Jugement et discernement et discrétion absolue
  • Capacité à travailler sous pression et à travailler plusieurs projets de fonts
  • Sens de priorités et de l’urgence
  • Autonomie
  • Disponibilité pour travailler en dehors des heures normales d’affaire lorsque requis

Tache clés :

• Voit à la tenue de l’agenda de la direction des opérations, à la gestion quotidienne et prioritaire des courriels et correspondances, à la coordination, préparation t invitation aux réunions.

• Prépare les comptes rendus des réunions des opérations et liste les actions en découlant

• Être responsable de la gestion de comptes pour A25 et A30, payer les factures et commander de nouvelles vignette

• Support aux superviseurs pour la gestion des exceptions dans Workday, et autres niveaux

• Traitement des dossiers de réclamation assurances et CNESST incluant les recherches pour compléter les dossiers

· **Liste non limitative

Venez rejoindre un environnement d'équipe et des collègues qui adoptent une culture "work hard, play harder".Notre programme de rémunération est compétitif et s'accompagne d'excellents avantages sociaux.Vous vous associerez également à une entreprise qui aime montrer l'exemple grâce à une forte présence dans nos communautés locales, des dons de bienfaisance, des initiatives de développement durable, etc.

Enviro connexions est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi.

Enviro Connexions / Waste Connections of Canada is a leader in non-hazardous solid waste management in North America. We are looking for a SAFETY conscious, energetic, self-directed and proactive team player who can make a difference in their team and their community.

We have an immediate opening for an Assistant Administrator in our Laval office.

As an Assistant Administrator, and reporting to the Directors of Operations you are the voice of Enviro Connexions, supporting one of our core operational values. Your success in this role depends on your hard work and quality of communication with internal and external customers. Your organizational and time management skills, as well as your personal and ethical demeanor, are of paramount importance to this position.

Location:

Located in the Laval district (St-Francis)

Presential work, full time Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 4:30 pm

Education and experience:

- High school diploma or college diploma in secretarial and administrative studies or equivalent with years of relevant experience.

- Minimum of 2 years’ experience in an administrative department in a similar support function.

Requirements:

- 5 years in Operations, Transport Logistics in industry or similar industry

- Bilingual: Excellent oral and written skills in French and English. Superior writing skills

- Excellent numeracy skills

- Sense of responsibility and commitment

- Excellent time management and prioritization skills

- Organizational and follow-up skills

- Methodical, structured and orderly

- Excellent interpersonal, communication and writing skills

- Judgment and discretion

- Ability to work under pressure and to work on several projects at once

- Sense of priorities and urgency

- Self-starter

- Availability to work outside normal business hours when required

Key tasks:

- Responsible for maintaining the Operations Department's agenda, managing daily and priority emails and correspondence, coordinating, preparing and inviting to meetings.

- Prepares minutes of operations meetings and lists actions arising from them

- Responsible for managing accounts for A25 and A30, paying invoices and ordering new stickers

- Support to supervisors for exception management in Workday, and other levels

- Processing of insurance and CNESST claim files including research to complete the files

- **Non-limiting list

Come join a team environment and colleagues who embrace a "work hard, play harder" culture. Our compensation package is competitive and comes with excellent benefits. You'll also be associated with a company that likes to lead by example through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives, and more.

Enviro connections is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Your Employer:

Terraprobe Inc. (an Englobe Company)

At Terraprobe, we adopt innovative, human-centered management. We welcome new ideas and are open to continuous Improvement. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

We offer:

  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service
  • Compensation for vehicle expense and travel
  • Personal Protective Equipment
  • Professional Development, skills certifications
Your Contribution:

As an Administrative Assistant, you will work in collaboration with the Testing & Inspection Team. Reporting to the Barrie Branch Manager, this candidate will specifically:

  • Greet guests and providing basic company information through email, phone and in-person
  • Answer the phone and direct calls to other employees
  • Data entry
  • Support a wide variety of projects by completing administrative tasks such as typing concrete cards and filing for multiple projects
Your Profile:
  • Enrolled in or completed a Business Administration college program or related discipline
  • Experience in an administrative role is an asset
  • Experience using Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Teams, etc.) Adobe, and other office applications
  • Attention to detail with accurate proofreading skills
  • High level written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Prioritize multiple projects and adjust work accordingly
  • Be a team player as well the ability work independently
  • Punctuality and dependability are required

title: Assistant(e) Administratif(ve) - Emploi d'été
description:
Assistant(e) Administratif(ve) Programme Emplois d’été Canada pour Jeunes Note : Ce poste est ouvert à tous les jeunes âgés de 15 à 30 ans peu importe s’ils sont aux études ou non
Les ‘étudiants étrangers’ (détenteurs d’un permis d’études) ne sont pas admissibles
Lieu de travail : Welland Contrat de 16 semaines à raison de 30 heures / semaine Salaire : 15 $ de l’heure; date de début souhaitée : 2 mai 2022 Responsabilité Générale Sous la supervision de la directrice des Services en soins de santé primaire et communautaire et de la coordonnatrice, l’assistant(e) administratif (ve) assiste les intervenants à la Réception
Il/elle accomplit des tâches de soutien administratif général
Responsabilités Spécifiques : Effectuer des appels téléphoniques Accueillir la clientèle du Centre de santé à la Réception et au téléphone Orienter les clients vers les services appropriés Procéder au dépistage du COVID-19 auprès de la clientèle S’assurer du respect des consignes sanitaires en place Procéder à l'entrée des données électroniques Mettre à jour les dossiers des clients Effectuer les appels téléphoniques nécessaires à la mise à jour des dossiers Enregistrer les rendez-vous de la clientèle Procéder à la désinfection des aires à forte circulation Recevoir, trier et diffuser le courrier Réaliser des tâches générales de bureau telles que le classement, les photocopies, etc
Fournir tout soutien administratif nécessaire aux Services Toute autre tâche connexe jugée pertinente par le superviseur Qualifications, Aptitudes et Exigences Spécifiques : Être âgé(e) entre 15 à 30 ans Excellente connaissance du français et de l’anglais à l'oral et à l'écrit Diplôme d’études secondaires complété ou en cours Diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaires en cours serait un atout Éducation et/ou expérience en informatique ou en secrétariat serait un atout Disponible à travailler une soirée par semaine (jusqu’à 20 h le soir) Capacité d'organiser et de prioriser les tâches Excellente aptitude à la communication avec la clientèle de tous âges et toutes origines Excellentes connaissances de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc
) Bonnes compétences interpersonnelles Capacité de respecter la confidentialité Flexibilité quant aux heures de travail Fournir une vérification du casier judiciaire pour le secteur vulnérable satisfaisant (si âgé de plus de 18 ans) Veuillez faire parvenir votre candidature avec lettre de présentation et Curriculum Vitae rédigés en français ou en anglais
------- Administrative Assistant Canada Summer Jobs Program for Youth Note: This position is open to all youth between the ages of 15 and 30 regardless of whether they are in school or not
International students' (with a study permit) are not eligible
Location : Welland 16 week contract with 30 hours per week Salary: $15 per hour; desired start date: May 2, 2022 General Responsibility Under the supervision of the Director of Primary Health Care Services and the Coordinator, the Administrative Assistant assists the Receptionists
He/she performs general administrative support duties
Specific Responsibilities: Make telephone calls Greet the Health Centre's clientele at the reception desk and on the telephone Refer clients to appropriate services Screen clients for COVID-19 Ensure compliance with the health regulations in place Perform electronic data entry Update client files Make telephone calls to update files Record customer appointments Disinfect high traffic areas Receive, sort and distribute mail Perform general office duties such as filing, photocopying, etc
Provide any necessary administrative support to the Services Any other related duties as deemed appropriate by the supervisor Specific Qualifications, Skills and Requirements: Must be between 15 and 30 years of age Excellent knowledge of French and English, both written and spoken High school diploma completed or in progress College or university degree in progress would be an asset Education and/or experience in computer or secretarial skills would be an asset Available to work one evening per week (up to 8:00 p
m
in the evening) Ability to organize and prioritize tasks Excellent communication skills with clients of all ages and backgrounds Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, etc
) Good interpersonal skills Ability to respect confidentiality Flexibility in terms of work hours Provide a satisfactory vulnerable sector criminal record check (if over 18 years of age) Please send your application with cover letter and resume written in French or English

title: Proposal Coordinator
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Proposal Coordinator is responsible for assisting with the pursuit of leads and opportunities leading to new business for Chandos.

This work includes assembling proposals, cold calling as directed, pulling land titles for prospective projects, monitoring trade publications, arranging lunches/coffees/meetings, assembling presentation materials, following up on leads, entering leads/opportunities into Chandos’ Cosential database, preparing reports to assist with analysis of sales performance within the organization, etc.

The efficient and quick completion of these tasks allow Chandos’ Director(s) of Business Development to operate at peak efficiency while providing the Business Development Director the opportunity to learn the construction business.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in liberal arts, business, journalism, engineering or related field.
  • Minimum 5 years experience in Proposal Coordinator role
  • Experience working in Cosential and Adobe Suite preferred

  • Highly effective task management, prioritization, multi-tasking and time management skills.

  • Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.



Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.', 'Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. title: Guest Relations Administrative Specialist
description:
Company Description

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s® history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers. From coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day. 

Job Description

We currently have a 1 year contract position opening in the Calgary Regional Office for the position of Guest Relations Administrative Specialist.

The Guest Relations Administrative Specialist will be the first line of contact for our guests.  We are looking for someone with an energetic can-do attitude, as well as customer service skills and strong administrative skills. This individual needs to be a business professional and enjoy working with senior leadership. This position requires excellent guest service, guest recovery and time management skills. It also requires excellent analytical and interpersonal skills and requires the ability to engage with team members at all levels of the organization.

Principal Accountabilities
In addition to following McDonald’s policies and procedures, principle accountabilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Providing support to other members of the team including but not limited to Operations, Facilities, Deployment, Field Service and our Vice-President. This includes but is not limited to answering guest phone calls, guest recovery, replying to guest concerns via email and Medallia, preparing and sending guest recovery letters and escalating concerns when necessary to members of the restaurant teams
  • Administrative support will include: scheduling, coordination, materials formatting in excel, PowerPoint, Publisher or other software
  • Preparation of background information for meetings and appointments.
  • File, prepare and proofing of all communication
  • Updating and creating Excel spreadsheets, Word documents and PowerPoint slides
  • Preparing, editing & printing communication memos, reports and other information as required
  • Answering all guest calls through the switchboard as required and / or taking appropriate action to assist in resolving matters whenever possible
  • Receive guest complaints and respond in a timely manner
  • Organize and manage guest feedback as it is received
  • Compile and prepare weekly and monthly reports for team members.
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and qualifications:

  • Several years of experience as an administrative assistant preferably with a reception/customer service background
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong competency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and the ability to adapt easily to new software programs
  • Organized and the ability to multi-task and work in a high pressure environment, while still maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Dedicated self-starter who can work independently taking initiative on appropriate tasks
  • Experience working in a fast paced environment with the ability to adjust quickly to change and ambiguity
  • The ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a cross functional team
  • Strong attention to detail and timelines
  • Ability to work with confidential and sensitive information


Additional Information

This is a 1 year contract employment position

Successful candidate must be available to work from Mon-Sun 9a-5p

Successful candidate must be fluent in both English & French

title: Admin AM (Data Acquisition)-1
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Summary
This position provides inbound telephone customer support and determines the nature of the call or inquiry. The successful candidate communicates with internal/external customers on a daily basis via phone, fax, and email. This position inputs and processes shipments, domestic and international, in accordance with UPS and local government policies.

Responsibilities:

  • Screens incoming calls.
  • Keys data accurately within time specific deadlines into UPS systems.
  • Checks and forwards legal documentation.
  • Provides administrative support to Management team


Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Accurate typing speed of 40+ words per minute
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment
  • Availability to work flexible shift hours

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Adjoint(e) administratif
description:
Adjoint(e) administratifFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Mesure et analyse développe, fabrique, vend, livre et assure la maintenance de produits et de solutions afin de permettre aux clients des secteurs industriels et de l'énergie de renforcer l'efficacité et la rentabilité de leurs opérations. Nous sommes déterminés à servir nos clients en leur offrant les meilleures solutions numériques pour répondre à leurs besoins rapidement et de façon fiable, tout en mettant à leur disposition un réseau de services mondial.Dans le cadre de vos fonctions, vous offrirez un soutien administratif général à la division Mesure et analyse à Québec et des services en secrétariat à son équipe d'ingénierie. Vous agirez à titre de point de contact pour les requêtes, offrirez des solutions à celles qui se trouvent dans votre portée et entreprendrez des mesures de référence hiérarchique au besoin.Relevant du directeur général, vous serez essentiel au bon déroulement des procédures et processus administratifs au sein du secteur d'activité : vous devrez évaluer le niveau d'urgence des problèmes tout en offrant un soutien de nature confidentielle à l'équipe de direction.
Vos responsabilités

  • Répondre au téléphone, transférer des appels et prendre en charge les questions simples des clients et aux questions d'ordre général.
  • Réserver des salles de réunion, planifier des rendez-vous et organiser les services de traiteur lors d'événements.
  • Accueillir et inscrire les visiteurs et les nouveaux employés et gérer leur accès au bâtiment.
  • Entretenir les salles de photocopie et de courrier en conséquence, veiller à ce que l'équipement de bureau soit fonctionnel et que les stocks appropriés soient disponibles.
  • Se coordonner avec les différents fournisseurs du bâtiment.
  • Entretenir la documentation et les bases de données en ingénierie (documents de formation,SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, SAP, etc.).
  • Offrir un soutien administratif pour les bons de commande, les contrats d'ingénierie, les facturations, la gestion de la feuille de temps et l'équipement et les licences de TI.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Un à trois ans d'expérience dans un poste administratif ou un poste d'assistant(e).
  • Avoir la capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément ainsi que posséder d'excellentes aptitudes de planification.
  • Avoir une attitude amicale et approchable, en plus d'avoir une approche dynamique et enthousiaste envers ses tâches.
  • Excellentes compétences en communication en anglais et en français, à l'oral comme à l'écrit.
  • Connaissance des outils informatiques tels que la suite Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.).

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.#LI-Hybrid

title: Administrative Assistant (Construction)
description:
Job Description:

Administrative Assistant (Construction)

 

 

We continue to grow without sacrificing our quality and integrity, and are dedicate to building great things - solid teams, amazing projects, and lasting relationships.  As we continue to win new work in all areas of the company we are looking for great people like you join our team!

 

The  Administrative Assistant assumes a wide range of responsibilities including, but not limited to:  

  • Understand and anticipate priorities and needs of the Project Director and Project Management Team  and provide effective and timely confidential support.
  • Schedule meetings and assist in calendar management.
  • Manage the calendar and identification of key correspondence.
  • Organize management meetings including event logistics, catering, travel, and meeting materials.
  • Prepare and circulate memos, letters and reports.
  • Assist in the orientation and project onboarding of new personnel.
  • Routine correspondence to Owner, Engineer, Sub-Trades and Suppliers in co-operation with the Project Manager.
  • Assist with the management of and tracking of our QA / QC program.
  • Track progress and productivity rates.
  • Compile, develop and submit all project billings to the customer
  • Compile, organize and manage project operations & maintenance (O&M) manuals
  • Supports the team with other duties as required

  • Checking and processing supplier invoices

  • Uploading documentation and any relevant information onto the Maple internal portal, Sharepoint and other platforms as required

   

This role will require an experienced  Administrative  Assistant with the following:    

  • Minimum Grade 12 education.
  • Related administrative experience in construction would be an asset
  • Minimum 5 yearsâ€™ experience in an administrative support role.
  • Proficient in MS Office and Windows-based computer applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.).
  • Ability to use/learn industry specific software programs.
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Able to work under pressure and effective at multitasking
  • A dedicated team player with excellent interpersonal skill
  • Ability to handle multiple projects at the same time with excellent follow-up skills
  • Detail oriented, with excellent organizational skills
  • Experience with ISO 9001:2015 or other Quality Management Systems would be an asset
  • Valid driverâ€™s license.

 

 

If you would like to be part of our continued success, please submit your resume and cover letter.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders.  Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

Being part of a growing company in the cleantech sector and contributing to the global transition to a circular economy appeals to you? That’s exactly what our employees do every day when they come to work. Enerkem is based on a revolutionary idea: transforming waste into clean fuels and renewable chemicals. Our Canadian-born solution offers an innovative and sustainable alternative to landfilling and incineration while reducing dependency on fossil fuels.

Such an ambitious mission requires people who strive to make a difference. Our employees are the best in their field; they are resilient and passionate contributors who transform challenges into opportunities. Our culture values individual ideas and contributions for the company’s success. It’s a place where you can lead and inspire others within a creative and dynamic team.

Job Description

You are recognized for your exceptional organizational skills, high energy and attention to people, you are looking to have an impact, in your job, your workplace, and the world too, by working for a company that brings innovation to another level.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION
You will provide administrative support to our executive team within Enerkem. You will report to the Executive Assistant to the CEO. This is an opportunity to collaborate with a dynamic team as you enrich your career and work on Enerkem’s unique and disruptive technology.

Your role and responsibilities will be the following:

Support to the executive team ​

Agenda Management:​

  • Manage agenda and establish priorities​ as needed
  • In charge of domestic and international travel and hotel arrangements and manage logistics for visitors ​
  • Coordinate internal and external projects appointments, conferences, meetings (room bookings, required equipment, catering services on occasions)​
  • Prepare expense reports as needed​

Communication and collaboration:​

  • Preparation and formatting of correspondence, communications, reports, briefing documents or other documents based on drafts, including correction of grammar, spelling and punctuation in both French and English (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio)​
  • Support in the tracking of the defined corporate objectives and update into monthly trackers, dashboards, and presentations​
  • Provide occasional help on special and ad-hoc projects

Administration:​

  • Work in collaboration with HR to support the onboarding of new members, especially for managerial functions (first week agenda, meetings coordination, communications)
  • Invoice matching / transaction tracking, PO reconciliation, Budget support

General office coordination​

  • Collaborate with other executive assistants, participate in common tasks and occasionally replace the receptionist​
  • Provide support in logistics and office management needs for our Sherbrooke office on a 1 day per month basis or as needed
  • Provide assistance on ad-hoc business requests as needed​
  • Provide ad-hoc support to the social committee team​
Qualifications

  • At least 7 years of relevant experience in an administrative or professional support function
  • College diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience as an administrative assistant
  • Perfectly bilingual in both written and verbal communication in French and English
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office, especially Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience in synthesizing information and building presentations and reports
  • Availability to travel to our Sherbrooke office to provide assistance 1 day per month (having a car would be ideal)

YOUR COMPETENCIES

  • High demonstration of flexibility, and positive motivation to help with varying tasks supporting different groups and functions in the organization
  • Resourceful and proactive with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail with an aptitude for proofreading and data entry
  • Strong time management skills and ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment under minimal supervision
  • Proven ability to deal with sensitive materials with a high degree of tact and discretion
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders


Additional Information

At Enerkem, the well-being of our employees is at the heart of our priorities! We provide a living environment where each individual counts and is recognized for their contribution to the success of the organization. We believe in the importance of celebrating our successes and having fun! We focus our efforts on developing talents and, among other things, offer opportunities for everyone to participate in stimulating projects as well as learning opportunities and feedback / coaching that allow them to succeed, develop and flourish professionally.  Enerkem also offers a total compensation package that includes competitive salary, performance bonus, and comprehensive benefits to meet all the needs of our employees and their families, including telemedicine.

And that's not all, here are some other unique benefits:

  • $ 400 credit for health care and / or physical activities to support the well-being of our employees
  • Access to telemedicine
  • An employee recognition program
  • Social activities organized by a committee dedicated to encourage team spirit and promoting well-being
  • Enerkem adopts a hybrid working mode where employees are be able balance working from home and working at the office according to business requirements
  • Training costs, membership fees and professional association memberships paid
  • A flexible working environment with autonomy to take action.

Enerkem subscribes to the principle of equity in employment. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace that offers equal opportunities for all, where people of diverse backgrounds and characteristics feel valued, respected, supported and can thrive. These values, which reflect the talent, experience and qualities of our employees, allows us to get the best out of each and every one of us.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Apollo Health & Beauty Care (Apollo) is a premium developer of private label and control label health & beauty care products and leverages unique expertise and experience in developing national brand-equivalent products designed to compete equivalently with the most popular national brands. The largest private label and control label personal care manufacturer in Canada, Apollo has formidable penetration and distribution in the North American marketplace and also services customers throughout Central and South Asia, Mexico, Europe and Asia. Building on our core values of Excellence and Commitment, Apollo has established itself as a market leader that attracts the industry's top talent. We are currently searching for an energetic, motivated Travel Coordinator and Administrative Assistant  to join our Apollo Team!
 
POSITION SCOPE: The Travel Coordinator & Administration Assistant will be responsible for managing the air, hotel and ground transportation reservations for executive members travel requirements and assisting other administrative or HR support.  RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES: ·        Manage all national and international air, hotel, and ground transportation reservations for executive members.
·        Research and compare available flights/hotels/car rentals to identify the best available option for each travel need
·        Responsible for day to day operations, last minute changes, new bookings due to schedule changes/delays, cancellations.
·        Prepare travel itineraries and distribute travel arrangements and schedules to all appropriate executive member within a reasonable amount of time
·        Advise travelers of and assist with any need for specialized travel documents
·        Find COVID-19 testing sites and book tests for travelers, when needed 

·         Prepare and submit per diem requests for all travel booked

·        Provide cost breakdown for flights, hotels, rentals, etc. for install travel booked 

·        On call for travel emergencies after hours
·        Perform a variety of clerical duties such as writing memos, letters, filing, photocopying etc. as requested
·        Perform other duties as assigned 

JOB SPECIFICATIONS: ·        1-2 years’ experience of booking corporate travel, with scheduling/logistics experience considered an asset
·        Knowledge and Experience: 1-3 years’ experience in a corporate environment required; post-secondary education preferred
·        Superior organizational skills and attention to detail 

·        Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills, with the ability to juggle multiple large and small projects at a time 

·        Excellent decision-making skills with the ability to assess multiple options and to identify the best choice to serve a specified goal 

·        Ability to work well under pressure and remain calm in stressful situations 
·        Excellent verbal and written communication skills 

·        Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with extra proficiency in Excel 
·        Willingness and ability to keep up to date with evolving technology and travel regulations 

·        Ability to keep personal information about employees and others confidential 

·        Available for work weekends and/or after hours for emergency support for travelers "Apollo Health & Beauty Care will ensure accommodations are available in consultation with candidates during all stages of the recruitment process" The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Duties outlined on this job description may not be all-inclusive and can be modified at any time if requested by management. Apollo is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all parts of the hiring process. Apollo will work with applicants to meet accommodation needs that are made known in advance. We thank all applicants for their interest however only those meeting the minimum qualifications will be interviewed.

title: Secrétaire-réceptionniste
description:
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

Tu cherches un milieu de travail dynamique où tu pourras acquérir de l'expérience en soutien administratif ?
Tu apprécies le fait d'offrir un excellent service à la clientèle et tu entre facilement en contact avec les autres ?

Tu es allumée, dynamique, proactive et tu aimes apprendre de nouvelles choses ?
Tu as une bonne gestion des priorités et ton anglais est de niveau avancé à bilingue ?

Dans ce poste de secrétaire-réceptionniste, tu seras amené à faire du multitâche.
Ce rôle te permettra de t'accomplir au quotidien en soutien administratif et au service à la clientèle.
Œuvrant dans le milieu manufacturier, cette entreprise offre un environnement de travail dynamique où les bureaux ont récemment été rénovés.
Tu seras amené à collaborer et être souvent en contact avec tes collègues de travail.

Ce poste vous intéresse ? Contactez-nous dès maintenant!
Vous souhaitez en apprendre davantage sur le rôle?

Communiquez avec nous par téléphone au : 418.525.1191
Par courriel au :
elise.dumas-roy@randstad.ca
ivonne.carrillo@randstad.ca
myriam.lheureux@randstad.ca

Avantages
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

-Salaire compétitif ;
-Horaire flexible ; 40h/semaine ;
-Poste permanent, du lundi au vendredi ;
-Congés fériés payés ;
-Congé mobile (1 journée) ;
-REER ;
-Environnement dynamique ;
-Bureau nouvellement rénové ;
-Gym sur place ;
-Café gratuit ;
-Et bien plus encore !

Responsabilités
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

20% des tâches :
-Accueil des clients et visiteurs ;
-Répondre et transférer les appels ;
-S'occuper du système téléphonique ;

80% des tâches :
-Effectuer divers travaux administratifs tels que : saisie de données, facturations, classement, rédaction de mémos, etc. ;
-S'occuper du courrier ;
-Traiter, transférer et envoyer des courriels ;
-Assurer un suivi des sondages clients (à raison de 1h à 2h/semaine).

Qualifications
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

-Expérience pertinente en administration en service à la clientèle ;
-Connaître la Suite Office ;
-Anglais de niveau avancé à bilingue ;
-Excellente communication interpersonnelle ;
-Dynamique, proactive, bonne gestion des priorités ;
-Aimer le multitâche !


Sommaire
Secrétaire-réceptionniste | St-Augustin-de-Desmaures | 45 000$ à 55 000$

Tu cherches un milieu de travail dynamique où tu pourras acquérir de l'expérience en soutien administratif ?

Tu es allumée, dynamique, proactive et tu aimes apprendre de nouvelles choses ?
Tu as une bonne gestion des priorités et ton anglais est de niveau avancé à bilingue ?

Dans ce poste de secrétaire-réceptionniste, tu seras amené à faire du multitâche.
Ce rôle te permettra de t'accomplir au quotidien en soutien administratif et au service à la clientèle.
Œuvrant dans le milieu manufacturier, cette entreprise offre un environnement de travail dynamique où les bureaux sont tout neuf.
Tu seras amené à collaborer et être souvent en contact avec tes collègues de travail.

Ce poste vous intéresse ? Contactez-nous dès maintenant!
Vous souhaitez en apprendre davantage sur le rôle?

Communiquez avec nous par téléphone au : 418.525.1191
Par courriel au :
elise.dumas-roy@randstad.ca
ivonne.carrillo@randstad.ca
myriam.lheureux@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Affinity Group Canada is a well established successful and growing company that prides itself on being one of the premier food brokers in Canada.  Since 1989, our success has been driven by the number of industry leading food manufacturers that we represent.  We pride ourselves on having a dedicated sales team, strong customer service orientation, extensive product knowledge and a professional, challenging and rewarding work environment.

 

Summary:  The Administrative Assistant plays a key support role within the Affinity sales team by providing administrative and management support to the sales team and management group. This role is responsible for managing and prioritizing requests from the sales team and managing key projects and ensuring reporting and correspondence is completed timely.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Administrative support to sales team and management group
  • Updating and maintaining CRM system
  • Various project support and maintenance
  • General office administration duties
  • Shared reception duty

The successful candidates must possess the following Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: 

  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills complemented by tact and diplomacy
  • Must be fluent in English written and oral communication
  • Excellent organization skills
  • Problem solving ability to resolve the day-to-day situations as they arise
  • Advanced Computer Skills, i.e. Word, Excel, and MS Outlook, CRM
  • Self-motivated with an ability to work independently in a fast-paced multi-tasking environment
  • Proven ability to effectively prioritize work flow
  • Ability to exercise good judgment, show initiative and be proactive
  • Motivated team player with a demonstrated passion for exceptional customer service,
  • Responsive to time-sensitive deadlines.

Physical Requirements/Working Conditions:

  • Candidate must be able to perform the essential functions of the job.
  • Work will be performed in an office 
  • Sit for extended periods of time.

We offer a competitive wage, and group benefit package.  Interested candidates should email resumes.  Only successful candidates that meet our requirements will be contacted.  Previous applicants need not apply.

The Affinity Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Assistant(e) administratif(ve) bilingue
description:
Offre d’emploi : Assistant(e) administratif(ve) bilingue – Montréal, Québec, semaine de travail de cinq jours

Hill+Knowlton Stratégies est à la recherche d’un(e) assistant(e) administratif(ve) bilingue, consciencieux et dynamique basé(e) à Montréal pour assurer le soutien administratif et appuyer les équipes du bureau de Montréal et Québec.
 

Hill+Knowlton Stratégies est la plus importante société d’experts‑conseils en communications stratégiques au pays. Nommée pour une onzième année consécutive l’un des meilleurs lieux de travail au Canada, elle offre à ses employés un environnement collaboratif où les activités se déroulent à un rythme effréné. Son équipe des plus talentueuses est propice à l’échange avec des collègues qui prônent l’excellence. Par ailleurs, elle propose d’intéressantes possibilités d’emploi, un programme complet de perfectionnement ainsi qu’une rémunération et des avantages concurrentiels.
 

RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Répondre au téléphone et rediriger les appels
  • Accueillir les clients
  • Coordonner l’entrée et la sortie du courrier et des colis pour services de messagerie
  • Tenir à jour la liste des postes téléphoniques des employés
  • Tenir l’horaire des réunions dans les salles de conférence
  • Assurer le bon ordre des salles de conférence
  • Coordonner les services de restauration et le support technique pour les réunions
  • Gestion quotidienne du bureau
  • Suivi administratif, comptable et contractuel
  • Création, révision et mise en page des documents selon les normes graphiques de l’entreprise
  • Appui et soutien dans l’élaboration d’offres de services
  • Traduction et révision de documents
  • Soutien informatique
  • Appui logistique aux conseillers de l’équipe
  • Appui à l’arrivée des nouveaux employés
  • Support à l’organisation d’événements internes et d’événements clients
  • Organisation et coordination de rencontres internes et externes
  • Organisation des déplacements
  • Interface avec les autres bureaux au Canada
  • Archiver les dossiers et la base de données


QUALIFICATIONS PROFESSIONNELLES

  • Bilinguisme (français et anglais)
  • Diplôme universitaire ou collégial, un atout
  • Excellente capacité à communiquer et aisance au téléphone
  • Capacité de suivre des procédures précises et d’appliquer une grande attention aux détails pour produire des documents exacts, sans erreur
  • Capacité éprouvée à travailler en équipe
  • Expertise dans la suite Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint et Excel) et Outlook
  • Capacité à gérer les priorités et à travailler de manière autonome, avec un minimum de supervision
  • Aptitude à respecter des échéances serrées
  • Capacité à présenter visuellement des données
  • Expérience du service à la clientèle, un atout

 

Grâce à ses huit bureaux répartis d’un océan à l’autre, Hill+Knowlton Stratégies est le chef de file des relations publiques et gouvernementales. Ayant son siège social à Toronto, Hill+Knowlton Stratégies est la meilleure agence de communications stratégiques au Canada. Son équipe d’experts se spécialise dans les communications d’entreprise, le marketing de contenu, la recherche et l’analyse, les affaires publiques, les techniques de communication commerciale, la gestion de crise, l’énergie, les technologies, les soins de santé, les communications numériques et les médias sociaux, les communications financières, ainsi que les transactions. Seule agence de communication s’étant vu décerner l’Ordre d’excellence pour la qualité par Excellence Canada, elle figure également parmi les meilleurs lieux de travail au Canada pour la dixième année consécutive. Sa société mère, Hill+Knowlton Strategies inc., compte 87 bureaux répartis dans 49 pays ainsi qu’un vaste réseau de membres associés. Elle est aussi membre du groupe WPP (NASDAQ : WPPGY), l’un des plus importants réseaux d’entreprises de services de communication au monde.

*Le masculin est utilisé sans discrimination dans le seul but d’alléger le texte*

 

Déclaration d'hébergement :

H+K Stratégies accueille et encourage les candidatures de personnes handicapées. Ainsi, des aménagements raisonnables sont disponibles à la demande d'un candidat handicapé, vous assurant ainsi de pouvoir participer à tous les aspects du processus de recrutement et de sélection. Si, en tant que demandeur d'emploi qualifié, vous demandez un aménagement, nous vous consulterons et vous proposerons des aménagements raisonnables en fonction de vos besoins d'accessibilité. Si vous souhaitez faire une demande, merci de fournir une lettre de motivation lors de votre candidature à ce poste.

 

Le candidat retenu pour ce poste peut être invité à remplir un examen des antécédents, qui peut inclure des contrôles criminels, de crédit, d'emploi, d'éducation et/ou de vaccination COVID 19. Toutes les offres d'emploi sont conditionnelles à la réception de résultats satisfaisants de tout contrôle applicable. Dans notre engagement continu à donner la priorité à la santé de nos collègues, à nous conformer aux exigences des clients/partenaires commerciaux et à contribuer à préserver la continuité de nos activités H+K Stratégies exige que les employés, les sous-traitants et les partenaires commerciaux soient entièrement vaccinés avec la ou les doses appropriées d'un vaccin approuvé par Santé Canada. Vous devrez fournir une preuve de vaccination complète contre la COVID-19 à H+K Canada avant votre date de début comme condition d'emploi. « Entièrement vacciné » signifie que 14 jours se sont écoulés depuis la réception de la série complète d'un vaccin contre la COVID-19 ou d'une combinaison de vaccins contre la COVID-19 approuvée par Santé Canada (c.-à-d. deux doses d'une série de vaccins à deux doses ou une dose d'un vaccin à dose unique). Série de doses de vaccins) et peut inclure, à la discrétion de la Société, toute autre dose conformément aux directives de Santé Canada. Les exemptions ne seront accordées que pour des raisons médicales ou pour un motif protégé en vertu de la législation applicable en matière de droits de la personne.

 

Déclaration sur la diversité et l'inclusivité :

H+K Stratégies Canada fournit des services dans l'un des pays les plus diversifiés au monde.

En tant qu'employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances, Hill+Knowlton Stratégies ne discrimine pas les candidats ou les employés sur la base de leur race, croyance, couleur, âge, religion, sexe, expression et présentation de genre, handicap, orientation sexuelle, état civil, statut militaire, le statut socio-économique, l'origine nationale ou l'ascendance.

 

Chez Hill+Knowlton Stratégies, nous croyons que le travail que nous faisons ensemble devrait permettre à toutes les personnes touchées de prospérer, y compris et surtout celles des groupes sous-représentés. Grâce à notre stratégie nationale de diversité, d'équité et d'inclusion, nous nous engageons à lutter contre les préjugés et le racisme systémique dans notre industrie. Nous considérons la diversité comme un atout pour notre organisation et nos communautés et nous nous efforçons de constituer une main-d'œuvre qui reflète la société dans laquelle nous travaillons. Nous nous engageons à promouvoir une meilleure compréhension et appréciation de notre diversité humaine ; un engagement qui se concrétise au mieux par nos efforts individuels et collectifs. Ensemble, nous construisons un environnement où nous embrassons l'ensemble de chaque personne ; où chacun est traité avec humanité et agit avec empathie ; et où tous ceux qui travaillent avec nous ont ce dont ils ont besoin pour s'épanouir.

 

Message aux agences :

H+K Stratégies Canada n'accepte pas les appels téléphoniques non sollicités, les références ou les curriculums vitae de toute source autre que directement des candidats. H+K Stratégies Canada ne prendra pas en considération les appels téléphoniques non sollicités, les références et/ou les CV des fournisseurs, y compris et sans s'y limiter, les cabinets de recrutement, les agences de recrutement, les services de référence payants et les agences de recrutement. La soumission de références ou de curriculum vitae par toute personne autre qu'un candidat directement à H+K Stratégies Canada n'est pas la bienvenue. Les références et les curriculums vitae non sollicités envoyés à H+K Stratégies Canada seront considérés comme gratuits, et H+K Stratégies Canada ne sera en aucun cas obligé ou lié de payer une référence ou tout autre frais si un candidat référé par une source tierce est embauché par la suite.

Il s'agit d'un poste contractuel de douze mois pour couvrir un congé de maternité

#LI AHC6

title: Administrative Assistant — Health and Safety
description:
Is the administrative field your favorite subject? Does the Office suite hold no secret for you? And above all, do you have a strong interest in the field of occupational health and safety? Then you are probably the administrative assistant — health and safety that we need!

Your future team
Premier Tech Growers and Consumers is a North American leader in the professional and commercial horticulture markets. Thanks to our coast-to-coast production and distribution network, we provide our customers with superior quality products so they can help feed, protect and improve our world in turn!

Your future role in a few words

  • Maintain existing OHS programs in accordance with regulations — WHMIS, lockouts, electrical hazards, inspections, work procedures, etc.
  • Participate in various special projects in collaboration with the OHS team — plant reorganization, acquisition of new equipment, implementation of new processes or work methods, etc.
  • Coordinate the logistics of meetings and training sessions — invitations, reservations, preparation of support documents, etc.
  • Develop visual presentations for training and information sessions
  • Prepare and review PowerPoint presentations
  • Assist in the development of team indicators
  • Compile statistical data
  • Produce, translate and proofread documents — both in French and English

Required skills

  • Training in office automation or translation — or any other relevant training
  • Proficiency with the Office suite — particularly Excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience in performing administrative tasks
  • Proactivity
  • Good management of priorities
  • Concern for a job well done
  • Curiosity
  • Excellent command of French and English — written and spoken

Are these words meaningful for you?
OHS program, regulations, presentations, data analysis, project management

Want to learn more? Don't wait any longer, you're one click away from taking your career to the next level!
