title: Office Administrator
description:
Alberici subsidiary, BRC Group, is seeking an Office Administrator to provide administrative office support on a full time,  basis. This position is office based out of the Uxbridge office with occasional travel to the Burlington office 

BRC Group provides masonry, historic rehabilitation, and concrete formwork construction services throughout Ontario.

The Office Administrator is responsible for receiving all visitors and callers to the main office, coordinating all mail and deliveries and provide Safety and Operational support. Confidentiality, professionalism, diplomacy, and strong communication skills  are required. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following, however, other duties may be assigned.  Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

General Office and Administrative Support to include but not limited to:

  • Performs all administrative duties
  • Manages incoming calls
  • Answers or directs general inquiries from employees and the public relating to the organization in a helpful and courteous manner.
  • Manages sorting and delivery of incoming mail and courier packages.
  • Prepares outgoing mail, parcels and courier deliveries; track shipments as required.
  • Provides meeting services (such as video equipment, audio equipment, projectors, catering, clean up, etc.) as requested.
  • Ensures office equipment is maintained and in working order
  • Ensures kitchen is tidy and stocked.
  • Ensures reception area and meeting rooms are organized with a professional appearance.
  • Assist IT with requests as needed.
  • Oversight and management of project documentation.
  • Setup credit accounts with new vendors/ suppliers.
  • Order miscellaneous tools/material for projects.
  • Prints drawings and specifications for project sites
  • Coordinate travel bookings for employees.
  • Submit employee expense reports as required
  • Provide Safety administrative support (i.e. documentation, coordinate training, update training logs, etc.)
  • Collect and submit requalification documentation as required.
  • Submit “Form1000” or “Notice of Project” forms
  • Travel to sites within Southern Ontario as required.
  • Maintains office inventory.

Cost/Accounting/ Payroll Support to include but not limited to:

  • Process (code, forward, approve) invoices via Workflow
  • Payroll support – complete and submit weekly payroll time sheets
  • Submit monthly corporate card expense reports

Education, Experience, and Skills

Post- secondary status or post-secondary school education in Business Administration or Communications and a minimum of 1 to 3 years related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

 

 

**Accommodations will be made upon request throughout the Recruitment process**

*We thank all applicants, however only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview*

See job description

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Bio:

Applus+ is a global leader in the Testing, Inspection and Certification sector delivering non-destructive testing, inspection, engineering, and manpower services to the aerospace, power, and, oil and gas industries. We are a trusted partner who enhances the quality and safety of our clientsâ€™ assets and infrastructures while safeguarding their operations. We deliver this through our technical capabilities, innovative approach, and our motivated team who are committed to operational excellence.

 

Applus+ has achieved a significant global presence and a leading position in its target markets and regions. As a result, our teams have expanded with 19,000 professionals across the world, attracting the very best talent in the industry.

 

Together beyond standards.

Position Purpose:

Overall duty of this position is to provide day-to-day administrative and project support for both internal and external clients within the Non-Destructive Testing operations. The Administrative Assistant assists with a variety of standard office procedures including processing invoices, timekeeping and data entry.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Prepares and organizes client files.
  • Collects weekly timesheets and prepares weekly data entry for Payroll purposes. Prepares and processes weekly invoice drafts.
  • Requests safety training for Technicians. Prepares purchase order requests.
  • Organizes customer billing reports.
  • Collects and audits weekly expense reports.
  • Coordinates travel and accommodation bookings for Technicians Updates resumes and certification pages for Technicians.
  • Updates and maintains various documentation.
  • Coordinates all mail including arranging couriers when required.
  • Maintains office supply inventory and orders supplies in a cost-effective manner. Assists with the distribution of company supplies to project sites and Technicians. Provides back up support for the Operations team.
  • Adheres to organizational policies and procedures, including but not limited to Applus Code of Ethics and Confidentiality Agreements.
  • Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary.
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Firmly adheres to the values and ethics of Applus. Exhibits honesty, discretion, confidentiality, and sound judgment.
  • Excellent customer service focus, ability to quickly build strong working relationships with business partners and colleagues.
  • A sense of urgency, good attention to detail, excellent organizational and analytical skills, pragmatic, eager to learn.
  • Have the ability to establish and maintain effective and professional relationships with other management staff, employees, and the general public.
  • Adapt in a fast-paced environment with the ability to manage competing priorities and multi-task with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to excel in a team environment.
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office and other software applications.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills matched with the ability to negotiate and build relationships with key stakeholders.
Education and Work Experience:
  • Post-secondary education in Office Administration from an accredited College. 2-3 yearsâ€™ experience in office administration.
  • Equivalent experience combined with other formal training and accreditations may be accepted.
Working Conditions:
  • The physical environment requires the employee to work inside an office environment, protected from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes.
  • The work is primarily sedentary.
  • The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. Work outside of normal business hours will be occasionally required. Occasional to frequent travel will be required within Canada.

title: Office Coordinator
description:
Who we are:

Valnet Inc. is a digital media company that specializes in content distribution. Valnet has rapidly grown to become a leader and global trendsetter in content creation and distribution. Our core business lies in acquiring some of the trendiest entertainment news websites and investing our resources into growing them into leading global brands across several entertainment verticals. With over 22 websites and 36 YouTube channels, Valnet’s notable acquisitions include, Screen Rant, CBR, Game Rant, MakeUseOf, Android Police and more.

A place of cutting edge innovation and fierce digital content experts, Valnet is taking editorial and video publishing to the next level. Our overarching vision and mission statement: distribute editorial and video content to millions of viewers daily across our websites, YouTube channels, and Social Media platforms.

The position:

Valnet is on the lookout for an organized Office Coordinator. This person will oversee all aspects of our office and kitchen operations. In this role, you will play an important part in ensuring Valnet’s daily operations run smoothly while maintaining the facility in an orderly fashion. 

What you will be doing:

  • Greet visitors, direct them appropriately andnotify company personnel of visitor arrival. 
  • Sort mail/packages and ensure they are being picked up by the right people.
  • Handle mailing letters and parcels. 
  • Setup desk for new hires. 
  • Monitor and stock office supplies. 
  • Manage external vendors such as dry cleaners, office cleaners etc. 
  • Coordinate with the building manager, cleaning and repair crews to solve office issues. 
  • Maintain cleanliness in the kicthen. 
  • Ensure that snacks are readily available. 
  • Clean the coffee machines daily and oversee maintenance. 
  • Replenish missing kitchen utilities such as coffee cups, towel paper rolls, etc. 
  • Clean working surfaces before and after lunch. 
  • Undertake any other duties relevant to the position. 

Requirements: 

  • Experience in customer service, reception or similar field. 
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively. 
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.  
  • Highly organized and detail oriented. 
  • Team first mentality.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft office suite
  • Bilingual (French and English)

title: Office Administrator
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview

We are seeking an energetic and self-motivated Office Administrator to join our team to perform a variety of administrative tasks. The Office Administrator is someone that represents the executive team in a professional manner, maintains confidentiality, is detail oriented, takes initiative and has the ability to work independently and efficiently.

 

Responsibilities include supporting the Executive Assistant/Office Manager in general office operations, accounts payable, meeting and event coordination, reception relief and other tasks as assigned. 

Responsibilities

  • Assist in general office administration
  • Administrator for company cell phone account
  • Onboarding and offboarding of employees; orientations, seating plan, distribution lists, welcome packages
  • Accounts payable administration; cheque requisitions and purchase orders
  • Manages monthly office expense tracking
  • Contribute to the daily organization of all common office areas; meeting rooms, copy areas, supply/storage room, lunchroom and kitchenettes
  • Assist in meeting logistics (calendar bookings, catering, registration, room set up, visitor assistance)
  • Assist with event planning and coordination
  • Reception relief as needed, including vacation coverage
  • Member of the office OH&S Committee
  • Administrative support to the Executive Assistant / Office Manager
  • Other administrative tasks for operations and projects as assigned

Reception Relief Responsibilities

  • Greet internal and external guests in a courteous and professional manner
  • Answer main phone line and respond to general inquiries from the public
  • Enforce safety culture by providing safety orientations to visitors
  • Prompt distribution and preparation of incoming and outgoing mail, couriers and faxes
  • Ensure all machines in common areas are functioning and arrange services as required (dishwasher, coffee machines, copiers, printers, postage and reception tablet)

Qualifications

Education: 

Post-Secondary education in Business Administration an asset

 

Required Skills:

  • 2 years + of administrative and/or reception experience
  • Strong MS Word skills are required - Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Sharepoint knowledge is an asset
  • A high degree of tact, discretion and confidentiality
  • Self-motivated, takes initiative and strong work ethic
  • Ability to work independently with strong organizational skills
  • Experience with purchase orders and accounts payable
  • Excellent communication skills; both verbal and written
  • Excellent customer service skills; professional, friendly, energetic and positive attitude
  • Experience with SAP a plus

Competency Profile

  • Integrity, Trust and Confidentiality
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Detail Orientated
  • Interpersonal Savvy
  • Approachability
  • Time Management

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Operations Administrator
description:
Operations Administrator

Location: Calgary, AB

Who You’ll Work For  

REEF’s mission is to connect the world to your block. 

We transform underutilized urban spaces into neighborhood hubs that connect people to locally curated goods, services, and experiences.

With an ecosystem of 4,500 locations and a team of 15,000 people, REEF is the largest operator of mobility, logistics hubs, and neighborhood kitchens in North America.

Together we are leveraging the power of proximity to keep our communities moving forward in a sustainable and thoughtful way.

What You’ll Do 

You'll flex your communication skills and problem-solving abilities while serving as a face for REEF Technology's global-facing brand. By serving as a resource to motorists, you'll deduce strategies to provide consistent, quality operations while cultivating positive consumer attitudes and rapport. If you're up for the challenge and ready for fast-paced fun, we've got a Customer Service Representative (CSR) position just for you! 

Operate with Speed & Agility  

  • Develop sound critical and decision-making skills necessary to thrive in a fast-paced environment with back-to-back calls while maintaining poise, accuracy, and speed 
  • Act as a fast-moving, courteous company brand ambassador while processing transactions, interfacing with guests, communicating company policies, and enforcing regulations  

Champion Customer Success 

  • Foster customer success, happiness, and satisfaction by building customer rapport, addressing customer inquiries and complaints, providing empathy, and communicating information 
  • Embrace performance-based call monitoring, recording, and assessment approach to improve communication, timeliness, and overall satisfaction 

Cultivate Information Accuracy & Quality  

  • Spark accurate, speedy operations while optimizing voice quality, grammar skills, tone, and proactiveness to improve quality and consistency  
  • Leverage your knack for technology and attention to detail to foster data integrity by gathering information, composing documents, and inputting data  

What We Want From You 

  • Responsible and accountable for providing general information to customers and assisting with their concerns as needed
  • Provide trouble shooting and preventative maintenance for parkade equipment
  • Building and maintaining strong relationships with client, operational and security staff
  • Accountable for general facility maintenance requirements
  • Ensuring all safety protocols are met
  • Ability to work independently and/or in a team-oriented environment
  • Capable of working in a variety of weather conditions
  • Able to lift a minimum of 30lbs when required
  • Other projects as assigned
  • Must be at least 18 years of age  
  • Previous experience in a high-volume, fast-paced environment, preferred  
  • A knowledge of contact center policies and software, including CRM, phone systems, etc.  
  • A strong work ethic and reliability with professionalism and poise  
  • Superior interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills 

What We’ll Provide 

  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • RRSP Matching program
  • Personal Absence Days (PAD)
  • Flexible schedules
  • Career pathing and advancement opportunities

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: 
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. 

  • Frequently operate small office equipment such as a computer, calculator, and copier/printer 
  • Will remain in seated position for extended periods of time 

WORKING CONDITIONS:  

Work is performed indoors for extended periods of time, including up to the entire duration of shift.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

At Farm Boy, it is our mission to create a fun, fresh experience for all! Whether you are a team member or a customer, Farm Boy is passionate about creating a unique fresh food shopping experience and ensuring that we deliver on our commitments.

As we continue to grow within Ontario, Farm Boy is excited to welcome new team members that share our passion for providing the best fresh shopping experience!

Job Description

The position is responsible for supporting the retail team by performing various administrative and clerical duties.  The performance of the duties must ensure a quality service approach to all employees, customers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Farm Boy Way.

Major Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for assisting with department inventory i.e., uniforms, office/store supplies.
  • Responsible for assisting with the organization and maintenance of confidential store-level files.
  • Assist with recruitment administration in SmartRecruiters, including screening candidates and scheduling interviews.
  • Preparation and presentation of new hire documents, including participating in orientations.
  • May be required to assist with payroll functions including timecard corrections and reporting.
  • Responsible for logging invoices as well as ensuring the corresponding paperwork is attached to the invoices.
  • Coordinate with Finance and Store Manager regarding queries on invoices.
  • Responsible for contacting employees regarding any schedule changes.
  • Provide assistance with the organization and maintenance of the employee Training Master.
  • Responsible for printing, posting, collecting, and filing of SOP’s, sweep logs, high touch sanitation sheets and Covid screening logs.
  • Ensure that scheduled periodic reporting is sent out on time and accurately.
  • Assist with ad hoc requests like preparation of name tags, assisting employees with locker information, etc.
  • Assist employees on filing expense reports, secure necessary approvals and submit for reimbursement.
  • Coordinate meetings for Store Manager / Regional Director / Vice President and take minutes when required.
  • Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and share with appropriate stakeholders.
  • May be requested to undertake other related duties to support our stores.
Qualifications

  • Typically requires completion of a post-secondary education with an emphasis in Office Administration plus a minimum of 2 years related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Above average interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.
  • Superior customer service skills with ability to handle complaints and communicate calmly and professionally.
  • Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.
  • Superior time management and organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
  • Positive, team-oriented attitude and ability to work with minimal supervision and solve problems.
  • Ability to handle confidential materials in a sensitive and appropriate manner.
  • Reliable, responsible and adaptable to change and learning new tasks.
  • Fluency in both official languages would be considered an asset.
  • Able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and holidays as required.

Work & Sensory Environment:

  • Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines
  • Performing extensive and repetitive data entry
  • Sitting for long periods of time at workstation
  • Possible exposure to eye strain from computer terminals
  • Exposure to distractions cause by open office noise and frequent interruptions


Additional Information

Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities.

title: Administrative Assistant
description: ENQUIRIS is looking for an energetic and enthusiastic Administrative Assistant to provide support for day-to-day operations, working directly with managing directors and recruitment agents.

title: Office Coordinator
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Our associates celebrate lives. We celebrate our associates. Consider the possibilities of joining a Great Place to Work! Sutton's Campbell River Funeral Home is hiring for an Office Coordinator to join its team. Coordinates the operational activities of a funeral home, cemetery and/or crematory operation. Ensures the highest quality services and products, to satisfy the need of any client family, to maximize budgeted profit plans for the location, and maintain a positive employee relations atmosphere. Assists the Office Manager with a variety of other administrative functions. **JOB RESPONSIBILITIES** **Accounting Function Oversight** + Collections of all accounts receivable + Verifications and payments of all accounts payable invoices + Controls of receipt and deposit of cash payments received + Maintains petty cash account and disburses the same in accordance with company policies and procedures + Reconciliations of all accounts + Cash advance checks + Same Day Check requests + Bank deposits + Verifies/audits cash disbursement reports + Tracks Capital Expenditure Authorizations (CEAs) **Operational Activities** + Orders supplies for the office and completes inventory counts + Coordinates the processing of orders and receipt of all merchandise orders including memorials and caskets and the control of storage inventory for vaults and markers, urns and caskets + Oversees the processing of installation funeral-related orders and orders to the grounds and maintenance departments + Supports location management to ensure all contracts and work orders are completed in a timely manner with proper documentation + Schedules incoming orders and drivers for the ambulate service + Completes various funeral/cemetery reports and files accurately + Supports Sales as necessary requiring an understanding of JD Powers + Assures compliance with all Company policies and procedures t + Assists in preparing and/or overseeing all funeral/cemetery-related forms + Reviews time cards and administers corporate payroll policies and procedures + Administers local Human Resources (HR) processes such as processing new hire paperwork, verifying pre-need sales licenses, maintaining employee files and other confidential files (I9’s, etc.). + Ensures new associates receive new hire orientation + Pulls monthly reports from reporting site and create stack ranking reports for key performance indicators + Maintains vehicle records/licenses + Processes expense reports + Updates General Price Lists (GPLs) + Manages all Alarm Systems (codes, working order, etc.) + Assists with funeral services and “Making Everlasting Memories” (MEMs) as needed + Coordinates daily activities with business unit as well as other departments + Trains associates in the proper administration of policies and procedures + Services customers by interacting with families in a professional and compassionate manner + Maintains and updates customer records + Updates company website with current obituaries and ensures obituaries are placed in newspapers + Provides a collaborative, productive workplace environment for associate growth and development that instills pride, a sense of ownership, and the challenge to associates to exceed expectations + Behaves in a supportive way to enrich the work environment + Uses customer feedback in conjunction with Sales to improve location administration and strengthen individual associate performance + Performs other duties as assigned **MINIMUM Requirements** **Education** + High school diploma, GED or completion of a diploma-training program at a college or technical school **Experience** + Two (2) years bookkeeping, general office, clerical accounting, and Accounts Payable experience required **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities** + Solid working knowledge of computers, typewriter, MS Office, e-mail, internet and basic office equipment required + Excellent communication skills both orally and in writing + High level of compassion, integrity, and confidentiality + Problem solving skills + Ability to multi task and set priorities + Detail oriented + Must be flexible and able to function in a face-paced environment **Work CONDITIONS** **Work Environment** + Professional Dress is required when in contact with families. **Work Postures** + Sitting continuously for many hours per day, up to 6 hours per day + Climbing stairs to access buildings frequently **Physical Demands** + Physical effort requiring manual dexterity is required, includes paperwork, calculators, computers and phone usage **Work Hours** + Working beyond “standard” hours as the need arises Postal Code: V9W 6R4 Category (Portal Searching): Operations Job Location: CA-BC - Campbell River</section>

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Reference # :22-05008Title :Administrative Assistant
Location :Toronto, ON
Experience Level :Start Date / End Date :04/04/2022 / 03/29/2024 
Description
Job Title     : Administrative Assistant
Location     : Toronto, ON, M2R 3T4
Duration    : 24 Months Contract (Possible Extension)

Job Description:
Project Administrative Assistant for the Toronto Flu and Pandemic Readiness Program
• Support Project Senior Director and project team on day-to-day administrative duties (daily schedule, travel arrangements, expenses, meeting coordination, etc.)
• Attend project meetings and record/distribute minutes, decisions, and actions out to project team.
• Organize and update report and presentation documents as directed by Project Director.
• Input and track purchase requisitions and orders in appropriate company systems.
• Communicate effectively with project team members and site leaders.
• Manage, track and control paper and electronic project documentation.
• May provide clerical support as necessary, including filing (typically electronically), copying, performing data entry, etc.
• Facility and Seating management/maintenance for resources.
• Coordinate and plan site tours with various teams across site for external visitors and internal SPL personnel.
• Onboarding/Off boarding resources (internal & external) for the team; registering for training.
• Requesting/processing site/network/software/hardware requests for resources (old and new).
• Order/replenish office/kitchenette supplies on a regular basis.
• Exercise discretion in handling of confidential material and information
• Assist in special projects as assigned.
• Recommends improvements on administrative procedures and implements changes.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Colonnade BridgePort is a full-service real estate company, offering property management and leasing services, acquisition, development, investment management and asset management for commercial and residential properties.

We take the time to understand our clients’ objectives then apply our real estate expertise and market knowledge to drive better performance.

Colonnade BridgePort is headquartered in Ottawa with offices in the Greater Toronto Area (“GTA”), our continued growth and expansion has created an opportunity for an experienced full-time Administrative Assistant located in GTA or Ottawa.

Administrative Assistant

Reporting to the Director, Investment & Asset Management, the Administrative Assistant as part of the Investment & Asset Management team will be responsible for providing administrative and investor relations support to the Investment & Asset Management team. As an integral member to the team, this individual will enable the team to provide a superior level of service to investors and institutional clients by ensuring deadlines are met and regular investor communications are managed on a proactive basis. A key requirement of this role are superior organizational skills and attention to detail.

This is an exciting opportunity for an individual with exceptional multi-tasking, organizational, and communication skills to provide support in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. They will make a difference through utilizing their strong decision-making skills, attention to detail and high level of professionalism while working independently.

So that you know what to expect on any given day, you’ll be doing one or all of these things:

  • Support the IM/AM team by preparing for investor and business-related presentations and/or meetings.
  • Assist and coordinate internal and external team and investor meetings by scheduling, managing deadlines, managing communication, and assembling investor financial packages (i.e. annual reports, monthly updates, quarterly reports, investor pitch decks) and other meeting materials.
  • Draft professional and articulate responses to routine emails, memo’s, correspondence, presentations, etc.
  • Act as a resource and liaison with outside organizations and all levels of management, staff, etc.
  • Coordinate and request appropriate follow-up with Investors for missing documentation or signatures on behalf of the team. For example, updates to financial statements, signatures on loan documents, status updates, and sign off/approvals on recommendations made from asset managment.
  • Record and draft meeting minutes, as well as required post-meeting follow up.
  • Maintain investor lists and documentation on an ongoing basis.
  • Review the Asset Management Agreements for private equity limited partnerships in order to set up timelines, due dates, and consistency in reporting structure and deliverables.
  • Create and maintain methods of documentation, such as forms or templates for investor presentations, annual general meetings, quarterly updates, and email communication.
  • Assist in preparation for AGM meetings by coordinating the documentation process.
  • Maintain a confidential and accurate filing system.
  • Assist, coordinate, update, and track ongoing and ad hoc special projects and associated documentation.
  • Perform general administration support such as tracking, compiling, and submitting expenses.
  • Other duties as required.

The Qualifications we would like you to bring to the position include:

  • 2 or more years’ experience in an administrative or relevant role
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Communications, or relevant discipline
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Strong communication skills, written and verbal, with all levels of any organization
  • Superior organizational, problem solving, and time management skills
  • Attention to detail and pride in producing quality work is essential
  • Experience in real estate, transaction management, Private Equity or Investor Relations considered an asset

The above statements reflect the general details considered necessary to describe functions of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in the job.

Colonnade BridgePort provides a dynamic work environment and offers a competitive salary and benefit package.

In recognition of its obligation to take all necessary precautions to protect the health and safety of its employees, Colonnade BridgePort has introduced a mandatory policy that requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for everyone working in or visiting its properties. Accordingly, an offer of employment will be conditional upon the successful candidate providing proof of full vaccination. Exemption requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated on valid medical or human rights grounds.

Colonnade BridgePort welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Administrative Coordinator (Executive Support)
description:
Our Story

About You:You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!About Us:Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.We’re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.

Overview

Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, the Administrative Coordinator will perform an array of administrative functions requiring confidentiality and critical decision making for the executive team and associates globally.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the President of Canada, this role will:

  • Provide administrative support – detailed calendar management, overseeing correspondence and conversations, invoice tracking and other governance requirements, assembling reports, presentations, and some market research. Responsible for coordinating complex multi-destination travel, including flights, accommodations, and local transportation reservations in addition to the preparation of pre-departure itineraries reflecting all travel
  • Business Development – use data from CRM and proprietary analytics platform to create meaningful data and track metrics.
  • Creating PowerPoint presentations 
  • Client Pursuit Management – maintain and update databases and provide support for monthly/quarterly reporting and periodic investment reports
  • Internal and external communications – with the information provided by Marketing, create easy to use formats for this team to send communications and videos internally and externally
  • Business Sectors – assist in the creation, organization, and management. Responsible for scheduling of meetings and events as well as developing/circulating agenda, taking minutes, tracking prospects, and creating metrics
  • And, of course, other duties as assigned

Qualifications

You’re a customer focused and task-oriented individual who thrives in fast-paced environment. You take pride in being able to juggle multiple projects and work efficiently both independently and on teams. Having advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, solid interpersonal skills and being highly organized will be key in your success.

  • 5+ years of success in an executive administrative support or marketing role
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Experience managing senior executive calendars/travel
  • Tact and good judgment in confidential situations and proven experience interacting with senior management
  • Excellent ability to analyze data and create metrics and trends using Microsoft Excel
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong presentation skills required with excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Understanding of and commitment to client service
  • Possess leadership, assess what needs to be done and make recommendations accordingly
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, and Teams
  • Ability to prioritize tasks to meet arising deadlines and multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Capable of developing and maintaining relationships while facilitating executive level support with minimal supervision
  • Preference given to candidates with commercial real estate/investment experience

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

 

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Global Financial Firm located in MISSISSAUGA, ON has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced Administrative Assistant

"This role is currently on a Hybrid Schedule.
You will need to have reliable internet, computer and android or iphone for remote access into the client systems during remote work.
We will be expected in the office weekly 1-3 days depending on the team requirement.

****Video/ f2f interviews are required prior to all offers.

Located in Client s Mississauga site, this Administrative Assistant position supports the Mississauga ICG O&T Technology Lead and Client s Canada Technology Development Centre. Specific duties include:

Responsibilities:
" Provide administrative support including the drafting and preparation of general correspondence, handling incoming calls, initiating outgoing calls, faxing, and mailing;
" Coordinate travel arrangements and submit claims in Client Travel Expense (CTE) system;
" Ensure a smooth on-boarding process for new hires, including initiating system requests and accurately updating Spread sheets;
" Manage seating plans and coordinate seat assignments with local managers and the real estate team. Initiate move requests and oversee seat moves;
" Maintain headcount reports, organization charts, and hiring forecasts;
" Perform daily management and processing of invoices, and maintenance of office supplies and telecommunications supplies;
" Assist with creation/modification of presentations, spreadsheets and reports, including agendas and minutes;
" Assist with presentation arrangements including arranging boardrooms, A/V equipment, ordering food, etc.;
" Work with Aramark to ensure all catering invoices for all sites are processed in a timely manner;
" Provide exceptional service to Senior Executive internal clients;
" Manage vendor agreements to ensure all necessary documentation is received, purchase orders are created, and invoices and contract renewals occur in a timely manner;
" Maintain an up-to-date filing system;
" Update and maintain mail distribution lists, boardroom bookings, videoconferencing, and meeting arrangements for broader team;
" Oversee functionality of office technology (copiers, printers, telephones, computer, mobile systems, etc.) with internal IT and external service providers;
" Cross train on other local job functions to be able to cover temporary absences/vacations of other staff;
" Work to simplify and streamline processes to automate repeatable tasks;
" Assist with other functions, ad-hoc requests and special projects as required.

Qualifications:
" 3+ years of administrative support experience with a preference for supporting senior executives.
" Hyper-Organized and can with ability to stay on top of high volumes of requests, handling multiple priorities and delivering in a timely manner with great attention to detail
" Strong technical skills in Microsoft Office including Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Excel (including Pivot Tables).
" Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
" Ability to deal with both internal/external clients in a professional, mature and courteous manner.
" Ability to work effectively with all levels of management.
" Energetic, responsive team player with client-service focus.
" Appropriate sense of urgency with the ability to work on multiple tasks concurrently to meet deadlines.
" Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


Client, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. At Client, you are part of a dynamic, global team that provides clients and consumers with the highest level of service.

For more than 200 years Client has been enabling progress through ingenuity and a focus on our clients needs. We have financed some of the world s most transformative projects while at the same time acting as guides and advisors to our clients in working through their financial questions, no matter how large or small. This could not have been done without the expertise and dedication of each of our more than 200,000 employees working together to create lasting and meaningful impact.

Our employees reflect the diversity of our business, and are continually encouraged to create innovative solutions for our clients. At Client, we have a culture that recognizes and rewards initiative and courage while at the same time provides tools and resources to empower our people to build successful careers of meaning and impact.

title: Proposal Coordinator (Peterborough, ON, CA)
description:
At BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc. (BWXT NEC) we are committed to excellence in every business initiative.  BWXT NEC has achieved an enviable international reputation for excellence in the supply of nuclear fuel and fuel handling systems and service for CANDU reactors in both domestic and international markets. Our success is the result of our commitment to our employees, customers, quality & EHS initiatives.

 

Proposal Coordinator

 

We are looking for a Proposal Coordinator for our Peterborough, Ontario site.  BWXT NEC's Fuel Handling and Engineered Solutions group is involved in the design, manufacture, development, testing, parts supply, and service of on-power refueling, reactor maintenance, and nuclear medicine delivery tooling sold around the world. We are the original designer of the automated systems that allow 24/7 on power refueling of CANDU reactors and aim to solve some of the Nuclear Industry’s most challenging problems. Today, BWXT’s equipment is being used in most of the nuclear power plants in Canada and is critical to delivering carbon free energy production and lifesaving medical isotopes.

 

Check out the YouTube video of an innovative product we designed and manufactured in partnership with Bruce Power, called the Bruce Reactor Inspection and Maintenance System Channel Access Device. Go to YouTube and search for video: “Bruce Unveils new BRIMS Tool”. There are exceptional opportunities to learn and grow with a career in the nuclear industry in Ontario.

 

The Peterborough community invites you to take a deep breath, relax and enjoy life. We have an abundance of recreational opportunities, festivals, and entertainment that is fueled by culture, nature and homegrown culinary experiences. Friendly people, inspiring landscapes and incredible lakes are waiting for you in the heart of cottage country. The region is home to 140,000 people (approx. 83,000 in the City of Peterborough) in addition to the charming towns, townships and villages that make up the County. We offer the best of all worlds here and we’d like you to get to know us a bit better. http://peterboroughed.ca/why-peterborough/live/

 

Role Summary:

 

At BWXT, you will work on technically challenging proposals as a supporting member of the Customer Solutions/Commercial team. Our company supports on-power refueling systems for CANDU reactors and also responds to a range of challenging engineering and supply requests. You will be at the forefront of our customer response. You will help to define the design, development and testing stages of multi-disciplinary projects related to automated and semi-automated fueling machines, robotic systems, and maintenance tooling for CANDU reactors and other related systems. This opportunity will test your ability to cut through ambiguity, to generate technically sound, customized and accurate proposals as part of a multi-disciplinary team. Connecting customers to the best BWXT solution will be your mandate and, as such, building and maintaining internal and external customer relationships are a key part of this role. The proposal coordinator owns the proposal process from customer RFP to order receipt and evaluation and is accountable to produce high quality proposals. 

 

Responsibilities:

 

Proposals/Documentation:

  • Prepare proposals in accordance with company policies and procedures.
  • Develop proposal strategy in support of the sales strategy.
  • Direct functional areas in preparing the various sections and inputs to the proposal document.
  • Participate in contract negotiations with customers.
  • Review and challenge estimates prepared by the technical teams.
  • Chair Pricing Approval Request (PAR) meetings to obtain necessary approvals for bids.
  • Conduct Turnover meetings to pass on all relevant documentation to the project team.

 

Cost Estimates:

  • Work as part of a team to prepare and complete accurate cost estimates.
  • Ensure timely and accurate estimates, contingencies, cash flows, etc.
  • Benchmark internal costs with industry to ensure competitiveness.

 

Cost & Risk Reduction:

  • Provide direction and strategies to reduce costs and risks.
  • Implement Project Risk and Opportunity Management (PROM) procedure to ensure risks and opportunities are captured and mitigated.

 

Business Development:

  • Participate in developing business strategies to accomplish business objectives.
  • Take lead, when assigned, in developing and implementing strategies.

 

If you see yourself in a challenging, rewarding career at an extremely diverse, technology-driven company, this is the perfect place for you.  BWXT NEC’s supportive environment and free flow of information will encourage you to imagine, build, solve and lead.

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Bachelor's degree or diploma in Engineering, Business or other technical area, along with a minimum 3 years of related experience.
  • Technically minded individual with previous exposure to engineering project work.
  • Exposure to a broad range of interdisciplinary departments: mechanical, I&C, software design and manufacturing.
  • Excellent written, oral and illustrative communication skills.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to work in a team.
  • Demonstrated experience constructing proposals, incorporating inputs from the technical operations team. 
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint.
  • Most importantly…. creative and innovative thinkers!

 

 

WHY JOIN BWXT?:

 

  • Work within the growing and exciting nuclear industry as well as with talented and collaborative teams!
  • Competitive salaries
  • Employer-paid pension plan
  • Profit sharing plan
  • Bonus plan
  • Competitive Health and Dental benefits
  • Educational Refund Program
  • Life insurance… and so much more!

 

Come join us… we’ve been waiting for you.

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

title: Administrative Assistant, Job ID #4030
description:
Administrative Assistant, Job ID #4030
Employment Services
Full time / 1-year contract with possibility of renewal / Starting ASAP / Finch & Keele

JVS Toronto is a registered charity in the social services sector. Our mission is to enable people to maximize their potential at work and school. Join our development and communications team to help us engage donors and funders in an effort to generate revenue for the agency to provide our services without charge to those who need it most. 

Our employees benefit from competitive salaries, a friendly work environment and opportunities for continuous learning. JVS Toronto also offers a generous vacation package, group benefits and pension plans in addition to paid sick time, family care and wellness days, monthly wellness initiatives, access to an employee assistance program (EAP) and a variety of corporate discounts. 

Learn about the work we do: www.jvstoronto.org 

Program Overview
The JVS Employment Source office, funded by MTCU, provides employment services to unemployed individuals of all ages, financial backgrounds and skills to help them gain employment within their field or a related field.  To achieve this goal, a range of services is provided at one location including information and referral services, one-on-one employment counselling, employment workshops, and job development/ placement services.

Weâ€™re looking for someone who will: 
â€¢    Be responsible for processing claims for the training incentive and employment supports. 
â€¢    Maintain up-to-date financial documentation as well as client and employer files. 
â€¢    Be responsible for preparation of visa and petty cash monthly reconciliation 
â€¢    Enter data into excel spreadsheet, monitor data and provide to managers as needed. Assist with statistical and program reports
â€¢    Help maintain and manage various client and databases. Set up, maintain and file client records in EOIS CAMS as requested. Prepare rosters of clients as needed
â€¢    Update client information on the JVS client tracking system and program specific database as per program needs and standards
â€¢    Assist with organizing appointments, orientations, and workshops. Contacts employers, clients and referring agencies regarding session start dates, interviews, appointments, etc. 
â€¢    Provide front desk/ reception duties and customer service to all clients, employers and visitors
â€¢    Provide clerical support, including editing and formatting reports, preparing and completing agency and government forms, word processing of correspondence, reports and other materials, filing, faxing and photocopying
â€¢    Maintain office supplies and equipment. Assist location staff with all administrative and other related duties
â€¢    Provide support to JVS satellite location in York Region when needed. 

Flexible hours / evenings / weekends may be required for this position.

Minimum Qualifications & Experience:
â€¢    High school diploma
â€¢    1-2 years of office administration experience
â€¢    Experience in reading and understanding the financial statements, monitoring various calculations, and preparing reports 
â€¢    Strong organization skills; detail oriented with ability to multi task
â€¢    Effective time management and problem solving skills
â€¢    Effective verbal and written communication skills
â€¢    Advanced computer skills; the ability to learn systems used by the agency 

Our ideal candidate will also have:
â€¢    Employment Ontario knowledge and exposure


Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resume & covering letter here. 
JVS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. If you require accommodation in order to submit your application, please contact JVS directly. 
Our agency embraces diversity and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest in our agency, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Office Assistant
description:
For more than 20 years Global Relay has set the standard and trends in compliant communications with our multi-award winning unified communications, data capture, and data analysis platform. We securely capture and manage the world's communications data and give its owners greater control and visibility to drive value and ensure compliance with the regulatory requirements of a large variety of industries and authorities.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other typical things you expect, but we are not your typical company. Global Relay is a career-making company. It is a place for big ideas, new challenges, and cutting-edge innovation. It is a place where you can make an impact.

Your Role:

We're looking for an energetic, detail-oriented individual with superb customer service skills to join our growing administration team. As an Office Assistant you will provide comprehensive administrative support to the daily processes and business operations of our fast-paced organization.  

The role requires a resourceful individual who is energetic, adaptable, logical, tech-savvy, and works well independently but thrives in a team environment; someone who enjoys learning, building relationships, and possesses good business acumen.

 

The role may require you to work on statutory holidays.

Are you up for the challenge?

Your Job:

  • Ensure that visitors/clients are greeted and directed appropriately upon arrival, and adhere to office security procedures upon check-in
  • Maintain office appearance and cleanliness; provide assistance and support for Global Relay team members in daily operations including the cleaning and organizing of meeting rooms, supply stations, the lounge and cafeteria
  • Liaise with office janitorial and building maintenance for facility cleaning and repair
  • Manage office supplies and equipment, including supplies inventory, ordering and distribution; invoice reconciliation
  • Order and set up catering for client meetings
  • Perform office tasks such as handling a high volume telephone switchboard, calendar management, data entry, filing, generate reports and presentations and mail distribution
  • Perform administrative duties in Salesforce CRM software and other software systems such as data entry, client file updates, and ensuring data accuracy
  • Compose external correspondence to Global Relay customers and Partners
  • Support various departments in coordinating meeting and training schedules, circulating agendas and training materials
  • Various job-related duties as projects arise, such as event management

About You:

  • Diploma/certificate in Office Administration, or relevant work experience
  • Ability to speak and write English fluently and possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills with excellent telephone etiquette
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint & Outlook)
  • Exceptional time-management, organizational, and prioritizing skills with great attention to detail
  • Strong work ethic with a willingness to multi-task and be flexible to take on varied responsibilities
  • Ability and maturity to exercise tact and discretion, and can be entrusted with confidential information
  • Good judgment to proactively and independently solve problems and make sound decisions
  • Goal oriented self-starter who can work independently and reliably with minimal supervision and has an appetite for continuous learning
  • Comfortable working under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Proven ability to handle challenging situations with integrity, empathy and sincerity
  • A friendly, "can-do" attitude and customer focused approach

Please note: Submitting a cover letter in addition to your resume is highly encouraged for this role. 

About Us:

At Global Relay there is no ceiling. This is the land of opportunity for the energetic, intelligent, and driven people that make this company great. The combination of the right people in the right positions and a rapidly growing company means unlimited career potential.

You will receive the mentoring, coaching, and support that you need to reach your personal and career goals. You'll be part of a culture that promotes and rewards hard work and creativity and will grow into the new opportunities that are available to you. 

We understand flexible work arrangements are important and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it's flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Administrative Assistant|1021 Administrative Assistant|1021
description:
Job Description: Looking for an Administrative Assistant who has great people skills, diligent proactive worker, team player, energetic and computer proficient, where the successful candidate will be responsible for the following:
Greeting & signing in visitors;
Processing all incoming and outgoing shipments (local & international with Fedex), along with invoice reconciliation and payment. Will include delivery of packages/shipments - some lifting required;
Security Badge management: issue new hire/visitor/contractor//employee temporary/building access badges; taking photos of new hires, printing badges from the card printer, monthly card validation, along with maintaining an Inventory List;
Pick-up & sort incoming Canada Post mail, along with communicating & coordinating with employees;
Ordering and maintaining beverage supplies, along with monthly invoice reconciliation;
Coordinate catering, room set-up & tear down for main training room. Includes opening & closing of room divider wall, setting up training tables and chairs for classroom setting;
Conference and break room up-keep;
Providing backup support for other Admin staff as required and special projects such as team events as needed;
Arrange business travel and also submit PO Requisitions, when required;

Proficient in use of: Microsoft TEAMS; Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, Powerpoint); Oracle; Fedex Shipping Module; Concur Online Travel Booking Tool & SAP Concur Expense/Corporate credit card. Work experience in the hi-tech industry would be preferred.

Demonstrate professional communication skills, written and verbal - Prioritize workload and multi-task effectively - Sound working knowledge of office equipment - Maintain a positive, professional attitude and be a team player - Provide a high level of customer service under all conditions - Relevant work experience.
General Summary no standard job description text
Comments for Suppliers: 2-6 years of experience
Onsite critical
Preferred experience in FedEx Shipping tool, comfortable with Outlook scheduling. Very personable and upbeat personality needed.
Should be able to lift 20 pounds

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Summary

Dokainish & Company is looking for an administrative assistant to join our boutique consultancy firm. This person will work to support the daily operations of the office as well as provide executive assistance to the leadership team.The ideal candidate is a high-energy individual with excellent organizational skills, a strong attention to detail and the ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal communications.

Responsibilities

  • Assist with administrative duties and provide support to the HR department;
  • Manage the executiveâ€™s calendar, including making appointments and prioritizing the most sensitive matters;
  • Review expenses, client invoices, and related accounting transactions;
  • Answer phone calls/general email inquiries and route to the appropriate internal parties as needed;
  • Set up meetings based on cross-functional availability for both internal and external stakeholders;
  • Build out and maintain processes to keep files and office supplies organized and easily accessible;
  • Alert employees of new processes, rules and regulations;
  • Book travel, submit expense reports and send communications for high-level staff as needed;
  • Assist with all workstation set ups (computer) and maintenance; Coordinate IT support requests;
  • Participate in continuous improvement within role; Research best practices and recommend improvements to existing practices;
  • Assumes other activities and responsibilities from time to time as directed.

Education/Qualifications

  • College/university graduate or equivalent combination of technical skills and experience
  • 1 year of experience in Office and/or HR Administration within a fast-paced corporate environment preferred
  • Maintains a professional appearance, demeanor, and attitude at all times; Able to discreetly handle confidential matters
  • Ability to learn quickly and adapt to change
  • Proactive and able to work independently; A self-starter that shows initiative
  • MS Office proficiency
  • Valid Driver's License preferred
  • Must be willing to travel
  • Flexibility to work outside normal business hours as required and work in the office on a hybrid schedule

About Us

Since 2011, Dokainish & Company has been providing its clients with world class project consultancy services. Our clients have come to expect the highest delivery quality from our staff. Dokainish & Company focuses on all aspects of Project Services within small or multi-billion dollar capital projects.

title: D'assistante administrative
description:
Company Introduction:


30 Minute Hit is a fast paced, action packed boxing/kickboxing & self defense based circuit style workout designed just for women. As a company we pride ourselves on the quality of instruction we provide to our clients, and on our ability to foster a motivating, fun, and inclusive community of women. Our goal is to provide an unparalleled experience and to show each and every one of our members how amazing they truly are.

Overview:


Vous êtes intéressée à faire partie d'une équipe positive et accueillante? Vous recherchez une qualité de vie avec un emploi près de la maison avec un horaire flexible? Nous désirons vous rencontrer!


Le poste d'assistante administrative est un poste clé au sein de l'entreprise, étant la première image et le premier lien de confiance établi avec notre clientèle.


Nous sommes à la recherche d'une personne parfaitement bilingue, énergétique, et débrouillarde afin de se joindre à notre équipe dynamique.


Les tâches principales qui vous seront attribuées sont :


La gestion des rendez-vous, des paiements et des communications aux clientes.

Gérer les courriels entrants et sortants

Rédiger les diverses correspondances et autres documents

Effectuer des tâches administratives de base dans le bureau.

Toute autre tâche connexe.


Les compétences que nous recherchons sont :

Avoir de l’expérience en service à la clientèle 

Personnalité dynamique 

Binlingue 

La capacité de travailler dans un environnement rapide

La capacité à apprendre rapidement

title: Administrative assistant
description:
Our culture lifts you up—there is no ego in the way. Our common purpose? We all want to win for our customers. We aim to always be evolving, dynamic, and ambitious. We believe in the power of genuine connections. Each employee is a part of what makes us unique on the market: agile and dedicated.

Time Type:

Regular

Job Description :

Job summary:

Reporting to the Vice President, Wireless Solutions and Innovation and the Vice President IT & Digital Strategy, you will be responsible for administrative support to them and to coordinate certain activities of the departments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prioritize and manage day to day activities, calendar, emails, phone calls, guests, commitments, appointments etc.

  • Arrange all travel and hotel accommodations for VPs and Management teams.

  • Coordinate executive and management meetings and all related to room bookings, required equipment and catering services.

  • Record minutes during management meetings and assists the VPs and Management teams in developing and distributing agenda and follow up on action plans.

  • Assist in the preparation of reports and briefing documents in a variety of formats (Google Slide, Google Doc, Google Sheet, etc.).

  • Supports the onboarding of new members of the management team.

  • Manage the approval and payment of invoices as well as the budgets.

  • Collaborate with other executive assistants, participate in common tasks and occasionally replace the receptionist.

  • Manage supplies orders and mail.

  • Provides assistance on ad-hoc business requests as needed.

  • Coordinate and collaborate with our stakeholders.

Academic training:

  • College diploma in office automation, administration or any other related discipline.

Work experience:

  • Cumulated ten years in similar functions in a large company.

Key skills:

  • Excellent command of French and English, both oral and written.

  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office / Google Suite and ability to learn new software.

  • Demonstrates a good sense of collaboration and customer service both internally and externally.

  • Demonstrates discretion in handling confidential and sensitive information and tact in interpersonal communications.

  • Demonstrates a good ability to work with minimal supervision.

  • Very good ability to plan priorities.

  • Very good ability to juggle several files at the same time.

  • Great thoroughness in completing tasks.

** "Our employees and our customers are at the heart of everything we do. In order to provide a safe and healthy environment for our colleagues and their families, for our clients and for the members of our communities, COGECO has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy, which applies to all of its business units operating in Canada.”

You’ll benefit from:

  • Flexibility: yes, we think that what you do matters. At work and at home.

  • Fun: we laugh a lot, it makes every day brighter.

  • Discounted services: we provide amazing services to our clients, and you’ll get them at home, because you deserve them.

  • Rewarding Pay: let’s be honest, everybody likes to make a good salary. We offer attractive compensation packages, and it comes with a great culture. 

  • Benefits: we’ve got you covered. 

  • Career Evolution: join us and we will give you the tools to achieve your career goals!

  • Technology: you have a passion for technology? Excellent, we do too. Here, you will manage, influence, play, create, fix, and shape the industry.

Location :

Montréal, QC

Company :

Cogeco Communications Inc.

At Cogeco, we know that different backgrounds, perspectives, and beliefs can bring critical value to our business. The strength of this diversity enhances our ability to imagine, innovate, and grow as a company. So, we are committed to doing everything in our power to create a more diverse and inclusive world of belonging.

By creating a culture where all our colleagues can bring their best selves to work, we’re doing our part to build a more equitable workplace and world. From professional development to personal safety, Cogeco constantly strives to create an environment that welcomes and nurtures all. We make the health and well-being of our colleagues one of our highest priorities, for we know engaged and appreciated employees equate to a better overall experience for our customers.


If you need any accommodations to apply or as part of the recruitment process, please contact us confidentially at inclusiondiversite@cogeco.com

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
As the Administrative Assistant for our Windsor-Sarnia Branch office, you will be an integral part of our operations team.

 

You will be responsible for:

Scheduling, focusing on ensuring clients receive the best possible coverage with qualified staffing while mitigating open hours and overtime costs.

Working directly with the Management Team, Mobile Supervisors and Scheduling Coordinator you will provide support with hiring and uniform issuing and inventory control while ensuring that reporting, follow up and administration of the office runs smoothly and efficiently.

Your great customer service skills allow you to answer phones and greet clients and staff with a manner that shows them that GardaWorld Windsor-Sarnia Branch is the best of the best.

Security experience is not required however it is a preferred asset.

What does an Administrative Assistant in Thunder Bay do?

  • Provide customer service and support to visitors and staff - You are the first point of contact.
  • Develop and maintain a filing system
  • Assist in the preparation of reports, schedules and other administrative tasks as needed
  • Processing account payables/receivables for the branch
  • Scheduling staff and assist with payroll functions
  • Provide back up scheduling when scheduler is on vacation

Qualifications to become a Administrative Assistant in Thunder Bay ?

  • Multitasking and Time Management are key skills required
  • Must be computer savvy, proficient in Office 365, Scheduling Software platforms and be able to produce reports as associated with GardaWorld Systems
  • Understand CBA protocols and procedures, H&S and Business Management manuals
  • Excellent deportment and communication skills
  • Must be an organized self-starter
  • Able to work unsupervised in a fast-paced and stressful environment

title: Casual - Chairs' Assembly Administrative Assistant
description:
About MRU

Founded in 1910 and located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Mount Royal University grew into a vibrant college in the 1930s and became a mid-sized university in 2009. Mount Royal has carved out a distinct niche by offering smaller class sizes, a robust liberal education and unique undergraduate programs. Currently, more than 15,000 credit students choose from 13 bachelor degrees and 38 majors.

Mount Royal University is located in the traditional territories of the Niitsitapi (Blackfoot) and the people of the Treaty 7 region in southern Alberta, which includes the Siksika, the Piikani, the Kainai, the Tsuut'ina and the Iyarhe Nakoda. We are situated on land where the Bow River meets the Elbow River. The traditional Blackfoot name of this place is "Mohkinstsis," which we now call the city of Calgary. The city of Calgary is also home to the Métis Nation.

Mount Royal University is committed to removing barriers and fostering the inclusion of voices that have been historically underrepresented or discouraged in our society. In support of our belief that diversity in our faculty and staff enriches the work, learning and research experiences for the entire campus community, we strongly encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply and self-identify.

 

About the Chairs’ Assembly

Chairs' Assembly is an advisory and discussion body comprised of the Chairs of academic units and departments, representatives of other relevant university bodies, and the Chair Support Coordinator. It is led by a Speaker and Deputy Speaker, and guided by a representative agenda committee. The Assembly and its agenda committee normally each meet monthly on Monday mornings to plan and conduct business. The Assembly maintains key relationships with many decision-making bodies and executive leaders of the University, advising them on Chairs' perspectives on policies and processes.

 

About the Role

Chairs' Assembly is currently seeking an administrative assistant to coordinate meetings, solicit agenda items from various stakeholders, and prepare and distribute agendas and minutes, with the support and direction of the Speaker of Chairs' Assembly.

The typical weekly commitment will be a couple hours per week, most often on Monday mornings. The commitment will be less in months the Assembly does not meet (December, February and the summer months).

 

Responsibilities

  • Co-ordinate meetings
  • Prepare meeting agendas
  • Take minutes at meetings

 

Qualifications

  • Familiarity and demonstrated experience working with Mount Royal University's academic and administrative structures is required
  • High level of organizational skills and multi-tasking ability
  • Experience taking meeting minutes
  • Attention to detail
  • Highly developed communication skills
  • Highly competence with the Microsoft Office and the Google suite of applications including Google Meet.

 

MRU supports full immunization as the best way to protect yourself and our campus community and strongly recommends vaccination against COVID-19.

 

Salary:                   $22.00 - $26.00 per hour (commensurate with experience)

Closing Date:        Open until a suitable candidate is found

 

A cover letter and resume should be submitted in one .pdf formatted document. Please title your .pdf document as follows: [Last Name], [Requisition Number].pdf (ex. Smith, Coordinator, 999999.pdf).

title: Office Administrator for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!
description:
We are currently looking for Office Administrators for the Bonnyville/ Cold Lake area!!!!

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Employee Benefit Program including Medical and Dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Advancement Opportunities

Typical Responsibilities:

  • Daily time entry, including timesheets review and cost coding, for payroll entry and LEM creation of 100+ manpower
  • Review all time entry data changes that affect Payroll processing to ensure accuracy
  • Subcontractor invoice processing for submission to payroll
  • Coordinate with project management on timesheets for contracts and subcontract billings
  • Process daily LEM's for Labour, Equipment and Material for the Client
  • Review third party sub con LEM for client approval
  • Material received and verified against Purchase Orders, and reflected on LEMs
  • Providing daily man counts to ownership, management and client
  • Support project controls and adherence to policies and procedures within the department
  • Support Project Managers and other divisional personnel with document preparation and filing
  • Maintain employee history data records by electronic or manual filing systems while ensuring data integrity and confidentiality
  • Perform other duties as assigned
  • Administers and prepares internal/external cost reports
  • Completes Payroll entry and creates LEM reports
  • High volume receiving responsibilities for LEMs
  • High keying speeds to enter receiving amounts/quantities accurately in accounting system

What you bring:

  • Commensurate experience in administrative role with high volume keying and accuracy
  • Familiarity with time, materials and cost control measures
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excellent MS Office Skill particularly in Excel and Outlook
  • Ability to multi-task, with experience responding to changing deadlines/priorities
  • Strong interpersonal, communication and customer service skills, with the ability to communicate in a professional manner with tact and diplomacy
  • Effective written and verbal business communication skills
  • Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Dedicated team player
  • Demonstrated ability to handle and maintain confidentiality
  • Previous experience: Administration, Site Administrator, Site Admin, Construction, Oil&Gas

**At this time, our client’s may request contractors, vendors and suppliers to be fully vaccinated while providing service to their sites and therefore may require candidates to attest their vaccination disclosure status**

At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success. 

We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.

Come Grow With Us!
 

See Job Description
