title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Colonnade BridgePort is a full-service real estate company, offering property management and leasing services, acquisition, development, investment management and asset management for commercial and residential properties.

We take the time to understand our clients' objectives then apply our real estate expertise and market knowledge to drive better performance.

Colonnade BridgePort is headquartered in Ottawa with offices in the Greater Toronto Area (“GTA”), our continued growth and expansion has created an opportunity for an experienced full-time Administrative Assistant located in GTA or Ottawa.

Administrative Assistant

Reporting to the Director, Investment & Asset Management, the Administrative Assistant as part of the Investment & Asset Management team will be responsible for providing administrative and investor relations support to the Investment & Asset Management team.  As an integral member to the team, this individual will enable the team to provide a superior level of service to investors and institutional clients by ensuring deadlines are met and regular investor communications are managed on a proactive basis.  A key requirement of this role are superior organizational skills and attention to detail.

This is an exciting opportunity for an individual with exceptional multi-tasking, organizational, and communication skills to provide support in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. They will make a difference through utilizing their strong decision-making skills, attention to detail and high level of professionalism while working independently.

So that you know what to expect on any given day, you'll be doing one or all of these things:

  • Support the IM/AM team by preparing for investor and business-related presentations and/or meetings. 
  • Assist and coordinate internal and external team and investor meetings by scheduling, managing deadlines, managing communication, and assembling investor financial packages (i.e. annual reports, monthly updates, quarterly reports, investor pitch decks) and other meeting materials.
  • Draft professional and articulate responses to routine emails, memo's, correspondence, presentations, etc.
  • Act as a resource and liaison with outside organizations and all levels of management, staff, etc.
  • Coordinate and request appropriate follow-up with Investors for missing documentation or signatures on behalf of the team. For example, updates to financial statements, signatures on loan documents, status updates, and sign off/approvals on recommendations made from asset managment.
  • Record and draft meeting minutes, as well as required post-meeting follow up.
  • Maintain investor lists and documentation on an ongoing basis.
  • Review the Asset Management Agreements for private equity limited partnerships in order to set up timelines, due dates, and consistency in reporting structure and deliverables. 
  • Create and maintain methods of documentation, such as forms or templates for investor presentations, annual general meetings, quarterly updates, and email communication.
  • Assist in preparation for AGM meetings by coordinating the documentation process.
  • Maintain a confidential and accurate filing system.
  • Assist, coordinate, update, and track ongoing and ad hoc special projects and associated documentation.
  • Perform general administration support such as tracking, compiling, and submitting expenses.
  • Other duties as required.

The Qualifications we would like you to bring to the position include:

  • 2 or more years' experience in an administrative or relevant role
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration, Communications, or relevant discipline
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Strong communication skills, written and verbal, with all levels of any organization
  • Superior organizational, problem solving, and time management skills
  • Attention to detail and pride in producing quality work is essential
  • Experience in real estate, transaction management, Private Equity or Investor Relations considered an asset

The above statements reflect the general details considered necessary to describe functions of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in the job.

Colonnade BridgePort provides a dynamic work environment and offers a competitive salary and benefit package.

In recognition of its obligation to take all necessary precautions to protect the health and safety of its employees, Colonnade BridgePort has introduced a mandatory policy that requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for everyone working in or visiting its properties. Accordingly, an offer of employment will be conditional upon the successful candidate providing proof of full vaccination. Exemption requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated on valid medical or human rights grounds.

Colonnade BridgePort welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Administrative Associate
description:
Présentation

Bio-Rad recherche un(e) associé(e) administratif(ve).  Cette personne est principalement responsable de préparer en envoyer les renouvellements de contrats à partir de Microsoft Excel, de Salesforce.com (SFDC) et de CPQ, de s’assurer de l’harmonisation des prix lorsque nécessaire et d’entrer les prix de contrat au système.  Elle interagit donc avec les clients, les représentants des ventes et les autres intervenants internes ou externes par courrier électronique ou par téléphone.  Ce poste est basé à Montréal (Canada).

 

Fonctions et responsabilités

 

  • Revoit chaque mois les contrats et soumissions venant à échéance et prépare les renouvellements dans SFDC/CPQ avec l’aide de Microsoft Excel
  • Travaille en étroite collaboration avec les ventes et le marketing pour obtenir toute information spécifique aux différents contrats et pour s’assurer que les échéanciers sont respectés
  • Coordonne et finalise les soumissions, les envoie aux clients et les classe de façon électronique
  • Entre les prix au système (SAP)
  • Répond aux demandes de prix, résout les discordances et apporte les recommandations nécessaires à l’amélioration des procédures
  • Documente les nouvelles procédures
  • Produit / fournit les documents officiels nécessaires aux vérifications internes et externes et participe à ces audits
  • Assiste les représentants des ventes et du marketing dans toute demande
  • Peut être impliqué(e) dans toute autre tâche connexe

 

Expérience et éducation demandées

 

  • Diplôme de CEGEP ou équivalent
  • Plus de 2 ans d’expérience dans le domaine diagnostique ou pharmaceutique de préférence, ou une combinaison équivalente d’études et d’expérience
  • Une expérience en service à la clientèle est un atout

 

Pré-requis

 

  • Expérience souhaitée dans la gestion de contrats et autres documents
  • Bilingue (français/anglais), oral et écrit
  • Solides compétences en communication
  • Grande autonomie, aisance à prendre les responsabilités et les décisions nécessaires au bon fonctionnement du département
  • Haut niveau d’organisation
  • Maîtrise des applications et des systèmes informatiques de Microsoft Office (principalement Excel).  Expérience avec SAP, Salesforce.com et CPQ un atout
  • Connaissance des produits spécifiques à l’entreprise un atout

 

Bio-Rad Laboratories (Canada) Ltd souscrit à l'équité en matière d'emploi et à la diversité en milieu de travail et souhaite la bienvenue à tous les candidats qualifiés. Nous avons également mis en place un processus d'adaptation et offrons des accommodements aux candidats handicapés. Si vous avez besoin d'une adaptation au milieu de travail, veuillez nous en informer.

 

Nous remercions tous les candidats ayant postulé; cependant, seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées.

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  

Bio-Rad is looking for an Administrative Associate.  This person is mainly responsible for preparing the quote renewals in Salesforce.com (SFDC) and in CPQ, maintaining pricing harmonization within the different buying groups and entering contract pricing in SAP.  This position interfaces with customers, sales representatives and other internal stakeholders via email and phone.  This position is based in Montreal (Canada).

 

 

Duties and Responsibilities

 

  • Reviews every month all agreements coming to expiry and prepares the opportunity renewals in SFDC/CPQ starting from Microsoft Excel
  • Works closely with the Sales & Marketing teams as well as with the Quotes and Tenders Specialists to get specific information on the different contracts and to ensure timely renewals
  • Finalizes the quotations, sends them to the customers and files a copy
  • Enters contract pricing in the system (SAP)
  • Routinely uses judgment in resolving issues and making recommendations to improve processes
  • Documents new processes
  • Generates and provides official documentation required for internal and external audits and participate in these audits
  • Assists the Sales and Marketing team whenever needed
  • Can be involved in any other related tasks

 

Required Education and Experience

 

  • CEGEP degree or equivalent
  • 2+ years of experience a diagnostic or pharmaceutical environment preferably, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Customer Service experience is a strong asset for this position

 

 

Required Knowledge and Skills

 

  • Experience in Contract Administration desired
  • Excellent oral/written skills in both English and French
  • Strong communication skills
  • Must be autonomous and confident in taking ownership of decisions and projects
  • High level of organization
  • Proficient with computer systems and applications such as Microsoft Office (mainly Excel).  Knowledge of SAP, Salesforce.com and CPQ an asset
  • Knowledge of company specific products an asset

 

Bio-Rad Laboratories (Canada) Ltd. is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes all qualified applicants. We also have an accommodation process in place and provide accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Should you need accommodation, please let us know.  

We thank all applicants for applying; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Administrative Assistant, Job ID #4026
description:
Administrative Assistant,  Downtown Toronto

Job ID #4026 Employment Source
Full-time / 1 year contract with possibility of extension / Starting ASAP / Toronto Centre

Program Overview

JVS Torontoâ€™s downtown location is currently looking for an enthusiastic and personable individual to work alongside a highly motivated team! We are located on Front Street downtown Toronto, steps away from St Lawrence Market and easily accessible via TTC.


The JVS Employment Source office, funded by MLTSD, provides a range of employment services (information and referral, one-on-one employment counselling, employment workshops, job development/placement services) to unemployed individuals of all ages, financial backgrounds and skills to help them gain employment within their field or a related field.

Weâ€™re looking for someone who will: 
â€¢    Provide clerical support, including editing and formatting reports, preparing and completing agency and government forms, word processing of correspondence, reports and other materials, filing, faxing and photocopying
â€¢    Share reception duties and customer service to all clients, employers and visitors
â€¢    Set up, maintain and file client records in EOIS CAMS as requested.  Prepare rosters of clients as needed. Assist with statistical and program reports
â€¢    Assist with organizing appointments, orientations, and workshops and follow-up
â€¢    Update client information on the JVS client tracking system and program specific database as per program needs and standards
â€¢    Provide administrative support in processing claims for the training incentive component. Maintain up-to-date client and employer files
â€¢    Maintain office supplies and equipment. Assist location staff with all administrative and other related duties

Flexible hours / evenings / weekends may be required for this position.

Qualifications & Experience:
â€¢    High school diploma
â€¢    1-2 years of office administration experience
â€¢    Strong organization skills; detail oriented
â€¢    Effective time management and problem solving skills
â€¢    Effective verbal and written communication skills
â€¢    Computer literate; the ability to learn systems used by the agency 

Our ideal candidate will also have:
â€¢    Employment Ontario knowledge and exposure


Qualified applicants are invited to submit their resume & covering letter here. 
JVS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. If you require accommodation in order to submit your application, please contact JVS directly. 
Our agency embraces diversity and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest in our agency, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Business Office Coordinator
description:
JOB OVERVIEW:
"Sunrise is the best place that I've ever worked, simply because of the people. We provide quality care in an environment that feels like home. Our focus is doing whatâ€™s right for the resident. For me, thatâ€™s a big breath of fresh air."

- Sunrise Leader
 

 

At Sunrise, our Business Office Coordinator is responsible for assisting the community with business administration, human resources and system related business processes.
ABOUT SUNRISE:
Sunrise Senior Living has championed quality of life in senior care for more than 30 years. We believe team members are our greatest resource and are looking for people who share our commitment to provide quality care for seniors and their families. It's no surprise that many of the world's leading experts in Senior Living entrust their career to Sunrise.
 
At Sunrise, you willâ€¦

Make a Difference Every Day
We are passionate about our mission â€” to champion quality of life for all seniors. We deliver high-quality care with a personal touch and encourage our residents to enjoy life to the fullest.
 

 

Be Part of a Uniquely Supportive Community
The care-focused environment we create for residents extends to our team members. We offer programs, rewards, and benefits to help you live your best.
 

 

Ignite Your Potential
We believe potential has no limits. We offer best-in-class leadership development programs designed to grow our leaders. We are committed to helping our team members achieve their career goals.
 
Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work ®
RESPONSIBILITIES & QUALIFICATIONS:
 
Responsibilities:
- Establishing ongoing procedures to collect and review information needed to assist in billing and accounting support services to meet business performance results, deadlines and reporting
- Following the monthly accounting calendar to ensure all financial data expectations and deadlines are met
- Processing bi-weekly payroll, responding to payroll developments, trends, regulations and business controls
- Maintaining team member personnel information, including payroll processing, updating personnel files/binders and training records
- Championing the team member on-boarding and welcome orientation process
- Maintaining training records and ongoing data entry into training system
- Partnering with the Executive Director and other team leaders to form teams, encouraging strong team member engagement, morale and spirit
- Clearly and professionally communicating and conveying information and ideas in a manner that engages the audience
- Following Sunrise programs and policies for overall quality care in support of our Foundational Beliefs
- Completing training and independent study programs designed for the BOC position according to curriculum guidelines
- Completing state-required training per regulations
 



Qualifications:
- Must possess a dedication to seniors and a positive can-do attitude along with demonstrated skills in:
- Business computer applications, including Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel) as well as the ability to learn new computer applications
- Organization, time management, problem solving/resolution, and decision making
- Written and verbal communications and a willingness to facilitate small group presentations
- Interpersonal skills
- Financial/business principles

Candidates with the following experience are preferred:
- PeopleSoft, ADP, Kronos, ProCard and/or BASIS
- Associate's or Bachelor's degree

title: Corporate Office LinkLine- General Applications
description:
We are pleased to hear that you are interested in working at our property. By selecting “Apply Now” you will be prompted to upload your resume, indicate which department you are interested in and complete a short employment application.

Our Corporate Office hires seasonal LinkLine Call Center Agents that act as our central reservation center for all tee time bookings. 

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Manage large amounts of inbound calls.
  • Identify and assess Members' and guests' needs to achieve satisfaction.
  • Handle Member inquiries and provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within a timely manner; follow up to ensure resolution.
  • Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies.
  • Handle administrative requests and queries from managers.

Qualifications:

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.
  • Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of characters.
  • Communication skills; strong phone contact handling skills and active listening.
  • Dependability.
  • Customer Service experience is considered an asset.
  • Bilingual is considered an asset.
  • Must be able to work flexible hours, including early mornings and weekends.

Shifts run from: 6:45am -2:45pm  or 9:30am-5:30pm 

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact jobs@clublink.ca if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Secretary - PPT - Mental Health Outpatient Services
description:
Posting #: 2022-892061

Non Union

Position: Secretary

Department: Mental Health - Outpatient Services

Status: Part-time (must provide availability of up to a 0.6 FTE)

Hours: Monday to Friday – Days & Evenings - 8 Hour Shifts - 8-4, 9-5 and 12-8 (hours are subject to change based on operational requirements)

Site:Multi-site

This is what you'll be doing:

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we take healthcare to a new level to meet the urgent needs of ourcommunity's growing and aging population. We are adistinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

Halton Healthcare’s vision of Exemplary patient experiences, always , goes beyond just the patient experience; it has shaped our entire culture and remains at the core of every interaction in our organization, from our patients & families to our staff, physicians and volunteers. We believe in exemplary PEOPLE experiences always!

This is what you'll need to do it:

Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.

  • Recent Medical Office Administration diploma from a recognized college required OR minimum of 1 year of recent relevant experience working in a healthcare setting required
  • Medical terminology certificate required
  • Recent comparable experience in a mental health setting preferred.
  • Must have Word, Meditech and a willingness to upgrade computer skills as changes to the position may require overtime.
  • Must possess excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication and customer service skills.
  • Skills must include diplomacy, initiative, maturity and judgment.
  • Must be able to prioritize competing demands in a busy, sometimes stressful environment.
  • Must be able to type 30 words per minute
  • Satisfactory employment and attendance record.


Date Posted: January 25, 2022

Internal Applications due by: February 1, 2022

Please apply if you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination and Management Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation. All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: GECAN - Administrative Assistant III - GECAN - Adjoint administratif III
description:
Administrative Assistant III
La Prairie, QC
1+ Year

Semi-Remote position. MUST BE local to La Prairie, QC to go into office as needed. Most work can be done remotely.

Bilingual PREFERRED, but MUST speak French. English would be secondary.

ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT

Responsibilities:
" Provide administrative support to the Site Coordinator / Project Manager / Site Manager;
" Prepare internal and external correspondence related to the project;
" Client out documents according to the procedures established by the company and ensure the quality of presentation;
" Classify documents related to projects according to the established procedure;
" Prepare and maintain project streams;
" Follow up on the files;
" Make the invoicing according to the instructions given by the project manager;
" Track payments, and raise payment over due;
" Coordinate with the Site Manager for social events
" Perform other related tasks.
Requirements:
" Diploma of studies in secretarial, office or office management;
" French / English (spoken and written);
" Knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook;
" Knowledge of SAP (an advantage)
" Sense of initiative, dynamism, sense of organization, ease of communication in a team environment, great attention to detail and quality;
" Ability to work under pressure and to meet various deadlines;

ADJOINT(E) ADMINISTRATIVE
Responsabilite s :
Assurer le support administratif aux Coordonnateur chantier / Gestionnaires de projet / Directeur site;
Pre parer la correspondance interne et externe relie e au projet;
Mettre en page des documents selon les proce dures e tablies par l entreprise et en assurer la qualite de pre sentation;
Classer les documents relie s aux projets selon la proce dure e tablie;
Pre parer et maintenir les filie res de projet;
Faire le suivi des dossiers;
Faire la facturation selon les instructions transmises par les gestionnaires de projet;
Faire le suivi des paiements, et relance paiement over due ;
Coordonner avec le Directeur du site des e ve nements sociaux ;
Effectuer toute autre ta che connexe.
Exigences:
Diplo me d'e tudes en secre tariat, bureautique ou gestion de bureau;
Franc'ais/anglais (parle et e crit);
Connaissance des logiciels Word, Excel, Outlook;
Connaissance SAP (un atout)
Sens de l initiative, dynamisme, sens de l organisation, facilite a communiquer dans un environnement d e quipe, grand souci du de tail et de la qualite ;
Capacite a travailler sous pression ainsi qu'a respecter divers e che anciers;

title: Coordonnateur(trice) Administratif(ve) / Administrative Coordinator
description:
Our Story

Notre Histoire

 

Notre petite entreprise née au Canada a été fondée en 1978. Elle est depuis devenue une firme d'envergure mondiale qui compte maintenant 120 bureaux dans 20 pays. Certes, notre croissance a été rapide, mais ce qui compte le plus, c’est la conviction commune qui pousse nos 5 000 employés à faire de notre firme une société immobilière différente. Nous sommes d'avis que les lieux de vie, de travail et de loisir ont le pouvoir de nous rendre plus heureux et en meilleure santé, et nous sommes unis par un but commun : avoir un impact positif sur la vie des gens. Bref, nous sommes une société immobilière commerciale mondiale avec un objectif simple: que l’immobilier joue un rôle de premier plan dans la création d'espaces, de villes et de lieux dynamiques offrant une valeur sociale et un impact économique durables.

 

Pourquoi travailler ici?

 

Notre industrie est en changement constant et nous voulons que notre entreprise soit un lieu où se rencontrent des esprits curieux, des cœurs passionnés et des idées stratégiques. Chez Avison Young, nous nous engageons à embaucher des personnes de tous les horizons axés sur la collaboration et l'innovation. Nous croyons qu'une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et généreuse crée une entreprise plus forte, plus compétente et plus compétitive. Nous vous offrons un endroit où vous pourrez vous améliorer et changer les choses. La collaboration est ancrée dans notre façon de travailler: nos employés ont l’autonomie nécessaire pour collaborer aux relations avec les clients, engager des équipes dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise, diriger les opérations, travailler collectivement à des projets, participer à la stratégie de l'entreprise et ultimement, être à la barre de notre croissance. Notre modèle de gestion distinctif, selon lequel nos associés dirigent notre firme, nous place dans la position enviable de pouvoir offrir à chaque employé la possibilité de détenir une part de notre entreprise. Ce modèle inspire et permet à quiconque de devenir un Associé d'Avison Young. Ce rôle confère aux employés le droit de vote afin qu'ils aient vraiment leur mot à dire sur l’orientation future et le fonctionnement de notre entreprise. Cela signifie que nous sommes en mesure d'attirer, d'engager et de fidéliser les meilleurs talents.

 

______________

 

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organisation. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people’s lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact. 

 

Why Work for Us:

 

We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work – our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry. 

 

Overview

Sommaire : 

Sous la supervision de la Directrice des opérations et du Directeur principal, marketing, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec des courtiers (individuellement ou en équipe) et les assisterez dans leurs activités quotidiennes afin d’assurer un environnement de travail fluide et efficace.

 

 

Position Summary : 

 

Under the supervision of the Director of Operations and the Senior Marketing Manager, as an Administrative Coordinator, you will work closely with brokers and assist them in their day-to-day activities, to ensure a smooth and efficient work environment.

 

Responsibilities

Principales responsabilités

  • Soutenir les initiatives de courtage, de marketing et de recherche pour les bureaux d'Avison Young dans la province de Québec et, de temps à autre, pour le bureau corporatif et d'autres bureaux d'Avison Young, au besoin ; 
  • Effectuer des recherches de zonage, de renseignements sur les propriétés et de titres ainsi que toute autre demande de soutien au développement des affaires en utilisant diverses sources ;
  • Préparation et révision d’études de marché, de propositions, d’appels d’offres, de présentations, de contrats, d’offres et de contre-offres ainsi que d’ententes de commission, de sommaires de baux, de rapports d’activité, de correspondance et d’autres documents connexes ;
  • Recherche d’informations pour la préparation d’études de marché et autres projets liés à l’immobilier ;
  • Assistance à la préparation et la coordination de matériels de mise en marché des propriétés, incluant les brochures, les campagnes de distribution électronique, les invitations, les enseignes et les annonces ;
  • Mise à jour de la plateforme d'analyse de données (AVANT) et la base de données du système de gestion des relations clients (CRM) avec des informations du marché et de la clientèle ;
  • Traduction de documents de l’anglais au français et vice-versa ;
  • Révision de documents (orthographe, grammaire, gabarit et conformité aux règles d’image de marque d’Avison Young) ;
  • Remplacement occasionnel à la réception ;
  • Participation à diverses réunions et conférences téléphoniques (opérations, recherche et marketing) ;
  • Collaboration à divers besoins administratifs ou projets spéciaux selon les besoins.

________________

 

Responsibilities

  •  Support brokerage, marketing and research initiatives for the Avison Young offices in the province of Québec and, from time to time, for the Corporate office and other Avison Young offices, as required;
  • Carry out zoning, property information and title searches as well as any other requests to support business development and execution through various sources on a daily basis;
  • Prepare and edit market surveys, requests for proposals, presentations, contracts, offers and counter offers, commission agreements, lease summaries, reports, correspondence and other documents;
  • Complete research requirements in the preparation of market surveys and property-related projects for the investment and leasing teams;
  • Assist with the preparation and coordination of marketing and research materials for listings, including brochures, flyers and marketing campaigns;
  • Update data analytics platform (AVANT) and CRM database with current market and client information;
  • Translate documents from French to English and from English to French;
  • Proofread copy for spelling, grammar, layout and compliance with Avison Young’s branding;
  • Occasional replacement at reception;
  • Participate in various meetings and conference calls (operations, research, marketing);
  • Assist with other administrative needs and special projects as needed.

Qualifications

Qualifications et aptitudes recherchées

  • Parfait bilinguisme (français et anglais, oral et écrit) ;
  • Expérience en immobilier commercial, un atout ;
  • Maîtrise approfondie de la suite Microsoft Office ;
  • Maîtrise des logiciels InDesign, Illustrator et Photoshop ;
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication à l’oral et à l’écrit ;
  • Capacité à effectuer et prioriser plusieurs tâches à la fois, à travailler sous pression avec de nombreux délais, avec un minimum de direction et de supervision ; 
  • Respect de la discrétion et de la confidentialité ; 
  • Bon sens de l’organisation et initiative.  

___________________

 

Desired Skills and Experience

  • Bilingual in French and English - oral and written;
  • Commercial real estate experience an asset;
  • Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite;
  • Knowledge of InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize, to work under pressure with multiple timelines, with limited direction and supervision;
  • Ability to maintain discretion;
  • Well organized and demonstrate initiative.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Notre Engagement

 

Avison Young respecte les règlements relatifs à l'équité salariale dans tous ses bureaux autour du monde. Nous nous engageons à rassembler et à maintenir une main-d'oeuvre diversifiée en matière d'expérience, de compétences et de connaissances, avec comme but commun l'excellence du service, l'engagement et l'intégrité.

Avison Young applique une politique stricte visant à garantir l'équité salariale, et à ne faire aucune discrimination, qu'elle soit fondée sur l'origine ethnique, la couleur, la religion, les croyances, l'âge, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle, l'origine nationale, la citoyenneté, le handicap, les relations matrimoniales et civiles, le statut de partenariat/d’union, le statut de vétéran ou de service militaire protégé, ou tout autre élément protégé par la loi.

Pour les candidats nécessitant une assistance pour personnes à mobilité réduite, les informations relatives au besoin d'adaptation et aux mesures d'adaptation seront traitées de manière confidentielle.

 

Avison Young s'engage à employer les meilleurs talents, en ayant recours aux pratiques de recrutement les plus justes et équitables.

 

Postulez dès aujourd'hui!

 

______________

 

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

 

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Miles HR is seeking an experienced and energetic Administration Assistant to work with a small, but growing organization in Vancouver, BC. This is an opportunity for a self-directed, confident individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced setting and has excellent customer service and organizational skills. If you have at least two years of Administration experience and are a self-starter, this could be a great opportunity for you.

This position is based in-office in Vancouver, BC, following all current COVID-19 precautions.

About the Role:

  • Schedule and arrange client appointments by phone and email
  • Communicate directly with clients in regards to upcoming appointments including protocols and procedures
  • Identify client requests and offer adapted solutions to meet their needs
  • Prepare invoices for clients, and collect payments
  • Maintain the office environment including ordering all office and clinic supplies
  • Work closely with the Account Manager to support ongoing client activities
  • Manage social media platforms
  • Other duties as required

About You:

  • Minimum two years of experience in an Administrative or Clinic environment
  • Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, or equal number years of experience
  • Proactive and self-directed in identifying innovations and new solutions
  • Highly organized and can manage multiple priorities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and customer service skills
  • Tech-savvy with Word, Excel, Outlook, Adobe, and Microsoft Teams

If this sounds like you, then apply for the Administrative Assistant position today!

title: Administrative Assistant|1021 Administrative Assistant|1021
description:
Title: Administrative Assistant
Location: Markham, ON
Duration: 12+ Months
Job Description: Looking for an Administrative Assistant who has great people skills, diligent proactive worker, team player, energetic and computer proficient, where the successful candidate will be responsible for the following:
Greeting & signing in visitors;
Processing all incoming and outgoing shipments (local courier & Fedex), along with invoice reconciliation and payment. Will include delivery of packages/shipments;
Security Badge management: issue new hire/visitor/contractor//employee temporary/building access badges; taking photos of new hires, printing badges from the card printer, monthly card validation, along with maintaining an Inventory List;
Pick-up & sort incoming Canada Post mail, along with communicating & coordinating with employees;
Ordering and maintaining beverage supplies, along with monthly invoice reconciliation;
Coordinate catering, room set-up & tear down for main training room. Includes opening & closing of room divider wall, setting up training tables and chairs for classroom setting;
Conference and break room up-keep;
Providing backup support for other Admin staff as required and special projects such as team events as needed;
Arrange business travel and also submit PO Requisitions, when required;

Proficient in use of: Microsoft TEAMS; Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, Powerpoint); Oracle; Fedex Shipping Module; Concur Online Travel Booking Tool & SAP Concur Expense/Corporate credit card. Work experience in the hi-tech industry would be preferred.

Demonstrate professional communication skills, written and verbal - Prioritize workload and multi-task effectively - Sound working knowledge of office equipment - Maintain a positive, professional attitude and be a team player - Provide a high level of customer service under all conditions - Relevant work experience.
General Summary no standard job description text
Comments for Suppliers: 2-6 years of experience
Onsite critical - will have some remote days
Preferred experience in FedEx Shipping tool, comfortable with outlook scheduling. Very personable and upbeat personality needed. Will support director
Should be able to lift 20 pounds
